1799 void rorxl(Register dst, Register src, byte imm8);
1800 void rorxl(Register dst, Operand src, byte imm8);
1801
1802 void mfence();
1803 void lfence();
1804 void pause();
1805
1806 // Check the code size generated from label to here.
1807 int SizeOfCodeGeneratedSince(Label* label) {
1808 return pc_offset() - label->pos();
1809 }
1810
1811 // Record a deoptimization reason that can be used by a log or cpu profiler.
1812 // Use --trace-deopt to enable.
1813 void RecordDeoptReason(DeoptimizeReason reason, SourcePosition position,
1814 int id);
1815
1816 // Writes a single word of data in the code stream.
1817 // Used for inline tables, e.g., jump-tables.
1818 void db(uint8_t data);
1819 void dd(uint32_t data);
1820 void dq(uint64_t data);
1821 void dp(uintptr_t data) { dq(data); }
1822 void dq(Label* label);
1823
1824 // Patch entries for partial constant pool.
1825 void PatchConstPool();
1826
1827 // Check if use partial constant pool for this rmode.
1828 static bool UseConstPoolFor(RelocInfo::Mode rmode);
1829
1830 // Check if there is less than kGap bytes available in the buffer.
1831 // If this is the case, we need to grow the buffer before emitting
1832 // an instruction or relocation information.
1833 inline bool buffer_overflow() const {
1834 return pc_ >= reloc_info_writer.pos() - kGap;
1835 }
1836
1837 // Get the number of bytes available in the buffer.
1838 inline int available_space() const {
1839 return static_cast<int>(reloc_info_writer.pos() - pc_);
1840 }
1841
1842 static bool IsNop(Address addr);
1843
1844 // Avoid overflows for displacements etc.
1845 static constexpr int kMaximalBufferSize = 512 * MB;
1846
1847 byte byte_at(int pos) { return buffer_start_[pos]; }
1848 void set_byte_at(int pos, byte value) { buffer_start_[pos] = value; }
1849
1850#if defined(V8_OS_WIN_X64)
1851 win64_unwindinfo::BuiltinUnwindInfo GetUnwindInfo() const;
1852#endif
1853
1854 protected:
1855 // Call near indirect
1856 void call(Operand operand);
1857
1858 private:
1859 Address addr_at(int pos) {
1860 return reinterpret_cast<Address>(buffer_start_ + pos);
1861 }
1862 uint32_t long_at(int pos) {
1863 return ReadUnalignedValue<uint32_t>(addr_at(pos));
1864 }
1865 void long_at_put(int pos, uint32_t x) {
1866 WriteUnalignedValue(addr_at(pos), x);
1867 }
1868
1869 // code emission
1870 void GrowBuffer();
1871
1872 void emit(byte x) { *pc_++ = x; }
1873 inline void emitl(uint32_t x);
1874 inline void emitq(uint64_t x);
1875 inline void emitw(uint16_t x);
1876 inline void emit_runtime_entry(Address entry, RelocInfo::Mode rmode);
1877 inline void emit(Immediate x);
1878 inline void emit(Immediate64 x);
1879
1880 // Emits a REX prefix that encodes a 64-bit operand size and
1881 // the top bit of both register codes.
1882 // High bit of reg goes to REX.R, high bit of rm_reg goes to REX.B.
1883 // REX.W is set.
1884 inline void emit_rex_64(XMMRegister reg, Register rm_reg);
1885 inline void emit_rex_64(Register reg, XMMRegister rm_reg);
1886 inline void emit_rex_64(Register reg, Register rm_reg);
1887 inline void emit_rex_64(XMMRegister reg, XMMRegister rm_reg);
1888
1889 // Emits a REX prefix that encodes a 64-bit operand size and
1890 // the top bit of the destination, index, and base register codes.
1891 // The high bit of reg is used for REX.R, the high bit of op's base
1892 // register is used for REX.B, and the high bit of op's index register
1893 // is used for REX.X. REX.W is set.
1894 inline void emit_rex_64(Register reg, Operand op);
1895 inline void emit_rex_64(XMMRegister reg, Operand op);
1896
1897 // Emits a REX prefix that encodes a 64-bit operand size and
1898 // the top bit of the register code.
1899 // The high bit of register is used for REX.B.
1900 // REX.W is set and REX.R and REX.X are clear.
1901 inline void emit_rex_64(Register rm_reg);
1902
1903 // Emits a REX prefix that encodes a 64-bit operand size and
1904 // the top bit of the index and base register codes.
1905 // The high bit of op's base register is used for REX.B, and the high
1906 // bit of op's index register is used for REX.X.
1907 // REX.W is set and REX.R clear.
1908 inline void emit_rex_64(Operand op);
1909
1910 // Emit a REX prefix that only sets REX.W to choose a 64-bit operand size.
1911 void emit_rex_64() { emit(0x48); }
1912
1913 // High bit of reg goes to REX.R, high bit of rm_reg goes to REX.B.
1914 // REX.W is clear.
1915 inline void emit_rex_32(Register reg, Register rm_reg);
1916
1917 // The high bit of reg is used for REX.R, the high bit of op's base
1918 // register is used for REX.B, and the high bit of op's index register
1919 // is used for REX.X. REX.W is cleared.
1920 inline void emit_rex_32(Register reg, Operand op);
1921
1922 // High bit of rm_reg goes to REX.B.
1923 // REX.W, REX.R and REX.X are clear.
1924 inline void emit_rex_32(Register rm_reg);
1925
1926 // High bit of base goes to REX.B and high bit of index to REX.X.
1927 // REX.W and REX.R are clear.
1928 inline void emit_rex_32(Operand op);
1929
1930 // High bit of reg goes to REX.R, high bit of rm_reg goes to REX.B.
1931 // REX.W is cleared. If no REX bits are set, no byte is emitted.
1932 inline void emit_optional_rex_32(Register reg, Register rm_reg);
1933
1934 // The high bit of reg is used for REX.R, the high bit of op's base
1935 // register is used for REX.B, and the high bit of op's index register
1936 // is used for REX.X. REX.W is cleared. If no REX bits are set, nothing
1937 // is emitted.
1938 inline void emit_optional_rex_32(Register reg, Operand op);
1939
1940 // As for emit_optional_rex_32(Register, Register), except that
1941 // the registers are XMM registers.
1942 inline void emit_optional_rex_32(XMMRegister reg, XMMRegister base);
1943
1944 // As for emit_optional_rex_32(Register, Register), except that
1945 // one of the registers is an XMM registers.
1946 inline void emit_optional_rex_32(XMMRegister reg, Register base);
1947
1948 // As for emit_optional_rex_32(Register, Register), except that
1949 // one of the registers is an XMM registers.
1950 inline void emit_optional_rex_32(Register reg, XMMRegister base);
1951
1952 // As for emit_optional_rex_32(Register, Operand), except that
1953 // the register is an XMM register.
1954 inline void emit_optional_rex_32(XMMRegister reg, Operand op);
1955
1956 // Optionally do as emit_rex_32(Register) if the register number has
1957 // the high bit set.
1958 inline void emit_optional_rex_32(Register rm_reg);
1959 inline void emit_optional_rex_32(XMMRegister rm_reg);
1960
1961 // Optionally do as emit_rex_32(Operand) if the operand register
1962 // numbers have a high bit set.
1963 inline void emit_optional_rex_32(Operand op);
1964
1965 // Calls emit_rex_32(Register) for all non-byte registers.
1966 inline void emit_optional_rex_8(Register reg);
1967
1968 // Calls emit_rex_32(Register, Operand) for all non-byte registers, and
1969 // emit_optional_rex_32(Register, Operand) for byte registers.
1970 inline void emit_optional_rex_8(Register reg, Operand op);
1971
1972 void emit_rex(int size) {
1973 if (size == kInt64Size) {
1974 emit_rex_64();
1975 } else {
1976 DCHECK_EQ(size, kInt32Size)((void) 0);
1977 }
1978 }
1979
1980 template <class P1>
1981 void emit_rex(P1 p1, int size) {
1982 if (size == kInt64Size) {
1983 emit_rex_64(p1);
1984 } else {
1985 DCHECK_EQ(size, kInt32Size)((void) 0);
1986 emit_optional_rex_32(p1);
1987 }
1988 }
1989
1990 template <class P1, class P2>
1991 void emit_rex(P1 p1, P2 p2, int size) {
1992 if (size == kInt64Size) {
1993 emit_rex_64(p1, p2);
1994 } else {
1995 DCHECK_EQ(size, kInt32Size)((void) 0);
1996 emit_optional_rex_32(p1, p2);
1997 }
1998 }
1999
2000 // Emit vex prefix
2001 void emit_vex2_byte0() { emit(0xc5); }
2002 inline void emit_vex2_byte1(XMMRegister reg, XMMRegister v, VectorLength l,
2003 SIMDPrefix pp);
2004 void emit_vex3_byte0() { emit(0xc4); }
2005 inline void emit_vex3_byte1(XMMRegister reg, XMMRegister rm, LeadingOpcode m);
2006 inline void emit_vex3_byte1(XMMRegister reg, Operand rm, LeadingOpcode m);
2007 inline void emit_vex3_byte2(VexW w, XMMRegister v, VectorLength l,
2008 SIMDPrefix pp);
2009 inline void emit_vex_prefix(XMMRegister reg, XMMRegister v, XMMRegister rm,
2010 VectorLength l, SIMDPrefix pp, LeadingOpcode m,
2011 VexW w);
2012 inline void emit_vex_prefix(Register reg, Register v, Register rm,
2013 VectorLength l, SIMDPrefix pp, LeadingOpcode m,
2014 VexW w);
2015 inline void emit_vex_prefix(XMMRegister reg, XMMRegister v, Operand rm,
2016 VectorLength l, SIMDPrefix pp, LeadingOpcode m,
2017 VexW w);
2018 inline void emit_vex_prefix(Register reg, Register v, Operand rm,
2019 VectorLength l, SIMDPrefix pp, LeadingOpcode m,
2020 VexW w);
2021
2022 // Emit the ModR/M byte, and optionally the SIB byte and
2023 // 1- or 4-byte offset for a memory operand. Also encodes
2024 // the second operand of the operation, a register or operation
2025 // subcode, into the reg field of the ModR/M byte.
2026 void emit_operand(Register reg, Operand adr) {
2027 emit_operand(reg.low_bits(), adr);
2028 }
2029
2030 // Emit the ModR/M byte, and optionally the SIB byte and
2031 // 1- or 4-byte offset for a memory operand. Also used to encode
2032 // a three-bit opcode extension into the ModR/M byte.
2033 void emit_operand(int rm, Operand adr);
2034
2035 // Emit a ModR/M byte with registers coded in the reg and rm_reg fields.
2036 void emit_modrm(Register reg, Register rm_reg) {
2037 emit(0xC0 | reg.low_bits() << 3 | rm_reg.low_bits());
2038 }
2039
2040 // Emit a ModR/M byte with an operation subcode in the reg field and
2041 // a register in the rm_reg field.
2042 void emit_modrm(int code, Register rm_reg) {
2043 DCHECK(is_uint3(code))((void) 0);
2044 emit(0xC0 | code << 3 | rm_reg.low_bits());
2045 }
2046
2047 // Emit the code-object-relative offset of the label's position
2048 inline void emit_code_relative_offset(Label* label);
2049
2050 // The first argument is the reg field, the second argument is the r/m field.
2051 void emit_sse_operand(XMMRegister dst, XMMRegister src);
2052 void emit_sse_operand(XMMRegister reg, Operand adr);
2053 void emit_sse_operand(Register reg, Operand adr);
2054 void emit_sse_operand(XMMRegister dst, Register src);
2055 void emit_sse_operand(Register dst, XMMRegister src);
2056 void emit_sse_operand(XMMRegister dst);
2057
2058 // Emit machine code for one of the operations ADD, ADC, SUB, SBC,
2059 // AND, OR, XOR, or CMP. The encodings of these operations are all
2060 // similar, differing just in the opcode or in the reg field of the
2061 // ModR/M byte.
2062 void arithmetic_op_8(byte opcode, Register reg, Register rm_reg);
2063 void arithmetic_op_8(byte opcode, Register reg, Operand rm_reg);
2064 void arithmetic_op_16(byte opcode, Register reg, Register rm_reg);
2065 void arithmetic_op_16(byte opcode, Register reg, Operand rm_reg);
2066 // Operate on operands/registers with pointer size, 32-bit or 64-bit size.
2067 void arithmetic_op(byte opcode, Register reg, Register rm_reg, int size);
2068 void arithmetic_op(byte opcode, Register reg, Operand rm_reg, int size);
2069 // Operate on a byte in memory or register.
2070 void immediate_arithmetic_op_8(byte subcode, Register dst, Immediate src);
2071 void immediate_arithmetic_op_8(byte subcode, Operand dst, Immediate src);
2072 // Operate on a word in memory or register.
2073 void immediate_arithmetic_op_16(byte subcode, Register dst, Immediate src);
2074 void immediate_arithmetic_op_16(byte subcode, Operand dst, Immediate src);
2075 // Operate on operands/registers with pointer size, 32-bit or 64-bit size.
2076 void immediate_arithmetic_op(byte subcode, Register dst, Immediate src,
2077 int size);
2078 void immediate_arithmetic_op(byte subcode, Operand dst, Immediate src,
2079 int size);
2080
2081 // Emit machine code for a shift operation.
2082 void shift(Operand dst, Immediate shift_amount, int subcode, int size);
2083 void shift(Register dst, Immediate shift_amount, int subcode, int size);
2084 // Shift dst by cl % 64 bits.
2085 void shift(Register dst, int subcode, int size);
2086 void shift(Operand dst, int subcode, int size);
2087
2088 void emit_farith(int b1, int b2, int i);
2089
2090 // labels
2091 // void print(Label* L);
2092 void bind_to(Label* L, int pos);
2093
2094 // record reloc info for current pc_
2095 void RecordRelocInfo(RelocInfo::Mode rmode, intptr_t data = 0);
2096
2097 // Arithmetics
2098 void emit_add(Register dst, Register src, int size) {
2099 arithmetic_op(0x03, dst, src, size);
2100 }
2101
2102 void emit_add(Register dst, Immediate src, int size) {
2103 immediate_arithmetic_op(0x0, dst, src, size);
2104 }
2105
2106 void emit_add(Register dst, Operand src, int size) {
2107 arithmetic_op(0x03, dst, src, size);
2108 }
2109
2110 void emit_add(Operand dst, Register src, int size) {
2111 arithmetic_op(0x1, src, dst, size);
2112 }
2113
2114 void emit_add(Operand dst, Immediate src, int size) {
2115 immediate_arithmetic_op(0x0, dst, src, size);
2116 }
2117
2118 void emit_and(Register dst, Register src, int size) {
2119 arithmetic_op(0x23, dst, src, size);
2120 }
2121
2122 void emit_and(Register dst, Operand src, int size) {
2123 arithmetic_op(0x23, dst, src, size);
2124 }
2125
2126 void emit_and(Operand dst, Register src, int size) {
2127 arithmetic_op(0x21, src, dst, size);
2128 }
2129
2130 void emit_and(Register dst, Immediate src, int size) {
2131 immediate_arithmetic_op(0x4, dst, src, size);
2132 }
2133
2134 void emit_and(Operand dst, Immediate src, int size) {
2135 immediate_arithmetic_op(0x4, dst, src, size);
2136 }
2137
2138 void emit_cmp(Register dst, Register src, int size) {
2139 arithmetic_op(0x3B, dst, src, size);
2140 }
2141
2142 void emit_cmp(Register dst, Operand src, int size) {
2143 arithmetic_op(0x3B, dst, src, size);
2144 }
2145
2146 void emit_cmp(Operand dst, Register src, int size) {
2147 arithmetic_op(0x39, src, dst, size);
2148 }
2149
2150 void emit_cmp(Register dst, Immediate src, int size) {
2151 immediate_arithmetic_op(0x7, dst, src, size);
2152 }
2153
2154 void emit_cmp(Operand dst, Immediate src, int size) {
2155 immediate_arithmetic_op(0x7, dst, src, size);
2156 }
2157
2158 // Compare {al,ax,eax,rax} with src. If equal, set ZF and write dst into
2159 // src. Otherwise clear ZF and write src into {al,ax,eax,rax}. This
2160 // operation is only atomic if prefixed by the lock instruction.
2161 void emit_cmpxchg(Operand dst, Register src, int size);
2162
2163 void emit_dec(Register dst, int size);
2164 void emit_dec(Operand dst, int size);
2165
2166 // Divide rdx:rax by src. Quotient in rax, remainder in rdx when size is 64.
2167 // Divide edx:eax by lower 32 bits of src. Quotient in eax, remainder in edx
2168 // when size is 32.
2169 void emit_idiv(Register src, int size);
2170 void emit_div(Register src, int size);
2171
2172 // Signed multiply instructions.
2173 // rdx:rax = rax * src when size is 64 or edx:eax = eax * src when size is 32.
2174 void emit_imul(Register src, int size);
2175 void emit_imul(Operand src, int size);
2176 void emit_imul(Register dst, Register src, int size);
2177 void emit_imul(Register dst, Operand src, int size);
2178 void emit_imul(Register dst, Register src, Immediate imm, int size);
2179 void emit_imul(Register dst, Operand src, Immediate imm, int size);
2180
2181 void emit_inc(Register dst, int size);
2182 void emit_inc(Operand dst, int size);
2183
2184 void emit_lea(Register dst, Operand src, int size);
2185
2186 void emit_mov(Register dst, Operand src, int size);
2187 void emit_mov(Register dst, Register src, int size);
2188 void emit_mov(Operand dst, Register src, int size);
2189 void emit_mov(Register dst, Immediate value, int size);
2190 void emit_mov(Operand dst, Immediate value, int size);
2191 void emit_mov(Register dst, Immediate64 value, int size);
2192
2193 void emit_movzxb(Register dst, Operand src, int size);
2194 void emit_movzxb(Register dst, Register src, int size);
2195 void emit_movzxw(Register dst, Operand src, int size);
2196 void emit_movzxw(Register dst, Register src, int size);
2197
2198 void emit_neg(Register dst, int size);
2199 void emit_neg(Operand dst, int size);
2200
2201 void emit_not(Register dst, int size);
2202 void emit_not(Operand dst, int size);
2203
2204 void emit_or(Register dst, Register src, int size) {
2205 arithmetic_op(0x0B, dst, src, size);
2206 }
2207
2208 void emit_or(Register dst, Operand src, int size) {
2209 arithmetic_op(0x0B, dst, src, size);
2210 }
2211
2212 void emit_or(Operand dst, Register src, int size) {
2213 arithmetic_op(0x9, src, dst, size);
2214 }
2215
2216 void emit_or(Register dst, Immediate src, int size) {
2217 immediate_arithmetic_op(0x1, dst, src, size);
2218 }
2219
2220 void emit_or(Operand dst, Immediate src, int size) {
2221 immediate_arithmetic_op(0x1, dst, src, size);
2222 }
2223
2224 void emit_repmovs(int size);
2225
2226 void emit_sbb(Register dst, Register src, int size) {
2227 arithmetic_op(0x1b, dst, src, size);
2228 }
2229
2230 void emit_sub(Register dst, Register src, int size) {
2231 arithmetic_op(0x2B, dst, src, size);
2232 }
2233
2234 void emit_sub(Register dst, Immediate src, int size) {
2235 immediate_arithmetic_op(0x5, dst, src, size);
2236 }
2237
2238 void emit_sub(Register dst, Operand src, int size) {
2239 arithmetic_op(0x2B, dst, src, size);
2240 }
2241
2242 void emit_sub(Operand dst, Register src, int size) {
2243 arithmetic_op(0x29, src, dst, size);
2244 }
2245
2246 void emit_sub(Operand dst, Immediate src, int size) {
2247 immediate_arithmetic_op(0x5, dst, src, size);
2248 }
2249
2250 void emit_test(Register dst, Register src, int size);
2251 void emit_test(Register reg, Immediate mask, int size);
2252 void emit_test(Operand op, Register reg, int size);
2253 void emit_test(Operand op, Immediate mask, int size);
2254 void emit_test(Register reg, Operand op, int size) {
2255 return emit_test(op, reg, size);
2256 }
2257
2258 void emit_xchg(Register dst, Register src, int size);
2259 void emit_xchg(Register dst, Operand src, int size);
2260
2261 void emit_xor(Register dst, Register src, int size) {
2262 if (size == kInt64Size && dst.code() == src.code()) {
2263 // 32 bit operations zero the top 32 bits of 64 bit registers. Therefore
2264 // there is no need to make this a 64 bit operation.
2265 arithmetic_op(0x33, dst, src, kInt32Size);
2266 } else {
2267 arithmetic_op(0x33, dst, src, size);
2268 }
2269 }
2270
2271 void emit_xor(Register dst, Operand src, int size) {
2272 arithmetic_op(0x33, dst, src, size);
2273 }
2274
2275 void emit_xor(Register dst, Immediate src, int size) {
2276 immediate_arithmetic_op(0x6, dst, src, size);
2277 }
2278
2279 void emit_xor(Operand dst, Immediate src, int size) {
2280 immediate_arithmetic_op(0x6, dst, src, size);
2281 }
2282
2283 void emit_xor(Operand dst, Register src, int size) {
2284 arithmetic_op(0x31, src, dst, size);
2285 }
2286
2287 // Most BMI instructions are similar.
2288 void bmi1q(byte op, Register reg, Register vreg, Register rm);
2289 void bmi1q(byte op, Register reg, Register vreg, Operand rm);
2290 void bmi1l(byte op, Register reg, Register vreg, Register rm);
2291 void bmi1l(byte op, Register reg, Register vreg, Operand rm);
2292 void bmi2q(SIMDPrefix pp, byte op, Register reg, Register vreg, Register rm);
2293 void bmi2q(SIMDPrefix pp, byte op, Register reg, Register vreg, Operand rm);
2294 void bmi2l(SIMDPrefix pp, byte op, Register reg, Register vreg, Register rm);
2295 void bmi2l(SIMDPrefix pp, byte op, Register reg, Register vreg, Operand rm);
2296
2297 // record the position of jmp/jcc instruction
2298 void record_farjmp_position(Label* L, int pos);
2299
2300 bool is_optimizable_farjmp(int idx);
2301
2302 void AllocateAndInstallRequestedHeapObjects(Isolate* isolate);
2303
2304 int WriteCodeComments();
2305
2306 friend class EnsureSpace;
2307 friend class RegExpMacroAssemblerX64;
2308
2309 // code generation
2310 RelocInfoWriter reloc_info_writer;
2311
2312 // Internal reference positions, required for (potential) patching in
2313 // GrowBuffer(); contains only those internal references whose labels
2314 // are already bound.
2315 std::deque<int> internal_reference_positions_;
2316
2317 // Variables for this instance of assembler
2318 int farjmp_num_ = 0;
2319 std::deque<int> farjmp_positions_;
2320 std::map<Label*, std::vector<int>> label_farjmp_maps_;
2321
2322 ConstPool constpool_;
2323
2324 friend class ConstPool;
2325
2326#if defined(V8_OS_WIN_X64)
2327 std::unique_ptr<win64_unwindinfo::XdataEncoder> xdata_encoder_;
2328#endif
2329};
2330
2331// Helper class that ensures that there is enough space for generating
2332// instructions and relocation information. The constructor makes
2333// sure that there is enough space and (in debug mode) the destructor
2334// checks that we did not generate too much.
2335class EnsureSpace {
2336 public:
2337 explicit EnsureSpace(Assembler* assembler) : assembler_(assembler) {
2338 if (assembler_->buffer_overflow()) assembler_->GrowBuffer();
2339#ifdef DEBUG
2340 space_before_ = assembler_->available_space();
2341#endif
2342 }
2343
2344#ifdef DEBUG
2345 ~EnsureSpace() {
2346 int bytes_generated = space_before_ - assembler_->available_space();
2347 DCHECK(bytes_generated < assembler_->kGap)((void) 0);
2348 }
2349#endif
2350
2351 private:
2352 Assembler* assembler_;
2353#ifdef DEBUG
2354 int space_before_;
2355#endif
2356};
2357
2358} // namespace internal
2359} // namespace v8
2360
2361#endif // V8_CODEGEN_X64_ASSEMBLER_X64_H_

37constexpr auto kRegister = LiftoffAssembler::VarState::kRegister;
38constexpr auto kIntConst = LiftoffAssembler::VarState::kIntConst;
39constexpr auto kStack = LiftoffAssembler::VarState::kStack;
40
41namespace {
42
43#define __ asm_.
44
45#define TRACE(...) \
46 do { \
47 if (FLAG_trace_liftoff) PrintF("[liftoff] " __VA_ARGS__); \
48 } while (false)
49
50#define WASM_INSTANCE_OBJECT_FIELD_OFFSET(name) \
51 ObjectAccess::ToTagged(WasmInstanceObject::k##name##Offset)
52
53template <int expected_size, int actual_size>
54struct assert_field_size {
55 static_assert(expected_size == actual_size,
56 "field in WasmInstance does not have the expected size");
57 static constexpr int size = actual_size;
58};
59
60#define WASM_INSTANCE_OBJECT_FIELD_SIZE(name) \
61 FIELD_SIZE(WasmInstanceObject::k##name##Offset)(WasmInstanceObject::k##name##OffsetEnd + 1 - WasmInstanceObject
::k##name##Offset)
62
63#define LOAD_INSTANCE_FIELD(dst, name, load_size) \
64 __ LoadFromInstance(dst, WASM_INSTANCE_OBJECT_FIELD_OFFSET(name), \
65 assert_field_size<WASM_INSTANCE_OBJECT_FIELD_SIZE(name), \
66 load_size>::size);
67
68#define LOAD_TAGGED_PTR_INSTANCE_FIELD(dst, name) \
69 static_assert(WASM_INSTANCE_OBJECT_FIELD_SIZE(name) == kTaggedSize, \
70 "field in WasmInstance does not have the expected size"); \
71 __ LoadTaggedPointerFromInstance(dst, \
72 WASM_INSTANCE_OBJECT_FIELD_OFFSET(name));
73
74#ifdef DEBUG
75#define DEBUG_CODE_COMMENT(str) \
76 do { \
77 __ RecordComment(str); \
78 } while (false)
79#else
80#define DEBUG_CODE_COMMENT(str) ((void)0)
81#endif
82
83constexpr LoadType::LoadTypeValue kPointerLoadType =
84 kSystemPointerSize == 8 ? LoadType::kI64Load : LoadType::kI32Load;
85
86constexpr ValueType kPointerValueType =
87 kSystemPointerSize == 8 ? kWasmI64 : kWasmI32;
88
89#if V8_TARGET_ARCH_ARM64
90// On ARM64, the Assembler keeps track of pointers to Labels to resolve
91// branches to distant targets. Moving labels would confuse the Assembler,
92// thus store the label on the heap and keep a unique_ptr.
93class MovableLabel {
94 public:
95 MOVE_ONLY_NO_DEFAULT_CONSTRUCTOR(MovableLabel)MovableLabel(MovableLabel&&) noexcept = default; MovableLabel
& operator=(MovableLabel&&) noexcept = default; MovableLabel
(const MovableLabel&) = delete; MovableLabel& operator
=(const MovableLabel&) = delete;
96 MovableLabel() : label_(new Label()) {}
97
98 Label* get() { return label_.get(); }
99
100 private:
101 std::unique_ptr<Label> label_;
102};
103#else
104// On all other platforms, just store the Label directly.
105class MovableLabel {
106 public:
107 MOVE_ONLY_WITH_DEFAULT_CONSTRUCTORS(MovableLabel)MovableLabel() = default; MovableLabel(MovableLabel&&
) noexcept = default; MovableLabel& operator=(MovableLabel
&&) noexcept = default; MovableLabel(const MovableLabel
&) = delete; MovableLabel& operator=(const MovableLabel
&) = delete;
108
109 Label* get() { return &label_; }
110
111 private:
112 Label label_;
113};
114#endif
115
116compiler::CallDescriptor* GetLoweredCallDescriptor(
117 Zone* zone, compiler::CallDescriptor* call_desc) {
118 return kSystemPointerSize == 4
119 ? compiler::GetI32WasmCallDescriptor(zone, call_desc)
120 : call_desc;
121}
122
123constexpr ValueType kSupportedTypesArr[] = {kWasmI32, kWasmI64, kWasmF32,
124 kWasmF64, kWasmS128};
125constexpr Vector<const ValueType> kSupportedTypes =
126 ArrayVector(kSupportedTypesArr);
127
128constexpr Condition GetCompareCondition(WasmOpcode opcode) {
129 switch (opcode) {
130 case kExprI32Eq:
131 return kEqual;
132 case kExprI32Ne:
133 return kUnequal;
134 case kExprI32LtS:
135 return kSignedLessThan;
136 case kExprI32LtU:
137 return kUnsignedLessThan;
138 case kExprI32GtS:
139 return kSignedGreaterThan;
140 case kExprI32GtU:
141 return kUnsignedGreaterThan;
142 case kExprI32LeS:
143 return kSignedLessEqual;
144 case kExprI32LeU:
145 return kUnsignedLessEqual;
146 case kExprI32GeS:
147 return kSignedGreaterEqual;
148 case kExprI32GeU:
149 return kUnsignedGreaterEqual;
150 default:
151#if V8_HAS_CXX14_CONSTEXPR1
152 UNREACHABLE()V8_Fatal("unreachable code");
153#else
154 // We need to return something for old compilers here.
155 return kEqual;
156#endif
157 }
158}
159
160// Builds a {DebugSideTable}.
161class DebugSideTableBuilder {
162 public:
163 enum AssumeSpilling {
164 // All register values will be spilled before the pc covered by the debug
165 // side table entry. Register slots will be marked as stack slots in the
166 // generated debug side table entry.
167 kAssumeSpilling,
168 // Register slots will be written out as they are.
169 kAllowRegisters,
170 // Register slots cannot appear since we already spilled.
171 kDidSpill
172 };
173
174 class EntryBuilder {
175 public:
176 explicit EntryBuilder(int pc_offset,
177 std::vector<DebugSideTable::Entry::Value> values)
178 : pc_offset_(pc_offset), values_(std::move(values)) {}
179
180 DebugSideTable::Entry ToTableEntry() {
181 return DebugSideTable::Entry{pc_offset_, std::move(values_)};
182 }
183
184 int pc_offset() const { return pc_offset_; }
185 void set_pc_offset(int new_pc_offset) { pc_offset_ = new_pc_offset; }
186
187 private:
188 int pc_offset_;
189 std::vector<DebugSideTable::Entry::Value> values_;
190 };
191
192 // Adds a new entry, and returns a pointer to a builder for modifying that
193 // entry ({stack_height} includes {num_locals}).
194 EntryBuilder* NewEntry(int pc_offset, int num_locals, int stack_height,
195 LiftoffAssembler::VarState* stack_state,
196 AssumeSpilling assume_spilling) {
197 DCHECK_LE(num_locals, stack_height)((void) 0);
198 // Record stack types.
199 std::vector<DebugSideTable::Entry::Value> values(stack_height);
200 for (int i = 0; i < stack_height; ++i) {
201 const auto& slot = stack_state[i];
202 values[i].type = slot.type();
203 values[i].stack_offset = slot.offset();
204 switch (slot.loc()) {
205 case kIntConst:
206 values[i].kind = DebugSideTable::Entry::kConstant;
207 values[i].i32_const = slot.i32_const();
208 break;
209 case kRegister:
210 DCHECK_NE(kDidSpill, assume_spilling)((void) 0);
211 if (assume_spilling == kAllowRegisters) {
212 values[i].kind = DebugSideTable::Entry::kRegister;
213 values[i].reg_code = slot.reg().liftoff_code();
214 break;
215 }
216 DCHECK_EQ(kAssumeSpilling, assume_spilling)((void) 0);
217 V8_FALLTHROUGH[[clang::fallthrough]];
218 case kStack:
219 values[i].kind = DebugSideTable::Entry::kStack;
220 values[i].stack_offset = slot.offset();
221 break;
222 }
223 }
224 entries_.emplace_back(pc_offset, std::move(values));
225 return &entries_.back();
226 }
227
228 void SetNumLocals(int num_locals) {
229 DCHECK_EQ(-1, num_locals_)((void) 0);
230 DCHECK_LE(0, num_locals)((void) 0);
231 num_locals_ = num_locals;
232 }
233
234 std::unique_ptr<DebugSideTable> GenerateDebugSideTable() {
235 DCHECK_LE(0, num_locals_)((void) 0);
236 std::vector<DebugSideTable::Entry> entries;
237 entries.reserve(entries_.size());
238 for (auto& entry : entries_) entries.push_back(entry.ToTableEntry());
239 std::sort(entries.begin(), entries.end(),
240 [](DebugSideTable::Entry& a, DebugSideTable::Entry& b) {
241 return a.pc_offset() < b.pc_offset();
242 });
243 return std::make_unique<DebugSideTable>(num_locals_, std::move(entries));
244 }
245
246 private:
247 int num_locals_ = -1;
248 std::list<EntryBuilder> entries_;
249};
250
251class LiftoffCompiler {
252 public:
253 // TODO(clemensb): Make this a template parameter.
254 static constexpr Decoder::ValidateFlag validate = Decoder::kValidate;
255
256 using Value = ValueBase;
257
258 static constexpr auto kI32 = ValueType::kI32;
259 static constexpr auto kI64 = ValueType::kI64;
260 static constexpr auto kF32 = ValueType::kF32;
261 static constexpr auto kF64 = ValueType::kF64;
262 static constexpr auto kS128 = ValueType::kS128;
263
264 struct ElseState {
265 MovableLabel label;
266 LiftoffAssembler::CacheState state;
267 };
268
269 struct Control : public ControlBase<Value> {
270 std::unique_ptr<ElseState> else_state;
271 LiftoffAssembler::CacheState label_state;
272 MovableLabel label;
273
274 MOVE_ONLY_NO_DEFAULT_CONSTRUCTOR(Control)Control(Control&&) noexcept = default; Control& operator
=(Control&&) noexcept = default; Control(const Control
&) = delete; Control& operator=(const Control&) =
delete;
275
276 template <typename... Args>
277 explicit Control(Args&&... args) V8_NOEXCEPTnoexcept
278 : ControlBase(std::forward<Args>(args)...) {}
279 };
280
281 using FullDecoder = WasmFullDecoder<validate, LiftoffCompiler>;
282
283 // For debugging, we need to spill registers before a trap or a stack check to
284 // be able to inspect them.
285 struct SpilledRegistersForInspection : public ZoneObject {
286 struct Entry {
287 int offset;
288 LiftoffRegister reg;
289 ValueType type;
290 };
291 ZoneVector<Entry> entries;
292
293 explicit SpilledRegistersForInspection(Zone* zone) : entries(zone) {}
294 };
295
296 struct OutOfLineCode {
297 MovableLabel label;
298 MovableLabel continuation;
299 WasmCode::RuntimeStubId stub;
300 WasmCodePosition position;
301 LiftoffRegList regs_to_save;
302 uint32_t pc; // for trap handler.
303 // These two pointers will only be used for debug code:
304 DebugSideTableBuilder::EntryBuilder* debug_sidetable_entry_builder;
305 SpilledRegistersForInspection* spilled_registers;
306
307 // Named constructors:
308 static OutOfLineCode Trap(
309 WasmCode::RuntimeStubId s, WasmCodePosition pos, uint32_t pc,
310 DebugSideTableBuilder::EntryBuilder* debug_sidetable_entry_builder,
311 SpilledRegistersForInspection* spilled_registers) {
312 DCHECK_LT(0, pos)((void) 0);
313 return {{},
314 {},
315 s,
316 pos,
317 {},
318 pc,
319 debug_sidetable_entry_builder,
320 spilled_registers};
321 }
322 static OutOfLineCode StackCheck(
323 WasmCodePosition pos, LiftoffRegList regs_to_save,
324 SpilledRegistersForInspection* spilled_regs,
325 DebugSideTableBuilder::EntryBuilder* debug_sidetable_entry_builder) {
326 return {{}, {}, WasmCode::kWasmStackGuard, pos,
327 regs_to_save, 0, debug_sidetable_entry_builder, spilled_regs};
328 }
329 };
330
331 LiftoffCompiler(compiler::CallDescriptor* call_descriptor,
332 CompilationEnv* env, Zone* compilation_zone,
333 std::unique_ptr<AssemblerBuffer> buffer,
334 DebugSideTableBuilder* debug_sidetable_builder,
335 ForDebugging for_debugging, int func_index,
336 Vector<int> breakpoints = {})
337 : asm_(std::move(buffer)),
338 descriptor_(
339 GetLoweredCallDescriptor(compilation_zone, call_descriptor)),
340 env_(env),
341 debug_sidetable_builder_(debug_sidetable_builder),
342 for_debugging_(for_debugging),
343 func_index_(func_index),
344 out_of_line_code_(compilation_zone),
345 source_position_table_builder_(compilation_zone),
346 protected_instructions_(compilation_zone),
347 compilation_zone_(compilation_zone),
348 safepoint_table_builder_(compilation_zone_),
349 next_breakpoint_ptr_(breakpoints.begin()),
350 next_breakpoint_end_(breakpoints.end()) {
351 if (breakpoints.empty()) {
352 next_breakpoint_ptr_ = next_breakpoint_end_ = nullptr;
353 }
354 }
355
356 bool did_bailout() const { return bailout_reason_ != kSuccess; }
357 LiftoffBailoutReason bailout_reason() const { return bailout_reason_; }
358
359 void GetCode(CodeDesc* desc) {
360 asm_.GetCode(nullptr, desc, &safepoint_table_builder_,
361 Assembler::kNoHandlerTable);
362 }
363
364 OwnedVector<uint8_t> GetSourcePositionTable() {
365 return source_position_table_builder_.ToSourcePositionTableVector();
366 }
367
368 OwnedVector<uint8_t> GetProtectedInstructionsData() const {
369 return OwnedVector<uint8_t>::Of(
370 Vector<const uint8_t>::cast(VectorOf(protected_instructions_)));
371 }
372
373 uint32_t GetTotalFrameSlotCount() const {
374 return __ GetTotalFrameSlotCount();
375 }
376
377 void unsupported(FullDecoder* decoder, LiftoffBailoutReason reason,
378 const char* detail) {
379 DCHECK_NE(kSuccess, reason)((void) 0);
380 if (did_bailout()) return;
381 bailout_reason_ = reason;
382 TRACE("unsupported: %s\n", detail);
383 decoder->errorf(decoder->pc_offset(), "unsupported liftoff operation: %s",
384 detail);
385 UnuseLabels(decoder);
386 }
387
388 bool DidAssemblerBailout(FullDecoder* decoder) {
389 if (decoder->failed() || !__ did_bailout()) return false;
390 unsupported(decoder, __ bailout_reason(), __ bailout_detail());
391 return true;
392 }
393
394 LiftoffBailoutReason BailoutReasonForType(ValueType type) {
395 switch (type.kind()) {
396 case ValueType::kS128:
397 return kSimd;
398 case ValueType::kOptRef:
399 case ValueType::kRef:
400 if (type.is_reference_to(HeapType::kExn)) {
401 return kExceptionHandling;
402 } else {
403 return kRefTypes;
404 }
405 case ValueType::kBottom:
406 return kMultiValue;
407 default:
408 return kOtherReason;
409 }
410 }
411
412 bool CheckSupportedType(FullDecoder* decoder,
413 Vector<const ValueType> supported_types,
414 ValueType type, const char* context) {
415 // Special case for kWasm128 which requires specific hardware support.
416 if (type == kWasmS128 && (!CpuFeatures::SupportsWasmSimd128())) {
417 unsupported(decoder, kSimd, "simd");
418 return false;
419 }
420 // Check supported types.
421 for (ValueType supported : supported_types) {
422 if (type == supported) return true;
423 }
424 LiftoffBailoutReason bailout_reason = BailoutReasonForType(type);
425 EmbeddedVector<char, 128> buffer;
426 SNPrintF(buffer, "%s %s", type.name().c_str(), context);
427 unsupported(decoder, bailout_reason, buffer.begin());
428 return false;
429 }
430
431 int GetSafepointTableOffset() const {
432 return safepoint_table_builder_.GetCodeOffset();
433 }
434
435 void UnuseLabels(FullDecoder* decoder) {
436#ifdef DEBUG
437 auto Unuse = [](Label* label) {
438 label->Unuse();
439 label->UnuseNear();
440 };
441 // Unuse all labels now, otherwise their destructor will fire a DCHECK error
442 // if they where referenced before.
443 uint32_t control_depth = decoder ? decoder->control_depth() : 0;
444 for (uint32_t i = 0; i < control_depth; ++i) {
445 Control* c = decoder->control_at(i);
446 Unuse(c->label.get());
447 if (c->else_state) Unuse(c->else_state->label.get());
448 }
449 for (auto& ool : out_of_line_code_) Unuse(ool.label.get());
450#endif
451 }
452
453 void StartFunction(FullDecoder* decoder) {
454 if (FLAG_trace_liftoff && !FLAG_trace_wasm_decoder) {
455 StdoutStream{} << "hint: add --trace-wasm-decoder to also see the wasm "
456 "instructions being decoded\n";
457 }
458 int num_locals = decoder->num_locals();
459 __ set_num_locals(num_locals);
460 for (int i = 0; i < num_locals; ++i) {
461 ValueType type = decoder->local_type(i);
462 __ set_local_type(i, type);
463 }
464 }
465
466 // Returns the number of inputs processed (1 or 2).
467 uint32_t ProcessParameter(ValueType type, uint32_t input_idx) {
468 const bool needs_pair = needs_gp_reg_pair(type);
469 const ValueType reg_type = needs_pair ? kWasmI32 : type;
470 const RegClass rc = reg_class_for(reg_type);
471
472 auto LoadToReg = [this, reg_type, rc](compiler::LinkageLocation location,
473 LiftoffRegList pinned) {
474 if (location.IsRegister()) {
475 DCHECK(!location.IsAnyRegister())((void) 0);
476 return LiftoffRegister::from_external_code(rc, reg_type,
477 location.AsRegister());
478 }
479 DCHECK(location.IsCallerFrameSlot())((void) 0);
480 LiftoffRegister reg = __ GetUnusedRegister(rc, pinned);
481 __ LoadCallerFrameSlot(reg, -location.AsCallerFrameSlot(), reg_type);
482 return reg;
483 };
484
485 LiftoffRegister reg =
486 LoadToReg(descriptor_->GetInputLocation(input_idx), {});
487 if (needs_pair) {
488 LiftoffRegister reg2 =
489 LoadToReg(descriptor_->GetInputLocation(input_idx + 1),
490 LiftoffRegList::ForRegs(reg));
491 reg = LiftoffRegister::ForPair(reg.gp(), reg2.gp());
492 }
493 __ PushRegister(type, reg);
494
495 return needs_pair ? 2 : 1;
496 }
497
498 void StackCheck(WasmCodePosition position) {
499 DEBUG_CODE_COMMENT("stack check");
500 if (!FLAG_wasm_stack_checks || !env_->runtime_exception_support) return;
501 LiftoffRegList regs_to_save = __ cache_state()->used_registers;
502 SpilledRegistersForInspection* spilled_regs = nullptr;
503 Register limit_address = __ GetUnusedRegister(kGpReg, {}).gp();
504 if (V8_UNLIKELY(for_debugging_)(__builtin_expect(!!(for_debugging_), 0))) {
505 regs_to_save = {};
506 spilled_regs = GetSpilledRegistersForInspection();
507 }
508 out_of_line_code_.push_back(OutOfLineCode::StackCheck(
509 position, regs_to_save, spilled_regs,
510 RegisterDebugSideTableEntry(DebugSideTableBuilder::kAssumeSpilling)));
511 OutOfLineCode& ool = out_of_line_code_.back();
512 LOAD_INSTANCE_FIELD(limit_address, StackLimitAddress, kSystemPointerSize);
513 __ StackCheck(ool.label.get(), limit_address);
514 __ bind(ool.continuation.get());
515 }
516
517 bool SpillLocalsInitially(FullDecoder* decoder, uint32_t num_params) {
518 int actual_locals = __ num_locals() - num_params;
519 DCHECK_LE(0, actual_locals)((void) 0);
520 constexpr int kNumCacheRegisters = NumRegs(kLiftoffAssemblerGpCacheRegs);
521 // If we have many locals, we put them on the stack initially. This avoids
522 // having to spill them on merge points. Use of these initial values should
523 // be rare anyway.
524 if (actual_locals > kNumCacheRegisters / 2) return true;
525 // If there are locals which are not i32 or i64, we also spill all locals,
526 // because other types cannot be initialized to constants.
527 for (uint32_t param_idx = num_params; param_idx < __ num_locals();
528 ++param_idx) {
529 ValueType type = decoder->local_type(param_idx);
530 if (type != kWasmI32 && type != kWasmI64) return true;
531 }
532 return false;
533 }
534
535 void TierUpFunction(FullDecoder* decoder) {
536 __ CallRuntimeStub(WasmCode::kWasmTriggerTierUp);
537 safepoint_table_builder_.DefineSafepoint(&asm_, Safepoint::kNoLazyDeopt);
538 }
539
540 void TraceFunctionEntry(FullDecoder* decoder) {
541 DEBUG_CODE_COMMENT("trace function entry");
542 __ SpillAllRegisters();
543 source_position_table_builder_.AddPosition(
544 __ pc_offset(), SourcePosition(decoder->position()), false);
545 __ CallRuntimeStub(WasmCode::kWasmTraceEnter);
546 safepoint_table_builder_.DefineSafepoint(&asm_, Safepoint::kNoLazyDeopt);
547 }
548
549 void StartFunctionBody(FullDecoder* decoder, Control* block) {
550 for (uint32_t i = 0; i < __ num_locals(); ++i) {
551 if (!CheckSupportedType(decoder, kSupportedTypes, __ local_type(i),
552 "param"))
553 return;
554 }
555
556 // Input 0 is the call target, the instance is at 1.
557 constexpr int kInstanceParameterIndex = 1;
558 // Store the instance parameter to a special stack slot.
559 compiler::LinkageLocation instance_loc =
560 descriptor_->GetInputLocation(kInstanceParameterIndex);
561 DCHECK(instance_loc.IsRegister())((void) 0);
562 DCHECK(!instance_loc.IsAnyRegister())((void) 0);
563 Register instance_reg = Register::from_code(instance_loc.AsRegister());
564 DCHECK_EQ(kWasmInstanceRegister, instance_reg)((void) 0);
565
566 // Parameter 0 is the instance parameter.
567 uint32_t num_params =
568 static_cast<uint32_t>(decoder->sig_->parameter_count());
569
570 __ CodeEntry();
571
572 DEBUG_CODE_COMMENT("enter frame");
573 __ EnterFrame(StackFrame::WASM);
574 __ set_has_frame(true);
575 pc_offset_stack_frame_construction_ = __ PrepareStackFrame();
576 // {PrepareStackFrame} is the first platform-specific assembler method.
577 // If this failed, we can bail out immediately, avoiding runtime overhead
578 // and potential failures because of other unimplemented methods.
579 // A platform implementing {PrepareStackFrame} must ensure that we can
580 // finish compilation without errors even if we hit unimplemented
581 // LiftoffAssembler methods.
582 if (DidAssemblerBailout(decoder)) return;
583
584 // Process parameters.
585 if (num_params) DEBUG_CODE_COMMENT("process parameters");
586 __ SpillInstance(instance_reg);
587 // Input 0 is the code target, 1 is the instance. First parameter at 2.
588 uint32_t input_idx = kInstanceParameterIndex + 1;
589 for (uint32_t param_idx = 0; param_idx < num_params; ++param_idx) {
590 input_idx += ProcessParameter(__ local_type(param_idx), input_idx);
591 }
592 int params_size = __ TopSpillOffset();
593 DCHECK_EQ(input_idx, descriptor_->InputCount())((void) 0);
594
595 // Initialize locals beyond parameters.
596 if (num_params < __ num_locals()) DEBUG_CODE_COMMENT("init locals");
597 if (SpillLocalsInitially(decoder, num_params)) {
598 for (uint32_t param_idx = num_params; param_idx < __ num_locals();
599 ++param_idx) {
600 ValueType type = decoder->local_type(param_idx);
601 __ PushStack(type);
602 }
603 int spill_size = __ TopSpillOffset() - params_size;
604 __ FillStackSlotsWithZero(params_size, spill_size);
605 } else {
606 for (uint32_t param_idx = num_params; param_idx < __ num_locals();
607 ++param_idx) {
608 ValueType type = decoder->local_type(param_idx);
609 __ PushConstant(type, int32_t{0});
610 }
611 }
612
613 DCHECK_EQ(__ num_locals(), __ cache_state()->stack_height())((void) 0);
614
615 if (V8_UNLIKELY(debug_sidetable_builder_)(__builtin_expect(!!(debug_sidetable_builder_), 0))) {
616 debug_sidetable_builder_->SetNumLocals(__ num_locals());
617 }
618
619 // The function-prologue stack check is associated with position 0, which
620 // is never a position of any instruction in the function.
621 StackCheck(0);
622
623 if (FLAG_wasm_dynamic_tiering) {
624 // TODO(arobin): Avoid spilling registers unconditionally.
625 __ SpillAllRegisters();
626 DEBUG_CODE_COMMENT("dynamic tiering");
627 LiftoffRegList pinned;
628
629 // Get the number of calls array address.
630 LiftoffRegister array_address =
631 pinned.set(__ GetUnusedRegister(kGpReg, pinned));
632 LOAD_INSTANCE_FIELD(array_address.gp(), NumLiftoffFunctionCallsArray,
633 kSystemPointerSize);
634
635 // Compute the correct offset in the array.
636 uint32_t offset =
637 kInt32Size * declared_function_index(env_->module, func_index_);
638
639 // Get the number of calls and update it.
640 LiftoffRegister number_of_calls =
641 pinned.set(__ GetUnusedRegister(kGpReg, pinned));
642 __ Load(number_of_calls, array_address.gp(), no_reg, offset,
643 LoadType::kI32Load, pinned);
644 __ emit_i32_addi(number_of_calls.gp(), number_of_calls.gp(), 1);
645 __ Store(array_address.gp(), no_reg, offset, number_of_calls,
646 StoreType::kI32Store, pinned);
647
648 // Emit the runtime call if necessary.
649 Label no_tierup;
650 constexpr int kTierUpLimit = 5;
651 __ emit_i32_addi(number_of_calls.gp(), number_of_calls.gp(),
652 -kTierUpLimit);
653 // Unary "unequal" means "different from zero".
654 __ emit_cond_jump(kUnequal, &no_tierup, kWasmI32, number_of_calls.gp());
655 TierUpFunction(decoder);
656 __ bind(&no_tierup);
657 }
658
659 if (FLAG_trace_wasm) TraceFunctionEntry(decoder);
660
661 // If we are generating debug code, do check the "hook on function call"
662 // flag. If set, trigger a break.
663 if (V8_UNLIKELY(for_debugging_)(__builtin_expect(!!(for_debugging_), 0))) {
664 // If there is a breakpoint set on the first instruction (== start of the
665 // function), then skip the check for "hook on function call", since we
666 // will unconditionally break there anyway.
667 bool has_breakpoint = next_breakpoint_ptr_ != nullptr &&
668 (*next_breakpoint_ptr_ == 0 ||
669 *next_breakpoint_ptr_ == decoder->position());
670 if (!has_breakpoint) {
671 DEBUG_CODE_COMMENT("check hook on function call");
672 Register flag = __ GetUnusedRegister(kGpReg, {}).gp();
673 LOAD_INSTANCE_FIELD(flag, HookOnFunctionCallAddress,
674 kSystemPointerSize);
675 Label no_break;
676 __ Load(LiftoffRegister{flag}, flag, no_reg, 0, LoadType::kI32Load8U,
677 {});
678 // Unary "equal" means "equals zero".
679 __ emit_cond_jump(kEqual, &no_break, kWasmI32, flag);
680 EmitBreakpoint(decoder);
681 __ bind(&no_break);
682 }
683 }
684 }
685
686 void GenerateOutOfLineCode(OutOfLineCode* ool) {
687 DEBUG_CODE_COMMENT(
688 (std::string("out of line: ") + GetRuntimeStubName(ool->stub)).c_str());
689 __ bind(ool->label.get());
690 const bool is_stack_check = ool->stub == WasmCode::kWasmStackGuard;
8
←
Assuming field 'stub' is not equal to kWasmStackGuard
→
691 const bool is_mem_out_of_bounds =
692 ool->stub == WasmCode::kThrowWasmTrapMemOutOfBounds;
9
←
Assuming field 'stub' is not equal to kThrowWasmTrapMemOutOfBounds
→
693
694 if (is_mem_out_of_bounds
9.1
'is_mem_out_of_bounds' is false
9.1
'is_mem_out_of_bounds' is false
9.1
'is_mem_out_of_bounds' is false
9.1
'is_mem_out_of_bounds' is false
 && env_->use_trap_handler) {
695 uint32_t pc = static_cast<uint32_t>(__ pc_offset());
696 DCHECK_EQ(pc, __ pc_offset())((void) 0);
697 protected_instructions_.emplace_back(
698 trap_handler::ProtectedInstructionData{ool->pc, pc});
699 }
700
701 if (!env_->runtime_exception_support) {
10
←
Assuming field 'runtime_exception_support' is not equal to 0
→
11
←
Taking false branch
→
702 // We cannot test calls to the runtime in cctest/test-run-wasm.
703 // Therefore we emit a call to C here instead of a call to the runtime.
704 // In this mode, we never generate stack checks.
705 DCHECK(!is_stack_check)((void) 0);
706 __ CallTrapCallbackForTesting();
707 DEBUG_CODE_COMMENT("leave frame");
708 __ LeaveFrame(StackFrame::WASM);
709 __ DropStackSlotsAndRet(
710 static_cast<uint32_t>(descriptor_->StackParameterCount()));
711 return;
712 }
713
714 // We cannot both push and spill registers.
715 DCHECK(ool->regs_to_save.is_empty() || ool->spilled_registers == nullptr)((void) 0);
716 if (!ool->regs_to_save.is_empty()) {
12
←
Assuming the condition is false
→
13
←
Taking false branch
→
717 __ PushRegisters(ool->regs_to_save);
718 } else if (V8_UNLIKELY(ool->spilled_registers != nullptr)(__builtin_expect(!!(ool->spilled_registers != nullptr), 0
))) {
14
←
Assuming the condition is true
→
15
←
Taking true branch
→
719 for (auto& entry : ool->spilled_registers->entries) {
720 __ Spill(entry.offset, entry.reg, entry.type);
16
←
Calling 'LiftoffAssembler::Spill'
→
721 }
722 }
723
724 source_position_table_builder_.AddPosition(
725 __ pc_offset(), SourcePosition(ool->position), true);
726 __ CallRuntimeStub(ool->stub);
727 DCHECK_EQ(!debug_sidetable_builder_, !ool->debug_sidetable_entry_builder)((void) 0);
728 if (V8_UNLIKELY(ool->debug_sidetable_entry_builder)(__builtin_expect(!!(ool->debug_sidetable_entry_builder), 0
))) {
729 ool->debug_sidetable_entry_builder->set_pc_offset(__ pc_offset());
730 }
731 safepoint_table_builder_.DefineSafepoint(&asm_, Safepoint::kNoLazyDeopt);
732 DCHECK_EQ(ool->continuation.get()->is_bound(), is_stack_check)((void) 0);
733 if (!ool->regs_to_save.is_empty()) __ PopRegisters(ool->regs_to_save);
734 if (is_stack_check) {
735 if (V8_UNLIKELY(ool->spilled_registers != nullptr)(__builtin_expect(!!(ool->spilled_registers != nullptr), 0
))) {
736 DCHECK(for_debugging_)((void) 0);
737 for (auto& entry : ool->spilled_registers->entries) {
738 __ Fill(entry.reg, entry.offset, entry.type);
739 }
740 }
741 __ emit_jump(ool->continuation.get());
742 } else {
743 __ AssertUnreachable(AbortReason::kUnexpectedReturnFromWasmTrap);
744 }
745 }
746
747 void FinishFunction(FullDecoder* decoder) {
748 if (DidAssemblerBailout(decoder)) return;
6
←
Taking false branch
→
749 for (OutOfLineCode& ool : out_of_line_code_) {
750 GenerateOutOfLineCode(&ool);
7
←
Calling 'LiftoffCompiler::GenerateOutOfLineCode'
→
751 }
752 __ PatchPrepareStackFrame(pc_offset_stack_frame_construction_,
753 __ GetTotalFrameSize());
754 __ FinishCode();
755 safepoint_table_builder_.Emit(&asm_, __ GetTotalFrameSlotCount());
756 __ MaybeEmitOutOfLineConstantPool();
757 // The previous calls may have also generated a bailout.
758 DidAssemblerBailout(decoder);
759 }
760
761 void OnFirstError(FullDecoder* decoder) {
762 if (!did_bailout()) bailout_reason_ = kDecodeError;
763 UnuseLabels(decoder);
764 asm_.AbortCompilation();
765 }
766
767 V8_NOINLINE__attribute__((noinline)) void EmitDebuggingInfo(FullDecoder* decoder, WasmOpcode opcode) {
768 DCHECK(V8_UNLIKELY(for_debugging_))((void) 0);
769 if (next_breakpoint_ptr_) {
770 if (*next_breakpoint_ptr_ == 0) {
771 // A single breakpoint at offset 0 indicates stepping.
772 DCHECK_EQ(next_breakpoint_ptr_ + 1, next_breakpoint_end_)((void) 0);
773 if (WasmOpcodes::IsBreakable(opcode)) {
774 EmitBreakpoint(decoder);
775 }
776 } else {
777 while (next_breakpoint_ptr_ != next_breakpoint_end_ &&
778 *next_breakpoint_ptr_ < decoder->position()) {
779 // Skip unreachable breakpoints.
780 ++next_breakpoint_ptr_;
781 }
782 if (next_breakpoint_ptr_ == next_breakpoint_end_) {
783 next_breakpoint_ptr_ = next_breakpoint_end_ = nullptr;
784 } else if (*next_breakpoint_ptr_ == decoder->position()) {
785 DCHECK(WasmOpcodes::IsBreakable(opcode))((void) 0);
786 EmitBreakpoint(decoder);
787 }
788 }
789 }
790 }
791
792 void NextInstruction(FullDecoder* decoder, WasmOpcode opcode) {
793 // Add a single check, so that the fast path can be inlined while
794 // {EmitDebuggingInfo} stays outlined.
795 if (V8_UNLIKELY(for_debugging_)(__builtin_expect(!!(for_debugging_), 0))) EmitDebuggingInfo(decoder, opcode);
796 TraceCacheState(decoder);
797#ifdef DEBUG
798 SLOW_DCHECK(__ ValidateCacheState())((void)0);
799 if (WasmOpcodes::IsPrefixOpcode(opcode)) {
800 opcode = decoder->read_prefixed_opcode<Decoder::kValidate>(decoder->pc());
801 }
802 DEBUG_CODE_COMMENT(WasmOpcodes::OpcodeName(opcode));
803#endif
804 }
805
806 void EmitBreakpoint(FullDecoder* decoder) {
807 DEBUG_CODE_COMMENT("breakpoint");
808 DCHECK(for_debugging_)((void) 0);
809 source_position_table_builder_.AddPosition(
810 __ pc_offset(), SourcePosition(decoder->position()), true);
811 __ CallRuntimeStub(WasmCode::kWasmDebugBreak);
812 RegisterDebugSideTableEntry(DebugSideTableBuilder::kAllowRegisters);
813 safepoint_table_builder_.DefineSafepoint(&asm_, Safepoint::kNoLazyDeopt);
814 }
815
816 void Block(FullDecoder* decoder, Control* block) {}
817
818 void Loop(FullDecoder* decoder, Control* loop) {
819 // Before entering a loop, spill all locals to the stack, in order to free
820 // the cache registers, and to avoid unnecessarily reloading stack values
821 // into registers at branches.
822 // TODO(clemensb): Come up with a better strategy here, involving
823 // pre-analysis of the function.
824 __ SpillLocals();
825
826 __ PrepareLoopArgs(loop->start_merge.arity);
827
828 // Loop labels bind at the beginning of the block.
829 __ bind(loop->label.get());
830
831 // Save the current cache state for the merge when jumping to this loop.
832 loop->label_state.Split(*__ cache_state());
833
834 // Execute a stack check in the loop header.
835 StackCheck(decoder->position());
836 }
837
838 void Try(FullDecoder* decoder, Control* block) {
839 unsupported(decoder, kExceptionHandling, "try");
840 }
841
842 void Catch(FullDecoder* decoder, Control* block, Value* exception) {
843 unsupported(decoder, kExceptionHandling, "catch");
844 }
845
846 void If(FullDecoder* decoder, const Value& cond, Control* if_block) {
847 DCHECK_EQ(if_block, decoder->control_at(0))((void) 0);
848 DCHECK(if_block->is_if())((void) 0);
849
850 // Allocate the else state.
851 if_block->else_state = std::make_unique<ElseState>();
852
853 // Test the condition, jump to else if zero.
854 Register value = __ PopToRegister().gp();
855 __ emit_cond_jump(kEqual, if_block->else_state->label.get(), kWasmI32,
856 value);
857
858 // Store the state (after popping the value) for executing the else branch.
859 if_block->else_state->state.Split(*__ cache_state());
860 }
861
862 void FallThruTo(FullDecoder* decoder, Control* c) {
863 if (c->end_merge.reached) {
864 __ MergeFullStackWith(c->label_state, *__ cache_state());
865 } else {
866 c->label_state.Split(*__ cache_state());
867 }
868 TraceCacheState(decoder);
869 }
870
871 void FinishOneArmedIf(FullDecoder* decoder, Control* c) {
872 DCHECK(c->is_onearmed_if())((void) 0);
873 if (c->end_merge.reached) {
874 // Someone already merged to the end of the if. Merge both arms into that.
875 if (c->reachable()) {
876 // Merge the if state into the end state.
877 __ MergeFullStackWith(c->label_state, *__ cache_state());
878 __ emit_jump(c->label.get());
879 }
880 // Merge the else state into the end state.
881 __ bind(c->else_state->label.get());
882 __ MergeFullStackWith(c->label_state, c->else_state->state);
883 __ cache_state()->Steal(c->label_state);
884 } else if (c->reachable()) {
885 // No merge yet at the end of the if, but we need to create a merge for
886 // the both arms of this if. Thus init the merge point from the else
887 // state, then merge the if state into that.
888 DCHECK_EQ(c->start_merge.arity, c->end_merge.arity)((void) 0);
889 c->label_state.InitMerge(c->else_state->state, __ num_locals(),
890 c->start_merge.arity, c->stack_depth);
891 __ MergeFullStackWith(c->label_state, *__ cache_state());
892 __ emit_jump(c->label.get());
893 // Merge the else state into the end state.
894 __ bind(c->else_state->label.get());
895 __ MergeFullStackWith(c->label_state, c->else_state->state);
896 __ cache_state()->Steal(c->label_state);
897 } else {
898 // No merge needed, just continue with the else state.
899 __ bind(c->else_state->label.get());
900 __ cache_state()->Steal(c->else_state->state);
901 }
902 }
903
904 void PopControl(FullDecoder* decoder, Control* c) {
905 if (c->is_loop()) return; // A loop just falls through.
906 if (c->is_onearmed_if()) {
907 // Special handling for one-armed ifs.
908 FinishOneArmedIf(decoder, c);
909 } else if (c->end_merge.reached) {
910 // There is a merge already. Merge our state into that, then continue with
911 // that state.
912 if (c->reachable()) {
913 __ MergeFullStackWith(c->label_state, *__ cache_state());
914 }
915 __ cache_state()->Steal(c->label_state);
916 } else {
917 // No merge, just continue with our current state.
918 }
919
920 if (!c->label.get()->is_bound()) __ bind(c->label.get());
921 }
922
923 void EndControl(FullDecoder* decoder, Control* c) {}
924
925 void GenerateCCall(const LiftoffRegister* result_regs, const FunctionSig* sig,
926 ValueType out_argument_type,
927 const LiftoffRegister* arg_regs,
928 ExternalReference ext_ref) {
929 // Before making a call, spill all cache registers.
930 __ SpillAllRegisters();
931
932 // Store arguments on our stack, then align the stack for calling to C.
933 int param_bytes = 0;
934 for (ValueType param_type : sig->parameters()) {
935 param_bytes += param_type.element_size_bytes();
936 }
937 int out_arg_bytes = out_argument_type == kWasmStmt
938 ? 0
939 : out_argument_type.element_size_bytes();
940 int stack_bytes = std::max(param_bytes, out_arg_bytes);
941 __ CallC(sig, arg_regs, result_regs, out_argument_type, stack_bytes,
942 ext_ref);
943 }
944
945 template <typename EmitFn, typename... Args>
946 typename std::enable_if<!std::is_member_function_pointer<EmitFn>::value>::type
947 CallEmitFn(EmitFn fn, Args... args) {
948 fn(args...);
949 }
950
951 template <typename EmitFn, typename... Args>
952 typename std::enable_if<std::is_member_function_pointer<EmitFn>::value>::type
953 CallEmitFn(EmitFn fn, Args... args) {
954 (asm_.*fn)(ConvertAssemblerArg(args)...);
955 }
956
957 // Wrap a {LiftoffRegister} with implicit conversions to {Register} and
958 // {DoubleRegister}.
959 struct AssemblerRegisterConverter {
960 LiftoffRegister reg;
961 operator LiftoffRegister() { return reg; }
962 operator Register() { return reg.gp(); }
963 operator DoubleRegister() { return reg.fp(); }
964 };
965
966 // Convert {LiftoffRegister} to {AssemblerRegisterConverter}, other types stay
967 // unchanged.
968 template <typename T>
969 typename std::conditional<std::is_same<LiftoffRegister, T>::value,
970 AssemblerRegisterConverter, T>::type
971 ConvertAssemblerArg(T t) {
972 return {t};
973 }
974
975 template <typename EmitFn, typename ArgType>
976 struct EmitFnWithFirstArg {
977 EmitFn fn;
978 ArgType first_arg;
979 };
980
981 template <typename EmitFn, typename ArgType>
982 EmitFnWithFirstArg<EmitFn, ArgType> BindFirst(EmitFn fn, ArgType arg) {
983 return {fn, arg};
984 }
985
986 template <typename EmitFn, typename T, typename... Args>
987 void CallEmitFn(EmitFnWithFirstArg<EmitFn, T> bound_fn, Args... args) {
988 CallEmitFn(bound_fn.fn, bound_fn.first_arg, ConvertAssemblerArg(args)...);
989 }
990
991 template <ValueType::Kind src_type, ValueType::Kind result_type, class EmitFn>
992 void EmitUnOp(EmitFn fn) {
993 constexpr RegClass src_rc = reg_class_for(src_type);
994 constexpr RegClass result_rc = reg_class_for(result_type);
995 LiftoffRegister src = __ PopToRegister();
996 LiftoffRegister dst = src_rc == result_rc
997 ? __ GetUnusedRegister(result_rc, {src}, {})
998 : __ GetUnusedRegister(result_rc, {});
999 CallEmitFn(fn, dst, src);
1000 __ PushRegister(ValueType::Primitive(result_type), dst);
1001 }
1002
1003 template <ValueType::Kind type>
1004 void EmitFloatUnOpWithCFallback(
1005 bool (LiftoffAssembler::*emit_fn)(DoubleRegister, DoubleRegister),
1006 ExternalReference (*fallback_fn)()) {
1007 auto emit_with_c_fallback = [=](LiftoffRegister dst, LiftoffRegister src) {
1008 if ((asm_.*emit_fn)(dst.fp(), src.fp())) return;
1009 ExternalReference ext_ref = fallback_fn();
1010 ValueType sig_reps[] = {ValueType::Primitive(type)};
1011 FunctionSig sig(0, 1, sig_reps);
1012 GenerateCCall(&dst, &sig, ValueType::Primitive(type), &src, ext_ref);
1013 };
1014 EmitUnOp<type, type>(emit_with_c_fallback);
1015 }
1016
1017 enum TypeConversionTrapping : bool { kCanTrap = true, kNoTrap = false };
1018 template <ValueType::Kind dst_type, ValueType::Kind src_type,
1019 TypeConversionTrapping can_trap>
1020 void EmitTypeConversion(WasmOpcode opcode, ExternalReference (*fallback_fn)(),
1021 WasmCodePosition trap_position) {
1022 static constexpr RegClass src_rc = reg_class_for(src_type);
1023 static constexpr RegClass dst_rc = reg_class_for(dst_type);
1024 LiftoffRegister src = __ PopToRegister();
1025 LiftoffRegister dst = src_rc == dst_rc
1026 ? __ GetUnusedRegister(dst_rc, {src}, {})
1027 : __ GetUnusedRegister(dst_rc, {});
1028 DCHECK_EQ(!!can_trap, trap_position > 0)((void) 0);
1029 Label* trap = can_trap ? AddOutOfLineTrap(
1030 trap_position,
1031 WasmCode::kThrowWasmTrapFloatUnrepresentable)
1032 : nullptr;
1033 if (!__ emit_type_conversion(opcode, dst, src, trap)) {
1034 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(fallback_fn)((void) 0);
1035 ExternalReference ext_ref = fallback_fn();
1036 if (can_trap) {
1037 // External references for potentially trapping conversions return int.
1038 ValueType sig_reps[] = {kWasmI32, ValueType::Primitive(src_type)};
1039 FunctionSig sig(1, 1, sig_reps);
1040 LiftoffRegister ret_reg =
1041 __ GetUnusedRegister(kGpReg, LiftoffRegList::ForRegs(dst));
1042 LiftoffRegister dst_regs[] = {ret_reg, dst};
1043 GenerateCCall(dst_regs, &sig, ValueType::Primitive(dst_type), &src,
1044 ext_ref);
1045 __ emit_cond_jump(kEqual, trap, kWasmI32, ret_reg.gp());
1046 } else {
1047 ValueType sig_reps[] = {ValueType::Primitive(src_type)};
1048 FunctionSig sig(0, 1, sig_reps);
1049 GenerateCCall(&dst, &sig, ValueType::Primitive(dst_type), &src,
1050 ext_ref);
1051 }
1052 }
1053 __ PushRegister(ValueType::Primitive(dst_type), dst);
1054 }
1055
1056 void UnOp(FullDecoder* decoder, WasmOpcode opcode, const Value& value,
1057 Value* result) {
1058#define CASE_I32_UNOP(opcode, fn) \
1059 case kExpr##opcode: \
1060 return EmitUnOp<kI32, kI32>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_##fn);
1061#define CASE_I64_UNOP(opcode, fn) \
1062 case kExpr##opcode: \
1063 return EmitUnOp<kI64, kI64>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_##fn);
1064#define CASE_FLOAT_UNOP(opcode, type, fn) \
1065 case kExpr##opcode: \
1066 return EmitUnOp<k##type, k##type>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_##fn);
1067#define CASE_FLOAT_UNOP_WITH_CFALLBACK(opcode, type, fn) \
1068 case kExpr##opcode: \
1069 return EmitFloatUnOpWithCFallback<k##type>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_##fn, \
1070 &ExternalReference::wasm_##fn);
1071#define CASE_TYPE_CONVERSION(opcode, dst_type, src_type, ext_ref, can_trap) \
1072 case kExpr##opcode: \
1073 return EmitTypeConversion<k##dst_type, k##src_type, can_trap>( \
1074 kExpr##opcode, ext_ref, can_trap ? decoder->position() : 0);
1075 switch (opcode) {
1076 CASE_I32_UNOP(I32Clz, i32_clz)
1077 CASE_I32_UNOP(I32Ctz, i32_ctz)
1078 CASE_FLOAT_UNOP(F32Abs, F32, f32_abs)
1079 CASE_FLOAT_UNOP(F32Neg, F32, f32_neg)
1080 CASE_FLOAT_UNOP_WITH_CFALLBACK(F32Ceil, F32, f32_ceil)
1081 CASE_FLOAT_UNOP_WITH_CFALLBACK(F32Floor, F32, f32_floor)
1082 CASE_FLOAT_UNOP_WITH_CFALLBACK(F32Trunc, F32, f32_trunc)
1083 CASE_FLOAT_UNOP_WITH_CFALLBACK(F32NearestInt, F32, f32_nearest_int)
1084 CASE_FLOAT_UNOP(F32Sqrt, F32, f32_sqrt)
1085 CASE_FLOAT_UNOP(F64Abs, F64, f64_abs)
1086 CASE_FLOAT_UNOP(F64Neg, F64, f64_neg)
1087 CASE_FLOAT_UNOP_WITH_CFALLBACK(F64Ceil, F64, f64_ceil)
1088 CASE_FLOAT_UNOP_WITH_CFALLBACK(F64Floor, F64, f64_floor)
1089 CASE_FLOAT_UNOP_WITH_CFALLBACK(F64Trunc, F64, f64_trunc)
1090 CASE_FLOAT_UNOP_WITH_CFALLBACK(F64NearestInt, F64, f64_nearest_int)
1091 CASE_FLOAT_UNOP(F64Sqrt, F64, f64_sqrt)
1092 CASE_TYPE_CONVERSION(I32ConvertI64, I32, I64, nullptr, kNoTrap)
1093 CASE_TYPE_CONVERSION(I32SConvertF32, I32, F32, nullptr, kCanTrap)
1094 CASE_TYPE_CONVERSION(I32UConvertF32, I32, F32, nullptr, kCanTrap)
1095 CASE_TYPE_CONVERSION(I32SConvertF64, I32, F64, nullptr, kCanTrap)
1096 CASE_TYPE_CONVERSION(I32UConvertF64, I32, F64, nullptr, kCanTrap)
1097 CASE_TYPE_CONVERSION(I32ReinterpretF32, I32, F32, nullptr, kNoTrap)
1098 CASE_TYPE_CONVERSION(I64SConvertI32, I64, I32, nullptr, kNoTrap)
1099 CASE_TYPE_CONVERSION(I64UConvertI32, I64, I32, nullptr, kNoTrap)
1100 CASE_TYPE_CONVERSION(I64SConvertF32, I64, F32,
1101 &ExternalReference::wasm_float32_to_int64, kCanTrap)
1102 CASE_TYPE_CONVERSION(I64UConvertF32, I64, F32,
1103 &ExternalReference::wasm_float32_to_uint64, kCanTrap)
1104 CASE_TYPE_CONVERSION(I64SConvertF64, I64, F64,
1105 &ExternalReference::wasm_float64_to_int64, kCanTrap)
1106 CASE_TYPE_CONVERSION(I64UConvertF64, I64, F64,
1107 &ExternalReference::wasm_float64_to_uint64, kCanTrap)
1108 CASE_TYPE_CONVERSION(I64ReinterpretF64, I64, F64, nullptr, kNoTrap)
1109 CASE_TYPE_CONVERSION(F32SConvertI32, F32, I32, nullptr, kNoTrap)
1110 CASE_TYPE_CONVERSION(F32UConvertI32, F32, I32, nullptr, kNoTrap)
1111 CASE_TYPE_CONVERSION(F32SConvertI64, F32, I64,
1112 &ExternalReference::wasm_int64_to_float32, kNoTrap)
1113 CASE_TYPE_CONVERSION(F32UConvertI64, F32, I64,
1114 &ExternalReference::wasm_uint64_to_float32, kNoTrap)
1115 CASE_TYPE_CONVERSION(F32ConvertF64, F32, F64, nullptr, kNoTrap)
1116 CASE_TYPE_CONVERSION(F32ReinterpretI32, F32, I32, nullptr, kNoTrap)
1117 CASE_TYPE_CONVERSION(F64SConvertI32, F64, I32, nullptr, kNoTrap)
1118 CASE_TYPE_CONVERSION(F64UConvertI32, F64, I32, nullptr, kNoTrap)
1119 CASE_TYPE_CONVERSION(F64SConvertI64, F64, I64,
1120 &ExternalReference::wasm_int64_to_float64, kNoTrap)
1121 CASE_TYPE_CONVERSION(F64UConvertI64, F64, I64,
1122 &ExternalReference::wasm_uint64_to_float64, kNoTrap)
1123 CASE_TYPE_CONVERSION(F64ConvertF32, F64, F32, nullptr, kNoTrap)
1124 CASE_TYPE_CONVERSION(F64ReinterpretI64, F64, I64, nullptr, kNoTrap)
1125 CASE_I32_UNOP(I32SExtendI8, i32_signextend_i8)
1126 CASE_I32_UNOP(I32SExtendI16, i32_signextend_i16)
1127 CASE_I64_UNOP(I64SExtendI8, i64_signextend_i8)
1128 CASE_I64_UNOP(I64SExtendI16, i64_signextend_i16)
1129 CASE_I64_UNOP(I64SExtendI32, i64_signextend_i32)
1130 CASE_I64_UNOP(I64Clz, i64_clz)
1131 CASE_I64_UNOP(I64Ctz, i64_ctz)
1132 CASE_TYPE_CONVERSION(I32SConvertSatF32, I32, F32, nullptr, kNoTrap)
1133 CASE_TYPE_CONVERSION(I32UConvertSatF32, I32, F32, nullptr, kNoTrap)
1134 CASE_TYPE_CONVERSION(I32SConvertSatF64, I32, F64, nullptr, kNoTrap)
1135 CASE_TYPE_CONVERSION(I32UConvertSatF64, I32, F64, nullptr, kNoTrap)
1136 CASE_TYPE_CONVERSION(I64SConvertSatF32, I64, F32,
1137 &ExternalReference::wasm_float32_to_int64_sat,
1138 kNoTrap)
1139 CASE_TYPE_CONVERSION(I64UConvertSatF32, I64, F32,
1140 &ExternalReference::wasm_float32_to_uint64_sat,
1141 kNoTrap)
1142 CASE_TYPE_CONVERSION(I64SConvertSatF64, I64, F64,
1143 &ExternalReference::wasm_float64_to_int64_sat,
1144 kNoTrap)
1145 CASE_TYPE_CONVERSION(I64UConvertSatF64, I64, F64,
1146 &ExternalReference::wasm_float64_to_uint64_sat,
1147 kNoTrap)
1148 case kExprI32Eqz:
1149 DCHECK(decoder->lookahead(0, kExprI32Eqz))((void) 0);
1150 if (decoder->lookahead(1, kExprBrIf) && !for_debugging_) {
1151 DCHECK(!has_outstanding_op())((void) 0);
1152 outstanding_op_ = kExprI32Eqz;
1153 break;
1154 }
1155 return EmitUnOp<kI32, kI32>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32_eqz);
1156 case kExprI64Eqz:
1157 return EmitUnOp<kI64, kI32>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i64_eqz);
1158 case kExprI32Popcnt:
1159 return EmitUnOp<kI32, kI32>(
1160 [=](LiftoffRegister dst, LiftoffRegister src) {
1161 if (__ emit_i32_popcnt(dst.gp(), src.gp())) return;
1162 ValueType sig_i_i_reps[] = {kWasmI32, kWasmI32};
1163 FunctionSig sig_i_i(1, 1, sig_i_i_reps);
1164 GenerateCCall(&dst, &sig_i_i, kWasmStmt, &src,
1165 ExternalReference::wasm_word32_popcnt());
1166 });
1167 case kExprI64Popcnt:
1168 return EmitUnOp<kI64, kI64>(
1169 [=](LiftoffRegister dst, LiftoffRegister src) {
1170 if (__ emit_i64_popcnt(dst, src)) return;
1171 // The c function returns i32. We will zero-extend later.
1172 ValueType sig_i_l_reps[] = {kWasmI32, kWasmI64};
1173 FunctionSig sig_i_l(1, 1, sig_i_l_reps);
1174 LiftoffRegister c_call_dst = kNeedI64RegPair ? dst.low() : dst;
1175 GenerateCCall(&c_call_dst, &sig_i_l, kWasmStmt, &src,
1176 ExternalReference::wasm_word64_popcnt());
1177 // Now zero-extend the result to i64.
1178 __ emit_type_conversion(kExprI64UConvertI32, dst, c_call_dst,
1179 nullptr);
1180 });
1181 default:
1182 UNREACHABLE()V8_Fatal("unreachable code");
1183 }
1184#undef CASE_I32_UNOP
1185#undef CASE_I64_UNOP
1186#undef CASE_FLOAT_UNOP
1187#undef CASE_FLOAT_UNOP_WITH_CFALLBACK
1188#undef CASE_TYPE_CONVERSION
1189 }
1190
1191 template <ValueType::Kind src_type, ValueType::Kind result_type,
1192 typename EmitFn, typename EmitFnImm>
1193 void EmitBinOpImm(EmitFn fn, EmitFnImm fnImm) {
1194 static constexpr RegClass src_rc = reg_class_for(src_type);
1195 static constexpr RegClass result_rc = reg_class_for(result_type);
1196
1197 LiftoffAssembler::VarState rhs_slot = __ cache_state()->stack_state.back();
1198 // Check if the RHS is an immediate.
1199 if (rhs_slot.is_const()) {
1200 __ cache_state()->stack_state.pop_back();
1201 int32_t imm = rhs_slot.i32_const();
1202
1203 LiftoffRegister lhs = __ PopToRegister();
1204 LiftoffRegister dst = src_rc == result_rc
1205 ? __ GetUnusedRegister(result_rc, {lhs}, {})
1206 : __ GetUnusedRegister(result_rc, {});
1207
1208 CallEmitFn(fnImm, dst, lhs, imm);
1209 __ PushRegister(ValueType::Primitive(result_type), dst);
1210 } else {
1211 // The RHS was not an immediate.
1212 EmitBinOp<src_type, result_type>(fn);
1213 }
1214 }
1215
1216 template <ValueType::Kind src_type, ValueType::Kind result_type,
1217 bool swap_lhs_rhs = false, typename EmitFn>
1218 void EmitBinOp(EmitFn fn) {
1219 static constexpr RegClass src_rc = reg_class_for(src_type);
1220 static constexpr RegClass result_rc = reg_class_for(result_type);
1221 LiftoffRegister rhs = __ PopToRegister();
1222 LiftoffRegister lhs = __ PopToRegister(LiftoffRegList::ForRegs(rhs));
1223 LiftoffRegister dst = src_rc == result_rc
1224 ? __ GetUnusedRegister(result_rc, {lhs, rhs}, {})
1225 : __ GetUnusedRegister(result_rc, {});
1226
1227 if (swap_lhs_rhs) std::swap(lhs, rhs);
1228
1229 CallEmitFn(fn, dst, lhs, rhs);
1230 __ PushRegister(ValueType::Primitive(result_type), dst);
1231 }
1232
1233 void EmitDivOrRem64CCall(LiftoffRegister dst, LiftoffRegister lhs,
1234 LiftoffRegister rhs, ExternalReference ext_ref,
1235 Label* trap_by_zero,
1236 Label* trap_unrepresentable = nullptr) {
1237 // Cannot emit native instructions, build C call.
1238 LiftoffRegister ret =
1239 __ GetUnusedRegister(kGpReg, LiftoffRegList::ForRegs(dst));
1240 LiftoffRegister tmp =
1241 __ GetUnusedRegister(kGpReg, LiftoffRegList::ForRegs(dst, ret));
1242 LiftoffRegister arg_regs[] = {lhs, rhs};
1243 LiftoffRegister result_regs[] = {ret, dst};
1244 ValueType sig_types[] = {kWasmI32, kWasmI64, kWasmI64};
1245 // <i64, i64> -> i32 (with i64 output argument)
1246 FunctionSig sig(1, 2, sig_types);
1247 GenerateCCall(result_regs, &sig, kWasmI64, arg_regs, ext_ref);
1248 __ LoadConstant(tmp, WasmValue(int32_t{0}));
1249 __ emit_cond_jump(kEqual, trap_by_zero, kWasmI32, ret.gp(), tmp.gp());
1250 if (trap_unrepresentable) {
1251 __ LoadConstant(tmp, WasmValue(int32_t{-1}));
1252 __ emit_cond_jump(kEqual, trap_unrepresentable, kWasmI32, ret.gp(),
1253 tmp.gp());
1254 }
1255 }
1256
1257 template <WasmOpcode opcode>
1258 void EmitI32CmpOp(FullDecoder* decoder) {
1259 DCHECK(decoder->lookahead(0, opcode))((void) 0);
1260 if (decoder->lookahead(1, kExprBrIf) && !for_debugging_) {
1261 DCHECK(!has_outstanding_op())((void) 0);
1262 outstanding_op_ = opcode;
1263 return;
1264 }
1265 return EmitBinOp<kI32, kI32>(BindFirst(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32_set_cond,
1266 GetCompareCondition(opcode)));
1267 }
1268
1269 void BinOp(FullDecoder* decoder, WasmOpcode opcode, const Value& lhs,
1270 const Value& rhs, Value* result) {
1271#define CASE_I64_SHIFTOP(opcode, fn) \
1272 case kExpr##opcode: \
1273 return EmitBinOpImm<kI64, kI64>( \
1274 [=](LiftoffRegister dst, LiftoffRegister src, \
1275 LiftoffRegister amount) { \
1276 __ emit_##fn(dst, src, \
1277 amount.is_gp_pair() ? amount.low_gp() : amount.gp()); \
1278 }, \
1279 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_##fn##i);
1280#define CASE_CCALL_BINOP(opcode, type, ext_ref_fn) \
1281 case kExpr##opcode: \
1282 return EmitBinOp<k##type, k##type>( \
1283 [=](LiftoffRegister dst, LiftoffRegister lhs, LiftoffRegister rhs) { \
1284 LiftoffRegister args[] = {lhs, rhs}; \
1285 auto ext_ref = ExternalReference::ext_ref_fn(); \
1286 ValueType sig_reps[] = {kWasm##type, kWasm##type, kWasm##type}; \
1287 const bool out_via_stack = kWasm##type == kWasmI64; \
1288 FunctionSig sig(out_via_stack ? 0 : 1, 2, sig_reps); \
1289 ValueType out_arg_type = out_via_stack ? kWasmI64 : kWasmStmt; \
1290 GenerateCCall(&dst, &sig, out_arg_type, args, ext_ref); \
1291 });
1292 switch (opcode) {
1293 case kExprI32Add:
1294 return EmitBinOpImm<kI32, kI32>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32_add,
1295 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32_addi);
1296 case kExprI32Sub:
1297 return EmitBinOp<kI32, kI32>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32_sub);
1298 case kExprI32Mul:
1299 return EmitBinOp<kI32, kI32>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32_mul);
1300 case kExprI32And:
1301 return EmitBinOpImm<kI32, kI32>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32_and,
1302 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32_andi);
1303 case kExprI32Ior:
1304 return EmitBinOpImm<kI32, kI32>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32_or,
1305 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32_ori);
1306 case kExprI32Xor:
1307 return EmitBinOpImm<kI32, kI32>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32_xor,
1308 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32_xori);
1309 case kExprI32Eq:
1310 return EmitI32CmpOp<kExprI32Eq>(decoder);
1311 case kExprI32Ne:
1312 return EmitI32CmpOp<kExprI32Ne>(decoder);
1313 case kExprI32LtS:
1314 return EmitI32CmpOp<kExprI32LtS>(decoder);
1315 case kExprI32LtU:
1316 return EmitI32CmpOp<kExprI32LtU>(decoder);
1317 case kExprI32GtS:
1318 return EmitI32CmpOp<kExprI32GtS>(decoder);
1319 case kExprI32GtU:
1320 return EmitI32CmpOp<kExprI32GtU>(decoder);
1321 case kExprI32LeS:
1322 return EmitI32CmpOp<kExprI32LeS>(decoder);
1323 case kExprI32LeU:
1324 return EmitI32CmpOp<kExprI32LeU>(decoder);
1325 case kExprI32GeS:
1326 return EmitI32CmpOp<kExprI32GeS>(decoder);
1327 case kExprI32GeU:
1328 return EmitI32CmpOp<kExprI32GeU>(decoder);
1329 case kExprI64Add:
1330 return EmitBinOpImm<kI64, kI64>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i64_add,
1331 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i64_addi);
1332 case kExprI64Sub:
1333 return EmitBinOp<kI64, kI64>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i64_sub);
1334 case kExprI64Mul:
1335 return EmitBinOp<kI64, kI64>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i64_mul);
1336 case kExprI64And:
1337 return EmitBinOpImm<kI64, kI64>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i64_and,
1338 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i64_andi);
1339 case kExprI64Ior:
1340 return EmitBinOpImm<kI64, kI64>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i64_or,
1341 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i64_ori);
1342 case kExprI64Xor:
1343 return EmitBinOpImm<kI64, kI64>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i64_xor,
1344 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i64_xori);
1345 case kExprI64Eq:
1346 return EmitBinOp<kI64, kI32>(
1347 BindFirst(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i64_set_cond, kEqual));
1348 case kExprI64Ne:
1349 return EmitBinOp<kI64, kI32>(
1350 BindFirst(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i64_set_cond, kUnequal));
1351 case kExprI64LtS:
1352 return EmitBinOp<kI64, kI32>(
1353 BindFirst(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i64_set_cond, kSignedLessThan));
1354 case kExprI64LtU:
1355 return EmitBinOp<kI64, kI32>(
1356 BindFirst(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i64_set_cond, kUnsignedLessThan));
1357 case kExprI64GtS:
1358 return EmitBinOp<kI64, kI32>(BindFirst(
1359 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i64_set_cond, kSignedGreaterThan));
1360 case kExprI64GtU:
1361 return EmitBinOp<kI64, kI32>(BindFirst(
1362 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i64_set_cond, kUnsignedGreaterThan));
1363 case kExprI64LeS:
1364 return EmitBinOp<kI64, kI32>(
1365 BindFirst(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i64_set_cond, kSignedLessEqual));
1366 case kExprI64LeU:
1367 return EmitBinOp<kI64, kI32>(BindFirst(
1368 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i64_set_cond, kUnsignedLessEqual));
1369 case kExprI64GeS:
1370 return EmitBinOp<kI64, kI32>(BindFirst(
1371 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i64_set_cond, kSignedGreaterEqual));
1372 case kExprI64GeU:
1373 return EmitBinOp<kI64, kI32>(BindFirst(
1374 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i64_set_cond, kUnsignedGreaterEqual));
1375 case kExprF32Eq:
1376 return EmitBinOp<kF32, kI32>(
1377 BindFirst(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_f32_set_cond, kEqual));
1378 case kExprF32Ne:
1379 return EmitBinOp<kF32, kI32>(
1380 BindFirst(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_f32_set_cond, kUnequal));
1381 case kExprF32Lt:
1382 return EmitBinOp<kF32, kI32>(
1383 BindFirst(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_f32_set_cond, kUnsignedLessThan));
1384 case kExprF32Gt:
1385 return EmitBinOp<kF32, kI32>(BindFirst(
1386 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_f32_set_cond, kUnsignedGreaterThan));
1387 case kExprF32Le:
1388 return EmitBinOp<kF32, kI32>(BindFirst(
1389 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_f32_set_cond, kUnsignedLessEqual));
1390 case kExprF32Ge:
1391 return EmitBinOp<kF32, kI32>(BindFirst(
1392 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_f32_set_cond, kUnsignedGreaterEqual));
1393 case kExprF64Eq:
1394 return EmitBinOp<kF64, kI32>(
1395 BindFirst(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_f64_set_cond, kEqual));
1396 case kExprF64Ne:
1397 return EmitBinOp<kF64, kI32>(
1398 BindFirst(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_f64_set_cond, kUnequal));
1399 case kExprF64Lt:
1400 return EmitBinOp<kF64, kI32>(
1401 BindFirst(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_f64_set_cond, kUnsignedLessThan));
1402 case kExprF64Gt:
1403 return EmitBinOp<kF64, kI32>(BindFirst(
1404 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_f64_set_cond, kUnsignedGreaterThan));
1405 case kExprF64Le:
1406 return EmitBinOp<kF64, kI32>(BindFirst(
1407 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_f64_set_cond, kUnsignedLessEqual));
1408 case kExprF64Ge:
1409 return EmitBinOp<kF64, kI32>(BindFirst(
1410 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_f64_set_cond, kUnsignedGreaterEqual));
1411 case kExprI32Shl:
1412 return EmitBinOpImm<kI32, kI32>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32_shl,
1413 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32_shli);
1414 case kExprI32ShrS:
1415 return EmitBinOpImm<kI32, kI32>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32_sar,
1416 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32_sari);
1417 case kExprI32ShrU:
1418 return EmitBinOpImm<kI32, kI32>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32_shr,
1419 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32_shri);
1420 CASE_CCALL_BINOP(I32Rol, I32, wasm_word32_rol)
1421 CASE_CCALL_BINOP(I32Ror, I32, wasm_word32_ror)
1422 CASE_I64_SHIFTOP(I64Shl, i64_shl)
1423 CASE_I64_SHIFTOP(I64ShrS, i64_sar)
1424 CASE_I64_SHIFTOP(I64ShrU, i64_shr)
1425 CASE_CCALL_BINOP(I64Rol, I64, wasm_word64_rol)
1426 CASE_CCALL_BINOP(I64Ror, I64, wasm_word64_ror)
1427 case kExprF32Add:
1428 return EmitBinOp<kF32, kF32>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_f32_add);
1429 case kExprF32Sub:
1430 return EmitBinOp<kF32, kF32>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_f32_sub);
1431 case kExprF32Mul:
1432 return EmitBinOp<kF32, kF32>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_f32_mul);
1433 case kExprF32Div:
1434 return EmitBinOp<kF32, kF32>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_f32_div);
1435 case kExprF32Min:
1436 return EmitBinOp<kF32, kF32>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_f32_min);
1437 case kExprF32Max:
1438 return EmitBinOp<kF32, kF32>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_f32_max);
1439 case kExprF32CopySign:
1440 return EmitBinOp<kF32, kF32>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_f32_copysign);
1441 case kExprF64Add:
1442 return EmitBinOp<kF64, kF64>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_f64_add);
1443 case kExprF64Sub:
1444 return EmitBinOp<kF64, kF64>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_f64_sub);
1445 case kExprF64Mul:
1446 return EmitBinOp<kF64, kF64>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_f64_mul);
1447 case kExprF64Div:
1448 return EmitBinOp<kF64, kF64>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_f64_div);
1449 case kExprF64Min:
1450 return EmitBinOp<kF64, kF64>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_f64_min);
1451 case kExprF64Max:
1452 return EmitBinOp<kF64, kF64>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_f64_max);
1453 case kExprF64CopySign:
1454 return EmitBinOp<kF64, kF64>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_f64_copysign);
1455 case kExprI32DivS:
1456 return EmitBinOp<kI32, kI32>([this, decoder](LiftoffRegister dst,
1457 LiftoffRegister lhs,
1458 LiftoffRegister rhs) {
1459 WasmCodePosition position = decoder->position();
1460 AddOutOfLineTrap(position, WasmCode::kThrowWasmTrapDivByZero);
1461 // Adding the second trap might invalidate the pointer returned for
1462 // the first one, thus get both pointers afterwards.
1463 AddOutOfLineTrap(position,
1464 WasmCode::kThrowWasmTrapDivUnrepresentable);
1465 Label* div_by_zero = out_of_line_code_.end()[-2].label.get();
1466 Label* div_unrepresentable = out_of_line_code_.end()[-1].label.get();
1467 __ emit_i32_divs(dst.gp(), lhs.gp(), rhs.gp(), div_by_zero,
1468 div_unrepresentable);
1469 });
1470 case kExprI32DivU:
1471 return EmitBinOp<kI32, kI32>(
1472 [this, decoder](LiftoffRegister dst, LiftoffRegister lhs,
1473 LiftoffRegister rhs) {
1474 Label* div_by_zero = AddOutOfLineTrap(
1475 decoder->position(), WasmCode::kThrowWasmTrapDivByZero);
1476 __ emit_i32_divu(dst.gp(), lhs.gp(), rhs.gp(), div_by_zero);
1477 });
1478 case kExprI32RemS:
1479 return EmitBinOp<kI32, kI32>(
1480 [this, decoder](LiftoffRegister dst, LiftoffRegister lhs,
1481 LiftoffRegister rhs) {
1482 Label* rem_by_zero = AddOutOfLineTrap(
1483 decoder->position(), WasmCode::kThrowWasmTrapRemByZero);
1484 __ emit_i32_rems(dst.gp(), lhs.gp(), rhs.gp(), rem_by_zero);
1485 });
1486 case kExprI32RemU:
1487 return EmitBinOp<kI32, kI32>(
1488 [this, decoder](LiftoffRegister dst, LiftoffRegister lhs,
1489 LiftoffRegister rhs) {
1490 Label* rem_by_zero = AddOutOfLineTrap(
