1491 decoder->position(), WasmCode::kThrowWasmTrapRemByZero);
1492 __ emit_i32_remu(dst.gp(), lhs.gp(), rhs.gp(), rem_by_zero);
1493 });
1494 case kExprI64DivS:
1495 return EmitBinOp<kI64, kI64>([this, decoder](LiftoffRegister dst,
1496 LiftoffRegister lhs,
1497 LiftoffRegister rhs) {
1498 WasmCodePosition position = decoder->position();
1499 AddOutOfLineTrap(position, WasmCode::kThrowWasmTrapDivByZero);
1500 // Adding the second trap might invalidate the pointer returned for
1501 // the first one, thus get both pointers afterwards.
1502 AddOutOfLineTrap(position,
1503 WasmCode::kThrowWasmTrapDivUnrepresentable);
1504 Label* div_by_zero = out_of_line_code_.end()[-2].label.get();
1505 Label* div_unrepresentable = out_of_line_code_.end()[-1].label.get();
1506 if (!__ emit_i64_divs(dst, lhs, rhs, div_by_zero,
1507 div_unrepresentable)) {
1508 ExternalReference ext_ref = ExternalReference::wasm_int64_div();
1509 EmitDivOrRem64CCall(dst, lhs, rhs, ext_ref, div_by_zero,
1510 div_unrepresentable);
1511 }
1512 });
1513 case kExprI64DivU:
1514 return EmitBinOp<kI64, kI64>([this, decoder](LiftoffRegister dst,
1515 LiftoffRegister lhs,
1516 LiftoffRegister rhs) {
1517 Label* div_by_zero = AddOutOfLineTrap(
1518 decoder->position(), WasmCode::kThrowWasmTrapDivByZero);
1519 if (!__ emit_i64_divu(dst, lhs, rhs, div_by_zero)) {
1520 ExternalReference ext_ref = ExternalReference::wasm_uint64_div();
1521 EmitDivOrRem64CCall(dst, lhs, rhs, ext_ref, div_by_zero);
1522 }
1523 });
1524 case kExprI64RemS:
1525 return EmitBinOp<kI64, kI64>(
1526 [this, decoder](LiftoffRegister dst, LiftoffRegister lhs,
1527 LiftoffRegister rhs) {
1528 Label* rem_by_zero = AddOutOfLineTrap(
1529 decoder->position(), WasmCode::kThrowWasmTrapRemByZero);
1530 if (!__ emit_i64_rems(dst, lhs, rhs, rem_by_zero)) {
1531 ExternalReference ext_ref = ExternalReference::wasm_int64_mod();
1532 EmitDivOrRem64CCall(dst, lhs, rhs, ext_ref, rem_by_zero);
1533 }
1534 });
1535 case kExprI64RemU:
1536 return EmitBinOp<kI64, kI64>([this, decoder](LiftoffRegister dst,
1537 LiftoffRegister lhs,
1538 LiftoffRegister rhs) {
1539 Label* rem_by_zero = AddOutOfLineTrap(
1540 decoder->position(), WasmCode::kThrowWasmTrapRemByZero);
1541 if (!__ emit_i64_remu(dst, lhs, rhs, rem_by_zero)) {
1542 ExternalReference ext_ref = ExternalReference::wasm_uint64_mod();
1543 EmitDivOrRem64CCall(dst, lhs, rhs, ext_ref, rem_by_zero);
1544 }
1545 });
1546 default:
1547 UNREACHABLE()V8_Fatal("unreachable code");
1548 }
1549#undef CASE_I64_SHIFTOP
1550#undef CASE_CCALL_BINOP
1551 }
1552
1553 void I32Const(FullDecoder* decoder, Value* result, int32_t value) {
1554 __ PushConstant(kWasmI32, value);
1555 }
1556
1557 void I64Const(FullDecoder* decoder, Value* result, int64_t value) {
1558 // The {VarState} stores constant values as int32_t, thus we only store
1559 // 64-bit constants in this field if it fits in an int32_t. Larger values
1560 // cannot be used as immediate value anyway, so we can also just put them in
1561 // a register immediately.
1562 int32_t value_i32 = static_cast<int32_t>(value);
1563 if (value_i32 == value) {
1564 __ PushConstant(kWasmI64, value_i32);
1565 } else {
1566 LiftoffRegister reg = __ GetUnusedRegister(reg_class_for(kWasmI64), {});
1567 __ LoadConstant(reg, WasmValue(value));
1568 __ PushRegister(kWasmI64, reg);
1569 }
1570 }
1571
1572 void F32Const(FullDecoder* decoder, Value* result, float value) {
1573 LiftoffRegister reg = __ GetUnusedRegister(kFpReg, {});
1574 __ LoadConstant(reg, WasmValue(value));
1575 __ PushRegister(kWasmF32, reg);
1576 }
1577
1578 void F64Const(FullDecoder* decoder, Value* result, double value) {
1579 LiftoffRegister reg = __ GetUnusedRegister(kFpReg, {});
1580 __ LoadConstant(reg, WasmValue(value));
1581 __ PushRegister(kWasmF64, reg);
1582 }
1583
1584 void RefNull(FullDecoder* decoder, Value* result) {
1585 unsupported(decoder, kRefTypes, "ref_null");
1586 }
1587
1588 void RefFunc(FullDecoder* decoder, uint32_t function_index, Value* result) {
1589 unsupported(decoder, kRefTypes, "func");
1590 }
1591
1592 void RefAsNonNull(FullDecoder* decoder, const Value& arg, Value* result) {
1593 unsupported(decoder, kRefTypes, "ref.as_non_null");
1594 }
1595
1596 void Drop(FullDecoder* decoder, const Value& value) {
1597 auto& slot = __ cache_state()->stack_state.back();
1598 // If the dropped slot contains a register, decrement it's use count.
1599 if (slot.is_reg()) __ cache_state()->dec_used(slot.reg());
1600 __ cache_state()->stack_state.pop_back();
1601 }
1602
1603 void TraceFunctionExit(FullDecoder* decoder) {
1604 DEBUG_CODE_COMMENT("trace function exit");
1605 // Before making the runtime call, spill all cache registers.
1606 __ SpillAllRegisters();
1607 LiftoffRegList pinned;
1608 // Get a register to hold the stack slot for the return value.
1609 LiftoffRegister info = pinned.set(__ GetUnusedRegister(kGpReg, pinned));
1610 __ AllocateStackSlot(info.gp(), sizeof(int64_t));
1611
1612 // Store the return value if there is exactly one. Multiple return values
1613 // are not handled yet.
1614 size_t num_returns = decoder->sig_->return_count();
1615 if (num_returns == 1) {
1616 ValueType return_type = decoder->sig_->GetReturn(0);
1617 LiftoffRegister return_reg =
1618 __ LoadToRegister(__ cache_state()->stack_state.back(), pinned);
1619 __ Store(info.gp(), no_reg, 0, return_reg,
1620 StoreType::ForValueType(return_type), pinned);
1621 }
1622 // Put the parameter in its place.
1623 WasmTraceExitDescriptor descriptor;
1624 DCHECK_EQ(0, descriptor.GetStackParameterCount())((void) 0);
1625 DCHECK_EQ(1, descriptor.GetRegisterParameterCount())((void) 0);
1626 Register param_reg = descriptor.GetRegisterParameter(0);
1627 if (info.gp() != param_reg) {
1628 __ Move(param_reg, info.gp(), LiftoffAssembler::kWasmIntPtr);
1629 }
1630
1631 source_position_table_builder_.AddPosition(
1632 __ pc_offset(), SourcePosition(decoder->position()), false);
1633 __ CallRuntimeStub(WasmCode::kWasmTraceExit);
1634 safepoint_table_builder_.DefineSafepoint(&asm_, Safepoint::kNoLazyDeopt);
1635
1636 __ DeallocateStackSlot(sizeof(int64_t));
1637 }
1638
1639 void ReturnImpl(FullDecoder* decoder) {
1640 if (FLAG_trace_wasm) TraceFunctionExit(decoder);
1641 size_t num_returns = decoder->sig_->return_count();
1642 if (num_returns > 0) __ MoveToReturnLocations(decoder->sig_, descriptor_);
1643 DEBUG_CODE_COMMENT("leave frame");
1644 __ LeaveFrame(StackFrame::WASM);
1645 __ DropStackSlotsAndRet(
1646 static_cast<uint32_t>(descriptor_->StackParameterCount()));
1647 }
1648
1649 void DoReturn(FullDecoder* decoder, Vector<Value> /*values*/) {
1650 ReturnImpl(decoder);
1651 }
1652
1653 void LocalGet(FullDecoder* decoder, Value* result,
1654 const LocalIndexImmediate<validate>& imm) {
1655 auto local_slot = __ cache_state()->stack_state[imm.index];
1656 __ cache_state()->stack_state.emplace_back(
1657 local_slot.type(), __ NextSpillOffset(local_slot.type()));
1658 auto* slot = &__ cache_state()->stack_state.back();
1659 if (local_slot.is_reg()) {
1660 __ cache_state()->inc_used(local_slot.reg());
1661 slot->MakeRegister(local_slot.reg());
1662 } else if (local_slot.is_const()) {
1663 slot->MakeConstant(local_slot.i32_const());
1664 } else {
1665 DCHECK(local_slot.is_stack())((void) 0);
1666 auto rc = reg_class_for(local_slot.type());
1667 LiftoffRegister reg = __ GetUnusedRegister(rc, {});
1668 __ cache_state()->inc_used(reg);
1669 slot->MakeRegister(reg);
1670 __ Fill(reg, local_slot.offset(), local_slot.type());
1671 }
1672 }
1673
1674 void LocalSetFromStackSlot(LiftoffAssembler::VarState* dst_slot,
1675 uint32_t local_index) {
1676 auto& state = *__ cache_state();
1677 auto& src_slot = state.stack_state.back();
1678 ValueType type = dst_slot->type();
1679 if (dst_slot->is_reg()) {
1680 LiftoffRegister slot_reg = dst_slot->reg();
1681 if (state.get_use_count(slot_reg) == 1) {
1682 __ Fill(dst_slot->reg(), src_slot.offset(), type);
1683 return;
1684 }
1685 state.dec_used(slot_reg);
1686 dst_slot->MakeStack();
1687 }
1688 DCHECK_EQ(type, __ local_type(local_index))((void) 0);
1689 RegClass rc = reg_class_for(type);
1690 LiftoffRegister dst_reg = __ GetUnusedRegister(rc, {});
1691 __ Fill(dst_reg, src_slot.offset(), type);
1692 *dst_slot = LiftoffAssembler::VarState(type, dst_reg, dst_slot->offset());
1693 __ cache_state()->inc_used(dst_reg);
1694 }
1695
1696 void LocalSet(uint32_t local_index, bool is_tee) {
1697 auto& state = *__ cache_state();
1698 auto& source_slot = state.stack_state.back();
1699 auto& target_slot = state.stack_state[local_index];
1700 switch (source_slot.loc()) {
1701 case kRegister:
1702 if (target_slot.is_reg()) state.dec_used(target_slot.reg());
1703 target_slot.Copy(source_slot);
1704 if (is_tee) state.inc_used(target_slot.reg());
1705 break;
1706 case kIntConst:
1707 if (target_slot.is_reg()) state.dec_used(target_slot.reg());
1708 target_slot.Copy(source_slot);
1709 break;
1710 case kStack:
1711 LocalSetFromStackSlot(&target_slot, local_index);
1712 break;
1713 }
1714 if (!is_tee) __ cache_state()->stack_state.pop_back();
1715 }
1716
1717 void LocalSet(FullDecoder* decoder, const Value& value,
1718 const LocalIndexImmediate<validate>& imm) {
1719 LocalSet(imm.index, false);
1720 }
1721
1722 void LocalTee(FullDecoder* decoder, const Value& value, Value* result,
1723 const LocalIndexImmediate<validate>& imm) {
1724 LocalSet(imm.index, true);
1725 }
1726
1727 void AllocateLocals(FullDecoder* decoder, Vector<Value> local_values) {
1728 // TODO(7748): Introduce typed functions bailout reason
1729 unsupported(decoder, kGC, "let");
1730 }
1731
1732 void DeallocateLocals(FullDecoder* decoder, uint32_t count) {
1733 // TODO(7748): Introduce typed functions bailout reason
1734 unsupported(decoder, kGC, "let");
1735 }
1736
1737 Register GetGlobalBaseAndOffset(const WasmGlobal* global,
1738 LiftoffRegList* pinned, uint32_t* offset) {
1739 Register addr = pinned->set(__ GetUnusedRegister(kGpReg, {})).gp();
1740 if (global->mutability && global->imported) {
1741 LOAD_INSTANCE_FIELD(addr, ImportedMutableGlobals, kSystemPointerSize);
1742 __ Load(LiftoffRegister(addr), addr, no_reg,
1743 global->index * sizeof(Address), kPointerLoadType, *pinned);
1744 *offset = 0;
1745 } else {
1746 LOAD_INSTANCE_FIELD(addr, GlobalsStart, kSystemPointerSize);
1747 *offset = global->offset;
1748 }
1749 return addr;
1750 }
1751
1752 void GlobalGet(FullDecoder* decoder, Value* result,
1753 const GlobalIndexImmediate<validate>& imm) {
1754 const auto* global = &env_->module->globals[imm.index];
1755 if (!CheckSupportedType(decoder, kSupportedTypes, global->type, "global"))
1756 return;
1757 LiftoffRegList pinned;
1758 uint32_t offset = 0;
1759 Register addr = GetGlobalBaseAndOffset(global, &pinned, &offset);
1760 LiftoffRegister value =
1761 pinned.set(__ GetUnusedRegister(reg_class_for(global->type), pinned));
1762 LoadType type = LoadType::ForValueType(global->type);
1763 __ Load(value, addr, no_reg, offset, type, pinned, nullptr, true);
1764 __ PushRegister(global->type, value);
1765 }
1766
1767 void GlobalSet(FullDecoder* decoder, const Value& value,
1768 const GlobalIndexImmediate<validate>& imm) {
1769 auto* global = &env_->module->globals[imm.index];
1770 if (!CheckSupportedType(decoder, kSupportedTypes, global->type, "global"))
1771 return;
1772 LiftoffRegList pinned;
1773 uint32_t offset = 0;
1774 Register addr = GetGlobalBaseAndOffset(global, &pinned, &offset);
1775 LiftoffRegister reg = pinned.set(__ PopToRegister(pinned));
1776 StoreType type = StoreType::ForValueType(global->type);
1777 __ Store(addr, no_reg, offset, reg, type, {}, nullptr, true);
1778 }
1779
1780 void TableGet(FullDecoder* decoder, const Value& index, Value* result,
1781 const TableIndexImmediate<validate>& imm) {
1782 unsupported(decoder, kRefTypes, "table_get");
1783 }
1784
1785 void TableSet(FullDecoder* decoder, const Value& index, const Value& value,
1786 const TableIndexImmediate<validate>& imm) {
1787 unsupported(decoder, kRefTypes, "table_set");
1788 }
1789
1790 void Unreachable(FullDecoder* decoder) {
1791 Label* unreachable_label = AddOutOfLineTrap(
1792 decoder->position(), WasmCode::kThrowWasmTrapUnreachable);
1793 __ emit_jump(unreachable_label);
1794 __ AssertUnreachable(AbortReason::kUnexpectedReturnFromWasmTrap);
1795 }
1796
1797 void Select(FullDecoder* decoder, const Value& cond, const Value& fval,
1798 const Value& tval, Value* result) {
1799 LiftoffRegList pinned;
1800 Register condition = pinned.set(__ PopToRegister()).gp();
1801 ValueType type = __ cache_state()->stack_state.end()[-1].type();
1802 DCHECK_EQ(type, __ cache_state()->stack_state.end()[-2].type())((void) 0);
1803 LiftoffRegister false_value = pinned.set(__ PopToRegister(pinned));
1804 LiftoffRegister true_value = __ PopToRegister(pinned);
1805 LiftoffRegister dst = __ GetUnusedRegister(true_value.reg_class(),
1806 {true_value, false_value}, {});
1807 if (!__ emit_select(dst, condition, true_value, false_value, type)) {
1808 // Emit generic code (using branches) instead.
1809 Label cont;
1810 Label case_false;
1811 __ emit_cond_jump(kEqual, &case_false, kWasmI32, condition);
1812 if (dst != true_value) __ Move(dst, true_value, type);
1813 __ emit_jump(&cont);
1814
1815 __ bind(&case_false);
1816 if (dst != false_value) __ Move(dst, false_value, type);
1817 __ bind(&cont);
1818 }
1819 __ PushRegister(type, dst);
1820 }
1821
1822 void BrImpl(Control* target) {
1823 if (!target->br_merge()->reached) {
1824 target->label_state.InitMerge(*__ cache_state(), __ num_locals(),
1825 target->br_merge()->arity,
1826 target->stack_depth);
1827 }
1828 __ MergeStackWith(target->label_state, target->br_merge()->arity);
1829 __ jmp(target->label.get());
1830 }
1831
1832 void Br(FullDecoder* decoder, Control* target) { BrImpl(target); }
1833
1834 void BrOrRet(FullDecoder* decoder, uint32_t depth) {
1835 if (depth == decoder->control_depth() - 1) {
1836 ReturnImpl(decoder);
1837 } else {
1838 BrImpl(decoder->control_at(depth));
1839 }
1840 }
1841
1842 void BrIf(FullDecoder* decoder, const Value& /* cond */, uint32_t depth) {
1843 Label cont_false;
1844 Register value = __ PopToRegister().gp();
1845
1846 if (!has_outstanding_op()) {
1847 // Unary "equal" means "equals zero".
1848 __ emit_cond_jump(kEqual, &cont_false, kWasmI32, value);
1849 } else if (outstanding_op_ == kExprI32Eqz) {
1850 // Unary "unequal" means "not equals zero".
1851 __ emit_cond_jump(kUnequal, &cont_false, kWasmI32, value);
1852 outstanding_op_ = kNoOutstandingOp;
1853 } else {
1854 // Otherwise, it's an i32 compare opcode.
1855 Condition cond = NegateCondition(GetCompareCondition(outstanding_op_));
1856 Register rhs = value;
1857 Register lhs = __ PopToRegister(LiftoffRegList::ForRegs(rhs)).gp();
1858 __ emit_cond_jump(cond, &cont_false, kWasmI32, lhs, rhs);
1859 outstanding_op_ = kNoOutstandingOp;
1860 }
1861
1862 BrOrRet(decoder, depth);
1863 __ bind(&cont_false);
1864 }
1865
1866 // Generate a branch table case, potentially reusing previously generated
1867 // stack transfer code.
1868 void GenerateBrCase(FullDecoder* decoder, uint32_t br_depth,
1869 std::map<uint32_t, MovableLabel>* br_targets) {
1870 MovableLabel& label = (*br_targets)[br_depth];
1871 if (label.get()->is_bound()) {
1872 __ jmp(label.get());
1873 } else {
1874 __ bind(label.get());
1875 BrOrRet(decoder, br_depth);
1876 }
1877 }
1878
1879 // Generate a branch table for input in [min, max).
1880 // TODO(wasm): Generate a real branch table (like TF TableSwitch).
1881 void GenerateBrTable(FullDecoder* decoder, LiftoffRegister tmp,
1882 LiftoffRegister value, uint32_t min, uint32_t max,
1883 BranchTableIterator<validate>* table_iterator,
1884 std::map<uint32_t, MovableLabel>* br_targets) {
1885 DCHECK_LT(min, max)((void) 0);
1886 // Check base case.
1887 if (max == min + 1) {
1888 DCHECK_EQ(min, table_iterator->cur_index())((void) 0);
1889 GenerateBrCase(decoder, table_iterator->next(), br_targets);
1890 return;
1891 }
1892
1893 uint32_t split = min + (max - min) / 2;
1894 Label upper_half;
1895 __ LoadConstant(tmp, WasmValue(split));
1896 __ emit_cond_jump(kUnsignedGreaterEqual, &upper_half, kWasmI32, value.gp(),
1897 tmp.gp());
1898 // Emit br table for lower half:
1899 GenerateBrTable(decoder, tmp, value, min, split, table_iterator,
1900 br_targets);
1901 __ bind(&upper_half);
1902 // table_iterator will trigger a DCHECK if we don't stop decoding now.
1903 if (did_bailout()) return;
1904 // Emit br table for upper half:
1905 GenerateBrTable(decoder, tmp, value, split, max, table_iterator,
1906 br_targets);
1907 }
1908
1909 void BrTable(FullDecoder* decoder, const BranchTableImmediate<validate>& imm,
1910 const Value& key) {
1911 LiftoffRegList pinned;
1912 LiftoffRegister value = pinned.set(__ PopToRegister());
1913 BranchTableIterator<validate> table_iterator(decoder, imm);
1914 std::map<uint32_t, MovableLabel> br_targets;
1915
1916 if (imm.table_count > 0) {
1917 LiftoffRegister tmp = __ GetUnusedRegister(kGpReg, pinned);
1918 __ LoadConstant(tmp, WasmValue(uint32_t{imm.table_count}));
1919 Label case_default;
1920 __ emit_cond_jump(kUnsignedGreaterEqual, &case_default, kWasmI32,
1921 value.gp(), tmp.gp());
1922
1923 GenerateBrTable(decoder, tmp, value, 0, imm.table_count, &table_iterator,
1924 &br_targets);
1925
1926 __ bind(&case_default);
1927 // table_iterator will trigger a DCHECK if we don't stop decoding now.
1928 if (did_bailout()) return;
1929 }
1930
1931 // Generate the default case.
1932 GenerateBrCase(decoder, table_iterator.next(), &br_targets);
1933 DCHECK(!table_iterator.has_next())((void) 0);
1934 }
1935
1936 void Else(FullDecoder* decoder, Control* c) {
1937 if (c->reachable()) {
1938 if (!c->end_merge.reached) {
1939 c->label_state.InitMerge(*__ cache_state(), __ num_locals(),
1940 c->end_merge.arity, c->stack_depth);
1941 }
1942 __ MergeFullStackWith(c->label_state, *__ cache_state());
1943 __ emit_jump(c->label.get());
1944 }
1945 __ bind(c->else_state->label.get());
1946 __ cache_state()->Steal(c->else_state->state);
1947 }
1948
1949 SpilledRegistersForInspection* GetSpilledRegistersForInspection() {
1950 DCHECK(for_debugging_)((void) 0);
1951 // If we are generating debugging code, we really need to spill all
1952 // registers to make them inspectable when stopping at the trap.
1953 auto* spilled = compilation_zone_->New<SpilledRegistersForInspection>(
1954 compilation_zone_);
1955 for (uint32_t i = 0, e = __ cache_state()->stack_height(); i < e; ++i) {
1956 auto& slot = __ cache_state()->stack_state[i];
1957 if (!slot.is_reg()) continue;
1958 spilled->entries.push_back(SpilledRegistersForInspection::Entry{
1959 slot.offset(), slot.reg(), slot.type()});
1960 }
1961 return spilled;
1962 }
1963
1964 Label* AddOutOfLineTrap(WasmCodePosition position,
1965 WasmCode::RuntimeStubId stub, uint32_t pc = 0) {
1966 DCHECK(FLAG_wasm_bounds_checks)((void) 0);
1967
1968 out_of_line_code_.push_back(OutOfLineCode::Trap(
1969 stub, position, pc,
1970 RegisterDebugSideTableEntry(DebugSideTableBuilder::kAssumeSpilling),
1971 V8_UNLIKELY(for_debugging_)(__builtin_expect(!!(for_debugging_), 0)) ? GetSpilledRegistersForInspection()
1972 : nullptr));
1973 return out_of_line_code_.back().label.get();
1974 }
1975
1976 enum ForceCheck : bool { kDoForceCheck = true, kDontForceCheck = false };
1977
1978 // Returns true if the memory access is statically known to be out of bounds
1979 // (a jump to the trap was generated then); return false otherwise.
1980 bool BoundsCheckMem(FullDecoder* decoder, uint32_t access_size,
1981 uint32_t offset, Register index, LiftoffRegList pinned,
1982 ForceCheck force_check) {
1983 const bool statically_oob =
1984 !base::IsInBounds<uint64_t>(offset, access_size, env_->max_memory_size);
1985
1986 if (!force_check && !statically_oob &&
1987 (!FLAG_wasm_bounds_checks || env_->use_trap_handler)) {
1988 return false;
1989 }
1990
1991 // TODO(wasm): This adds protected instruction information for the jump
1992 // instruction we are about to generate. It would be better to just not add
1993 // protected instruction info when the pc is 0.
1994 Label* trap_label = AddOutOfLineTrap(
1995 decoder->position(), WasmCode::kThrowWasmTrapMemOutOfBounds,
1996 env_->use_trap_handler ? __ pc_offset() : 0);
1997
1998 if (statically_oob) {
1999 __ emit_jump(trap_label);
2000 decoder->SetSucceedingCodeDynamicallyUnreachable();
2001 return true;
2002 }
2003
2004 uint64_t end_offset = uint64_t{offset} + access_size - 1u;
2005
2006 // If the end offset is larger than the smallest memory, dynamically check
2007 // the end offset against the actual memory size, which is not known at
2008 // compile time. Otherwise, only one check is required (see below).
2009 LiftoffRegister end_offset_reg =
2010 pinned.set(__ GetUnusedRegister(kGpReg, pinned));
2011 Register mem_size = __ GetUnusedRegister(kGpReg, pinned).gp();
2012 LOAD_INSTANCE_FIELD(mem_size, MemorySize, kSystemPointerSize);
2013
2014 if (kSystemPointerSize == 8) {
2015 __ LoadConstant(end_offset_reg, WasmValue(end_offset));
2016 } else {
2017 __ LoadConstant(end_offset_reg,
2018 WasmValue(static_cast<uint32_t>(end_offset)));
2019 }
2020
2021 if (end_offset >= env_->min_memory_size) {
2022 __ emit_cond_jump(kUnsignedGreaterEqual, trap_label,
2023 LiftoffAssembler::kWasmIntPtr, end_offset_reg.gp(),
2024 mem_size);
2025 }
2026
2027 // Just reuse the end_offset register for computing the effective size.
2028 LiftoffRegister effective_size_reg = end_offset_reg;
2029 __ emit_ptrsize_sub(effective_size_reg.gp(), mem_size, end_offset_reg.gp());
2030
2031 __ emit_u32_to_intptr(index, index);
2032
2033 __ emit_cond_jump(kUnsignedGreaterEqual, trap_label,
2034 LiftoffAssembler::kWasmIntPtr, index,
2035 effective_size_reg.gp());
2036 return false;
2037 }
2038
2039 void AlignmentCheckMem(FullDecoder* decoder, uint32_t access_size,
2040 uint32_t offset, Register index,
2041 LiftoffRegList pinned) {
2042 Label* trap_label = AddOutOfLineTrap(
2043 decoder->position(), WasmCode::kThrowWasmTrapUnalignedAccess, 0);
2044 Register address = __ GetUnusedRegister(kGpReg, pinned).gp();
2045
2046 const uint32_t align_mask = access_size - 1;
2047 if ((offset & align_mask) == 0) {
2048 // If {offset} is aligned, we can produce faster code.
2049
2050 // TODO(ahaas): On Intel, the "test" instruction implicitly computes the
2051 // AND of two operands. We could introduce a new variant of
2052 // {emit_cond_jump} to use the "test" instruction without the "and" here.
2053 // Then we can also avoid using the temp register here.
2054 __ emit_i32_andi(address, index, align_mask);
2055 __ emit_cond_jump(kUnequal, trap_label, kWasmI32, address);
2056 return;
2057 }
2058 __ emit_i32_addi(address, index, offset);
2059 __ emit_i32_andi(address, address, align_mask);
2060
2061 __ emit_cond_jump(kUnequal, trap_label, kWasmI32, address);
2062 }
2063
2064 void TraceMemoryOperation(bool is_store, MachineRepresentation rep,
2065 Register index, uint32_t offset,
2066 WasmCodePosition position) {
2067 // Before making the runtime call, spill all cache registers.
2068 __ SpillAllRegisters();
2069
2070 LiftoffRegList pinned = LiftoffRegList::ForRegs(index);
2071 // Get one register for computing the address (offset + index).
2072 LiftoffRegister address = pinned.set(__ GetUnusedRegister(kGpReg, pinned));
2073 // Compute offset+index in address.
2074 __ LoadConstant(address, WasmValue(offset));
2075 __ emit_i32_add(address.gp(), address.gp(), index);
2076
2077 // Get a register to hold the stack slot for MemoryTracingInfo.
2078 LiftoffRegister info = pinned.set(__ GetUnusedRegister(kGpReg, pinned));
2079 // Allocate stack slot for MemoryTracingInfo.
2080 __ AllocateStackSlot(info.gp(), sizeof(MemoryTracingInfo));
2081
2082 // Now store all information into the MemoryTracingInfo struct.
2083 __ Store(info.gp(), no_reg, offsetof(MemoryTracingInfo, address)__builtin_offsetof(MemoryTracingInfo, address), address,
2084 StoreType::kI32Store, pinned);
2085 __ LoadConstant(address, WasmValue(is_store ? 1 : 0));
2086 __ Store(info.gp(), no_reg, offsetof(MemoryTracingInfo, is_store)__builtin_offsetof(MemoryTracingInfo, is_store), address,
2087 StoreType::kI32Store8, pinned);
2088 __ LoadConstant(address, WasmValue(static_cast<int>(rep)));
2089 __ Store(info.gp(), no_reg, offsetof(MemoryTracingInfo, mem_rep)__builtin_offsetof(MemoryTracingInfo, mem_rep), address,
2090 StoreType::kI32Store8, pinned);
2091
2092 WasmTraceMemoryDescriptor descriptor;
2093 DCHECK_EQ(0, descriptor.GetStackParameterCount())((void) 0);
2094 DCHECK_EQ(1, descriptor.GetRegisterParameterCount())((void) 0);
2095 Register param_reg = descriptor.GetRegisterParameter(0);
2096 if (info.gp() != param_reg) {
2097 __ Move(param_reg, info.gp(), LiftoffAssembler::kWasmIntPtr);
2098 }
2099
2100 source_position_table_builder_.AddPosition(__ pc_offset(),
2101 SourcePosition(position), false);
2102 __ CallRuntimeStub(WasmCode::kWasmTraceMemory);
2103 safepoint_table_builder_.DefineSafepoint(&asm_, Safepoint::kNoLazyDeopt);
2104
2105 __ DeallocateStackSlot(sizeof(MemoryTracingInfo));
2106 }
2107
2108 Register AddMemoryMasking(Register index, uint32_t* offset,
2109 LiftoffRegList* pinned) {
2110 if (!FLAG_untrusted_code_mitigations || env_->use_trap_handler) {
2111 return index;
2112 }
2113 DEBUG_CODE_COMMENT("mask memory index");
2114 // Make sure that we can overwrite {index}.
2115 if (__ cache_state()->is_used(LiftoffRegister(index))) {
2116 Register old_index = index;
2117 pinned->clear(LiftoffRegister(old_index));
2118 index = pinned->set(__ GetUnusedRegister(kGpReg, *pinned)).gp();
2119 if (index != old_index) __ Move(index, old_index, kWasmI32);
2120 }
2121 Register tmp = __ GetUnusedRegister(kGpReg, *pinned).gp();
2122 __ emit_ptrsize_addi(index, index, *offset);
2123 LOAD_INSTANCE_FIELD(tmp, MemoryMask, kSystemPointerSize);
2124 __ emit_ptrsize_and(index, index, tmp);
2125 *offset = 0;
2126 return index;
2127 }
2128
2129 void LoadMem(FullDecoder* decoder, LoadType type,
2130 const MemoryAccessImmediate<validate>& imm,
2131 const Value& index_val, Value* result) {
2132 ValueType value_type = type.value_type();
2133 if (!CheckSupportedType(decoder, kSupportedTypes, value_type, "load"))
2134 return;
2135 LiftoffRegList pinned;
2136 Register index = pinned.set(__ PopToRegister()).gp();
2137 if (BoundsCheckMem(decoder, type.size(), imm.offset, index, pinned,
2138 kDontForceCheck)) {
2139 return;
2140 }
2141 uint32_t offset = imm.offset;
2142 index = AddMemoryMasking(index, &offset, &pinned);
2143 DEBUG_CODE_COMMENT("load from memory");
2144 Register addr = pinned.set(__ GetUnusedRegister(kGpReg, pinned)).gp();
2145 LOAD_INSTANCE_FIELD(addr, MemoryStart, kSystemPointerSize);
2146 RegClass rc = reg_class_for(value_type);
2147 LiftoffRegister value = pinned.set(__ GetUnusedRegister(rc, pinned));
2148 uint32_t protected_load_pc = 0;
2149 __ Load(value, addr, index, offset, type, pinned, &protected_load_pc, true);
2150 if (env_->use_trap_handler) {
2151 AddOutOfLineTrap(decoder->position(),
2152 WasmCode::kThrowWasmTrapMemOutOfBounds,
2153 protected_load_pc);
2154 }
2155 __ PushRegister(value_type, value);
2156
2157 if (FLAG_trace_wasm_memory) {
2158 TraceMemoryOperation(false, type.mem_type().representation(), index,
2159 offset, decoder->position());
2160 }
2161 }
2162
2163 void LoadTransform(FullDecoder* decoder, LoadType type,
2164 LoadTransformationKind transform,
2165 const MemoryAccessImmediate<validate>& imm,
2166 const Value& index_val, Value* result) {
2167 // LoadTransform requires SIMD support, so check for it here. If
2168 // unsupported, bailout and let TurboFan lower the code.
2169 if (!CheckSupportedType(decoder, kSupportedTypes, kWasmS128,
2170 "LoadTransform")) {
2171 return;
2172 }
2173
2174 if (transform == LoadTransformationKind::kZeroExtend) {
2175 unsupported(decoder, kSimd, "prototyping s128 load zero extend");
2176 return;
2177 }
2178
2179 LiftoffRegList pinned;
2180 Register index = pinned.set(__ PopToRegister()).gp();
2181 // For load splats, LoadType is the size of the load, and for load
2182 // extends, LoadType is the size of the lane, and it always loads 8 bytes.
2183 uint32_t access_size =
2184 transform == LoadTransformationKind::kExtend ? 8 : type.size();
2185 if (BoundsCheckMem(decoder, access_size, imm.offset, index, pinned,
2186 kDontForceCheck)) {
2187 return;
2188 }
2189
2190 uint32_t offset = imm.offset;
2191 index = AddMemoryMasking(index, &offset, &pinned);
2192 DEBUG_CODE_COMMENT("load with transformation");
2193 Register addr = __ GetUnusedRegister(kGpReg, pinned).gp();
2194 LOAD_INSTANCE_FIELD(addr, MemoryStart, kSystemPointerSize);
2195 LiftoffRegister value = __ GetUnusedRegister(reg_class_for(kS128), {});
2196 uint32_t protected_load_pc = 0;
2197 __ LoadTransform(value, addr, index, offset, type, transform,
2198 &protected_load_pc);
2199
2200 if (env_->use_trap_handler) {
2201 AddOutOfLineTrap(decoder->position(),
2202 WasmCode::kThrowWasmTrapMemOutOfBounds,
2203 protected_load_pc);
2204 }
2205 __ PushRegister(ValueType::Primitive(kS128), value);
2206
2207 if (FLAG_trace_wasm_memory) {
2208 // Again load extend is different.
2209 MachineRepresentation mem_rep =
2210 transform == LoadTransformationKind::kExtend
2211 ? MachineRepresentation::kWord64
2212 : type.mem_type().representation();
2213 TraceMemoryOperation(false, mem_rep, index, offset, decoder->position());
2214 }
2215 }
2216
2217 void StoreMem(FullDecoder* decoder, StoreType type,
2218 const MemoryAccessImmediate<validate>& imm,
2219 const Value& index_val, const Value& value_val) {
2220 ValueType value_type = type.value_type();
2221 if (!CheckSupportedType(decoder, kSupportedTypes, value_type, "store"))
2222 return;
2223 LiftoffRegList pinned;
2224 LiftoffRegister value = pinned.set(__ PopToRegister());
2225 Register index = pinned.set(__ PopToRegister(pinned)).gp();
2226 if (BoundsCheckMem(decoder, type.size(), imm.offset, index, pinned,
2227 kDontForceCheck)) {
2228 return;
2229 }
2230 uint32_t offset = imm.offset;
2231 index = AddMemoryMasking(index, &offset, &pinned);
2232 DEBUG_CODE_COMMENT("store to memory");
2233 Register addr = pinned.set(__ GetUnusedRegister(kGpReg, pinned)).gp();
2234 LOAD_INSTANCE_FIELD(addr, MemoryStart, kSystemPointerSize);
2235 uint32_t protected_store_pc = 0;
2236 LiftoffRegList outer_pinned;
2237 if (FLAG_trace_wasm_memory) outer_pinned.set(index);
2238 __ Store(addr, index, offset, value, type, outer_pinned,
2239 &protected_store_pc, true);
2240 if (env_->use_trap_handler) {
2241 AddOutOfLineTrap(decoder->position(),
2242 WasmCode::kThrowWasmTrapMemOutOfBounds,
2243 protected_store_pc);
2244 }
2245 if (FLAG_trace_wasm_memory) {
2246 TraceMemoryOperation(true, type.mem_rep(), index, offset,
2247 decoder->position());
2248 }
2249 }
2250
2251 void CurrentMemoryPages(FullDecoder* decoder, Value* result) {
2252 Register mem_size = __ GetUnusedRegister(kGpReg, {}).gp();
2253 LOAD_INSTANCE_FIELD(mem_size, MemorySize, kSystemPointerSize);
2254 __ emit_ptrsize_shri(mem_size, mem_size, kWasmPageSizeLog2);
2255 __ PushRegister(kWasmI32, LiftoffRegister(mem_size));
2256 }
2257
2258 void MemoryGrow(FullDecoder* decoder, const Value& value, Value* result_val) {
2259 // Pop the input, then spill all cache registers to make the runtime call.
2260 LiftoffRegList pinned;
2261 LiftoffRegister input = pinned.set(__ PopToRegister());
2262 __ SpillAllRegisters();
2263
2264 constexpr Register kGpReturnReg = kGpReturnRegisters[0];
2265 static_assert(kLiftoffAssemblerGpCacheRegs & kGpReturnReg.bit(),
2266 "first return register is a cache register (needs more "
2267 "complex code here otherwise)");
2268 LiftoffRegister result = pinned.set(LiftoffRegister(kGpReturnReg));
2269
2270 WasmMemoryGrowDescriptor descriptor;
2271 DCHECK_EQ(0, descriptor.GetStackParameterCount())((void) 0);
2272 DCHECK_EQ(1, descriptor.GetRegisterParameterCount())((void) 0);
2273 DCHECK_EQ(kWasmI32.machine_type(), descriptor.GetParameterType(0))((void) 0);
2274
2275 Register param_reg = descriptor.GetRegisterParameter(0);
2276 if (input.gp() != param_reg) __ Move(param_reg, input.gp(), kWasmI32);
2277
2278 __ CallRuntimeStub(WasmCode::kWasmMemoryGrow);
2279 RegisterDebugSideTableEntry(DebugSideTableBuilder::kDidSpill);
2280 safepoint_table_builder_.DefineSafepoint(&asm_, Safepoint::kNoLazyDeopt);
2281
2282 if (kReturnRegister0 != result.gp()) {
2283 __ Move(result.gp(), kReturnRegister0, kWasmI32);
2284 }
2285
2286 __ PushRegister(kWasmI32, result);
2287 }
2288
2289 DebugSideTableBuilder::EntryBuilder* RegisterDebugSideTableEntry(
2290 DebugSideTableBuilder::AssumeSpilling assume_spilling) {
2291 if (V8_LIKELY(!debug_sidetable_builder_)(__builtin_expect(!!(!debug_sidetable_builder_), 1))) return nullptr;
2292 int stack_height = static_cast<int>(__ cache_state()->stack_height());
2293 return debug_sidetable_builder_->NewEntry(
2294 __ pc_offset(), __ num_locals(), stack_height,
2295 __ cache_state()->stack_state.begin(), assume_spilling);
2296 }
2297
2298 enum CallKind : bool { kReturnCall = true, kNoReturnCall = false };
2299
2300 void CallDirect(FullDecoder* decoder,
2301 const CallFunctionImmediate<validate>& imm,
2302 const Value args[], Value[]) {
2303 CallDirect(decoder, imm, args, nullptr, kNoReturnCall);
2304 }
2305
2306 void CallIndirect(FullDecoder* decoder, const Value& index_val,
2307 const CallIndirectImmediate<validate>& imm,
2308 const Value args[], Value returns[]) {
2309 CallIndirect(decoder, index_val, imm, kNoReturnCall);
2310 }
2311
2312 void CallRef(FullDecoder* decoder, const Value& func_ref,
2313 const FunctionSig* sig, uint32_t sig_index, const Value args[],
2314 Value returns[]) {
2315 unsupported(decoder, kRefTypes, "call_ref");
2316 }
2317
2318 void ReturnCall(FullDecoder* decoder,
2319 const CallFunctionImmediate<validate>& imm,
2320 const Value args[]) {
2321 CallDirect(decoder, imm, args, nullptr, kReturnCall);
2322 }
2323
2324 void ReturnCallIndirect(FullDecoder* decoder, const Value& index_val,
2325 const CallIndirectImmediate<validate>& imm,
2326 const Value args[]) {
2327 CallIndirect(decoder, index_val, imm, kReturnCall);
2328 }
2329
2330 void ReturnCallRef(FullDecoder* decoder, const Value& func_ref,
2331 const FunctionSig* sig, uint32_t sig_index,
2332 const Value args[]) {
2333 unsupported(decoder, kRefTypes, "call_ref");
2334 }
2335
2336 void BrOnNull(FullDecoder* decoder, const Value& ref_object, uint32_t depth) {
2337 unsupported(decoder, kRefTypes, "br_on_null");
2338 }
2339
2340 template <ValueType::Kind src_type, ValueType::Kind result_type,
2341 typename EmitFn>
2342 void EmitTerOp(EmitFn fn) {
2343 static constexpr RegClass src_rc = reg_class_for(src_type);
2344 static constexpr RegClass result_rc = reg_class_for(result_type);
2345 LiftoffRegister src3 = __ PopToRegister();
2346 LiftoffRegister src2 = __ PopToRegister(LiftoffRegList::ForRegs(src3));
2347 LiftoffRegister src1 =
2348 __ PopToRegister(LiftoffRegList::ForRegs(src3, src2));
2349 // Reusing src1 and src2 will complicate codegen for select for some
2350 // backend, so we allow only reusing src3 (the mask), and pin src1 and src2.
2351 LiftoffRegister dst =
2352 src_rc == result_rc
2353 ? __ GetUnusedRegister(result_rc, {src3},
2354 LiftoffRegList::ForRegs(src1, src2))
2355 : __ GetUnusedRegister(result_rc, {});
2356 CallEmitFn(fn, dst, src1, src2, src3);
2357 __ PushRegister(ValueType::Primitive(result_type), dst);
2358 }
2359
2360 template <typename EmitFn, typename EmitFnImm>
2361 void EmitSimdShiftOp(EmitFn fn, EmitFnImm fnImm) {
2362 static constexpr RegClass result_rc = reg_class_for(ValueType::kS128);
2363
2364 LiftoffAssembler::VarState rhs_slot = __ cache_state()->stack_state.back();
2365 // Check if the RHS is an immediate.
2366 if (rhs_slot.is_const()) {
2367 __ cache_state()->stack_state.pop_back();
2368 int32_t imm = rhs_slot.i32_const();
2369
2370 LiftoffRegister operand = __ PopToRegister();
2371 LiftoffRegister dst = __ GetUnusedRegister(result_rc, {operand}, {});
2372
2373 CallEmitFn(fnImm, dst, operand, imm);
2374 __ PushRegister(kWasmS128, dst);
2375 } else {
2376 LiftoffRegister count = __ PopToRegister();
2377 LiftoffRegister operand = __ PopToRegister();
2378 LiftoffRegister dst = __ GetUnusedRegister(result_rc, {operand}, {});
2379
2380 CallEmitFn(fn, dst, operand, count);
2381 __ PushRegister(kWasmS128, dst);
2382 }
2383 }
2384
2385 void SimdOp(FullDecoder* decoder, WasmOpcode opcode, Vector<Value> args,
2386 Value* result) {
2387 if (!CpuFeatures::SupportsWasmSimd128()) {
2388 return unsupported(decoder, kSimd, "simd");
2389 }
2390 switch (opcode) {
2391 case wasm::kExprS8x16Swizzle:
2392 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_s8x16_swizzle);
2393 case wasm::kExprI8x16Splat:
2394 return EmitUnOp<kI32, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i8x16_splat);
2395 case wasm::kExprI16x8Splat:
2396 return EmitUnOp<kI32, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i16x8_splat);
2397 case wasm::kExprI32x4Splat:
2398 return EmitUnOp<kI32, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32x4_splat);
2399 case wasm::kExprI64x2Splat:
2400 return EmitUnOp<kI64, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i64x2_splat);
2401 case wasm::kExprF32x4Splat:
2402 return EmitUnOp<kF32, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_f32x4_splat);
2403 case wasm::kExprF64x2Splat:
2404 return EmitUnOp<kF64, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_f64x2_splat);
2405 case wasm::kExprI8x16Eq:
2406 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i8x16_eq);
2407 case wasm::kExprI8x16Ne:
2408 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i8x16_ne);
2409 case wasm::kExprI8x16LtS:
2410 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128, true>(
2411 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i8x16_gt_s);
2412 case wasm::kExprI8x16LtU:
2413 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128, true>(
2414 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i8x16_gt_u);
2415 case wasm::kExprI8x16GtS:
2416 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i8x16_gt_s);
2417 case wasm::kExprI8x16GtU:
2418 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i8x16_gt_u);
2419 case wasm::kExprI8x16LeS:
2420 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128, true>(
2421 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i8x16_ge_s);
2422 case wasm::kExprI8x16LeU:
2423 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128, true>(
2424 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i8x16_ge_u);
2425 case wasm::kExprI8x16GeS:
2426 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i8x16_ge_s);
2427 case wasm::kExprI8x16GeU:
2428 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i8x16_ge_u);
2429 case wasm::kExprI16x8Eq:
2430 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i16x8_eq);
2431 case wasm::kExprI16x8Ne:
2432 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i16x8_ne);
2433 case wasm::kExprI16x8LtS:
2434 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128, true>(
2435 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i16x8_gt_s);
2436 case wasm::kExprI16x8LtU:
2437 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128, true>(
2438 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i16x8_gt_u);
2439 case wasm::kExprI16x8GtS:
2440 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i16x8_gt_s);
2441 case wasm::kExprI16x8GtU:
2442 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i16x8_gt_u);
2443 case wasm::kExprI16x8LeS:
2444 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128, true>(
2445 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i16x8_ge_s);
2446 case wasm::kExprI16x8LeU:
2447 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128, true>(
2448 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i16x8_ge_u);
2449 case wasm::kExprI16x8GeS:
2450 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i16x8_ge_s);
2451 case wasm::kExprI16x8GeU:
2452 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i16x8_ge_u);
2453 case wasm::kExprI32x4Eq:
2454 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32x4_eq);
2455 case wasm::kExprI32x4Ne:
2456 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32x4_ne);
2457 case wasm::kExprI32x4LtS:
2458 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128, true>(
2459 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32x4_gt_s);
2460 case wasm::kExprI32x4LtU:
2461 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128, true>(
2462 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32x4_gt_u);
2463 case wasm::kExprI32x4GtS:
2464 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32x4_gt_s);
2465 case wasm::kExprI32x4GtU:
2466 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32x4_gt_u);
2467 case wasm::kExprI32x4LeS:
2468 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128, true>(
2469 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32x4_ge_s);
2470 case wasm::kExprI32x4LeU:
2471 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128, true>(
2472 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32x4_ge_u);
2473 case wasm::kExprI32x4GeS:
2474 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32x4_ge_s);
2475 case wasm::kExprI32x4GeU:
2476 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32x4_ge_u);
2477 case wasm::kExprF32x4Eq:
2478 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_f32x4_eq);
2479 case wasm::kExprF32x4Ne:
2480 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_f32x4_ne);
2481 case wasm::kExprF32x4Lt:
2482 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_f32x4_lt);
2483 case wasm::kExprF32x4Gt:
2484 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128, true>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_f32x4_lt);
2485 case wasm::kExprF32x4Le:
2486 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_f32x4_le);
2487 case wasm::kExprF32x4Ge:
2488 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128, true>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_f32x4_le);
2489 case wasm::kExprF64x2Eq:
2490 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_f64x2_eq);
2491 case wasm::kExprF64x2Ne:
2492 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_f64x2_ne);
2493 case wasm::kExprF64x2Lt:
2494 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_f64x2_lt);
2495 case wasm::kExprF64x2Gt:
2496 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128, true>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_f64x2_lt);
2497 case wasm::kExprF64x2Le:
2498 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_f64x2_le);
2499 case wasm::kExprF64x2Ge:
2500 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128, true>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_f64x2_le);
2501 case wasm::kExprS128Not:
2502 return EmitUnOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_s128_not);
2503 case wasm::kExprS128And:
2504 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_s128_and);
2505 case wasm::kExprS128Or:
2506 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_s128_or);
2507 case wasm::kExprS128Xor:
2508 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_s128_xor);
2509 case wasm::kExprS128Select:
2510 return EmitTerOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_s128_select);
2511 case wasm::kExprI8x16Neg:
2512 return EmitUnOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i8x16_neg);
2513 case wasm::kExprV8x16AnyTrue:
2514 return EmitUnOp<kS128, kI32>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_v8x16_anytrue);
2515 case wasm::kExprV8x16AllTrue:
2516 return EmitUnOp<kS128, kI32>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_v8x16_alltrue);
2517 case wasm::kExprI8x16BitMask:
2518 return EmitUnOp<kS128, kI32>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i8x16_bitmask);
2519 case wasm::kExprI8x16Shl:
2520 return EmitSimdShiftOp(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i8x16_shl,
2521 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i8x16_shli);
2522 case wasm::kExprI8x16ShrS:
2523 return EmitSimdShiftOp(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i8x16_shr_s,
2524 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i8x16_shri_s);
2525 case wasm::kExprI8x16ShrU:
2526 return EmitSimdShiftOp(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i8x16_shr_u,
2527 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i8x16_shri_u);
2528 case wasm::kExprI8x16Add:
2529 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i8x16_add);
2530 case wasm::kExprI8x16AddSaturateS:
2531 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(
2532 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i8x16_add_saturate_s);
2533 case wasm::kExprI8x16AddSaturateU:
2534 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(
2535 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i8x16_add_saturate_u);
2536 case wasm::kExprI8x16Sub:
2537 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i8x16_sub);
2538 case wasm::kExprI8x16SubSaturateS:
2539 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(
2540 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i8x16_sub_saturate_s);
2541 case wasm::kExprI8x16SubSaturateU:
2542 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(
2543 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i8x16_sub_saturate_u);
2544 case wasm::kExprI8x16Mul:
2545 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i8x16_mul);
2546 case wasm::kExprI8x16MinS:
2547 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i8x16_min_s);
2548 case wasm::kExprI8x16MinU:
2549 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i8x16_min_u);
2550 case wasm::kExprI8x16MaxS:
2551 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i8x16_max_s);
2552 case wasm::kExprI8x16MaxU:
2553 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i8x16_max_u);
2554 case wasm::kExprI16x8Neg:
2555 return EmitUnOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i16x8_neg);
2556 case wasm::kExprV16x8AnyTrue:
2557 return EmitUnOp<kS128, kI32>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_v16x8_anytrue);
2558 case wasm::kExprV16x8AllTrue:
2559 return EmitUnOp<kS128, kI32>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_v16x8_alltrue);
2560 case wasm::kExprI16x8BitMask:
2561 return EmitUnOp<kS128, kI32>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i16x8_bitmask);
2562 case wasm::kExprI16x8Shl:
2563 return EmitSimdShiftOp(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i16x8_shl,
2564 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i16x8_shli);
2565 case wasm::kExprI16x8ShrS:
2566 return EmitSimdShiftOp(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i16x8_shr_s,
2567 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i16x8_shri_s);
2568 case wasm::kExprI16x8ShrU:
2569 return EmitSimdShiftOp(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i16x8_shr_u,
2570 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i16x8_shri_u);
2571 case wasm::kExprI16x8Add:
2572 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i16x8_add);
2573 case wasm::kExprI16x8AddSaturateS:
2574 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(
2575 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i16x8_add_saturate_s);
2576 case wasm::kExprI16x8AddSaturateU:
2577 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(
2578 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i16x8_add_saturate_u);
2579 case wasm::kExprI16x8Sub:
2580 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i16x8_sub);
2581 case wasm::kExprI16x8SubSaturateS:
2582 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(
2583 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i16x8_sub_saturate_s);
2584 case wasm::kExprI16x8SubSaturateU:
2585 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(
2586 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i16x8_sub_saturate_u);
2587 case wasm::kExprI16x8Mul:
2588 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i16x8_mul);
2589 case wasm::kExprI16x8MinS:
2590 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i16x8_min_s);
2591 case wasm::kExprI16x8MinU:
2592 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i16x8_min_u);
2593 case wasm::kExprI16x8MaxS:
2594 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i16x8_max_s);
2595 case wasm::kExprI16x8MaxU:
2596 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i16x8_max_u);
2597 case wasm::kExprI32x4Neg:
2598 return EmitUnOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32x4_neg);
2599 case wasm::kExprV32x4AnyTrue:
2600 return EmitUnOp<kS128, kI32>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_v32x4_anytrue);
2601 case wasm::kExprV32x4AllTrue:
2602 return EmitUnOp<kS128, kI32>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_v32x4_alltrue);
2603 case wasm::kExprI32x4BitMask:
2604 return EmitUnOp<kS128, kI32>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32x4_bitmask);
2605 case wasm::kExprI32x4Shl:
2606 return EmitSimdShiftOp(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32x4_shl,
2607 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32x4_shli);
2608 case wasm::kExprI32x4ShrS:
2609 return EmitSimdShiftOp(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32x4_shr_s,
2610 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32x4_shri_s);
2611 case wasm::kExprI32x4ShrU:
2612 return EmitSimdShiftOp(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32x4_shr_u,
2613 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32x4_shri_u);
2614 case wasm::kExprI32x4Add:
2615 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32x4_add);
2616 case wasm::kExprI32x4Sub:
2617 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32x4_sub);
2618 case wasm::kExprI32x4Mul:
2619 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32x4_mul);
2620 case wasm::kExprI32x4MinS:
2621 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32x4_min_s);
2622 case wasm::kExprI32x4MinU:
2623 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32x4_min_u);
2624 case wasm::kExprI32x4MaxS:
2625 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32x4_max_s);
2626 case wasm::kExprI32x4MaxU:
2627 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32x4_max_u);
2628 case wasm::kExprI64x2Neg:
2629 return EmitUnOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i64x2_neg);
2630 case wasm::kExprI64x2Shl:
2631 return EmitSimdShiftOp(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i64x2_shl,
2632 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i64x2_shli);
2633 case wasm::kExprI64x2ShrS:
2634 return EmitSimdShiftOp(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i64x2_shr_s,
2635 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i64x2_shri_s);
2636 case wasm::kExprI64x2ShrU:
2637 return EmitSimdShiftOp(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i64x2_shr_u,
2638 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i64x2_shri_u);
2639 case wasm::kExprI64x2Add:
2640 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i64x2_add);
2641 case wasm::kExprI64x2Sub:
2642 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i64x2_sub);
2643 case wasm::kExprI64x2Mul:
2644 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i64x2_mul);
2645 case wasm::kExprF32x4Abs:
2646 return EmitUnOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_f32x4_abs);
2647 case wasm::kExprF32x4Neg:
2648 return EmitUnOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_f32x4_neg);
2649 case wasm::kExprF32x4Sqrt:
2650 return EmitUnOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_f32x4_sqrt);
2651 case wasm::kExprF32x4Add:
2652 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_f32x4_add);
2653 case wasm::kExprF32x4Sub:
2654 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_f32x4_sub);
2655 case wasm::kExprF32x4Mul:
2656 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_f32x4_mul);
2657 case wasm::kExprF32x4Div:
2658 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_f32x4_div);
2659 case wasm::kExprF32x4Min:
2660 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_f32x4_min);
2661 case wasm::kExprF32x4Max:
2662 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_f32x4_max);
2663 case wasm::kExprF64x2Abs:
2664 return EmitUnOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_f64x2_abs);
2665 case wasm::kExprF64x2Neg:
2666 return EmitUnOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_f64x2_neg);
2667 case wasm::kExprF64x2Sqrt:
2668 return EmitUnOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_f64x2_sqrt);
2669 case wasm::kExprF64x2Add:
2670 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_f64x2_add);
2671 case wasm::kExprF64x2Sub:
2672 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_f64x2_sub);
2673 case wasm::kExprF64x2Mul:
2674 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_f64x2_mul);
2675 case wasm::kExprF64x2Div:
2676 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_f64x2_div);
2677 case wasm::kExprF64x2Min:
2678 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_f64x2_min);
2679 case wasm::kExprF64x2Max:
2680 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_f64x2_max);
2681 case wasm::kExprI32x4SConvertF32x4:
2682 return EmitUnOp<kS128, kS128>(
2683 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32x4_sconvert_f32x4);
2684 case wasm::kExprI32x4UConvertF32x4:
2685 return EmitUnOp<kS128, kS128>(
2686 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32x4_uconvert_f32x4);
2687 case wasm::kExprF32x4SConvertI32x4:
2688 return EmitUnOp<kS128, kS128>(
2689 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_f32x4_sconvert_i32x4);
2690 case wasm::kExprF32x4UConvertI32x4:
2691 return EmitUnOp<kS128, kS128>(
2692 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_f32x4_uconvert_i32x4);
2693 case wasm::kExprI8x16SConvertI16x8:
2694 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(
2695 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i8x16_sconvert_i16x8);
2696 case wasm::kExprI8x16UConvertI16x8:
2697 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(
2698 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i8x16_uconvert_i16x8);
2699 case wasm::kExprI16x8SConvertI32x4:
2700 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(
2701 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i16x8_sconvert_i32x4);
2702 case wasm::kExprI16x8UConvertI32x4:
2703 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(
2704 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i16x8_uconvert_i32x4);
2705 case wasm::kExprI16x8SConvertI8x16Low:
2706 return EmitUnOp<kS128, kS128>(
2707 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i16x8_sconvert_i8x16_low);
2708 case wasm::kExprI16x8SConvertI8x16High:
2709 return EmitUnOp<kS128, kS128>(
2710 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i16x8_sconvert_i8x16_high);
2711 case wasm::kExprI16x8UConvertI8x16Low:
2712 return EmitUnOp<kS128, kS128>(
2713 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i16x8_uconvert_i8x16_low);
2714 case wasm::kExprI16x8UConvertI8x16High:
2715 return EmitUnOp<kS128, kS128>(
2716 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i16x8_uconvert_i8x16_high);
2717 case wasm::kExprI32x4SConvertI16x8Low:
2718 return EmitUnOp<kS128, kS128>(
2719 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32x4_sconvert_i16x8_low);
2720 case wasm::kExprI32x4SConvertI16x8High:
2721 return EmitUnOp<kS128, kS128>(
2722 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32x4_sconvert_i16x8_high);
2723 case wasm::kExprI32x4UConvertI16x8Low:
2724 return EmitUnOp<kS128, kS128>(
2725 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32x4_uconvert_i16x8_low);
2726 case wasm::kExprI32x4UConvertI16x8High:
2727 return EmitUnOp<kS128, kS128>(
2728 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32x4_uconvert_i16x8_high);
2729 case wasm::kExprS128AndNot:
2730 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_s128_and_not);
2731 case wasm::kExprI8x16RoundingAverageU:
2732 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(
2733 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i8x16_rounding_average_u);
2734 case wasm::kExprI16x8RoundingAverageU:
2735 return EmitBinOp<kS128, kS128>(
2736 &LiftoffAssembler::emit_i16x8_rounding_average_u);
2737 case wasm::kExprI8x16Abs:
2738 return EmitUnOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i8x16_abs);
2739 case wasm::kExprI16x8Abs:
2740 return EmitUnOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i16x8_abs);
2741 case wasm::kExprI32x4Abs:
2742 return EmitUnOp<kS128, kS128>(&LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32x4_abs);
2743 default:
2744 unsupported(decoder, kSimd, "simd");
2745 }
2746 }
2747
2748 template <ValueType::Kind src_type, ValueType::Kind result_type,
2749 typename EmitFn>
2750 void EmitSimdExtractLaneOp(EmitFn fn,
2751 const SimdLaneImmediate<validate>& imm) {
2752 static constexpr RegClass src_rc = reg_class_for(src_type);
2753 static constexpr RegClass result_rc = reg_class_for(result_type);
2754 LiftoffRegister lhs = __ PopToRegister();
2755 LiftoffRegister dst = src_rc == result_rc
2756 ? __ GetUnusedRegister(result_rc, {lhs}, {})
2757 : __ GetUnusedRegister(result_rc, {});
2758 fn(dst, lhs, imm.lane);
2759 __ PushRegister(ValueType::Primitive(result_type), dst);
2760 }
2761
2762 template <ValueType::Kind src2_type, typename EmitFn>
2763 void EmitSimdReplaceLaneOp(EmitFn fn,
2764 const SimdLaneImmediate<validate>& imm) {
2765 static constexpr RegClass src1_rc = reg_class_for(kS128);
2766 static constexpr RegClass src2_rc = reg_class_for(src2_type);
2767 static constexpr RegClass result_rc = reg_class_for(kS128);
2768 // On backends which need fp pair, src1_rc and result_rc end up being
2769 // kFpRegPair, which is != kFpReg, but we still want to pin src2 when it is
2770 // kFpReg, since it can overlap with those pairs.
2771 static constexpr bool pin_src2 = kNeedS128RegPair && src2_rc == kFpReg;
2772
2773 // Does not work for arm
2774 LiftoffRegister src2 = __ PopToRegister();
2775 LiftoffRegister src1 = (src1_rc == src2_rc || pin_src2)
2776 ? __ PopToRegister(LiftoffRegList::ForRegs(src2))
2777 : __
2778 PopToRegister();
2779 LiftoffRegister dst =
2780 (src2_rc == result_rc || pin_src2)
2781 ? __ GetUnusedRegister(result_rc, {src1},
2782 LiftoffRegList::ForRegs(src2))
2783 : __ GetUnusedRegister(result_rc, {src1}, {});
2784 fn(dst, src1, src2, imm.lane);
2785 __ PushRegister(kWasmS128, dst);
2786 }
2787
2788 void SimdLaneOp(FullDecoder* decoder, WasmOpcode opcode,
2789 const SimdLaneImmediate<validate>& imm,
2790 const Vector<Value> inputs, Value* result) {
2791 if (!CpuFeatures::SupportsWasmSimd128()) {
2792 return unsupported(decoder, kSimd, "simd");
2793 }
2794 switch (opcode) {
2795#define CASE_SIMD_EXTRACT_LANE_OP(opcode, type, fn) \
2796 case wasm::kExpr##opcode: \
2797 EmitSimdExtractLaneOp<kS128, k##type>( \
2798 [=](LiftoffRegister dst, LiftoffRegister lhs, uint8_t imm_lane_idx) { \
2799 __ emit_##fn(dst, lhs, imm_lane_idx); \
2800 }, \
2801 imm); \
2802 break;
2803 CASE_SIMD_EXTRACT_LANE_OP(I8x16ExtractLaneS, I32, i8x16_extract_lane_s)
2804 CASE_SIMD_EXTRACT_LANE_OP(I8x16ExtractLaneU, I32, i8x16_extract_lane_u)
2805 CASE_SIMD_EXTRACT_LANE_OP(I16x8ExtractLaneS, I32, i16x8_extract_lane_s)
2806 CASE_SIMD_EXTRACT_LANE_OP(I16x8ExtractLaneU, I32, i16x8_extract_lane_u)
2807 CASE_SIMD_EXTRACT_LANE_OP(I32x4ExtractLane, I32, i32x4_extract_lane)
2808 CASE_SIMD_EXTRACT_LANE_OP(I64x2ExtractLane, I64, i64x2_extract_lane)
2809 CASE_SIMD_EXTRACT_LANE_OP(F32x4ExtractLane, F32, f32x4_extract_lane)
2810 CASE_SIMD_EXTRACT_LANE_OP(F64x2ExtractLane, F64, f64x2_extract_lane)
2811#undef CASE_SIMD_EXTRACT_LANE_OP
2812#define CASE_SIMD_REPLACE_LANE_OP(opcode, type, fn) \
2813 case wasm::kExpr##opcode: \
2814 EmitSimdReplaceLaneOp<k##type>( \
2815 [=](LiftoffRegister dst, LiftoffRegister src1, LiftoffRegister src2, \
2816 uint8_t imm_lane_idx) { \
2817 __ emit_##fn(dst, src1, src2, imm_lane_idx); \
2818 }, \
2819 imm); \
2820 break;
2821 CASE_SIMD_REPLACE_LANE_OP(I8x16ReplaceLane, I32, i8x16_replace_lane)
2822 CASE_SIMD_REPLACE_LANE_OP(I16x8ReplaceLane, I32, i16x8_replace_lane)
2823 CASE_SIMD_REPLACE_LANE_OP(I32x4ReplaceLane, I32, i32x4_replace_lane)
2824 CASE_SIMD_REPLACE_LANE_OP(I64x2ReplaceLane, I64, i64x2_replace_lane)
2825 CASE_SIMD_REPLACE_LANE_OP(F32x4ReplaceLane, F32, f32x4_replace_lane)
2826 CASE_SIMD_REPLACE_LANE_OP(F64x2ReplaceLane, F64, f64x2_replace_lane)
2827#undef CASE_SIMD_REPLACE_LANE_OP
2828 default:
2829 unsupported(decoder, kSimd, "simd");
2830 }
2831 }
2832
2833 void S128Const(FullDecoder* decoder, const Simd128Immediate<validate>& imm,
2834 Value* result) {
2835 constexpr RegClass result_rc = reg_class_for(ValueType::kS128);
2836 LiftoffRegister dst = __ GetUnusedRegister(result_rc, {});
2837 bool all_zeroes = std::all_of(std::begin(imm.value), std::end(imm.value),
2838 [](uint8_t v) { return v == 0; });
2839 bool all_ones = std::all_of(std::begin(imm.value), std::end(imm.value),
2840 [](uint8_t v) { return v == 0xff; });
2841 if (all_zeroes) {
2842 __ LiftoffAssembler::emit_s128_xor(dst, dst, dst);
2843 } else if (all_ones) {
2844 // Any SIMD eq will work, i32x4 is efficient on all archs.
2845 __ LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32x4_eq(dst, dst, dst);
2846 } else {
2847 __ LiftoffAssembler::emit_s128_const(dst, imm.value);
2848 }
2849 __ PushRegister(kWasmS128, dst);
2850 }
2851
2852 void Simd8x16ShuffleOp(FullDecoder* decoder,
2853 const Simd128Immediate<validate>& imm,
2854 const Value& input0, const Value& input1,
2855 Value* result) {
2856 static constexpr RegClass result_rc = reg_class_for(ValueType::kS128);
2857 LiftoffRegister rhs = __ PopToRegister();
2858 LiftoffRegister lhs = __ PopToRegister(LiftoffRegList::ForRegs(rhs));
2859 LiftoffRegister dst = __ GetUnusedRegister(result_rc, {lhs, rhs}, {});
2860
2861 uint8_t shuffle[kSimd128Size];
2862 memcpy(shuffle, imm.value, sizeof(shuffle));
2863 bool is_swizzle;
2864 bool needs_swap;
2865 wasm::SimdShuffle::CanonicalizeShuffle(lhs == rhs, shuffle, &needs_swap,
2866 &is_swizzle);
2867 if (needs_swap) {
2868 std::swap(lhs, rhs);
2869 }
2870 __ LiftoffAssembler::emit_s8x16_shuffle(dst, lhs, rhs, shuffle, is_swizzle);
2871 __ PushRegister(kWasmS128, dst);
2872 }
2873
2874 void Throw(FullDecoder* decoder, const ExceptionIndexImmediate<validate>&,
2875 const Vector<Value>& args) {
2876 unsupported(decoder, kExceptionHandling, "throw");
2877 }
2878 void Rethrow(FullDecoder* decoder, const Value& exception) {
2879 unsupported(decoder, kExceptionHandling, "rethrow");
2880 }
2881 void BrOnException(FullDecoder* decoder, const Value& exception,
2882 const ExceptionIndexImmediate<validate>& imm,
2883 uint32_t depth, Vector<Value> values) {
2884 unsupported(decoder, kExceptionHandling, "br_on_exn");
2885 }
2886
2887 void AtomicStoreMem(FullDecoder* decoder, StoreType type,
2888 const MemoryAccessImmediate<validate>& imm) {
2889 LiftoffRegList pinned;
2890 LiftoffRegister value = pinned.set(__ PopToRegister());
2891 Register index = pinned.set(__ PopToRegister(pinned)).gp();
2892 if (BoundsCheckMem(decoder, type.size(), imm.offset, index, pinned,
2893 kDoForceCheck)) {
2894 return;
2895 }
2896 AlignmentCheckMem(decoder, type.size(), imm.offset, index, pinned);
2897 uint32_t offset = imm.offset;
2898 index = AddMemoryMasking(index, &offset, &pinned);
2899 DEBUG_CODE_COMMENT("atomic store to memory");
2900 Register addr = pinned.set(__ GetUnusedRegister(kGpReg, pinned)).gp();
2901 LOAD_INSTANCE_FIELD(addr, MemoryStart, kSystemPointerSize);
2902 LiftoffRegList outer_pinned;
2903 if (FLAG_trace_wasm_memory) outer_pinned.set(index);
2904 __ AtomicStore(addr, index, offset, value, type, outer_pinned);
2905 if (FLAG_trace_wasm_memory) {
2906 TraceMemoryOperation(true, type.mem_rep(), index, offset,
2907 decoder->position());
2908 }
2909 }
2910
2911 void AtomicLoadMem(FullDecoder* decoder, LoadType type,
2912 const MemoryAccessImmediate<validate>& imm) {
2913 ValueType value_type = type.value_type();
2914 LiftoffRegList pinned;
2915 Register index = pinned.set(__ PopToRegister()).gp();
2916 if (BoundsCheckMem(decoder, type.size(), imm.offset, index, pinned,
2917 kDoForceCheck)) {
2918 return;
2919 }
2920 AlignmentCheckMem(decoder, type.size(), imm.offset, index, pinned);
2921 uint32_t offset = imm.offset;
2922 index = AddMemoryMasking(index, &offset, &pinned);
2923 DEBUG_CODE_COMMENT("atomic load from memory");
2924 Register addr = pinned.set(__ GetUnusedRegister(kGpReg, pinned)).gp();
2925 LOAD_INSTANCE_FIELD(addr, MemoryStart, kSystemPointerSize);
2926 RegClass rc = reg_class_for(value_type);
2927 LiftoffRegister value = pinned.set(__ GetUnusedRegister(rc, pinned));
2928 __ AtomicLoad(value, addr, index, offset, type, pinned);
2929 __ PushRegister(value_type, value);
2930
2931 if (FLAG_trace_wasm_memory) {
2932 TraceMemoryOperation(false, type.mem_type().representation(), index,
2933 offset, decoder->position());
2934 }
2935 }
2936
2937 void AtomicBinop(FullDecoder* decoder, StoreType type,
2938 const MemoryAccessImmediate<validate>& imm,
2939 void (LiftoffAssembler::*emit_fn)(Register, Register,
2940 uint32_t, LiftoffRegister,
2941 LiftoffRegister,
2942 StoreType)) {
2943 ValueType result_type = type.value_type();
2944 LiftoffRegList pinned;
2945 LiftoffRegister value = pinned.set(__ PopToRegister());
2946#ifdef V8_TARGET_ARCH_IA32
2947 // We have to reuse the value register as the result register so that we
2948 // don't run out of registers on ia32. For this we use the value register
2949 // as the result register if it has no other uses. Otherwise we allocate
2950 // a new register and let go of the value register to get spilled.
2951 LiftoffRegister result = value;
2952 if (__ cache_state()->is_used(value)) {
2953 result = pinned.set(__ GetUnusedRegister(value.reg_class(), pinned));
2954 __ Move(result, value, result_type);
2955 pinned.clear(value);
2956 value = result;
2957 }
2958#else
2959 LiftoffRegister result =
2960 pinned.set(__ GetUnusedRegister(value.reg_class(), pinned));
2961#endif
2962 Register index = pinned.set(__ PopToRegister(pinned)).gp();
2963 if (BoundsCheckMem(decoder, type.size(), imm.offset, index, pinned,
2964 kDoForceCheck)) {
2965 return;
2966 }
2967 AlignmentCheckMem(decoder, type.size(), imm.offset, index, pinned);
2968
2969 uint32_t offset = imm.offset;
2970 index = AddMemoryMasking(index, &offset, &pinned);
2971 Register addr = pinned.set(__ GetUnusedRegister(kGpReg, pinned)).gp();
2972 LOAD_INSTANCE_FIELD(addr, MemoryStart, kSystemPointerSize);
2973
2974 (asm_.*emit_fn)(addr, index, offset, value, result, type);
2975 __ PushRegister(result_type, result);
2976 }
2977
2978 void AtomicCompareExchange(FullDecoder* decoder, StoreType type,
2979 const MemoryAccessImmediate<validate>& imm) {
2980#ifdef V8_TARGET_ARCH_IA32
2981 // On ia32 we don't have enough registers to first pop all the values off
2982 // the stack and then start with the code generation. Instead we do the
2983 // complete address calculation first, so that the address only needs a
2984 // single register. Afterwards we load all remaining values into the
2985 // other registers.
2986 LiftoffRegList pinned;
2987 Register index_reg = pinned.set(__ PeekToRegister(2, pinned)).gp();
2988 if (BoundsCheckMem(decoder, type.size(), imm.offset, index_reg, pinned,
2989 kDoForceCheck)) {
2990 return;
2991 }
2992 AlignmentCheckMem(decoder, type.size(), imm.offset, index_reg, pinned);
2993
2994 uint32_t offset = imm.offset;
2995 index_reg = AddMemoryMasking(index_reg, &offset, &pinned);
2996 Register addr = pinned.set(__ GetUnusedRegister(kGpReg, pinned)).gp();
2997 LOAD_INSTANCE_FIELD(addr, MemoryStart, kSystemPointerSize);
2998 __ emit_i32_add(addr, addr, index_reg);
2999 pinned.clear(LiftoffRegister(index_reg));
3000 LiftoffRegister new_value = pinned.set(__ PopToRegister(pinned));
3001 LiftoffRegister expected = pinned.set(__ PopToRegister(pinned));
3002
3003 // Pop the index from the stack.
3004 __ cache_state()->stack_state.pop_back(1);
3005
3006 LiftoffRegister result = expected;
3007
3008 // We already added the index to addr, so we can just pass no_reg to the
3009 // assembler now.
3010 __ AtomicCompareExchange(addr, no_reg, offset, expected, new_value, result,
3011 type);
3012 __ PushRegister(type.value_type(), result);
3013 return;
3014#else
3015 ValueType result_type = type.value_type();
3016 LiftoffRegList pinned;
3017 LiftoffRegister new_value = pinned.set(__ PopToRegister());
3018 LiftoffRegister expected = pinned.set(__ PopToRegister(pinned));
3019 Register index = pinned.set(__ PopToRegister(pinned)).gp();
3020 if (BoundsCheckMem(decoder, type.size(), imm.offset, index, pinned,
3021 kDoForceCheck)) {
3022 return;
3023 }
3024 AlignmentCheckMem(decoder, type.size(), imm.offset, index, pinned);
3025
3026 uint32_t offset = imm.offset;
3027 index = AddMemoryMasking(index, &offset, &pinned);
3028 Register addr = pinned.set(__ GetUnusedRegister(kGpReg, pinned)).gp();
3029 LOAD_INSTANCE_FIELD(addr, MemoryStart, kSystemPointerSize);
3030 LiftoffRegister result =
3031 pinned.set(__ GetUnusedRegister(reg_class_for(result_type), pinned));
3032
3033 __ AtomicCompareExchange(addr, index, offset, expected, new_value, result,
3034 type);
3035 __ PushRegister(result_type, result);
3036#endif
3037 }
3038
3039 template <typename BuiltinDescriptor>
3040 compiler::CallDescriptor* GetBuiltinCallDescriptor(Zone* zone) {
3041 BuiltinDescriptor interface_descriptor;
3042 return compiler::Linkage::GetStubCallDescriptor(
3043 zone, // zone
3044 interface_descriptor, // descriptor
3045 interface_descriptor.GetStackParameterCount(), // stack parameter count
3046 compiler::CallDescriptor::kNoFlags, // flags
3047 compiler::Operator::kNoProperties, // properties
3048 StubCallMode::kCallWasmRuntimeStub); // stub call mode
3049 }
3050
3051 void AtomicWait(FullDecoder* decoder, ValueType type,
3052 const MemoryAccessImmediate<validate>& imm) {
3053 LiftoffRegList pinned;
3054 Register index_reg = pinned.set(__ PeekToRegister(2, pinned)).gp();
3055 if (BoundsCheckMem(decoder, type.element_size_bytes(), imm.offset,
3056 index_reg, pinned, kDoForceCheck)) {
3057 return;
3058 }
3059 AlignmentCheckMem(decoder, type.element_size_bytes(), imm.offset, index_reg,
3060 pinned);
3061
3062 uint32_t offset = imm.offset;
3063 index_reg = AddMemoryMasking(index_reg, &offset, &pinned);
3064 if (offset != 0) __ emit_i32_addi(index_reg, index_reg, offset);
3065
3066 LiftoffAssembler::VarState timeout =
3067 __ cache_state()->stack_state.end()[-1];
3068 LiftoffAssembler::VarState expected_value =
3069 __ cache_state()->stack_state.end()[-2];
3070 LiftoffAssembler::VarState index = __ cache_state()->stack_state.end()[-3];
3071
3072 // We have to set the correct register for the index. It may have changed
3073 // above in {AddMemoryMasking}.
3074 index.MakeRegister(LiftoffRegister(index_reg));
3075
3076 WasmCode::RuntimeStubId target;
3077 compiler::CallDescriptor* call_descriptor;
3078 if (type == kWasmI32) {
3079 if (kNeedI64RegPair) {
3080 target = WasmCode::kWasmI32AtomicWait32;
3081 call_descriptor =
3082 GetBuiltinCallDescriptor<WasmI32AtomicWait32Descriptor>(
3083 compilation_zone_);
3084 } else {
3085 target = WasmCode::kWasmI32AtomicWait64;
3086 call_descriptor =
3087 GetBuiltinCallDescriptor<WasmI32AtomicWait64Descriptor>(
3088 compilation_zone_);
3089 }
3090 } else {
3091 if (kNeedI64RegPair) {
3092 target = WasmCode::kWasmI64AtomicWait32;
3093 call_descriptor =
3094 GetBuiltinCallDescriptor<WasmI64AtomicWait32Descriptor>(
3095 compilation_zone_);
3096 } else {
3097 target = WasmCode::kWasmI64AtomicWait64;
3098 call_descriptor =
3099 GetBuiltinCallDescriptor<WasmI64AtomicWait64Descriptor>(
3100 compilation_zone_);
3101 }
3102 }
3103
3104 ValueType sig_reps[] = {kWasmI32, type, kWasmI64};
3105 FunctionSig sig(0, 3, sig_reps);
3106
3107 __ PrepareBuiltinCall(&sig, call_descriptor,
3108 {index, expected_value, timeout});
3109 __ CallRuntimeStub(target);
3110
3111 // Pop parameters from the value stack.
3112 __ cache_state()->stack_state.pop_back(3);
3113
3114 RegisterDebugSideTableEntry(DebugSideTableBuilder::kDidSpill);
3115 safepoint_table_builder_.DefineSafepoint(&asm_, Safepoint::kNoLazyDeopt);
3116
3117 __ PushRegister(kWasmI32, LiftoffRegister(kReturnRegister0));
3118 }
3119
3120 void AtomicNotify(FullDecoder* decoder,
3121 const MemoryAccessImmediate<validate>& imm) {
3122 LiftoffRegList pinned;
3123 LiftoffRegister count = pinned.set(__ PopToRegister());
3124 Register index = pinned.set(__ PopToRegister(pinned)).gp();
3125 if (BoundsCheckMem(decoder, kWasmI32.element_size_bytes(), imm.offset,
3126 index, pinned, kDoForceCheck)) {
3127 return;
3128 }
3129 AlignmentCheckMem(decoder, kWasmI32.element_size_bytes(), imm.offset, index,
3130 pinned);
3131
3132 uint32_t offset = imm.offset;
3133 index = AddMemoryMasking(index, &offset, &pinned);
3134 if (offset) __ emit_i32_addi(index, index, offset);
3135
3136 // TODO(ahaas): Use PrepareCall to prepare parameters.
3137 __ SpillAllRegisters();
3138
3139 WasmAtomicNotifyDescriptor descriptor;
3140 DCHECK_EQ(0, descriptor.GetStackParameterCount())((void) 0);
3141 DCHECK_EQ(2, descriptor.GetRegisterParameterCount())((void) 0);
3142 __ ParallelRegisterMove(
3143 {{descriptor.GetRegisterParameter(0), index, kWasmI32},
3144 {descriptor.GetRegisterParameter(1), count, kWasmI32}});
3145
3146 __ CallRuntimeStub(WasmCode::kWasmAtomicNotify);
3147 RegisterDebugSideTableEntry(DebugSideTableBuilder::kDidSpill);
3148 safepoint_table_builder_.DefineSafepoint(&asm_, Safepoint::kNoLazyDeopt);
3149
3150 __ PushRegister(kWasmI32, LiftoffRegister(kReturnRegister0));
3151 }
3152
3153#define ATOMIC_STORE_LIST(V) \
3154 V(I32AtomicStore, kI32Store) \
3155 V(I64AtomicStore, kI64Store) \
3156 V(I32AtomicStore8U, kI32Store8) \
3157 V(I32AtomicStore16U, kI32Store16) \
3158 V(I64AtomicStore8U, kI64Store8) \
3159 V(I64AtomicStore16U, kI64Store16) \
3160 V(I64AtomicStore32U, kI64Store32)
3161
3162#define ATOMIC_LOAD_LIST(V) \
3163 V(I32AtomicLoad, kI32Load) \
3164 V(I64AtomicLoad, kI64Load) \
3165 V(I32AtomicLoad8U, kI32Load8U) \
3166 V(I32AtomicLoad16U, kI32Load16U) \
3167 V(I64AtomicLoad8U, kI64Load8U) \
3168 V(I64AtomicLoad16U, kI64Load16U) \
3169 V(I64AtomicLoad32U, kI64Load32U)
3170
3171#define ATOMIC_BINOP_INSTRUCTION_LIST(V) \
3172 V(Add, I32AtomicAdd, kI32Store) \
3173 V(Add, I64AtomicAdd, kI64Store) \
3174 V(Add, I32AtomicAdd8U, kI32Store8) \
3175 V(Add, I32AtomicAdd16U, kI32Store16) \
3176 V(Add, I64AtomicAdd8U, kI64Store8) \
3177 V(Add, I64AtomicAdd16U, kI64Store16) \
3178 V(Add, I64AtomicAdd32U, kI64Store32) \
3179 V(Sub, I32AtomicSub, kI32Store) \
3180 V(Sub, I64AtomicSub, kI64Store) \
3181 V(Sub, I32AtomicSub8U, kI32Store8) \
3182 V(Sub, I32AtomicSub16U, kI32Store16) \
3183 V(Sub, I64AtomicSub8U, kI64Store8) \
3184 V(Sub, I64AtomicSub16U, kI64Store16) \
3185 V(Sub, I64AtomicSub32U, kI64Store32) \
3186 V(And, I32AtomicAnd, kI32Store) \
3187 V(And, I64AtomicAnd, kI64Store) \
3188 V(And, I32AtomicAnd8U, kI32Store8) \
3189 V(And, I32AtomicAnd16U, kI32Store16) \
3190 V(And, I64AtomicAnd8U, kI64Store8) \
3191 V(And, I64AtomicAnd16U, kI64Store16) \
3192 V(And, I64AtomicAnd32U, kI64Store32) \
3193 V(Or, I32AtomicOr, kI32Store) \
3194 V(Or, I64AtomicOr, kI64Store) \
3195 V(Or, I32AtomicOr8U, kI32Store8) \
3196 V(Or, I32AtomicOr16U, kI32Store16) \
3197 V(Or, I64AtomicOr8U, kI64Store8) \
3198 V(Or, I64AtomicOr16U, kI64Store16) \
3199 V(Or, I64AtomicOr32U, kI64Store32) \
3200 V(Xor, I32AtomicXor, kI32Store) \
3201 V(Xor, I64AtomicXor, kI64Store) \
3202 V(Xor, I32AtomicXor8U, kI32Store8) \
3203 V(Xor, I32AtomicXor16U, kI32Store16) \
3204 V(Xor, I64AtomicXor8U, kI64Store8) \
3205 V(Xor, I64AtomicXor16U, kI64Store16) \
3206 V(Xor, I64AtomicXor32U, kI64Store32) \
3207 V(Exchange, I32AtomicExchange, kI32Store) \
3208 V(Exchange, I64AtomicExchange, kI64Store) \
3209 V(Exchange, I32AtomicExchange8U, kI32Store8) \
3210 V(Exchange, I32AtomicExchange16U, kI32Store16) \
3211 V(Exchange, I64AtomicExchange8U, kI64Store8) \
3212 V(Exchange, I64AtomicExchange16U, kI64Store16) \
3213 V(Exchange, I64AtomicExchange32U, kI64Store32)
3214
3215#define ATOMIC_COMPARE_EXCHANGE_LIST(V) \
3216 V(I32AtomicCompareExchange, kI32Store) \
3217 V(I64AtomicCompareExchange, kI64Store) \
3218 V(I32AtomicCompareExchange8U, kI32Store8) \
3219 V(I32AtomicCompareExchange16U, kI32Store16) \
3220 V(I64AtomicCompareExchange8U, kI64Store8) \
3221 V(I64AtomicCompareExchange16U, kI64Store16) \
3222 V(I64AtomicCompareExchange32U, kI64Store32)
3223
3224 void AtomicOp(FullDecoder* decoder, WasmOpcode opcode, Vector<Value> args,
3225 const MemoryAccessImmediate<validate>& imm, Value* result) {
3226 switch (opcode) {
3227#define ATOMIC_STORE_OP(name, type) \
3228 case wasm::kExpr##name: \
3229 AtomicStoreMem(decoder, StoreType::type, imm); \
3230 break;
3231
3232 ATOMIC_STORE_LIST(ATOMIC_STORE_OP)
3233#undef ATOMIC_STORE_OP
3234
3235#define ATOMIC_LOAD_OP(name, type) \
3236 case wasm::kExpr##name: \
3237 AtomicLoadMem(decoder, LoadType::type, imm); \
3238 break;
3239
3240 ATOMIC_LOAD_LIST(ATOMIC_LOAD_OP)
3241#undef ATOMIC_LOAD_OP
3242
3243#define ATOMIC_BINOP_OP(op, name, type) \
3244 case wasm::kExpr##name: \
3245 AtomicBinop(decoder, StoreType::type, imm, &LiftoffAssembler::Atomic##op); \
3246 break;
3247
3248 ATOMIC_BINOP_INSTRUCTION_LIST(ATOMIC_BINOP_OP)
3249#undef ATOMIC_BINOP_OP
3250
3251#define ATOMIC_COMPARE_EXCHANGE_OP(name, type) \
3252 case wasm::kExpr##name: \
3253 AtomicCompareExchange(decoder, StoreType::type, imm); \
3254 break;
3255
3256 ATOMIC_COMPARE_EXCHANGE_LIST(ATOMIC_COMPARE_EXCHANGE_OP)
3257#undef ATOMIC_COMPARE_EXCHANGE_OP
3258
3259 case kExprI32AtomicWait:
3260 AtomicWait(decoder, kWasmI32, imm);
3261 break;
3262 case kExprI64AtomicWait:
3263 AtomicWait(decoder, kWasmI64, imm);
3264 break;
3265 case kExprAtomicNotify:
3266 AtomicNotify(decoder, imm);
3267 break;
3268 default:
3269 unsupported(decoder, kAtomics, "atomicop");
3270 }
3271 }
3272
3273#undef ATOMIC_STORE_LIST
3274#undef ATOMIC_LOAD_LIST
3275#undef ATOMIC_BINOP_INSTRUCTION_LIST
3276#undef ATOMIC_COMPARE_EXCHANGE_LIST
3277
3278 void AtomicFence(FullDecoder* decoder) { __ AtomicFence(); }
3279
3280 void MemoryInit(FullDecoder* decoder,
3281 const MemoryInitImmediate<validate>& imm, const Value&,
3282 const Value&, const Value&) {
3283 LiftoffRegList pinned;
3284 LiftoffRegister size = pinned.set(__ PopToRegister());
3285 LiftoffRegister src = pinned.set(__ PopToRegister(pinned));
3286 LiftoffRegister dst = pinned.set(__ PopToRegister(pinned));
3287
3288 Register instance = pinned.set(__ GetUnusedRegister(kGpReg, pinned)).gp();
3289 __ FillInstanceInto(instance);
3290
3291 LiftoffRegister segment_index =
3292 pinned.set(__ GetUnusedRegister(kGpReg, pinned));
3293 __ LoadConstant(segment_index, WasmValue(imm.data_segment_index));
3294
3295 ExternalReference ext_ref = ExternalReference::wasm_memory_init();
3296 ValueType sig_reps[] = {kWasmI32, kPointerValueType, kWasmI32,
3297 kWasmI32, kWasmI32, kWasmI32};
3298 FunctionSig sig(1, 5, sig_reps);
3299 LiftoffRegister args[] = {LiftoffRegister(instance), dst, src,
3300 segment_index, size};
3301 // We don't need the instance anymore after the call. We can use the
3302 // register for the result.
3303 LiftoffRegister result(instance);
3304 GenerateCCall(&result, &sig, kWasmStmt, args, ext_ref);
3305 Label* trap_label = AddOutOfLineTrap(
3306 decoder->position(), WasmCode::kThrowWasmTrapMemOutOfBounds);
3307 __ emit_cond_jump(kEqual, trap_label, kWasmI32, result.gp());
3308 }
3309
3310 void DataDrop(FullDecoder* decoder, const DataDropImmediate<validate>& imm) {
3311 LiftoffRegList pinned;
3312
3313 Register seg_size_array =
3314 pinned.set(__ GetUnusedRegister(kGpReg, pinned)).gp();
3315 LOAD_INSTANCE_FIELD(seg_size_array, DataSegmentSizes, kSystemPointerSize);
3316
3317 LiftoffRegister seg_index =
3318 pinned.set(__ GetUnusedRegister(kGpReg, pinned));
3319 // Scale the seg_index for the array access.
3320 __ LoadConstant(seg_index,
3321 WasmValue(imm.index << kWasmI32.element_size_log2()));
3322
3323 // Set the length of the segment to '0' to drop it.
3324 LiftoffRegister null_reg = pinned.set(__ GetUnusedRegister(kGpReg, pinned));
3325 __ LoadConstant(null_reg, WasmValue(0));
3326 __ Store(seg_size_array, seg_index.gp(), 0, null_reg, StoreType::kI32Store,
3327 pinned);
3328 }
3329
3330 void MemoryCopy(FullDecoder* decoder,
3331 const MemoryCopyImmediate<validate>& imm, const Value&,
3332 const Value&, const Value&) {
3333 LiftoffRegList pinned;
3334 LiftoffRegister size = pinned.set(__ PopToRegister());
3335 LiftoffRegister src = pinned.set(__ PopToRegister(pinned));
3336 LiftoffRegister dst = pinned.set(__ PopToRegister(pinned));
3337 Register instance = pinned.set(__ GetUnusedRegister(kGpReg, pinned)).gp();
3338 __ FillInstanceInto(instance);
3339 ExternalReference ext_ref = ExternalReference::wasm_memory_copy();
3340 ValueType sig_reps[] = {kWasmI32, kPointerValueType, kWasmI32, kWasmI32,
3341 kWasmI32};
3342 FunctionSig sig(1, 4, sig_reps);
3343 LiftoffRegister args[] = {LiftoffRegister(instance), dst, src, size};
3344 // We don't need the instance anymore after the call. We can use the
3345 // register for the result.
3346 LiftoffRegister result(instance);
3347 GenerateCCall(&result, &sig, kWasmStmt, args, ext_ref);
3348 Label* trap_label = AddOutOfLineTrap(
3349 decoder->position(), WasmCode::kThrowWasmTrapMemOutOfBounds);
3350 __ emit_cond_jump(kEqual, trap_label, kWasmI32, result.gp());
3351 }
3352
3353 void MemoryFill(FullDecoder* decoder,
3354 const MemoryIndexImmediate<validate>& imm, const Value&,
3355 const Value&, const Value&) {
3356 LiftoffRegList pinned;
3357 LiftoffRegister size = pinned.set(__ PopToRegister());
3358 LiftoffRegister value = pinned.set(__ PopToRegister(pinned));
3359 LiftoffRegister dst = pinned.set(__ PopToRegister(pinned));
3360 Register instance = pinned.set(__ GetUnusedRegister(kGpReg, pinned)).gp();
3361 __ FillInstanceInto(instance);
3362 ExternalReference ext_ref = ExternalReference::wasm_memory_fill();
3363 ValueType sig_reps[] = {kWasmI32, kPointerValueType, kWasmI32, kWasmI32,
3364 kWasmI32};
3365 FunctionSig sig(1, 4, sig_reps);
3366 LiftoffRegister args[] = {LiftoffRegister(instance), dst, value, size};
3367 // We don't need the instance anymore after the call. We can use the
3368 // register for the result.
3369 LiftoffRegister result(instance);
3370 GenerateCCall(&result, &sig, kWasmStmt, args, ext_ref);
3371 Label* trap_label = AddOutOfLineTrap(
3372 decoder->position(), WasmCode::kThrowWasmTrapMemOutOfBounds);
3373 __ emit_cond_jump(kEqual, trap_label, kWasmI32, result.gp());
3374 }
3375
3376 void TableInit(FullDecoder* decoder, const TableInitImmediate<validate>& imm,
3377 Vector<Value> args) {
3378 LiftoffRegList pinned;
3379 LiftoffRegister table_index_reg =
3380 pinned.set(__ GetUnusedRegister(kGpReg, pinned));
3381
3382#if V8_TARGET_ARCH_32_BIT || defined(V8_COMPRESS_POINTERS)
3383 WasmValue table_index_val(
3384 static_cast<uint32_t>(Smi::FromInt(imm.table.index).ptr()));
3385 WasmValue segment_index_val(
