3386 static_cast<uint32_t>(Smi::FromInt(imm.elem_segment_index).ptr()));
3387#else
3388 WasmValue table_index_val(
3389 static_cast<uint64_t>(Smi::FromInt(imm.table.index).ptr()));
3390 WasmValue segment_index_val(
3391 static_cast<uint64_t>(Smi::FromInt(imm.elem_segment_index).ptr()));
3392#endif
3393 __ LoadConstant(table_index_reg, table_index_val);
3394 LiftoffAssembler::VarState table_index(kPointerValueType, table_index_reg,
3395 0);
3396
3397 LiftoffRegister segment_index_reg =
3398 pinned.set(__ GetUnusedRegister(kGpReg, pinned));
3399 __ LoadConstant(segment_index_reg, segment_index_val);
3400 LiftoffAssembler::VarState segment_index(kPointerValueType,
3401 segment_index_reg, 0);
3402
3403 LiftoffAssembler::VarState size = __ cache_state()->stack_state.end()[-1];
3404 LiftoffAssembler::VarState src = __ cache_state()->stack_state.end()[-2];
3405 LiftoffAssembler::VarState dst = __ cache_state()->stack_state.end()[-3];
3406
3407 WasmCode::RuntimeStubId target = WasmCode::kWasmTableInit;
3408 compiler::CallDescriptor* call_descriptor =
3409 GetBuiltinCallDescriptor<WasmTableInitDescriptor>(compilation_zone_);
3410
3411 ValueType sig_reps[] = {kWasmI32, kWasmI32, kWasmI32,
3412 table_index_val.type(), segment_index_val.type()};
3413 FunctionSig sig(0, 5, sig_reps);
3414
3415 __ PrepareBuiltinCall(&sig, call_descriptor,
3416 {dst, src, size, table_index, segment_index});
3417 __ CallRuntimeStub(target);
3418
3419 // Pop parameters from the value stack.
3420 __ cache_state()->stack_state.pop_back(3);
3421
3422 RegisterDebugSideTableEntry(DebugSideTableBuilder::kDidSpill);
3423 safepoint_table_builder_.DefineSafepoint(&asm_, Safepoint::kNoLazyDeopt);
3424 }
3425
3426 void ElemDrop(FullDecoder* decoder, const ElemDropImmediate<validate>& imm) {
3427 LiftoffRegList pinned;
3428 Register seg_size_array =
3429 pinned.set(__ GetUnusedRegister(kGpReg, pinned)).gp();
3430 LOAD_INSTANCE_FIELD(seg_size_array, DroppedElemSegments,
3431 kSystemPointerSize);
3432
3433 LiftoffRegister seg_index =
3434 pinned.set(__ GetUnusedRegister(kGpReg, pinned));
3435 __ LoadConstant(seg_index, WasmValue(imm.index));
3436
3437 // Set the length of the segment to '0' to drop it.
3438 LiftoffRegister one_reg = pinned.set(__ GetUnusedRegister(kGpReg, pinned));
3439 __ LoadConstant(one_reg, WasmValue(1));
3440 __ Store(seg_size_array, seg_index.gp(), 0, one_reg, StoreType::kI32Store,
3441 pinned);
3442 }
3443
3444 void TableCopy(FullDecoder* decoder, const TableCopyImmediate<validate>& imm,
3445 Vector<Value> args) {
3446 LiftoffRegList pinned;
3447
3448#if V8_TARGET_ARCH_32_BIT || defined(V8_COMPRESS_POINTERS)
3449 WasmValue table_dst_index_val(
3450 static_cast<uint32_t>(Smi::FromInt(imm.table_dst.index).ptr()));
3451 WasmValue table_src_index_val(
3452 static_cast<uint32_t>(Smi::FromInt(imm.table_src.index).ptr()));
3453#else
3454 WasmValue table_dst_index_val(
3455 static_cast<uint64_t>(Smi::FromInt(imm.table_dst.index).ptr()));
3456 WasmValue table_src_index_val(
3457 static_cast<uint64_t>(Smi::FromInt(imm.table_src.index).ptr()));
3458#endif
3459
3460 LiftoffRegister table_dst_index_reg =
3461 pinned.set(__ GetUnusedRegister(kGpReg, pinned));
3462 __ LoadConstant(table_dst_index_reg, table_dst_index_val);
3463 LiftoffAssembler::VarState table_dst_index(kPointerValueType,
3464 table_dst_index_reg, 0);
3465
3466 LiftoffRegister table_src_index_reg =
3467 pinned.set(__ GetUnusedRegister(kGpReg, pinned));
3468 __ LoadConstant(table_src_index_reg, table_src_index_val);
3469 LiftoffAssembler::VarState table_src_index(kPointerValueType,
3470 table_src_index_reg, 0);
3471
3472 LiftoffAssembler::VarState size = __ cache_state()->stack_state.end()[-1];
3473 LiftoffAssembler::VarState src = __ cache_state()->stack_state.end()[-2];
3474 LiftoffAssembler::VarState dst = __ cache_state()->stack_state.end()[-3];
3475
3476 WasmCode::RuntimeStubId target = WasmCode::kWasmTableCopy;
3477 compiler::CallDescriptor* call_descriptor =
3478 GetBuiltinCallDescriptor<WasmTableCopyDescriptor>(compilation_zone_);
3479
3480 ValueType sig_reps[] = {kWasmI32, kWasmI32, kWasmI32,
3481 table_dst_index_val.type(),
3482 table_src_index_val.type()};
3483 FunctionSig sig(0, 5, sig_reps);
3484
3485 __ PrepareBuiltinCall(&sig, call_descriptor,
3486 {dst, src, size, table_dst_index, table_src_index});
3487 __ CallRuntimeStub(target);
3488
3489 // Pop parameters from the value stack.
3490 __ cache_state()->stack_state.pop_back(3);
3491
3492 RegisterDebugSideTableEntry(DebugSideTableBuilder::kDidSpill);
3493 safepoint_table_builder_.DefineSafepoint(&asm_, Safepoint::kNoLazyDeopt);
3494 }

3610
3611 private:
3612 void CallDirect(FullDecoder* decoder,
3613 const CallFunctionImmediate<validate>& imm,
3614 const Value args[], Value returns[], CallKind call_kind) {
3615 for (ValueType ret : imm.sig->returns()) {
3616 if (!CheckSupportedType(decoder, kSupportedTypes, ret, "return")) {
3617 return;
3618 }
3619 }
3620
3621 auto call_descriptor =
3622 compiler::GetWasmCallDescriptor(compilation_zone_, imm.sig);
3623 call_descriptor =
3624 GetLoweredCallDescriptor(compilation_zone_, call_descriptor);
3625
3626 if (imm.index < env_->module->num_imported_functions) {
3627 // A direct call to an imported function.
3628 LiftoffRegList pinned;
3629 Register tmp = pinned.set(__ GetUnusedRegister(kGpReg, pinned)).gp();
3630 Register target = pinned.set(__ GetUnusedRegister(kGpReg, pinned)).gp();
3631
3632 Register imported_targets = tmp;
3633 LOAD_INSTANCE_FIELD(imported_targets, ImportedFunctionTargets,
3634 kSystemPointerSize);
3635 __ Load(LiftoffRegister(target), imported_targets, no_reg,
3636 imm.index * sizeof(Address), kPointerLoadType, pinned);
3637
3638 Register imported_function_refs = tmp;
3639 LOAD_TAGGED_PTR_INSTANCE_FIELD(imported_function_refs,
3640 ImportedFunctionRefs);
3641 Register imported_function_ref = tmp;
3642 __ LoadTaggedPointer(
3643 imported_function_ref, imported_function_refs, no_reg,
3644 ObjectAccess::ElementOffsetInTaggedFixedArray(imm.index), pinned);
3645
3646 Register* explicit_instance = &imported_function_ref;
3647 __ PrepareCall(imm.sig, call_descriptor, &target, explicit_instance);
3648 if (call_kind == kReturnCall) {
3649 __ PrepareTailCall(
3650 static_cast<int>(call_descriptor->StackParameterCount()),
3651 static_cast<int>(
3652 call_descriptor->GetStackParameterDelta(descriptor_)));
3653 __ TailCallIndirect(target);
3654 } else {
3655 source_position_table_builder_.AddPosition(
3656 __ pc_offset(), SourcePosition(decoder->position()), true);
3657 __ CallIndirect(imm.sig, call_descriptor, target);
3658 }
3659 } else {
3660 // A direct call within this module just gets the current instance.
3661 __ PrepareCall(imm.sig, call_descriptor);
3662 // Just encode the function index. This will be patched at instantiation.
3663 Address addr = static_cast<Address>(imm.index);
3664 if (call_kind == kReturnCall) {
3665 DCHECK(descriptor_->CanTailCall(call_descriptor))((void) 0);
3666 __ PrepareTailCall(
3667 static_cast<int>(call_descriptor->StackParameterCount()),
3668 static_cast<int>(
3669 call_descriptor->GetStackParameterDelta(descriptor_)));
3670 __ TailCallNativeWasmCode(addr);
3671 } else {
3672 source_position_table_builder_.AddPosition(
3673 __ pc_offset(), SourcePosition(decoder->position()), true);
3674 __ CallNativeWasmCode(addr);
3675 }
3676 }
3677
3678 RegisterDebugSideTableEntry(DebugSideTableBuilder::kDidSpill);
3679 safepoint_table_builder_.DefineSafepoint(&asm_, Safepoint::kNoLazyDeopt);
3680
3681 __ FinishCall(imm.sig, call_descriptor);
3682 }
3683
3684 void CallIndirect(FullDecoder* decoder, const Value& index_val,
3685 const CallIndirectImmediate<validate>& imm,
3686 CallKind call_kind) {
3687 if (imm.table_index != 0) {
3688 return unsupported(decoder, kRefTypes, "table index != 0");
3689 }
3690 for (ValueType ret : imm.sig->returns()) {
3691 if (!CheckSupportedType(decoder, kSupportedTypes, ret, "return")) {
3692 return;
3693 }
3694 }
3695
3696 // Pop the index.
3697 Register index = __ PopToRegister().gp();
3698 // If that register is still being used after popping, we move it to another
3699 // register, because we want to modify that register.
3700 if (__ cache_state()->is_used(LiftoffRegister(index))) {
3701 Register new_index =
3702 __ GetUnusedRegister(kGpReg, LiftoffRegList::ForRegs(index)).gp();
3703 __ Move(new_index, index, kWasmI32);
3704 index = new_index;
3705 }
3706
3707 LiftoffRegList pinned = LiftoffRegList::ForRegs(index);
3708 // Get three temporary registers.
3709 Register table = pinned.set(__ GetUnusedRegister(kGpReg, pinned)).gp();
3710 Register tmp_const = pinned.set(__ GetUnusedRegister(kGpReg, pinned)).gp();
3711 Register scratch = pinned.set(__ GetUnusedRegister(kGpReg, pinned)).gp();
3712
3713 // Bounds check against the table size.
3714 Label* invalid_func_label = AddOutOfLineTrap(
3715 decoder->position(), WasmCode::kThrowWasmTrapFuncInvalid);
3716
3717 uint32_t canonical_sig_num = env_->module->signature_ids[imm.sig_index];
3718 DCHECK_GE(canonical_sig_num, 0)((void) 0);
3719 DCHECK_GE(kMaxInt, canonical_sig_num)((void) 0);
3720
3721 // Compare against table size stored in
3722 // {instance->indirect_function_table_size}.
3723 LOAD_INSTANCE_FIELD(tmp_const, IndirectFunctionTableSize, kUInt32Size);
3724 __ emit_cond_jump(kUnsignedGreaterEqual, invalid_func_label, kWasmI32,
3725 index, tmp_const);
3726
3727 // Mask the index to prevent SSCA.
3728 if (FLAG_untrusted_code_mitigations) {
3729 DEBUG_CODE_COMMENT("Mask indirect call index");
3730 // mask = ((index - size) & ~index) >> 31
3731 // Reuse allocated registers; note: size is still stored in {tmp_const}.
3732 Register diff = table;
3733 Register neg_index = tmp_const;
3734 Register mask = scratch;
3735 // 1) diff = index - size
3736 __ emit_i32_sub(diff, index, tmp_const);
3737 // 2) neg_index = ~index
3738 __ LoadConstant(LiftoffRegister(neg_index), WasmValue(int32_t{-1}));
3739 __ emit_i32_xor(neg_index, neg_index, index);
3740 // 3) mask = diff & neg_index
3741 __ emit_i32_and(mask, diff, neg_index);
3742 // 4) mask = mask >> 31
3743 __ emit_i32_sari(mask, mask, 31);
3744
3745 // Apply mask.
3746 __ emit_i32_and(index, index, mask);
3747 }
3748
3749 DEBUG_CODE_COMMENT("Check indirect call signature");
3750 // Load the signature from {instance->ift_sig_ids[key]}
3751 LOAD_INSTANCE_FIELD(table, IndirectFunctionTableSigIds, kSystemPointerSize);
3752 // Shift {index} by 2 (multiply by 4) to represent kInt32Size items.
3753 STATIC_ASSERT((1 << 2) == kInt32Size)static_assert((1 << 2) == kInt32Size, "(1 << 2) == kInt32Size"
);
3754 __ emit_i32_shli(index, index, 2);
3755 __ Load(LiftoffRegister(scratch), table, index, 0, LoadType::kI32Load,
3756 pinned);
3757
3758 // Compare against expected signature.
3759 __ LoadConstant(LiftoffRegister(tmp_const), WasmValue(canonical_sig_num));
3760
3761 Label* sig_mismatch_label = AddOutOfLineTrap(
3762 decoder->position(), WasmCode::kThrowWasmTrapFuncSigMismatch);
3763 __ emit_cond_jump(kUnequal, sig_mismatch_label,
3764 LiftoffAssembler::kWasmIntPtr, scratch, tmp_const);
3765
3766 // At this point {index} has already been multiplied by 4.
3767 DEBUG_CODE_COMMENT("Execute indirect call");
3768 if (kTaggedSize != kInt32Size) {
3769 DCHECK_EQ(kTaggedSize, kInt32Size * 2)((void) 0);
3770 // Multiply {index} by another 2 to represent kTaggedSize items.
3771 __ emit_i32_add(index, index, index);
3772 }
3773 // At this point {index} has already been multiplied by kTaggedSize.
3774
3775 // Load the instance from {instance->ift_instances[key]}
3776 LOAD_TAGGED_PTR_INSTANCE_FIELD(table, IndirectFunctionTableRefs);
3777 __ LoadTaggedPointer(tmp_const, table, index,
3778 ObjectAccess::ElementOffsetInTaggedFixedArray(0),
3779 pinned);
3780
3781 if (kTaggedSize != kSystemPointerSize) {
3782 DCHECK_EQ(kSystemPointerSize, kTaggedSize * 2)((void) 0);
3783 // Multiply {index} by another 2 to represent kSystemPointerSize items.
3784 __ emit_i32_add(index, index, index);
3785 }
3786 // At this point {index} has already been multiplied by kSystemPointerSize.
3787
3788 Register* explicit_instance = &tmp_const;
3789
3790 // Load the target from {instance->ift_targets[key]}
3791 LOAD_INSTANCE_FIELD(table, IndirectFunctionTableTargets,
3792 kSystemPointerSize);
3793 __ Load(LiftoffRegister(scratch), table, index, 0, kPointerLoadType,
3794 pinned);
3795
3796 auto call_descriptor =
3797 compiler::GetWasmCallDescriptor(compilation_zone_, imm.sig);
3798 call_descriptor =
3799 GetLoweredCallDescriptor(compilation_zone_, call_descriptor);
3800
3801 Register target = scratch;
3802 __ PrepareCall(imm.sig, call_descriptor, &target, explicit_instance);
3803 if (call_kind == kReturnCall) {
3804 __ PrepareTailCall(
3805 static_cast<int>(call_descriptor->StackParameterCount()),
3806 static_cast<int>(
3807 call_descriptor->GetStackParameterDelta(descriptor_)));
3808 __ TailCallIndirect(target);
3809 } else {
3810 source_position_table_builder_.AddPosition(
3811 __ pc_offset(), SourcePosition(decoder->position()), true);
3812 __ CallIndirect(imm.sig, call_descriptor, target);
3813 }
3814
3815 RegisterDebugSideTableEntry(DebugSideTableBuilder::kDidSpill);
3816 safepoint_table_builder_.DefineSafepoint(&asm_, Safepoint::kNoLazyDeopt);
3817
3818 __ FinishCall(imm.sig, call_descriptor);
3819 }
3820
3821 static constexpr WasmOpcode kNoOutstandingOp = kExprUnreachable;
3822
3823 LiftoffAssembler asm_;
3824
3825 // Used for merging code generation of subsequent operations (via look-ahead).
3826 // Set by the first opcode, reset by the second.
3827 WasmOpcode outstanding_op_ = kNoOutstandingOp;
3828
3829 compiler::CallDescriptor* const descriptor_;
3830 CompilationEnv* const env_;
3831 DebugSideTableBuilder* const debug_sidetable_builder_;
3832 const ForDebugging for_debugging_;
3833 LiftoffBailoutReason bailout_reason_ = kSuccess;
3834 const int func_index_;
3835 ZoneVector<OutOfLineCode> out_of_line_code_;
3836 SourcePositionTableBuilder source_position_table_builder_;
3837 ZoneVector<trap_handler::ProtectedInstructionData> protected_instructions_;
3838 // Zone used to store information during compilation. The result will be
3839 // stored independently, such that this zone can die together with the
3840 // LiftoffCompiler after compilation.
3841 Zone* compilation_zone_;
3842 SafepointTableBuilder safepoint_table_builder_;
3843 // The pc offset of the instructions to reserve the stack frame. Needed to
3844 // patch the actually needed stack size in the end.
3845 uint32_t pc_offset_stack_frame_construction_ = 0;
3846 // For emitting breakpoint, we store a pointer to the position of the next
3847 // breakpoint, and a pointer after the list of breakpoints as end marker.
3848 // A single breakpoint at offset 0 indicates that we should prepare the
3849 // function for stepping by flooding it with breakpoints.
3850 int* next_breakpoint_ptr_ = nullptr;
3851 int* next_breakpoint_end_ = nullptr;
3852
3853 bool has_outstanding_op() const {
3854 return outstanding_op_ != kNoOutstandingOp;
3855 }
3856
3857 void TraceCacheState(FullDecoder* decoder) const {
3858 if (!FLAG_trace_liftoff) return;
3859 StdoutStream os;
3860 for (int control_depth = decoder->control_depth() - 1; control_depth >= -1;
3861 --control_depth) {
3862 auto* cache_state =
3863 control_depth == -1 ? __ cache_state()
3864 : &decoder->control_at(control_depth)
3865 ->label_state;
3866 os << PrintCollection(cache_state->stack_state);
3867 if (control_depth != -1) PrintF("; ");
3868 }
3869 os << "\n";
3870 }
3871
3872 DISALLOW_IMPLICIT_CONSTRUCTORS(LiftoffCompiler)LiftoffCompiler() = delete; LiftoffCompiler(const LiftoffCompiler
&) = delete; LiftoffCompiler& operator=(const LiftoffCompiler
&) = delete;
3873};
3874
3875} // namespace
3876
3877WasmCompilationResult ExecuteLiftoffCompilation(
3878 AccountingAllocator* allocator, CompilationEnv* env,
3879 const FunctionBody& func_body, int func_index, ForDebugging for_debugging,
3880 Counters* counters, WasmFeatures* detected, Vector<int> breakpoints,
3881 std::unique_ptr<DebugSideTable>* debug_sidetable) {
3882 int func_body_size = static_cast<int>(func_body.end - func_body.start);
3883 TRACE_EVENT2(TRACE_DISABLED_BY_DEFAULT("v8.wasm.detailed"),static v8::base::AtomicWord trace_event_unique_atomic3885 = 0
; const uint8_t* trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3885

))); if (!trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3885) { trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3885

() ->GetCategoryGroupEnabled("disabled-by-default-" "v8.wasm.detailed"
); v8::base::Relaxed_Store(&(trace_event_unique_atomic3885
), (reinterpret_cast<v8::base::AtomicWord>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3885
))); };; v8::internal::tracing::ScopedTracer trace_event_unique_tracer3885
; if (v8::base::Relaxed_Load(reinterpret_cast<const v8::base
::Atomic8*>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3885
)) & (kEnabledForRecording_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags | kEnabledForEventCallback_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags
)) { uint64_t h = v8::internal::tracing::AddTraceEvent( ('X')

int>(0)), "func_index", func_index, "body_size", func_body_size
); trace_event_unique_tracer3885 .Initialize(trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3885
, "wasm.CompileBaseline", h); }

; const uint8_t* trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3885
; trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3885 = reinterpret_cast
<const uint8_t*>(v8::base::Relaxed_Load(&(trace_event_unique_atomic3885

); v8::base::Relaxed_Store(&(trace_event_unique_atomic3885

))); };; v8::internal::tracing::ScopedTracer trace_event_unique_tracer3885
; if (v8::base::Relaxed_Load(reinterpret_cast<const v8::base
::Atomic8*>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3885
)) & (kEnabledForRecording_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags | kEnabledForEventCallback_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags
)) { uint64_t h = v8::internal::tracing::AddTraceEvent( ('X')
, trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3885, "wasm.CompileBaseline"
, v8::internal::tracing::kGlobalScope, v8::internal::tracing::
kNoId, v8::internal::tracing::kNoId, (static_cast<unsigned
int>(0)), "func_index", func_index, "body_size", func_body_size
); trace_event_unique_tracer3885 .Initialize(trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3885
, "wasm.CompileBaseline", h); }
3885 func_body_size)static v8::base::AtomicWord trace_event_unique_atomic3885 = 0
; const uint8_t* trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3885
; trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3885 = reinterpret_cast
<const uint8_t*>(v8::base::Relaxed_Load(&(trace_event_unique_atomic3885
))); if (!trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3885) { trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3885
= v8::internal::tracing::TraceEventHelper::GetTracingController
() ->GetCategoryGroupEnabled("disabled-by-default-" "v8.wasm.detailed"
); v8::base::Relaxed_Store(&(trace_event_unique_atomic3885
), (reinterpret_cast<v8::base::AtomicWord>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3885
))); };; v8::internal::tracing::ScopedTracer trace_event_unique_tracer3885
; if (v8::base::Relaxed_Load(reinterpret_cast<const v8::base
::Atomic8*>( trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3885
)) & (kEnabledForRecording_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags | kEnabledForEventCallback_CategoryGroupEnabledFlags
)) { uint64_t h = v8::internal::tracing::AddTraceEvent( ('X')
, trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3885, "wasm.CompileBaseline"
, v8::internal::tracing::kGlobalScope, v8::internal::tracing::
kNoId, v8::internal::tracing::kNoId, (static_cast<unsigned
int>(0)), "func_index", func_index, "body_size", func_body_size
); trace_event_unique_tracer3885 .Initialize(trace_event_unique_category_group_enabled3885
, "wasm.CompileBaseline", h); };
3886
3887 Zone zone(allocator, "LiftoffCompilationZone");
3888 auto call_descriptor = compiler::GetWasmCallDescriptor(&zone, func_body.sig);
3889 base::Optional<TimedHistogramScope> liftoff_compile_time_scope;
3890 if (counters) {
3891 liftoff_compile_time_scope.emplace(counters->liftoff_compile_time());
3892 }
3893 size_t code_size_estimate =
3894 WasmCodeManager::EstimateLiftoffCodeSize(func_body_size);
3895 // Allocate the initial buffer a bit bigger to avoid reallocation during code
3896 // generation.
3897 std::unique_ptr<wasm::WasmInstructionBuffer> instruction_buffer =
3898 wasm::WasmInstructionBuffer::New(128 + code_size_estimate * 4 / 3);
3899 std::unique_ptr<DebugSideTableBuilder> debug_sidetable_builder;
3900 // If we are emitting breakpoints, we should also emit the debug side table.
3901 DCHECK_IMPLIES(!breakpoints.empty(), debug_sidetable != nullptr)((void) 0);
3902 if (debug_sidetable) {
3903 debug_sidetable_builder = std::make_unique<DebugSideTableBuilder>();
3904 }
3905 WasmFullDecoder<Decoder::kValidate, LiftoffCompiler> decoder(
3906 &zone, env->module, env->enabled_features, detected, func_body,
3907 call_descriptor, env, &zone, instruction_buffer->CreateView(),
3908 debug_sidetable_builder.get(), for_debugging, func_index, breakpoints);
3909 decoder.Decode();
3910 liftoff_compile_time_scope.reset();
3911 LiftoffCompiler* compiler = &decoder.interface();
3912 if (decoder.failed()) compiler->OnFirstError(&decoder);
3913
3914 if (counters) {
3915 // Check that the histogram for the bailout reasons has the correct size.
3916 DCHECK_EQ(0, counters->liftoff_bailout_reasons()->min())((void) 0);
3917 DCHECK_EQ(kNumBailoutReasons - 1,((void) 0)
3918 counters->liftoff_bailout_reasons()->max())((void) 0);
3919 DCHECK_EQ(kNumBailoutReasons,((void) 0)
3920 counters->liftoff_bailout_reasons()->num_buckets())((void) 0);
3921 // Register the bailout reason (can also be {kSuccess}).
3922 counters->liftoff_bailout_reasons()->AddSample(
3923 static_cast<int>(compiler->bailout_reason()));
3924 if (compiler->did_bailout()) {
3925 counters->liftoff_unsupported_functions()->Increment();
3926 } else {
3927 counters->liftoff_compiled_functions()->Increment();
3928 }
3929 }
3930
3931 if (compiler->did_bailout()) return WasmCompilationResult{};
3932
3933 WasmCompilationResult result;
3934 compiler->GetCode(&result.code_desc);
3935 result.instr_buffer = instruction_buffer->ReleaseBuffer();
3936 result.source_positions = compiler->GetSourcePositionTable();
3937 result.protected_instructions_data = compiler->GetProtectedInstructionsData();
3938 result.frame_slot_count = compiler->GetTotalFrameSlotCount();
3939 result.tagged_parameter_slots = call_descriptor->GetTaggedParameterSlots();
3940 result.func_index = func_index;
3941 result.result_tier = ExecutionTier::kLiftoff;
3942 result.for_debugging = for_debugging;
3943 if (debug_sidetable) {
3944 *debug_sidetable = debug_sidetable_builder->GenerateDebugSideTable();
3945 }
3946
3947 DCHECK(result.succeeded())((void) 0);
3948 return result;
3949}
3950
3951std::unique_ptr<DebugSideTable> GenerateLiftoffDebugSideTable(
3952 AccountingAllocator* allocator, CompilationEnv* env,
3953 const FunctionBody& func_body, int func_index) {
3954 Zone zone(allocator, "LiftoffDebugSideTableZone");
3955 auto call_descriptor = compiler::GetWasmCallDescriptor(&zone, func_body.sig);
3956 DebugSideTableBuilder debug_sidetable_builder;
3957 WasmFeatures detected;
3958 WasmFullDecoder<Decoder::kValidate, LiftoffCompiler> decoder(
3959 &zone, env->module, env->enabled_features, &detected, func_body,
3960 call_descriptor, env, &zone,
3961 NewAssemblerBuffer(AssemblerBase::kDefaultBufferSize),
3962 &debug_sidetable_builder, kForDebugging, func_index);
3963 decoder.Decode();
1
Calling 'WasmFullDecoder::Decode'
→
3964 DCHECK(decoder.ok())((void) 0);
3965 DCHECK(!decoder.interface().did_bailout())((void) 0);
3966 return debug_sidetable_builder.GenerateDebugSideTable();
3967}

32#define TRACE(...) \
33 do { \
34 if (FLAG_trace_wasm_decoder) PrintF(__VA_ARGS__); \
35 } while (false)
36
37#define TRACE_INST_FORMAT " @%-8d #%-20s|"
38
39// Return the evaluation of `condition` if validate==true, DCHECK that it's
40// true and always return true otherwise.
41#define VALIDATE(condition) \
42 (validate ? V8_LIKELY(condition)(__builtin_expect(!!(condition), 1)) : [&] { \
43 DCHECK(condition)((void) 0); \
44 return true; \
45 }())
46
47#define CHECK_PROTOTYPE_OPCODE(feat) \
48 DCHECK(this->module_->origin == kWasmOrigin)((void) 0); \
49 if (!VALIDATE(this->enabled_.has_##feat())) { \
50 this->errorf(this->pc(), \
51 "Invalid opcode 0x%x (enable with --experimental-wasm-" #feat \
52 ")", \
53 opcode); \
54 return 0; \
55 } \
56 this->detected_->Add(kFeature_##feat);
57
58#define ATOMIC_OP_LIST(V)V(AtomicNotify, Uint32) V(I32AtomicWait, Uint32) V(I64AtomicWait
, Uint64) V(I32AtomicLoad, Uint32) V(I64AtomicLoad, Uint64) V

, Uint8) V(I64AtomicLoad16U, Uint16) V(I64AtomicLoad32U, Uint32

, Uint32) V(I32AtomicCompareExchange, Uint32) V(I64AtomicCompareExchange
, Uint64) V(I32AtomicCompareExchange8U, Uint8) V(I32AtomicCompareExchange16U
, Uint16) V(I64AtomicCompareExchange8U, Uint8) V(I64AtomicCompareExchange16U

119#define ATOMIC_STORE_OP_LIST(V)V(I32AtomicStore, Uint32) V(I64AtomicStore, Uint64) V(I32AtomicStore8U
, Uint8) V(I32AtomicStore16U, Uint16) V(I64AtomicStore8U, Uint8

128namespace value_type_reader {
129
130V8_INLINEinline __attribute__((always_inline)) WasmFeature feature_for_heap_type(HeapType heap_type) {
131 switch (heap_type.representation()) {
132 case HeapType::kFunc:
133 case HeapType::kExtern:
134 return WasmFeature::kFeature_reftypes;
135 case HeapType::kExn:
136 return WasmFeature::kFeature_eh;
137 case HeapType::kEq:
138 case HeapType::kI31:
139 return WasmFeature::kFeature_gc;
140 default:
141 UNREACHABLE()V8_Fatal("unreachable code");
142 }
143}
144
145template <Decoder::ValidateFlag validate>
146HeapType read_heap_type(Decoder* decoder, const byte* pc,
147 uint32_t* const length, const WasmFeatures& enabled) {
148 int64_t heap_index = decoder->read_i33v<validate>(pc, length, "heap type");
149 if (heap_index < 0) {
150 uint8_t uint_7_mask = 0x7F;
151 uint8_t code = static_cast<ValueTypeCode>(heap_index) & uint_7_mask;
152 switch (code) {
153 case kLocalFuncRef:
154 case kLocalExnRef:
155 case kLocalEqRef:
156 case kLocalExternRef:
157 case kLocalI31Ref: {
158 HeapType result = HeapType::from_code(code);
159 if (!VALIDATE(enabled.contains(feature_for_heap_type(result)))) {
160 decoder->errorf(
161 pc, "invalid heap type '%s', enable with --experimental-wasm-%s",
162 result.name().c_str(),
163 WasmFeatures::name_for_feature(feature_for_heap_type(result)));
164 return HeapType(HeapType::kBottom);
165 }
166 return result;
167 }
168 default:
169 if (validate) {
170 decoder->errorf(pc, "Unknown heap type %" PRId64"l" "d", heap_index);
171 }
172 return HeapType(HeapType::kBottom);
173 }
174 UNREACHABLE()V8_Fatal("unreachable code");
175 } else {
176 if (!VALIDATE(enabled.has_typed_funcref())) {
177 decoder->error(pc,
178 "Invalid indexed heap type, enable with "
179 "--experimental-wasm-typed-funcref");
180 return HeapType(HeapType::kBottom);
181 }
182 uint32_t type_index = static_cast<uint32_t>(heap_index);
183 if (!VALIDATE(type_index < kV8MaxWasmTypes)) {
184 decoder->errorf(pc,
185 "Type index %u is greater than the maximum number %zu "
186 "of type definitions supported by V8",
187 type_index, kV8MaxWasmTypes);
188 return HeapType(HeapType::kBottom);
189 }
190 return HeapType(type_index);
191 }
192}
193
194// Read a value type starting at address 'pc' in 'decoder'.
195// No bytes are consumed. The result is written into the 'result' parameter.
196// Returns the amount of bytes read, or 0 if decoding failed.
197// Registers an error if the type opcode is invalid iff validate is set.
198template <Decoder::ValidateFlag validate>
199ValueType read_value_type(Decoder* decoder, const byte* pc,
200 uint32_t* const length, const WasmFeatures& enabled) {
201 *length = 1;
202 byte val = decoder->read_u8<validate>(pc, "value type opcode");
203 if (decoder->failed()) {
204 return kWasmBottom;
205 }
206 ValueTypeCode code = static_cast<ValueTypeCode>(val);
207 switch (code) {
208 case kLocalFuncRef:
209 case kLocalExnRef:
210 case kLocalEqRef:
211 case kLocalExternRef:
212 case kLocalI31Ref: {
213 HeapType heap_type = HeapType::from_code(code);
214 ValueType result = ValueType::Ref(heap_type, kNullable);
215 if (!VALIDATE(enabled.contains(feature_for_heap_type(heap_type)))) {
216 decoder->errorf(
217 pc, "invalid value type '%s', enable with --experimental-wasm-%s",
218 result.name().c_str(),
219 WasmFeatures::name_for_feature(feature_for_heap_type(heap_type)));
220 return kWasmBottom;
221 }
222 return result;
223 }
224 case kLocalI32:
225 return kWasmI32;
226 case kLocalI64:
227 return kWasmI64;
228 case kLocalF32:
229 return kWasmF32;
230 case kLocalF64:
231 return kWasmF64;
232 case kLocalRef:
233 case kLocalOptRef: {
234 Nullability nullability = code == kLocalOptRef ? kNullable : kNonNullable;
235 if (!VALIDATE(enabled.has_typed_funcref())) {
236 decoder->errorf(pc,
237 "Invalid type 'ref%s', enable with "
238 "--experimental-wasm-typed-funcref",
239 nullability == kNullable ? " null" : "");
240 return kWasmBottom;
241 }
242 HeapType heap_type =
243 read_heap_type<validate>(decoder, pc + 1, length, enabled);
244 *length += 1;
245 return heap_type.is_bottom() ? kWasmBottom
246 : ValueType::Ref(heap_type, nullability);
247 }
248 case kLocalRtt: {
249 if (!VALIDATE(enabled.has_gc())) {
250 decoder->error(
251 pc, "invalid value type 'rtt', enable with --experimental-wasm-gc");
252 return kWasmBottom;
253 }
254 uint32_t depth_length;
255 uint32_t depth =
256 decoder->read_u32v<validate>(pc + 1, &depth_length, "depth");
257 // TODO(7748): Introduce a proper limit.
258 const uint32_t kMaxRttSubtypingDepth = 7;
259 if (!VALIDATE(depth <= kMaxRttSubtypingDepth)) {
260 decoder->errorf(pc,
261 "subtyping depth %u is greater than the maximum depth "
262 "%u supported by V8",
263 depth, kMaxRttSubtypingDepth);
264 return kWasmBottom;
265 }
266 HeapType heap_type = read_heap_type<validate>(
267 decoder, pc + depth_length + 1, length, enabled);
268 *length += depth_length + 1;
269 return heap_type.is_bottom() ? kWasmBottom
270 : ValueType::Rtt(heap_type, depth);
271 }
272 case kLocalS128:
273 if (!VALIDATE(enabled.has_simd())) {
274 decoder->error(pc,
275 "invalid value type 'Simd128', enable with "
276 "--experimental-wasm-simd");
277 return kWasmBottom;
278 }
279 return kWasmS128;
280 case kLocalVoid:
281 case kLocalI8:
282 case kLocalI16:
283 // Although these types are included in ValueType, they are technically
284 // not value types and are only used in specific contexts. The caller of
285 // this function is responsible to check for them separately.
286 break;
287 }
288 // Malformed modules specifying invalid types can get here.
289 return kWasmBottom;
290}
291} // namespace value_type_reader
292
293// Helpers for decoding different kinds of immediates which follow bytecodes.
294template <Decoder::ValidateFlag validate>
295struct LocalIndexImmediate {
296 uint32_t index;
297 uint32_t length;
298
299 inline LocalIndexImmediate(Decoder* decoder, const byte* pc) {
300 index = decoder->read_u32v<validate>(pc, &length, "local index");
301 }
302};
303
304template <Decoder::ValidateFlag validate>
305struct ExceptionIndexImmediate {
306 uint32_t index;
307 const WasmException* exception = nullptr;
308 uint32_t length;
309
310 inline ExceptionIndexImmediate(Decoder* decoder, const byte* pc) {
311 index = decoder->read_u32v<validate>(pc, &length, "exception index");
312 }
313};
314
315template <Decoder::ValidateFlag validate>
316struct ImmI32Immediate {
317 int32_t value;
318 uint32_t length;
319 inline ImmI32Immediate(Decoder* decoder, const byte* pc) {
320 value = decoder->read_i32v<validate>(pc, &length, "immi32");
321 }
322};
323
324template <Decoder::ValidateFlag validate>
325struct ImmI64Immediate {
326 int64_t value;
327 uint32_t length;
328 inline ImmI64Immediate(Decoder* decoder, const byte* pc) {
329 value = decoder->read_i64v<validate>(pc, &length, "immi64");
330 }
331};
332
333template <Decoder::ValidateFlag validate>
334struct ImmF32Immediate {
335 float value;
336 uint32_t length = 4;
337 inline ImmF32Immediate(Decoder* decoder, const byte* pc) {
338 // We can't use bit_cast here because calling any helper function that
339 // returns a float would potentially flip NaN bits per C++ semantics, so we
340 // have to inline the memcpy call directly.
341 uint32_t tmp = decoder->read_u32<validate>(pc, "immf32");
342 memcpy(&value, &tmp, sizeof(value));
343 }
344};
345
346template <Decoder::ValidateFlag validate>
347struct ImmF64Immediate {
348 double value;
349 uint32_t length = 8;
350 inline ImmF64Immediate(Decoder* decoder, const byte* pc) {
351 // Avoid bit_cast because it might not preserve the signalling bit of a NaN.
352 uint64_t tmp = decoder->read_u64<validate>(pc, "immf64");
353 memcpy(&value, &tmp, sizeof(value));
354 }
355};
356
357template <Decoder::ValidateFlag validate>
358struct GlobalIndexImmediate {
359 uint32_t index;
360 ValueType type = kWasmStmt;
361 const WasmGlobal* global = nullptr;
362 uint32_t length;
363
364 inline GlobalIndexImmediate(Decoder* decoder, const byte* pc) {
365 index = decoder->read_u32v<validate>(pc, &length, "global index");
366 }
367};
368
369template <Decoder::ValidateFlag validate>
370struct SelectTypeImmediate {
371 uint32_t length;
372 ValueType type;
373
374 inline SelectTypeImmediate(const WasmFeatures& enabled, Decoder* decoder,
375 const byte* pc) {
376 uint8_t num_types =
377 decoder->read_u32v<validate>(pc, &length, "number of select types");
378 if (!VALIDATE(num_types == 1)) {
379 decoder->error(
380 pc + 1, "Invalid number of types. Select accepts exactly one type");
381 return;
382 }
383 uint32_t type_length;
384 type = value_type_reader::read_value_type<validate>(decoder, pc + length,
385 &type_length, enabled);
386 length += type_length;
387 if (!VALIDATE(type != kWasmBottom)) {
388 decoder->error(pc + 1, "invalid select type");
389 }
390 }
391};
392
393template <Decoder::ValidateFlag validate>
394struct BlockTypeImmediate {
395 uint32_t length = 1;
396 ValueType type = kWasmStmt;
397 uint32_t sig_index = 0;
398 const FunctionSig* sig = nullptr;
399
400 inline BlockTypeImmediate(const WasmFeatures& enabled, Decoder* decoder,
401 const byte* pc) {
402 int64_t block_type =
403 decoder->read_i33v<validate>(pc, &length, "block type");
404 if (block_type < 0) {
405 if ((static_cast<uint8_t>(block_type) & byte{0x7f}) == kLocalVoid) return;
406 type = value_type_reader::read_value_type<validate>(decoder, pc, &length,
407 enabled);
408 if (!VALIDATE(type != kWasmBottom)) {
409 decoder->errorf(pc, "Invalid block type %" PRId64"l" "d", block_type);
410 }
411 } else {
412 if (!VALIDATE(enabled.has_mv())) {
413 decoder->errorf(pc,
414 "invalid block type %" PRId64"l" "d"
415 ", enable with --experimental-wasm-mv",
416 block_type);
417 return;
418 }
419 type = kWasmBottom;
420 sig_index = static_cast<uint32_t>(block_type);
421 }
422 }
423
424 uint32_t in_arity() const {
425 if (type != kWasmBottom) return 0;
426 return static_cast<uint32_t>(sig->parameter_count());
427 }
428 uint32_t out_arity() const {
429 if (type == kWasmStmt) return 0;
430 if (type != kWasmBottom) return 1;
431 return static_cast<uint32_t>(sig->return_count());
432 }
433 ValueType in_type(uint32_t index) {
434 DCHECK_EQ(kWasmBottom, type)((void) 0);
435 return sig->GetParam(index);
436 }
437 ValueType out_type(uint32_t index) {
438 if (type == kWasmBottom) return sig->GetReturn(index);
439 DCHECK_NE(kWasmStmt, type)((void) 0);
440 DCHECK_EQ(0, index)((void) 0);
441 return type;
442 }
443};
444
445template <Decoder::ValidateFlag validate>
446struct BranchDepthImmediate {
447 uint32_t depth;
448 uint32_t length;
449 inline BranchDepthImmediate(Decoder* decoder, const byte* pc) {
450 depth = decoder->read_u32v<validate>(pc, &length, "branch depth");
451 }
452};
453
454template <Decoder::ValidateFlag validate>
455struct BranchOnExceptionImmediate {
456 BranchDepthImmediate<validate> depth;
457 ExceptionIndexImmediate<validate> index;
458 uint32_t length = 0;
459 inline BranchOnExceptionImmediate(Decoder* decoder, const byte* pc)
460 : depth(BranchDepthImmediate<validate>(decoder, pc)),
461 index(ExceptionIndexImmediate<validate>(decoder, pc + depth.length)) {
462 length = depth.length + index.length;
463 }
464};
465
466template <Decoder::ValidateFlag validate>
467struct FunctionIndexImmediate {
468 uint32_t index = 0;
469 uint32_t length = 1;
470 inline FunctionIndexImmediate(Decoder* decoder, const byte* pc) {
471 index = decoder->read_u32v<validate>(pc, &length, "function index");
472 }
473};
474
475template <Decoder::ValidateFlag validate>
476struct MemoryIndexImmediate {
477 uint32_t index = 0;
478 uint32_t length = 1;
479 inline MemoryIndexImmediate() = default;
480 inline MemoryIndexImmediate(Decoder* decoder, const byte* pc) {
481 index = decoder->read_u8<validate>(pc, "memory index");
482 if (!VALIDATE(index == 0)) {
483 decoder->errorf(pc, "expected memory index 0, found %u", index);
484 }
485 }
486};
487
488template <Decoder::ValidateFlag validate>
489struct TableIndexImmediate {
490 uint32_t index = 0;
491 unsigned length = 1;
492 inline TableIndexImmediate() = default;
493 inline TableIndexImmediate(Decoder* decoder, const byte* pc) {
494 index = decoder->read_u32v<validate>(pc, &length, "table index");
495 }
496};
497
498// TODO(jkummerow): Introduce a common superclass for StructIndexImmediate and
499// ArrayIndexImmediate? Maybe even FunctionIndexImmediate too?
500template <Decoder::ValidateFlag validate>
501struct StructIndexImmediate {
502 uint32_t index = 0;
503 uint32_t length = 0;
504 const StructType* struct_type = nullptr;
505 inline StructIndexImmediate(Decoder* decoder, const byte* pc) {
506 index = decoder->read_u32v<validate>(pc, &length, "struct index");
507 }
508};
509
510template <Decoder::ValidateFlag validate>
511struct FieldIndexImmediate {
512 StructIndexImmediate<validate> struct_index;
513 uint32_t index = 0;
514 uint32_t length = 0;
515 inline FieldIndexImmediate(Decoder* decoder, const byte* pc)
516 : struct_index(decoder, pc) {
517 index = decoder->read_u32v<validate>(pc + struct_index.length, &length,
518 "field index");
519 length += struct_index.length;
520 }
521};
522
523template <Decoder::ValidateFlag validate>
524struct ArrayIndexImmediate {
525 uint32_t index = 0;
526 uint32_t length = 0;
527 const ArrayType* array_type = nullptr;
528 inline ArrayIndexImmediate(Decoder* decoder, const byte* pc) {
529 index = decoder->read_u32v<validate>(pc, &length, "array index");
530 }
531};
532
533template <Decoder::ValidateFlag validate>
534struct CallIndirectImmediate {
535 uint32_t table_index;
536 uint32_t sig_index;
537 const FunctionSig* sig = nullptr;
538 uint32_t length = 0;
539 inline CallIndirectImmediate(const WasmFeatures enabled, Decoder* decoder,
540 const byte* pc) {
541 uint32_t len = 0;
542 sig_index = decoder->read_u32v<validate>(pc, &len, "signature index");
543 TableIndexImmediate<validate> table(decoder, pc + len);
544 if (!VALIDATE((table.index == 0 && table.length == 1) ||
545 enabled.has_reftypes())) {
546 decoder->errorf(pc + len, "expected table index 0, found %u",
547 table.index);
548 }
549 table_index = table.index;
550 length = len + table.length;
551 }
552};
553
554template <Decoder::ValidateFlag validate>
555struct CallFunctionImmediate {
556 uint32_t index;
557 const FunctionSig* sig = nullptr;
558 uint32_t length;
559 inline CallFunctionImmediate(Decoder* decoder, const byte* pc) {
560 index = decoder->read_u32v<validate>(pc, &length, "function index");
561 }
562};
563
564template <Decoder::ValidateFlag validate>
565struct BranchTableImmediate {
566 uint32_t table_count;
567 const byte* start;
568 const byte* table;
569 inline BranchTableImmediate(Decoder* decoder, const byte* pc) {
570 start = pc;
571 uint32_t len = 0;
572 table_count = decoder->read_u32v<validate>(pc, &len, "table count");
573 table = pc + len;
574 }
575};
576
577// A helper to iterate over a branch table.
578template <Decoder::ValidateFlag validate>
579class BranchTableIterator {
580 public:
581 uint32_t cur_index() { return index_; }
582 bool has_next() { return VALIDATE(decoder_->ok()) && index_ <= table_count_; }
583 uint32_t next() {
584 DCHECK(has_next())((void) 0);
585 index_++;
586 uint32_t length;
587 uint32_t result =
588 decoder_->read_u32v<validate>(pc_, &length, "branch table entry");
589 pc_ += length;
590 return result;
591 }
592 // length, including the length of the {BranchTableImmediate}, but not the
593 // opcode.
594 uint32_t length() {
595 while (has_next()) next();
596 return static_cast<uint32_t>(pc_ - start_);
597 }
598 const byte* pc() { return pc_; }
599
600 BranchTableIterator(Decoder* decoder,
601 const BranchTableImmediate<validate>& imm)
602 : decoder_(decoder),
603 start_(imm.start),
604 pc_(imm.table),
605 table_count_(imm.table_count) {}
606
607 private:
608 Decoder* const decoder_;
609 const byte* start_;
610 const byte* pc_;
611 uint32_t index_ = 0; // the current index.
612 const uint32_t table_count_; // the count of entries, not including default.
613};
614
615template <Decoder::ValidateFlag validate>
616struct MemoryAccessImmediate {
617 uint32_t alignment;
618 uint32_t offset;
619 uint32_t length = 0;
620 inline MemoryAccessImmediate(Decoder* decoder, const byte* pc,
621 uint32_t max_alignment) {
622 uint32_t alignment_length;
623 alignment =
624 decoder->read_u32v<validate>(pc, &alignment_length, "alignment");
625 if (!VALIDATE(alignment <= max_alignment)) {
626 decoder->errorf(pc,
627 "invalid alignment; expected maximum alignment is %u, "
628 "actual alignment is %u",
629 max_alignment, alignment);
630 }
631 uint32_t offset_length;
632 offset = decoder->read_u32v<validate>(pc + alignment_length, &offset_length,
633 "offset");
634 length = alignment_length + offset_length;
635 }
636};
637
638// Immediate for SIMD lane operations.
639template <Decoder::ValidateFlag validate>
640struct SimdLaneImmediate {
641 uint8_t lane;
642 uint32_t length = 1;
643
644 inline SimdLaneImmediate(Decoder* decoder, const byte* pc) {
645 lane = decoder->read_u8<validate>(pc, "lane");
646 }
647};
648
649// Immediate for SIMD S8x16 shuffle operations.
650template <Decoder::ValidateFlag validate>
651struct Simd128Immediate {
652 uint8_t value[kSimd128Size] = {0};
653
654 inline Simd128Immediate(Decoder* decoder, const byte* pc) {
655 for (uint32_t i = 0; i < kSimd128Size; ++i) {
656 value[i] = decoder->read_u8<validate>(pc + i, "value");
657 }
658 }
659};
660
661template <Decoder::ValidateFlag validate>
662struct MemoryInitImmediate {
663 uint32_t data_segment_index = 0;
664 MemoryIndexImmediate<validate> memory;
665 unsigned length = 0;
666
667 inline MemoryInitImmediate(Decoder* decoder, const byte* pc) {
668 uint32_t len = 0;
669 data_segment_index =
670 decoder->read_u32v<validate>(pc, &len, "data segment index");
671 memory = MemoryIndexImmediate<validate>(decoder, pc + len);
672 length = len + memory.length;
673 }
674};
675
676template <Decoder::ValidateFlag validate>
677struct DataDropImmediate {
678 uint32_t index;
679 unsigned length;
680
681 inline DataDropImmediate(Decoder* decoder, const byte* pc) {
682 index = decoder->read_u32v<validate>(pc, &length, "data segment index");
683 }
684};
685
686template <Decoder::ValidateFlag validate>
687struct MemoryCopyImmediate {
688 MemoryIndexImmediate<validate> memory_src;
689 MemoryIndexImmediate<validate> memory_dst;
690 unsigned length = 0;
691
692 inline MemoryCopyImmediate(Decoder* decoder, const byte* pc) {
693 memory_src = MemoryIndexImmediate<validate>(decoder, pc);
694 memory_dst =
695 MemoryIndexImmediate<validate>(decoder, pc + memory_src.length);
696 length = memory_src.length + memory_dst.length;
697 }
698};
699
700template <Decoder::ValidateFlag validate>
701struct TableInitImmediate {
702 uint32_t elem_segment_index = 0;
703 TableIndexImmediate<validate> table;
704 unsigned length = 0;
705
706 inline TableInitImmediate(Decoder* decoder, const byte* pc) {
707 uint32_t len = 0;
708 elem_segment_index =
709 decoder->read_u32v<validate>(pc, &len, "elem segment index");
710 table = TableIndexImmediate<validate>(decoder, pc + len);
711 length = len + table.length;
712 }
713};
714
715template <Decoder::ValidateFlag validate>
716struct ElemDropImmediate {
717 uint32_t index;
718 unsigned length;
719
720 inline ElemDropImmediate(Decoder* decoder, const byte* pc) {
721 index = decoder->read_u32v<validate>(pc, &length, "elem segment index");
722 }
723};
724
725template <Decoder::ValidateFlag validate>
726struct TableCopyImmediate {
727 TableIndexImmediate<validate> table_dst;
728 TableIndexImmediate<validate> table_src;
729 unsigned length = 0;
730
731 inline TableCopyImmediate(Decoder* decoder, const byte* pc) {
732 table_dst = TableIndexImmediate<validate>(decoder, pc);
733 table_src = TableIndexImmediate<validate>(decoder, pc + table_dst.length);
734 length = table_src.length + table_dst.length;
735 }
736};
737
738template <Decoder::ValidateFlag validate>
739struct HeapTypeImmediate {
740 uint32_t length = 1;
741 HeapType type = HeapType(HeapType::kBottom);
742 inline HeapTypeImmediate(const WasmFeatures& enabled, Decoder* decoder,
743 const byte* pc) {
744 type = value_type_reader::read_heap_type<validate>(decoder, pc, &length,
745 enabled);
746 }
747};
748
749// An entry on the value stack.
750struct ValueBase {
751 const byte* pc = nullptr;
752 ValueType type = kWasmStmt;
753
754 ValueBase(const byte* pc, ValueType type) : pc(pc), type(type) {}
755};
756
757template <typename Value>
758struct Merge {
759 uint32_t arity = 0;
760 union { // Either multiple values or a single value.
761 Value* array;
762 Value first;
763 } vals = {nullptr}; // Initialize {array} with {nullptr}.
764
765 // Tracks whether this merge was ever reached. Uses precise reachability, like
766 // Reachability::kReachable.
767 bool reached;
768
769 explicit Merge(bool reached = false) : reached(reached) {}
770
771 Value& operator[](uint32_t i) {
772 DCHECK_GT(arity, i)((void) 0);
773 return arity == 1 ? vals.first : vals.array[i];
774 }
775};
776
777enum ControlKind : uint8_t {
778 kControlIf,
779 kControlIfElse,
780 kControlBlock,
781 kControlLoop,
782 kControlLet,
783 kControlTry,
784 kControlTryCatch
785};
786
787enum Reachability : uint8_t {
788 // reachable code.
789 kReachable,
790 // reachable code in unreachable block (implies normal validation).
791 kSpecOnlyReachable,
792 // code unreachable in its own block (implies polymorphic validation).
793 kUnreachable
794};
795
796// An entry on the control stack (i.e. if, block, loop, or try).
797template <typename Value>
798struct ControlBase {
799 ControlKind kind = kControlBlock;
800 uint32_t locals_count = 0;
801 uint32_t stack_depth = 0; // stack height at the beginning of the construct.
802 const uint8_t* pc = nullptr;
803 Reachability reachability = kReachable;
804
805 // Values merged into the start or end of this control construct.
806 Merge<Value> start_merge;
807 Merge<Value> end_merge;
808
809 MOVE_ONLY_NO_DEFAULT_CONSTRUCTOR(ControlBase)ControlBase(ControlBase&&) noexcept = default; ControlBase
& operator=(ControlBase&&) noexcept = default; ControlBase
(const ControlBase&) = delete; ControlBase& operator=
(const ControlBase&) = delete;
810
811 ControlBase(ControlKind kind, uint32_t locals_count, uint32_t stack_depth,
812 const uint8_t* pc, Reachability reachability)
813 : kind(kind),
814 locals_count(locals_count),
815 stack_depth(stack_depth),
816 pc(pc),
817 reachability(reachability),
818 start_merge(reachability == kReachable) {
819 DCHECK(kind == kControlLet || locals_count == 0)((void) 0);
820 }
821
822 // Check whether the current block is reachable.
823 bool reachable() const { return reachability == kReachable; }
824
825 // Check whether the rest of the block is unreachable.
826 // Note that this is different from {!reachable()}, as there is also the
827 // "indirect unreachable state", for which both {reachable()} and
828 // {unreachable()} return false.
829 bool unreachable() const { return reachability == kUnreachable; }
830
831 // Return the reachability of new control structs started in this block.
832 Reachability innerReachability() const {
833 return reachability == kReachable ? kReachable : kSpecOnlyReachable;
834 }
835
836 bool is_if() const { return is_onearmed_if() || is_if_else(); }
837 bool is_onearmed_if() const { return kind == kControlIf; }
838 bool is_if_else() const { return kind == kControlIfElse; }
839 bool is_block() const { return kind == kControlBlock; }
840 bool is_let() const { return kind == kControlLet; }
841 bool is_loop() const { return kind == kControlLoop; }
842 bool is_incomplete_try() const { return kind == kControlTry; }
843 bool is_try_catch() const { return kind == kControlTryCatch; }
844 bool is_try() const { return is_incomplete_try() || is_try_catch(); }
845
846 inline Merge<Value>* br_merge() {
847 return is_loop() ? &this->start_merge : &this->end_merge;
848 }
849};
850
851// This is the list of callback functions that an interface for the
852// WasmFullDecoder should implement.
853// F(Name, args...)
854#define INTERFACE_FUNCTIONS(F)F(StartFunction) F(StartFunctionBody, Control* block) F(FinishFunction
) F(OnFirstError) F(NextInstruction, WasmOpcode) F(Block, Control
* block) F(Loop, Control* block) F(Try, Control* block) F(Catch
, Control* block, Value* exception) F(If, const Value& cond
, Control* if_block) F(FallThruTo, Control* c) F(PopControl, Control
* block) F(EndControl, Control* block) F(UnOp, WasmOpcode opcode
, const Value& value, Value* result) F(BinOp, WasmOpcode opcode
, const Value& lhs, const Value& rhs, Value* result) F
(I32Const, Value* result, int32_t value) F(I64Const, Value* result
, int64_t value) F(F32Const, Value* result, float value) F(F64Const
, Value* result, double value) F(RefNull, Value* result) F(RefFunc
, uint32_t function_index, Value* result) F(RefAsNonNull, const
Value& arg, Value* result) F(Drop, const Value& value
) F(DoReturn, Vector<Value> values) F(LocalGet, Value* result
, const LocalIndexImmediate<validate>& imm) F(LocalSet
, const Value& value, const LocalIndexImmediate<validate
>& imm) F(LocalTee, const Value& value, Value* result
, const LocalIndexImmediate<validate>& imm) F(AllocateLocals
, Vector<Value> local_values) F(DeallocateLocals, uint32_t
count) F(GlobalGet, Value* result, const GlobalIndexImmediate
<validate>& imm) F(GlobalSet, const Value& value
, const GlobalIndexImmediate<validate>& imm) F(TableGet
, const Value& index, Value* result, const TableIndexImmediate
<validate>& imm) F(TableSet, const Value& index
, const Value& value, const TableIndexImmediate<validate
>& imm) F(Unreachable) F(Select, const Value& cond
, const Value& fval, const Value& tval, Value* result
) F(Br, Control* target) F(BrIf, const Value& cond, uint32_t
depth) F(BrTable, const BranchTableImmediate<validate>
& imm, const Value& key) F(Else, Control* if_block) F
(LoadMem, LoadType type, const MemoryAccessImmediate<validate
>& imm, const Value& index, Value* result) F(LoadTransform
, LoadType type, LoadTransformationKind transform, const MemoryAccessImmediate
<validate>& imm, const Value& index, Value* result
) F(StoreMem, StoreType type, const MemoryAccessImmediate<
validate>& imm, const Value& index, const Value&
value) F(CurrentMemoryPages, Value* result) F(MemoryGrow, const
Value& value, Value* result) F(CallDirect, const CallFunctionImmediate
<validate>& imm, const Value args[], Value returns[
]) F(CallIndirect, const Value& index, const CallIndirectImmediate
<validate>& imm, const Value args[], Value returns[
]) F(CallRef, const Value& func_ref, const FunctionSig* sig
, uint32_t sig_index, const Value args[], const Value returns
[]) F(ReturnCallRef, const Value& func_ref, const FunctionSig
* sig, uint32_t sig_index, const Value args[]) F(ReturnCall, const
CallFunctionImmediate<validate>& imm, const Value args
[]) F(ReturnCallIndirect, const Value& index, const CallIndirectImmediate
<validate>& imm, const Value args[]) F(BrOnNull, const
Value& ref_object, uint32_t depth) F(SimdOp, WasmOpcode opcode
, Vector<Value> args, Value* result) F(SimdLaneOp, WasmOpcode
opcode, const SimdLaneImmediate<validate>& imm, const
Vector<Value> inputs, Value* result) F(S128Const, const
Simd128Immediate<validate>& imm, Value* result) F(
Simd8x16ShuffleOp, const Simd128Immediate<validate>&
imm, const Value& input0, const Value& input1, Value
* result) F(Throw, const ExceptionIndexImmediate<validate>
& imm, const Vector<Value>& args) F(Rethrow, const
Value& exception) F(BrOnException, const Value& exception
, const ExceptionIndexImmediate<validate>& imm, uint32_t
depth, Vector<Value> values) F(AtomicOp, WasmOpcode opcode
, Vector<Value> args, const MemoryAccessImmediate<validate
>& imm, Value* result) F(AtomicFence) F(MemoryInit, const
MemoryInitImmediate<validate>& imm, const Value&
dst, const Value& src, const Value& size) F(DataDrop
, const DataDropImmediate<validate>& imm) F(MemoryCopy
, const MemoryCopyImmediate<validate>& imm, const Value
& dst, const Value& src, const Value& size) F(MemoryFill
, const MemoryIndexImmediate<validate>& imm, const Value
& dst, const Value& value, const Value& size) F(TableInit
, const TableInitImmediate<validate>& imm, Vector<
Value> args) F(ElemDrop, const ElemDropImmediate<validate
>& imm) F(TableCopy, const TableCopyImmediate<validate
>& imm, Vector<Value> args) F(TableGrow, const TableIndexImmediate
<validate>& imm, const Value& value, const Value
& delta, Value* result) F(TableSize, const TableIndexImmediate
<validate>& imm, Value* result) F(TableFill, const TableIndexImmediate
<validate>& imm, const Value& start, const Value
& value, const Value& count) F(StructNewWithRtt, const
StructIndexImmediate<validate>& imm, const Value&
rtt, const Value args[], Value* result) F(StructNewDefault, const
StructIndexImmediate<validate>& imm, const Value&
rtt, Value* result) F(StructGet, const Value& struct_object
, const FieldIndexImmediate<validate>& field, bool is_signed
, Value* result) F(StructSet, const Value& struct_object,
const FieldIndexImmediate<validate>& field, const Value
& field_value) F(ArrayNewWithRtt, const ArrayIndexImmediate
<validate>& imm, const Value& length, const Value
& initial_value, const Value& rtt, Value* result) F(ArrayNewDefault
, const ArrayIndexImmediate<validate>& imm, const Value
& length, const Value& rtt, Value* result) F(ArrayGet
, const Value& array_obj, const ArrayIndexImmediate<validate
>& imm, const Value& index, bool is_signed, Value*
result) F(ArraySet, const Value& array_obj, const ArrayIndexImmediate
<validate>& imm, const Value& index, const Value
& value) F(ArrayLen, const Value& array_obj, Value* result
) F(I31New, const Value& input, Value* result) F(I31GetS,
const Value& input, Value* result) F(I31GetU, const Value
& input, Value* result) F(RttCanon, const HeapTypeImmediate
<validate>& imm, Value* result) F(RttSub, const HeapTypeImmediate
<validate>& imm, const Value& parent, Value* result
) F(RefTest, const Value& obj, const Value& rtt, Value
* result) F(RefCast, const Value& obj, const Value& rtt
, Value* result) F(BrOnCast, const Value& obj, const Value
& rtt, Value* result_on_branch, uint32_t depth) F(PassThrough
, const Value& from, Value* to) \
855 /* General: */ \
856 F(StartFunction) \
857 F(StartFunctionBody, Control* block) \
858 F(FinishFunction) \
859 F(OnFirstError) \
860 F(NextInstruction, WasmOpcode) \
861 /* Control: */ \
862 F(Block, Control* block) \
863 F(Loop, Control* block) \
864 F(Try, Control* block) \
865 F(Catch, Control* block, Value* exception) \
866 F(If, const Value& cond, Control* if_block) \
867 F(FallThruTo, Control* c) \
868 F(PopControl, Control* block) \
869 F(EndControl, Control* block) \
870 /* Instructions: */ \
871 F(UnOp, WasmOpcode opcode, const Value& value, Value* result) \
872 F(BinOp, WasmOpcode opcode, const Value& lhs, const Value& rhs, \
873 Value* result) \
874 F(I32Const, Value* result, int32_t value) \
875 F(I64Const, Value* result, int64_t value) \
876 F(F32Const, Value* result, float value) \
877 F(F64Const, Value* result, double value) \
878 F(RefNull, Value* result) \
879 F(RefFunc, uint32_t function_index, Value* result) \
880 F(RefAsNonNull, const Value& arg, Value* result) \
881 F(Drop, const Value& value) \
882 F(DoReturn, Vector<Value> values) \
883 F(LocalGet, Value* result, const LocalIndexImmediate<validate>& imm) \
884 F(LocalSet, const Value& value, const LocalIndexImmediate<validate>& imm) \
885 F(LocalTee, const Value& value, Value* result, \
886 const LocalIndexImmediate<validate>& imm) \
887 F(AllocateLocals, Vector<Value> local_values) \
888 F(DeallocateLocals, uint32_t count) \
889 F(GlobalGet, Value* result, const GlobalIndexImmediate<validate>& imm) \
890 F(GlobalSet, const Value& value, const GlobalIndexImmediate<validate>& imm) \
891 F(TableGet, const Value& index, Value* result, \
892 const TableIndexImmediate<validate>& imm) \
893 F(TableSet, const Value& index, const Value& value, \
894 const TableIndexImmediate<validate>& imm) \
895 F(Unreachable) \
896 F(Select, const Value& cond, const Value& fval, const Value& tval, \
897 Value* result) \
898 F(Br, Control* target) \
899 F(BrIf, const Value& cond, uint32_t depth) \
900 F(BrTable, const BranchTableImmediate<validate>& imm, const Value& key) \
901 F(Else, Control* if_block) \
902 F(LoadMem, LoadType type, const MemoryAccessImmediate<validate>& imm, \
903 const Value& index, Value* result) \
904 F(LoadTransform, LoadType type, LoadTransformationKind transform, \
905 const MemoryAccessImmediate<validate>& imm, const Value& index, \
906 Value* result) \
907 F(StoreMem, StoreType type, const MemoryAccessImmediate<validate>& imm, \
908 const Value& index, const Value& value) \
909 F(CurrentMemoryPages, Value* result) \
910 F(MemoryGrow, const Value& value, Value* result) \
911 F(CallDirect, const CallFunctionImmediate<validate>& imm, \
912 const Value args[], Value returns[]) \
913 F(CallIndirect, const Value& index, \
914 const CallIndirectImmediate<validate>& imm, const Value args[], \
915 Value returns[]) \
916 F(CallRef, const Value& func_ref, const FunctionSig* sig, \
917 uint32_t sig_index, const Value args[], const Value returns[]) \
918 F(ReturnCallRef, const Value& func_ref, const FunctionSig* sig, \
919 uint32_t sig_index, const Value args[]) \
920 F(ReturnCall, const CallFunctionImmediate<validate>& imm, \
921 const Value args[]) \
922 F(ReturnCallIndirect, const Value& index, \
923 const CallIndirectImmediate<validate>& imm, const Value args[]) \
924 F(BrOnNull, const Value& ref_object, uint32_t depth) \
925 F(SimdOp, WasmOpcode opcode, Vector<Value> args, Value* result) \
926 F(SimdLaneOp, WasmOpcode opcode, const SimdLaneImmediate<validate>& imm, \
927 const Vector<Value> inputs, Value* result) \
928 F(S128Const, const Simd128Immediate<validate>& imm, Value* result) \
929 F(Simd8x16ShuffleOp, const Simd128Immediate<validate>& imm, \
930 const Value& input0, const Value& input1, Value* result) \
931 F(Throw, const ExceptionIndexImmediate<validate>& imm, \
932 const Vector<Value>& args) \
933 F(Rethrow, const Value& exception) \
934 F(BrOnException, const Value& exception, \
935 const ExceptionIndexImmediate<validate>& imm, uint32_t depth, \
936 Vector<Value> values) \
937 F(AtomicOp, WasmOpcode opcode, Vector<Value> args, \
938 const MemoryAccessImmediate<validate>& imm, Value* result) \
939 F(AtomicFence) \
940 F(MemoryInit, const MemoryInitImmediate<validate>& imm, const Value& dst, \
941 const Value& src, const Value& size) \
942 F(DataDrop, const DataDropImmediate<validate>& imm) \
943 F(MemoryCopy, const MemoryCopyImmediate<validate>& imm, const Value& dst, \
944 const Value& src, const Value& size) \
945 F(MemoryFill, const MemoryIndexImmediate<validate>& imm, const Value& dst, \
946 const Value& value, const Value& size) \
947 F(TableInit, const TableInitImmediate<validate>& imm, Vector<Value> args) \
948 F(ElemDrop, const ElemDropImmediate<validate>& imm) \
949 F(TableCopy, const TableCopyImmediate<validate>& imm, Vector<Value> args) \
950 F(TableGrow, const TableIndexImmediate<validate>& imm, const Value& value, \
951 const Value& delta, Value* result) \
952 F(TableSize, const TableIndexImmediate<validate>& imm, Value* result) \
953 F(TableFill, const TableIndexImmediate<validate>& imm, const Value& start, \
954 const Value& value, const Value& count) \
955 F(StructNewWithRtt, const StructIndexImmediate<validate>& imm, \
956 const Value& rtt, const Value args[], Value* result) \
957 F(StructNewDefault, const StructIndexImmediate<validate>& imm, \
958 const Value& rtt, Value* result) \
959 F(StructGet, const Value& struct_object, \
960 const FieldIndexImmediate<validate>& field, bool is_signed, Value* result) \
961 F(StructSet, const Value& struct_object, \
962 const FieldIndexImmediate<validate>& field, const Value& field_value) \
963 F(ArrayNewWithRtt, const ArrayIndexImmediate<validate>& imm, \
964 const Value& length, const Value& initial_value, const Value& rtt, \
965 Value* result) \
966 F(ArrayNewDefault, const ArrayIndexImmediate<validate>& imm, \
967 const Value& length, const Value& rtt, Value* result) \
968 F(ArrayGet, const Value& array_obj, \
969 const ArrayIndexImmediate<validate>& imm, const Value& index, \
970 bool is_signed, Value* result) \
971 F(ArraySet, const Value& array_obj, \
972 const ArrayIndexImmediate<validate>& imm, const Value& index, \
973 const Value& value) \
974 F(ArrayLen, const Value& array_obj, Value* result) \
975 F(I31New, const Value& input, Value* result) \
976 F(I31GetS, const Value& input, Value* result) \
977 F(I31GetU, const Value& input, Value* result) \
978 F(RttCanon, const HeapTypeImmediate<validate>& imm, Value* result) \
979 F(RttSub, const HeapTypeImmediate<validate>& imm, const Value& parent, \
980 Value* result) \
981 F(RefTest, const Value& obj, const Value& rtt, Value* result) \
982 F(RefCast, const Value& obj, const Value& rtt, Value* result) \
983 F(BrOnCast, const Value& obj, const Value& rtt, Value* result_on_branch, \
984 uint32_t depth) \
985 F(PassThrough, const Value& from, Value* to)
986
987// Generic Wasm bytecode decoder with utilities for decoding immediates,
988// lengths, etc.
989template <Decoder::ValidateFlag validate>
990class WasmDecoder : public Decoder {
991 public:
992 WasmDecoder(Zone* zone, const WasmModule* module, const WasmFeatures& enabled,
993 WasmFeatures* detected, const FunctionSig* sig, const byte* start,
994 const byte* end, uint32_t buffer_offset = 0)
995 : Decoder(start, end, buffer_offset),
996 local_types_(zone),
997 module_(module),
998 enabled_(enabled),
999 detected_(detected),
1000 sig_(sig) {}
1001
1002 Zone* zone() const { return local_types_.get_allocator().zone(); }
1003
1004 uint32_t num_locals() const {
1005 return static_cast<uint32_t>(local_types_.size());
1006 }
1007
1008 ValueType local_type(uint32_t index) const { return local_types_[index]; }
1009
1010 void InitializeLocalsFromSig() {
1011 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(sig_)((void) 0);
1012 DCHECK_EQ(0, this->local_types_.size())((void) 0);
1013 local_types_.assign(sig_->parameters().begin(), sig_->parameters().end());
1014 }
1015
1016 // Decodes local definitions in the current decoder.
1017 // Returns true iff locals are found.
1018 // Writes the total length of decoded locals in 'total_length'.
1019 // If insert_postion is present, the decoded locals will be inserted into the
1020 // 'local_types_' of this decoder. Otherwise, this function is used just to
1021 // check validity and determine the encoding length of the locals in bytes.
1022 // The decoder's pc is not advanced. If no locals are found (i.e., no
1023 // compressed uint32 is found at pc), this will exit as 'false' and without an
1024 // error.
1025 bool DecodeLocals(const byte* pc, uint32_t* total_length,
1026 const base::Optional<uint32_t> insert_position) {
1027 uint32_t length;
1028 *total_length = 0;
1029
1030 // The 'else' value is useless, we pass it for convenience.
1031 auto insert_iterator = insert_position.has_value()
1032 ? local_types_.begin() + insert_position.value()
1033 : local_types_.begin();
1034
1035 // Decode local declarations, if any.
1036 uint32_t entries = read_u32v<kValidate>(pc, &length, "local decls count");
1037 if (!VALIDATE(ok())) {
1038 error(pc + *total_length, "invalid local decls count");
1039 return false;
1040 }
1041
1042 *total_length += length;
1043 TRACE("local decls count: %u\n", entries);
1044
1045 while (entries-- > 0) {
1046 if (!VALIDATE(more())) {
1047 error(end(), "expected more local decls but reached end of input");
1048 return false;
1049 }
1050 uint32_t count =
1051 read_u32v<kValidate>(pc + *total_length, &length, "local count");
1052 if (!VALIDATE(ok())) {
1053 error(pc + *total_length, "invalid local count");
1054 return false;
1055 }
1056 DCHECK_LE(local_types_.size(), kV8MaxWasmFunctionLocals)((void) 0);
1057 if (!VALIDATE(count <= kV8MaxWasmFunctionLocals - local_types_.size())) {
1058 error(pc + *total_length, "local count too large");
1059 return false;
1060 }
1061 *total_length += length;
1062
1063 ValueType type = value_type_reader::read_value_type<kValidate>(
1064 this, pc + *total_length, &length, enabled_);
1065 if (!VALIDATE(type != kWasmBottom)) {
1066 error(pc + *total_length, "invalid local type");
1067 return false;
1068 }
1069 *total_length += length;
1070
1071 if (insert_position.has_value()) {
1072 // Move the insertion iterator to the end of the newly inserted locals.
1073 insert_iterator =
1074 local_types_.insert(insert_iterator, count, type) + count;
1075 }
1076 }
1077 DCHECK(ok())((void) 0);
1078 return true;
1079 }
1080
1081 static BitVector* AnalyzeLoopAssignment(WasmDecoder* decoder, const byte* pc,
1082 uint32_t locals_count, Zone* zone) {
1083 if (pc >= decoder->end()) return nullptr;
1084 if (*pc != kExprLoop) return nullptr;
1085
1086 // The number of locals_count is augmented by 2 so that 'locals_count - 2'
1087 // can be used to track mem_size, and 'locals_count - 1' to track mem_start.
1088 BitVector* assigned = zone->New<BitVector>(locals_count, zone);
1089 int depth = 0;
1090 // Iteratively process all AST nodes nested inside the loop.
1091 while (pc < decoder->end() && VALIDATE(decoder->ok())) {
1092 WasmOpcode opcode = static_cast<WasmOpcode>(*pc);
1093 uint32_t length = 1;
1094 switch (opcode) {
1095 case kExprLoop:
1096 case kExprIf:
1097 case kExprBlock:
1098 case kExprTry:
1099 length = OpcodeLength(decoder, pc);
1100 depth++;
1101 break;
1102 case kExprLocalSet: // fallthru
1103 case kExprLocalTee: {
1104 LocalIndexImmediate<validate> imm(decoder, pc + 1);
1105 if (assigned->length() > 0 &&
1106 imm.index < static_cast<uint32_t>(assigned->length())) {
1107 // Unverified code might have an out-of-bounds index.
1108 assigned->Add(imm.index);
1109 }
1110 length = 1 + imm.length;
1111 break;
1112 }
1113 case kExprMemoryGrow:
1114 case kExprCallFunction:
1115 case kExprCallIndirect:
1116 case kExprReturnCall:
1117 case kExprReturnCallIndirect:
1118 // Add instance cache nodes to the assigned set.
1119 // TODO(titzer): make this more clear.
1120 assigned->Add(locals_count - 1);
1121 length = OpcodeLength(decoder, pc);
1122 break;
1123 case kExprEnd:
1124 depth--;
1125 break;
1126 default:
1127 length = OpcodeLength(decoder, pc);
1128 break;
1129 }
1130 if (depth <= 0) break;
1131 pc += length;
1132 }
1133 return VALIDATE(decoder->ok()) ? assigned : nullptr;
1134 }
1135
1136 inline bool Validate(const byte* pc, LocalIndexImmediate<validate>& imm) {
1137 if (!VALIDATE(imm.index < num_locals())) {
1138 errorf(pc, "invalid local index: %u", imm.index);
1139 return false;
1140 }
1141 return true;
1142 }
1143
1144 inline bool Complete(ExceptionIndexImmediate<validate>& imm) {
1145 if (!VALIDATE(imm.index < module_->exceptions.size())) return false;
1146 imm.exception = &module_->exceptions[imm.index];
1147 return true;
1148 }
1149
1150 inline bool Validate(const byte* pc, ExceptionIndexImmediate<validate>& imm) {
1151 if (!Complete(imm)) {
1152 errorf(pc, "Invalid exception index: %u", imm.index);
1153 return false;
1154 }
1155 return true;
1156 }
1157
1158 inline bool Validate(const byte* pc, GlobalIndexImmediate<validate>& imm) {
1159 if (!VALIDATE(imm.index < module_->globals.size())) {
1160 errorf(pc, "invalid global index: %u", imm.index);
1161 return false;
1162 }
1163 imm.global = &module_->globals[imm.index];
1164 imm.type = imm.global->type;
1165 return true;
1166 }
1167
1168 inline bool Complete(StructIndexImmediate<validate>& imm) {
1169 if (!VALIDATE(module_->has_struct(imm.index))) return false;
1170 imm.struct_type = module_->struct_type(imm.index);
1171 return true;
1172 }
1173
1174 inline bool Validate(const byte* pc, StructIndexImmediate<validate>& imm) {
1175 if (Complete(imm)) return true;
1176 errorf(pc, "invalid struct index: %u", imm.index);
1177 return false;
1178 }
1179
1180 inline bool Validate(const byte* pc, FieldIndexImmediate<validate>& imm) {
1181 if (!Validate(pc, imm.struct_index)) return false;
1182 if (!VALIDATE(imm.index < imm.struct_index.struct_type->field_count())) {
1183 errorf(pc + imm.struct_index.length, "invalid field index: %u",
1184 imm.index);
1185 return false;
1186 }
1187 return true;
1188 }
1189
1190 inline bool Complete(ArrayIndexImmediate<validate>& imm) {
1191 if (!VALIDATE(module_->has_array(imm.index))) return false;
1192 imm.array_type = module_->array_type(imm.index);
1193 return true;
1194 }
1195
1196 inline bool Validate(const byte* pc, ArrayIndexImmediate<validate>& imm) {
1197 if (!Complete(imm)) {
1198 errorf(pc, "invalid array index: %u", imm.index);
1199 return false;
1200 }
1201 return true;
1202 }
1203
1204 inline bool CanReturnCall(const FunctionSig* target_sig) {
1205 if (target_sig == nullptr) return false;
1206 size_t num_returns = sig_->return_count();
1207 if (num_returns != target_sig->return_count()) return false;
1208 for (size_t i = 0; i < num_returns; ++i) {
1209 if (sig_->GetReturn(i) != target_sig->GetReturn(i)) return false;
1210 }
1211 return true;
1212 }
1213
1214 inline bool Complete(CallFunctionImmediate<validate>& imm) {
1215 if (!VALIDATE(imm.index < module_->functions.size())) return false;
1216 imm.sig = module_->functions[imm.index].sig;
1217 if (imm.sig->return_count() > 1) {
1218 this->detected_->Add(kFeature_mv);
1219 }
1220 return true;
1221 }
1222
1223 inline bool Validate(const byte* pc, CallFunctionImmediate<validate>& imm) {
1224 if (!Complete(imm)) {
1225 errorf(pc, "invalid function index: %u", imm.index);
1226 return false;
1227 }
1228 return true;
1229 }
1230
1231 inline bool Complete(CallIndirectImmediate<validate>& imm) {
1232 if (!VALIDATE(module_->has_signature(imm.sig_index))) return false;
1233 imm.sig = module_->signature(imm.sig_index);
1234 if (imm.sig->return_count() > 1) {
1235 this->detected_->Add(kFeature_mv);
1236 }
1237 return true;
1238 }
1239
1240 inline bool Validate(const byte* pc, CallIndirectImmediate<validate>& imm) {
1241 if (!VALIDATE(imm.table_index < module_->tables.size())) {
1242 error("function table has to exist to execute call_indirect");
1243 return false;
1244 }
1245 if (!VALIDATE(IsSubtypeOf(module_->tables[imm.table_index].type,
1246 kWasmFuncRef, module_))) {
1247 error("table of call_indirect must be of a function type");
1248 return false;
1249 }
1250 if (!Complete(imm)) {
1251 errorf(pc, "invalid signature index: #%u", imm.sig_index);
1252 return false;
1253 }
1254 // Check that the dynamic signature for this call is a subtype of the static
1255 // type of the table the function is defined in.
1256 if (!VALIDATE(IsSubtypeOf(ValueType::Ref(imm.sig_index, kNonNullable),
1257 module_->tables[imm.table_index].type,
1258 module_))) {
1259 errorf(pc,
1260 "call_indirect: Signature of function %u is not a subtype of "
1261 "table %u",
1262 imm.sig_index, imm.table_index);
1263 }
1264 return true;
1265 }
1266
1267 inline bool Validate(const byte* pc, BranchDepthImmediate<validate>& imm,
1268 size_t control_depth) {
1269 if (!VALIDATE(imm.depth < control_depth)) {
1270 errorf(pc, "invalid branch depth: %u", imm.depth);
1271 return false;
1272 }
1273 return true;
1274 }
1275
1276 inline bool Validate(const byte* pc, BranchTableImmediate<validate>& imm,
1277 size_t block_depth) {
1278 if (!VALIDATE(imm.table_count <= kV8MaxWasmFunctionBrTableSize)) {
1279 errorf(pc, "invalid table count (> max br_table size): %u",
1280 imm.table_count);
1281 return false;
1282 }
1283 return checkAvailable(imm.table_count);
1284 }
1285
1286 inline bool Validate(const byte* pc,
1287 BranchOnExceptionImmediate<validate>& imm,
1288 size_t control_size) {
1289 return Validate(pc, imm.depth, control_size) &&
1290 Validate(pc + imm.depth.length, imm.index);
1291 }
1292
1293 inline bool Validate(const byte* pc, WasmOpcode opcode,
1294 SimdLaneImmediate<validate>& imm) {
1295 uint8_t num_lanes = 0;
1296 switch (opcode) {
1297 case kExprF64x2ExtractLane:
1298 case kExprF64x2ReplaceLane:
1299 case kExprI64x2ExtractLane:
1300 case kExprI64x2ReplaceLane:
1301 num_lanes = 2;
1302 break;
1303 case kExprF32x4ExtractLane:
1304 case kExprF32x4ReplaceLane:
1305 case kExprI32x4ExtractLane:
1306 case kExprI32x4ReplaceLane:
1307 num_lanes = 4;
1308 break;
1309 case kExprI16x8ExtractLaneS:
1310 case kExprI16x8ExtractLaneU:
1311 case kExprI16x8ReplaceLane:
1312 num_lanes = 8;
1313 break;
1314 case kExprI8x16ExtractLaneS:
1315 case kExprI8x16ExtractLaneU:
1316 case kExprI8x16ReplaceLane:
1317 num_lanes = 16;
1318 break;
1319 default:
1320 UNREACHABLE()V8_Fatal("unreachable code");
1321 break;
1322 }
1323 if (!VALIDATE(imm.lane >= 0 && imm.lane < num_lanes)) {
1324 error(pc, "invalid lane index");
1325 return false;
1326 } else {
1327 return true;
1328 }
1329 }
1330
1331 inline bool Validate(const byte* pc, Simd128Immediate<validate>& imm) {
1332 uint8_t max_lane = 0;
1333 for (uint32_t i = 0; i < kSimd128Size; ++i) {
1334 max_lane = std::max(max_lane, imm.value[i]);
1335 }
1336 // Shuffle indices must be in [0..31] for a 16 lane shuffle.
1337 if (!VALIDATE(max_lane < 2 * kSimd128Size)) {
1338 error(pc, "invalid shuffle mask");
1339 return false;
1340 }
1341 return true;
1342 }
1343
1344 inline bool Complete(BlockTypeImmediate<validate>& imm) {
1345 if (imm.type != kWasmBottom) return true;
1346 if (!VALIDATE(module_->has_signature(imm.sig_index))) return false;
1347 imm.sig = module_->signature(imm.sig_index);
1348 if (imm.sig->return_count() > 1) {
1349 this->detected_->Add(kFeature_mv);
1350 }
1351 return true;
1352 }
1353
1354 inline bool Validate(const byte* pc, BlockTypeImmediate<validate>& imm) {
1355 if (!Complete(imm)) {
1356 errorf(pc, "block type index %u out of bounds (%zu types)", imm.sig_index,
1357 module_->types.size());
1358 return false;
1359 }
1360 return true;
1361 }
1362
1363 inline bool Validate(const byte* pc, FunctionIndexImmediate<validate>& imm) {
1364 if (!VALIDATE(imm.index < module_->functions.size())) {
1365 errorf(pc, "invalid function index: %u", imm.index);
1366 return false;
1367 }
1368 if (!VALIDATE(module_->functions[imm.index].declared)) {
1369 this->errorf(pc, "undeclared reference to function #%u", imm.index);
1370 return false;
1371 }
1372 return true;
1373 }
1374
1375 inline bool Validate(const byte* pc, MemoryIndexImmediate<validate>& imm) {
1376 if (!VALIDATE(module_->has_memory)) {
1377 errorf(pc, "memory instruction with no memory");
1378 return false;
1379 }
1380 return true;
1381 }
1382
1383 inline bool Validate(const byte* pc, MemoryInitImmediate<validate>& imm) {
1384 if (!VALIDATE(imm.data_segment_index <
1385 module_->num_declared_data_segments)) {
1386 errorf(pc, "invalid data segment index: %u", imm.data_segment_index);
1387 return false;
1388 }
1389 if (!Validate(pc + imm.length - imm.memory.length, imm.memory))
1390 return false;
1391 return true;
1392 }
1393
1394 inline bool Validate(const byte* pc, DataDropImmediate<validate>& imm) {
1395 if (!VALIDATE(imm.index < module_->num_declared_data_segments)) {
1396 errorf(pc, "invalid data segment index: %u", imm.index);
1397 return false;
1398 }
1399 return true;
1400 }
1401
1402 inline bool Validate(const byte* pc, MemoryCopyImmediate<validate>& imm) {
1403 return Validate(pc, imm.memory_src) &&
1404 Validate(pc + imm.memory_src.length, imm.memory_dst);
1405 }
1406
1407 inline bool Validate(const byte* pc, TableIndexImmediate<validate>& imm) {
1408 if (!VALIDATE(imm.index < module_->tables.size())) {
1409 errorf(pc, "invalid table index: %u", imm.index);
1410 return false;
1411 }
1412 return true;
1413 }
1414
1415 inline bool Validate(const byte* pc, TableInitImmediate<validate>& imm) {
1416 if (!VALIDATE(imm.elem_segment_index < module_->elem_segments.size())) {
1417 errorf(pc, "invalid element segment index: %u", imm.elem_segment_index);
1418 return false;
1419 }
1420 if (!Validate(pc + imm.length - imm.table.length, imm.table)) {
1421 return false;
1422 }
1423 ValueType elem_type = module_->elem_segments[imm.elem_segment_index].type;
1424 if (!VALIDATE(IsSubtypeOf(elem_type, module_->tables[imm.table.index].type,
1425 module_))) {
1426 errorf(pc, "table %u is not a super-type of %s", imm.table.index,
1427 elem_type.name().c_str());
1428 return false;
1429 }
1430 return true;
1431 }
1432
1433 inline bool Validate(const byte* pc, ElemDropImmediate<validate>& imm) {
1434 if (!VALIDATE(imm.index < module_->elem_segments.size())) {
1435 errorf(pc, "invalid element segment index: %u", imm.index);
1436 return false;
1437 }
1438 return true;
1439 }
1440
1441 inline bool Validate(const byte* pc, TableCopyImmediate<validate>& imm) {
1442 if (!Validate(pc, imm.table_src)) return false;
1443 if (!Validate(pc + imm.table_src.length, imm.table_dst)) return false;
1444 ValueType src_type = module_->tables[imm.table_src.index].type;
1445 if (!VALIDATE(IsSubtypeOf(
1446 src_type, module_->tables[imm.table_dst.index].type, module_))) {
1447 errorf(pc, "table %u is not a super-type of %s", imm.table_dst.index,
1448 src_type.name().c_str());
1449 return false;
1450 }
1451 return true;
1452 }
1453
1454 inline bool Validate(const byte* pc, HeapTypeImmediate<validate>& imm) {
1455 if (!VALIDATE(!imm.type.is_bottom())) {
1456 error(pc, "invalid heap type");
1457 return false;
1458 }
1459 if (!VALIDATE(imm.type.is_generic() ||
1460 module_->has_type(imm.type.ref_index()))) {
1461 errorf(pc, "Type index %u is out of bounds", imm.type.ref_index());
1462 return false;
1463 }
1464 return true;
1465 }
1466
1467 static uint32_t OpcodeLength(WasmDecoder* decoder, const byte* pc) {
1468 WasmOpcode opcode = static_cast<WasmOpcode>(*pc);
1469 switch (opcode) {
1470#define DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(name, opcode, sig) case kExpr##name:
1471 FOREACH_LOAD_MEM_OPCODE(DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE)DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I32LoadMem, 0x28, i_i) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I64LoadMem, 0x29, l_i) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(F32LoadMem, 0x2a,
f_i) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(F64LoadMem, 0x2b, d_i) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I32LoadMem8S, 0x2c, i_i) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I32LoadMem8U, 0x2d
, i_i) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I32LoadMem16S, 0x2e, i_i) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I32LoadMem16U, 0x2f, i_i) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I64LoadMem8S, 0x30
, l_i) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I64LoadMem8U, 0x31, l_i) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I64LoadMem16S, 0x32, l_i) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I64LoadMem16U,
0x33, l_i) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I64LoadMem32S, 0x34, l_i) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I64LoadMem32U, 0x35, l_i)
1472 FOREACH_STORE_MEM_OPCODE(DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE)DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I32StoreMem, 0x36, v_ii) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I64StoreMem, 0x37, v_il) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(F32StoreMem, 0x38
, v_if) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(F64StoreMem, 0x39, v_id) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I32StoreMem8, 0x3a, v_ii) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I32StoreMem16,
0x3b, v_ii) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I64StoreMem8, 0x3c, v_il) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I64StoreMem16, 0x3d, v_il) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I64StoreMem32
, 0x3e, v_il)
1473#undef DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
1474 {
1475 MemoryAccessImmediate<validate> imm(decoder, pc + 1, UINT32_MAX(4294967295U));
1476 return 1 + imm.length;
1477 }
1478 case kExprBr:
1479 case kExprBrIf: {
1480 BranchDepthImmediate<validate> imm(decoder, pc + 1);
