1481 return 1 + imm.length;
1482 }
1483 case kExprGlobalGet:
1484 case kExprGlobalSet: {
1485 GlobalIndexImmediate<validate> imm(decoder, pc + 1);
1486 return 1 + imm.length;
1487 }
1488 case kExprTableGet:
1489 case kExprTableSet: {
1490 TableIndexImmediate<validate> imm(decoder, pc + 1);
1491 return 1 + imm.length;
1492 }
1493 case kExprCallFunction:
1494 case kExprReturnCall: {
1495 CallFunctionImmediate<validate> imm(decoder, pc + 1);
1496 return 1 + imm.length;
1497 }
1498 case kExprCallIndirect:
1499 case kExprReturnCallIndirect: {
1500 CallIndirectImmediate<validate> imm(WasmFeatures::All(), decoder,
1501 pc + 1);
1502 return 1 + imm.length;
1503 }
1504
1505 case kExprTry:
1506 case kExprIf: // fall through
1507 case kExprLoop:
1508 case kExprBlock: {
1509 BlockTypeImmediate<validate> imm(WasmFeatures::All(), decoder, pc + 1);
1510 return 1 + imm.length;
1511 }
1512
1513 case kExprLet: {
1514 BlockTypeImmediate<validate> imm(WasmFeatures::All(), decoder, pc + 1);
1515 uint32_t locals_length;
1516 bool locals_result =
1517 decoder->DecodeLocals(decoder->pc() + 1 + imm.length,
1518 &locals_length, base::Optional<uint32_t>());
1519 return 1 + imm.length + (locals_result ? locals_length : 0);
1520 }
1521
1522 case kExprThrow: {
1523 ExceptionIndexImmediate<validate> imm(decoder, pc + 1);
1524 return 1 + imm.length;
1525 }
1526
1527 case kExprBrOnExn: {
1528 BranchOnExceptionImmediate<validate> imm(decoder, pc + 1);
1529 return 1 + imm.length;
1530 }
1531
1532 case kExprBrOnNull: {
1533 BranchDepthImmediate<validate> imm(decoder, pc + 1);
1534 return 1 + imm.length;
1535 }
1536
1537 case kExprLocalGet:
1538 case kExprLocalSet:
1539 case kExprLocalTee: {
1540 LocalIndexImmediate<validate> imm(decoder, pc + 1);
1541 return 1 + imm.length;
1542 }
1543 case kExprSelectWithType: {
1544 SelectTypeImmediate<validate> imm(WasmFeatures::All(), decoder, pc + 1);
1545 return 1 + imm.length;
1546 }
1547 case kExprBrTable: {
1548 BranchTableImmediate<validate> imm(decoder, pc + 1);
1549 BranchTableIterator<validate> iterator(decoder, imm);
1550 return 1 + iterator.length();
1551 }
1552 case kExprI32Const: {
1553 ImmI32Immediate<validate> imm(decoder, pc + 1);
1554 return 1 + imm.length;
1555 }
1556 case kExprI64Const: {
1557 ImmI64Immediate<validate> imm(decoder, pc + 1);
1558 return 1 + imm.length;
1559 }
1560 case kExprRefNull: {
1561 HeapTypeImmediate<validate> imm(WasmFeatures::All(), decoder, pc + 1);
1562 return 1 + imm.length;
1563 }
1564 case kExprRefIsNull: {
1565 return 1;
1566 }
1567 case kExprRefFunc: {
1568 FunctionIndexImmediate<validate> imm(decoder, pc + 1);
1569 return 1 + imm.length;
1570 }
1571 case kExprMemoryGrow:
1572 case kExprMemorySize: {
1573 MemoryIndexImmediate<validate> imm(decoder, pc + 1);
1574 return 1 + imm.length;
1575 }
1576 case kExprF32Const:
1577 return 5;
1578 case kExprF64Const:
1579 return 9;
1580 case kNumericPrefix: {
1581 byte numeric_index =
1582 decoder->read_u8<validate>(pc + 1, "numeric_index");
1583 WasmOpcode opcode =
1584 static_cast<WasmOpcode>(kNumericPrefix << 8 | numeric_index);
1585 switch (opcode) {
1586 case kExprI32SConvertSatF32:
1587 case kExprI32UConvertSatF32:
1588 case kExprI32SConvertSatF64:
1589 case kExprI32UConvertSatF64:
1590 case kExprI64SConvertSatF32:
1591 case kExprI64UConvertSatF32:
1592 case kExprI64SConvertSatF64:
1593 case kExprI64UConvertSatF64:
1594 return 2;
1595 case kExprMemoryInit: {
1596 MemoryInitImmediate<validate> imm(decoder, pc + 2);
1597 return 2 + imm.length;
1598 }
1599 case kExprDataDrop: {
1600 DataDropImmediate<validate> imm(decoder, pc + 2);
1601 return 2 + imm.length;
1602 }
1603 case kExprMemoryCopy: {
1604 MemoryCopyImmediate<validate> imm(decoder, pc + 2);
1605 return 2 + imm.length;
1606 }
1607 case kExprMemoryFill: {
1608 MemoryIndexImmediate<validate> imm(decoder, pc + 2);
1609 return 2 + imm.length;
1610 }
1611 case kExprTableInit: {
1612 TableInitImmediate<validate> imm(decoder, pc + 2);
1613 return 2 + imm.length;
1614 }
1615 case kExprElemDrop: {
1616 ElemDropImmediate<validate> imm(decoder, pc + 2);
1617 return 2 + imm.length;
1618 }
1619 case kExprTableCopy: {
1620 TableCopyImmediate<validate> imm(decoder, pc + 2);
1621 return 2 + imm.length;
1622 }
1623 case kExprTableGrow:
1624 case kExprTableSize:
1625 case kExprTableFill: {
1626 TableIndexImmediate<validate> imm(decoder, pc + 2);
1627 return 2 + imm.length;
1628 }
1629 default:
1630 decoder->error(pc, "invalid numeric opcode");
1631 return 2;
1632 }
1633 }
1634 case kSimdPrefix: {
1635 uint32_t length = 0;
1636 opcode = decoder->read_prefixed_opcode<validate>(pc, &length);
1637 switch (opcode) {
1638#define DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(name, opcode, sig) case kExpr##name:
1639 FOREACH_SIMD_0_OPERAND_OPCODE(DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE)DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(S8x16Swizzle, 0xfd0e, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I8x16Splat, 0xfd0f, s_i) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I16x8Splat, 0xfd10
, s_i) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I32x4Splat, 0xfd11, s_i) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I64x2Splat, 0xfd12, s_l) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(F32x4Splat, 0xfd13
, s_f) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(F64x2Splat, 0xfd14, s_d) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I8x16Eq, 0xfd23, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I8x16Ne, 0xfd24, s_ss
) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I8x16LtS, 0xfd25, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I8x16LtU, 0xfd26, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I8x16GtS, 0xfd27
, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I8x16GtU, 0xfd28, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I8x16LeS, 0xfd29, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I8x16LeU, 0xfd2a
, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I8x16GeS, 0xfd2b, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I8x16GeU, 0xfd2c, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I16x8Eq, 0xfd2d,
s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I16x8Ne, 0xfd2e, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I16x8LtS, 0xfd2f, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I16x8LtU, 0xfd30
, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I16x8GtS, 0xfd31, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I16x8GtU, 0xfd32, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I16x8LeS, 0xfd33
, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I16x8LeU, 0xfd34, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I16x8GeS, 0xfd35, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I16x8GeU, 0xfd36
, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I32x4Eq, 0xfd37, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I32x4Ne, 0xfd38, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I32x4LtS, 0xfd39,
s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I32x4LtU, 0xfd3a, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I32x4GtS, 0xfd3b, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I32x4GtU, 0xfd3c
, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I32x4LeS, 0xfd3d, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I32x4LeU, 0xfd3e, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I32x4GeS, 0xfd3f
, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I32x4GeU, 0xfd40, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(F32x4Eq, 0xfd41, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(F32x4Ne, 0xfd42, s_ss
) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(F32x4Lt, 0xfd43, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(F32x4Gt, 0xfd44, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(F32x4Le, 0xfd45, s_ss
) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(F32x4Ge, 0xfd46, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(F64x2Eq, 0xfd47, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(F64x2Ne, 0xfd48, s_ss
) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(F64x2Lt, 0xfd49, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(F64x2Gt, 0xfd4a, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(F64x2Le, 0xfd4b, s_ss
) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(F64x2Ge, 0xfd4c, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(S128Not, 0xfd4d, s_s) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(S128And, 0xfd4e, s_ss
) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(S128AndNot, 0xfd4f, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(S128Or, 0xfd50, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(S128Xor, 0xfd51, s_ss
) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(S128Select, 0xfd52, s_sss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I8x16Abs, 0xfd60, s_s) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I8x16Neg, 0xfd61,
s_s) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(V8x16AnyTrue, 0xfd62, i_s) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(V8x16AllTrue, 0xfd63, i_s) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I8x16SConvertI16x8
, 0xfd65, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I8x16UConvertI16x8, 0xfd66
, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I8x16Shl, 0xfd6b, s_si) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I8x16ShrS, 0xfd6c, s_si) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I8x16ShrU, 0xfd6d
, s_si) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I8x16Add, 0xfd6e, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I8x16AddSaturateS, 0xfd6f, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I8x16AddSaturateU
, 0xfd70, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I8x16Sub, 0xfd71, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I8x16SubSaturateS, 0xfd72, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I8x16SubSaturateU
, 0xfd73, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I8x16MinS, 0xfd76, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I8x16MinU, 0xfd77, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I8x16MaxS, 0xfd78
, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I8x16MaxU, 0xfd79, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I8x16RoundingAverageU, 0xfd7b, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I16x8Abs
, 0xfd80, s_s) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I16x8Neg, 0xfd81, s_s) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(V16x8AnyTrue, 0xfd82, i_s) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(V16x8AllTrue,
0xfd83, i_s) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I16x8SConvertI32x4, 0xfd85,
s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I16x8UConvertI32x4, 0xfd86, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I16x8SConvertI8x16Low, 0xfd87, s_s) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I16x8SConvertI8x16High
, 0xfd88, s_s) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I16x8UConvertI8x16Low, 0xfd89
, s_s) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I16x8UConvertI8x16High, 0xfd8a, s_s
) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I16x8Shl, 0xfd8b, s_si) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I16x8ShrS, 0xfd8c, s_si) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I16x8ShrU, 0xfd8d
, s_si) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I16x8Add, 0xfd8e, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I16x8AddSaturateS, 0xfd8f, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I16x8AddSaturateU
, 0xfd90, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I16x8Sub, 0xfd91, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I16x8SubSaturateS, 0xfd92, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I16x8SubSaturateU
, 0xfd93, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I16x8Mul, 0xfd95, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I16x8MinS, 0xfd96, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I16x8MinU, 0xfd97
, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I16x8MaxS, 0xfd98, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I16x8MaxU, 0xfd99, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I16x8RoundingAverageU
, 0xfd9b, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I32x4Abs, 0xfda0, s_s) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I32x4Neg, 0xfda1, s_s) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(V32x4AnyTrue, 0xfda2
, i_s) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(V32x4AllTrue, 0xfda3, i_s) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I32x4SConvertI16x8Low, 0xfda7, s_s) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I32x4SConvertI16x8High
, 0xfda8, s_s) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I32x4UConvertI16x8Low, 0xfda9
, s_s) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I32x4UConvertI16x8High, 0xfdaa, s_s
) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I32x4Shl, 0xfdab, s_si) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I32x4ShrS, 0xfdac, s_si) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I32x4ShrU, 0xfdad
, s_si) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I32x4Add, 0xfdae, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I32x4Sub, 0xfdb1, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I32x4Mul, 0xfdb5
, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I32x4MinS, 0xfdb6, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I32x4MinU, 0xfdb7, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I32x4MaxS, 0xfdb8
, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I32x4MaxU, 0xfdb9, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I64x2Neg, 0xfdc1, s_s) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I64x2Shl, 0xfdcb,
s_si) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I64x2ShrS, 0xfdcc, s_si) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I64x2ShrU, 0xfdcd, s_si) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I64x2Add, 0xfdce
, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I64x2Sub, 0xfdd1, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I64x2Mul, 0xfdd5, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(F32x4Abs, 0xfde0
, s_s) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(F32x4Neg, 0xfde1, s_s) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(F32x4Sqrt, 0xfde3, s_s) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(F32x4Add, 0xfde4
, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(F32x4Sub, 0xfde5, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(F32x4Mul, 0xfde6, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(F32x4Div, 0xfde7
, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(F32x4Min, 0xfde8, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(F32x4Max, 0xfde9, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(F64x2Abs, 0xfdec
, s_s) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(F64x2Neg, 0xfded, s_s) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(F64x2Sqrt, 0xfdef, s_s) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(F64x2Add, 0xfdf0
, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(F64x2Sub, 0xfdf1, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(F64x2Mul, 0xfdf2, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(F64x2Div, 0xfdf3
, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(F64x2Min, 0xfdf4, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(F64x2Max, 0xfdf5, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I32x4SConvertF32x4
, 0xfdf8, s_s) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I32x4UConvertF32x4, 0xfdf9
, s_s) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(F32x4SConvertI32x4, 0xfdfa, s_s) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(F32x4UConvertI32x4, 0xfdfb, s_s) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I8x16Mul
, 0xfd75, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I8x16BitMask, 0xfd64, i_s
) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I16x8BitMask, 0xfd84, i_s) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I32x4BitMask, 0xfda4, i_s) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(V64x2AnyTrue,
0xfdc2, i_s) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(V64x2AllTrue, 0xfdc3, i_s) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I64x2Eq, 0xfdc0, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I64x2Ne, 0xfdc4, s_ss
) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I64x2LtS, 0xfdc5, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I64x2LtU, 0xfdc6, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I64x2GtS, 0xfdc7
, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I64x2GtU, 0xfdc8, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I64x2LeS, 0xfdc9, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I64x2LeU, 0xfdca
, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I64x2GeS, 0xfdcf, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I64x2GeU, 0xfdd0, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I64x2MinS, 0xfdd6
, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I64x2MinU, 0xfdd7, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I64x2MaxS, 0xfde2, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I64x2MaxU, 0xfdee
, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(F32x4Qfma, 0xfdb4, s_sss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(F32x4Qfms, 0xfdd4, s_sss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(F64x2Qfma, 0xfdfe
, s_sss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(F64x2Qfms, 0xfdff, s_sss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I16x8AddHoriz, 0xfdaf, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I32x4AddHoriz
, 0xfdb0, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I32x4DotI16x8S, 0xfdba, s_ss
) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(F32x4AddHoriz, 0xfdb2, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(F32x4RecipApprox, 0xfdb3, s_s) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(F32x4RecipSqrtApprox
, 0xfdbc, s_s) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(F32x4Pmin, 0xfdea, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(F32x4Pmax, 0xfdeb, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(F32x4Ceil, 0xfdd8
, s_s) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(F32x4Floor, 0xfdd9, s_s) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(F32x4Trunc, 0xfdda, s_s) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(F32x4NearestInt
, 0xfddb, s_s) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(F64x2Pmin, 0xfdf6, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(F64x2Pmax, 0xfdf7, s_ss) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(F64x2Ceil, 0xfddc
, s_s) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(F64x2Floor, 0xfddd, s_s) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(F64x2Trunc, 0xfdde, s_s) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(F64x2NearestInt
, 0xfddf, s_s)
1640#undef DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
1641 return 1 + length;
1642#define DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(name, opcode, sig) case kExpr##name:
1643 FOREACH_SIMD_1_OPERAND_OPCODE(DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE)DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I8x16ExtractLaneS, 0xfd15, _) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I8x16ExtractLaneU, 0xfd16, _) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I16x8ExtractLaneS
, 0xfd18, _) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I16x8ExtractLaneU, 0xfd19, _
) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I32x4ExtractLane, 0xfd1b, _) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I64x2ExtractLane, 0xfd1d, _) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(F32x4ExtractLane
, 0xfd1f, _) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(F64x2ExtractLane, 0xfd21, _)
DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I8x16ReplaceLane, 0xfd17, _) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I16x8ReplaceLane, 0xfd1a, _) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I32x4ReplaceLane
, 0xfd1c, _) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I64x2ReplaceLane, 0xfd1e, _)
DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(F32x4ReplaceLane, 0xfd20, _) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(F64x2ReplaceLane, 0xfd22, _)
1644#undef DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
1645 return 2 + length;
1646#define DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(name, opcode, sig) case kExpr##name:
1647 FOREACH_SIMD_MEM_OPCODE(DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE)DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(S128LoadMem, 0xfd00, s_i) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I16x8Load8x8S, 0xfd01, s_i) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I16x8Load8x8U
, 0xfd02, s_i) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I32x4Load16x4S, 0xfd03, s_i
) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I32x4Load16x4U, 0xfd04, s_i) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I64x2Load32x2S, 0xfd05, s_i) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I64x2Load32x2U
, 0xfd06, s_i) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(S8x16LoadSplat, 0xfd07, s_i
) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(S16x8LoadSplat, 0xfd08, s_i) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(S32x4LoadSplat, 0xfd09, s_i) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(S64x2LoadSplat
, 0xfd0a, s_i) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(S128StoreMem, 0xfd0b, v_is
)
1648 FOREACH_SIMD_POST_MVP_MEM_OPCODE(DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE)DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(S128LoadMem32Zero, 0xfdfc, s_i) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(S128LoadMem64Zero, 0xfdfd, s_i)
1649#undef DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
1650 {
1651 MemoryAccessImmediate<validate> imm(decoder, pc + length + 1,
1652 UINT32_MAX(4294967295U));
1653 return 1 + length + imm.length;
1654 }
1655 // Shuffles require a byte per lane, or 16 immediate bytes.
1656 case kExprS128Const:
1657 case kExprS8x16Shuffle:
1658 return 1 + length + kSimd128Size;
1659 default:
1660 decoder->error(pc, "invalid SIMD opcode");
1661 return 1 + length;
1662 }
1663 }
1664 case kAtomicPrefix: {
1665 byte atomic_index = decoder->read_u8<validate>(pc + 1, "atomic_index");
1666 WasmOpcode opcode =
1667 static_cast<WasmOpcode>(kAtomicPrefix << 8 | atomic_index);
1668 switch (opcode) {
1669#define DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(name, opcode, sig) case kExpr##name:
1670 FOREACH_ATOMIC_OPCODE(DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE)DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(AtomicNotify, 0xfe00, i_ii) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I32AtomicWait, 0xfe01, i_iil) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I64AtomicWait
, 0xfe02, i_ill) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I32AtomicLoad, 0xfe10, i_i
) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I64AtomicLoad, 0xfe11, l_i) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I32AtomicLoad8U, 0xfe12, i_i) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I32AtomicLoad16U
, 0xfe13, i_i) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I64AtomicLoad8U, 0xfe14, l_i
) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I64AtomicLoad16U, 0xfe15, l_i) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I64AtomicLoad32U, 0xfe16, l_i) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I32AtomicStore
, 0xfe17, v_ii) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I64AtomicStore, 0xfe18, v_il
) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I32AtomicStore8U, 0xfe19, v_ii) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I32AtomicStore16U, 0xfe1a, v_ii) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I64AtomicStore8U
, 0xfe1b, v_il) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I64AtomicStore16U, 0xfe1c
, v_il) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I64AtomicStore32U, 0xfe1d, v_il) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I32AtomicAdd, 0xfe1e, i_ii) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I64AtomicAdd
, 0xfe1f, l_il) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I32AtomicAdd8U, 0xfe20, i_ii
) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I32AtomicAdd16U, 0xfe21, i_ii) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I64AtomicAdd8U, 0xfe22, l_il) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I64AtomicAdd16U
, 0xfe23, l_il) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I64AtomicAdd32U, 0xfe24, l_il
) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I32AtomicSub, 0xfe25, i_ii) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I64AtomicSub, 0xfe26, l_il) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I32AtomicSub8U
, 0xfe27, i_ii) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I32AtomicSub16U, 0xfe28, i_ii
) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I64AtomicSub8U, 0xfe29, l_il) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I64AtomicSub16U, 0xfe2a, l_il) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I64AtomicSub32U
, 0xfe2b, l_il) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I32AtomicAnd, 0xfe2c, i_ii
) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I64AtomicAnd, 0xfe2d, l_il) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I32AtomicAnd8U, 0xfe2e, i_ii) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I32AtomicAnd16U
, 0xfe2f, i_ii) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I64AtomicAnd8U, 0xfe30, l_il
) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I64AtomicAnd16U, 0xfe31, l_il) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I64AtomicAnd32U, 0xfe32, l_il) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I32AtomicOr
, 0xfe33, i_ii) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I64AtomicOr, 0xfe34, l_il
) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I32AtomicOr8U, 0xfe35, i_ii) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I32AtomicOr16U, 0xfe36, i_ii) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I64AtomicOr8U
, 0xfe37, l_il) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I64AtomicOr16U, 0xfe38, l_il
) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I64AtomicOr32U, 0xfe39, l_il) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I32AtomicXor, 0xfe3a, i_ii) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I64AtomicXor
, 0xfe3b, l_il) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I32AtomicXor8U, 0xfe3c, i_ii
) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I32AtomicXor16U, 0xfe3d, i_ii) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I64AtomicXor8U, 0xfe3e, l_il) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I64AtomicXor16U
, 0xfe3f, l_il) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I64AtomicXor32U, 0xfe40, l_il
) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I32AtomicExchange, 0xfe41, i_ii) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I64AtomicExchange, 0xfe42, l_il) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I32AtomicExchange8U
, 0xfe43, i_ii) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I32AtomicExchange16U, 0xfe44
, i_ii) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I64AtomicExchange8U, 0xfe45, l_il
) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I64AtomicExchange16U, 0xfe46, l_il) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I64AtomicExchange32U, 0xfe47, l_il) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I32AtomicCompareExchange
, 0xfe48, i_iii) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I64AtomicCompareExchange
, 0xfe49, l_ill) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I32AtomicCompareExchange8U
, 0xfe4a, i_iii) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I32AtomicCompareExchange16U
, 0xfe4b, i_iii) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I64AtomicCompareExchange8U
, 0xfe4c, l_ill) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I64AtomicCompareExchange16U
, 0xfe4d, l_ill) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I64AtomicCompareExchange32U
, 0xfe4e, l_ill)
1671#undef DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
1672 {
1673 MemoryAccessImmediate<validate> imm(decoder, pc + 2, UINT32_MAX(4294967295U));
1674 return 2 + imm.length;
1675 }
1676#define DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(name, opcode, sig) case kExpr##name:
1677 FOREACH_ATOMIC_0_OPERAND_OPCODE(DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE)DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(AtomicFence, 0xfe03, v_v)
1678#undef DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
1679 {
1680 return 2 + 1;
1681 }
1682 default:
1683 decoder->error(pc, "invalid Atomics opcode");
1684 return 2;
1685 }
1686 }
1687 case kGCPrefix: {
1688 byte gc_index = decoder->read_u8<validate>(pc + 1, "gc_index");
1689 WasmOpcode opcode = static_cast<WasmOpcode>(kGCPrefix << 8 | gc_index);
1690 switch (opcode) {
1691 case kExprStructNewWithRtt:
1692 case kExprStructNewDefault: {
1693 StructIndexImmediate<validate> imm(decoder, pc + 2);
1694 return 2 + imm.length;
1695 }
1696 case kExprStructGet:
1697 case kExprStructGetS:
1698 case kExprStructGetU:
1699 case kExprStructSet: {
1700 FieldIndexImmediate<validate> imm(decoder, pc + 2);
1701 return 2 + imm.length;
1702 }
1703 case kExprArrayNewWithRtt:
1704 case kExprArrayNewDefault:
1705 case kExprArrayGet:
1706 case kExprArrayGetS:
1707 case kExprArrayGetU:
1708 case kExprArraySet:
1709 case kExprArrayLen: {
1710 ArrayIndexImmediate<validate> imm(decoder, pc + 2);
1711 return 2 + imm.length;
1712 }
1713 case kExprBrOnCast: {
1714 BranchDepthImmediate<validate> imm(decoder, pc + 2);
1715 return 2 + imm.length;
1716 }
1717 case kExprRttCanon:
1718 case kExprRttSub: {
1719 // TODO(7748): Account for rtt.sub's additional immediates if
1720 // they stick.
1721 HeapTypeImmediate<validate> imm(WasmFeatures::All(), decoder,
1722 pc + 2);
1723 return 2 + imm.length;
1724 }
1725
1726 case kExprI31New:
1727 case kExprI31GetS:
1728 case kExprI31GetU:
1729 return 2;
1730 case kExprRefTest:
1731 case kExprRefCast: {
1732 HeapTypeImmediate<validate> ht1(WasmFeatures::All(), decoder,
1733 pc + 2);
1734 HeapTypeImmediate<validate> ht2(WasmFeatures::All(), decoder,
1735 pc + 2 + ht1.length);
1736 return 2 + ht1.length + ht2.length;
1737 }
1738
1739 default:
1740 // This is unreachable except for malformed modules.
1741 decoder->error(pc, "invalid gc opcode");
1742 return 2;
1743 }
1744 }
1745 default:
1746 return 1;
1747 }
1748 }
1749
1750 // TODO(clemensb): This is only used by the interpreter; move there.
1751 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE std::pair<uint32_t, uint32_t> StackEffect(const byte* pc) {
1752 WasmOpcode opcode = static_cast<WasmOpcode>(*pc);
1753 // Handle "simple" opcodes with a fixed signature first.
1754 const FunctionSig* sig = WasmOpcodes::Signature(opcode);
1755 if (!sig) sig = WasmOpcodes::AsmjsSignature(opcode);
1756 if (sig) return {sig->parameter_count(), sig->return_count()};
1757
1758#define DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(name, opcode, sig) case kExpr##name:
1759 // clang-format off
1760 switch (opcode) {
1761 case kExprSelect:
1762 case kExprSelectWithType:
1763 return {3, 1};
1764 case kExprTableSet:
1765 FOREACH_STORE_MEM_OPCODE(DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE)DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I32StoreMem, 0x36, v_ii) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I64StoreMem, 0x37, v_il) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(F32StoreMem, 0x38
, v_if) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(F64StoreMem, 0x39, v_id) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I32StoreMem8, 0x3a, v_ii) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I32StoreMem16,
0x3b, v_ii) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I64StoreMem8, 0x3c, v_il) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I64StoreMem16, 0x3d, v_il) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I64StoreMem32
, 0x3e, v_il)
1766 return {2, 0};
1767 FOREACH_LOAD_MEM_OPCODE(DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE)DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I32LoadMem, 0x28, i_i) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I64LoadMem, 0x29, l_i) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(F32LoadMem, 0x2a,
f_i) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(F64LoadMem, 0x2b, d_i) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I32LoadMem8S, 0x2c, i_i) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I32LoadMem8U, 0x2d
, i_i) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I32LoadMem16S, 0x2e, i_i) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I32LoadMem16U, 0x2f, i_i) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I64LoadMem8S, 0x30
, l_i) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I64LoadMem8U, 0x31, l_i) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I64LoadMem16S, 0x32, l_i) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I64LoadMem16U,
0x33, l_i) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I64LoadMem32S, 0x34, l_i) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I64LoadMem32U, 0x35, l_i)
1768 case kExprTableGet:
1769 case kExprLocalTee:
1770 case kExprMemoryGrow:
1771 case kExprRefAsNonNull:
1772 case kExprBrOnNull:
1773 case kExprRefIsNull:
1774 return {1, 1};
1775 case kExprLocalSet:
1776 case kExprGlobalSet:
1777 case kExprDrop:
1778 case kExprBrIf:
1779 case kExprBrTable:
1780 case kExprIf:
1781 case kExprRethrow:
1782 return {1, 0};
1783 case kExprLocalGet:
1784 case kExprGlobalGet:
1785 case kExprI32Const:
1786 case kExprI64Const:
1787 case kExprF32Const:
1788 case kExprF64Const:
1789 case kExprRefNull:
1790 case kExprRefFunc:
1791 case kExprMemorySize:
1792 return {0, 1};
1793 case kExprCallFunction: {
1794 CallFunctionImmediate<validate> imm(this, pc + 1);
1795 CHECK(Complete(imm))do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(Complete(imm))), 0))) { V8_Fatal
("Check failed: %s.", "Complete(imm)"); } } while (false);
1796 return {imm.sig->parameter_count(), imm.sig->return_count()};
1797 }
1798 case kExprCallIndirect: {
1799 CallIndirectImmediate<validate> imm(this->enabled_, this, pc + 1);
1800 CHECK(Complete(imm))do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(Complete(imm))), 0))) { V8_Fatal
("Check failed: %s.", "Complete(imm)"); } } while (false);
1801 // Indirect calls pop an additional argument for the table index.
1802 return {imm.sig->parameter_count() + 1,
1803 imm.sig->return_count()};
1804 }
1805 case kExprThrow: {
1806 ExceptionIndexImmediate<validate> imm(this, pc + 1);
1807 CHECK(Complete(imm))do { if ((__builtin_expect(!!(!(Complete(imm))), 0))) { V8_Fatal
("Check failed: %s.", "Complete(imm)"); } } while (false);
1808 DCHECK_EQ(0, imm.exception->sig->return_count())((void) 0);
1809 return {imm.exception->sig->parameter_count(), 0};
1810 }
1811 case kExprBr:
1812 case kExprBlock:
1813 case kExprLoop:
1814 case kExprEnd:
1815 case kExprElse:
1816 case kExprTry:
1817 case kExprCatch:
1818 case kExprBrOnExn:
1819 case kExprNop:
1820 case kExprReturn:
1821 case kExprReturnCall:
1822 case kExprReturnCallIndirect:
1823 case kExprUnreachable:
1824 return {0, 0};
1825 case kExprLet:
1826 // TODO(7748): Implement
1827 return {0, 0};
1828 case kNumericPrefix:
1829 case kAtomicPrefix:
1830 case kSimdPrefix: {
1831 opcode = this->read_prefixed_opcode<validate>(pc);
1832 switch (opcode) {
1833 FOREACH_SIMD_1_OPERAND_1_PARAM_OPCODE(DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE)DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I8x16ExtractLaneS, 0xfd15, _) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I8x16ExtractLaneU, 0xfd16, _) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I16x8ExtractLaneS
, 0xfd18, _) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I16x8ExtractLaneU, 0xfd19, _
) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I32x4ExtractLane, 0xfd1b, _) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I64x2ExtractLane, 0xfd1d, _) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(F32x4ExtractLane
, 0xfd1f, _) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(F64x2ExtractLane, 0xfd21, _)
1834 return {1, 1};
1835 FOREACH_SIMD_1_OPERAND_2_PARAM_OPCODE(DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE)DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I8x16ReplaceLane, 0xfd17, _) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(I16x8ReplaceLane, 0xfd1a, _) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I32x4ReplaceLane
, 0xfd1c, _) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(I64x2ReplaceLane, 0xfd1e, _)
DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(F32x4ReplaceLane, 0xfd20, _) DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
(F64x2ReplaceLane, 0xfd22, _)
1836 FOREACH_SIMD_MASK_OPERAND_OPCODE(DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE)DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(S8x16Shuffle, 0xfd0d, s_ss)
1837 return {2, 1};
1838 FOREACH_SIMD_CONST_OPCODE(DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE)DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE(S128Const, 0xfd0c, _)
1839 return {0, 1};
1840 default: {
1841 sig = WasmOpcodes::Signature(opcode);
1842 if (sig) {
1843 return {sig->parameter_count(), sig->return_count()};
1844 } else {
1845 UNREACHABLE()V8_Fatal("unreachable code");
1846 }
1847 }
1848 }
1849 }
1850 case kGCPrefix: {
1851 opcode = this->read_prefixed_opcode<validate>(pc);
1852 switch (opcode) {
1853 case kExprStructNewDefault:
1854 case kExprStructGet:
1855 case kExprStructGetS:
1856 case kExprStructGetU:
1857 case kExprI31New:
1858 case kExprI31GetS:
1859 case kExprI31GetU:
1860 case kExprArrayLen:
1861 case kExprRttSub:
1862 return {1, 1};
1863 case kExprStructSet:
1864 return {2, 0};
1865 case kExprArrayNewDefault:
1866 case kExprArrayGet:
1867 case kExprArrayGetS:
1868 case kExprArrayGetU:
1869 case kExprRefTest:
1870 case kExprRefCast:
1871 case kExprBrOnCast:
1872 return {2, 1};
1873 case kExprArraySet:
1874 return {3, 0};
1875 case kExprRttCanon:
1876 return {0, 1};
1877 case kExprArrayNewWithRtt:
1878 return {3, 1};
1879 case kExprStructNewWithRtt: {
1880 StructIndexImmediate<validate> imm(this, this->pc_ + 2);
1881 this->Complete(imm);
1882 return {imm.struct_type->field_count() + 1, 1};
1883 }
1884 default:
1885 UNREACHABLE()V8_Fatal("unreachable code");
1886 }
1887 }
1888 default:
1889 FATAL("unimplemented opcode: %x (%s)", opcode,V8_Fatal("unimplemented opcode: %x (%s)", opcode, WasmOpcodes
::OpcodeName(opcode))
1890 WasmOpcodes::OpcodeName(opcode))V8_Fatal("unimplemented opcode: %x (%s)", opcode, WasmOpcodes
::OpcodeName(opcode));
1891 return {0, 0};
1892 }
1893#undef DECLARE_OPCODE_CASE
1894 // clang-format on
1895 }
1896
1897 // The {Zone} is implicitly stored in the {ZoneAllocator} which is part of
1898 // this {ZoneVector}. Hence save one field and just get it from there if
1899 // needed (see {zone()} accessor below).
1900 ZoneVector<ValueType> local_types_;
1901
1902 const WasmModule* module_;
1903 const WasmFeatures enabled_;
1904 WasmFeatures* detected_;
1905 const FunctionSig* sig_;
1906};
1907
1908#define CALL_INTERFACE(name, ...) interface_.name(this, ##__VA_ARGS__)
1909#define CALL_INTERFACE_IF_REACHABLE(name, ...) \
1910 do { \
1911 DCHECK(!control_.empty())((void) 0); \
1912 DCHECK_EQ(current_code_reachable_, \((void) 0)
1913 this->ok() && control_.back().reachable())((void) 0); \
1914 if (current_code_reachable_) { \
1915 interface_.name(this, ##__VA_ARGS__); \
1916 } \
1917 } while (false)
1918#define CALL_INTERFACE_IF_PARENT_REACHABLE(name, ...) \
1919 do { \
1920 DCHECK(!control_.empty())((void) 0); \
1921 if (VALIDATE(this->ok()) && \
1922 (control_.size() == 1 || control_at(1)->reachable())) { \
1923 interface_.name(this, ##__VA_ARGS__); \
1924 } \
1925 } while (false)
1926
1927template <Decoder::ValidateFlag validate, typename Interface>
1928class WasmFullDecoder : public WasmDecoder<validate> {
1929 using Value = typename Interface::Value;
1930 using Control = typename Interface::Control;
1931 using ArgVector = base::SmallVector<Value, 8>;
1932
1933 // All Value types should be trivially copyable for performance. We push, pop,
1934 // and store them in local variables.
1935 ASSERT_TRIVIALLY_COPYABLE(Value)static_assert(::v8::base::is_trivially_copyable<Value>::
value, "Value" " should be trivially copyable");
1936
1937 public:
1938 template <typename... InterfaceArgs>
1939 WasmFullDecoder(Zone* zone, const WasmModule* module,
1940 const WasmFeatures& enabled, WasmFeatures* detected,
1941 const FunctionBody& body, InterfaceArgs&&... interface_args)
1942 : WasmDecoder<validate>(zone, module, enabled, detected, body.sig,
1943 body.start, body.end, body.offset),
1944 interface_(std::forward<InterfaceArgs>(interface_args)...),
1945 stack_(zone),
1946 control_(zone) {}
1947
1948 Interface& interface() { return interface_; }
1949
1950 bool Decode() {
1951 DCHECK(stack_.empty())((void) 0);
1952 DCHECK(control_.empty())((void) 0);
1953 DCHECK_LE(this->pc_, this->end_)((void) 0);
1954 DCHECK_EQ(this->num_locals(), 0)((void) 0);
1955
1956 this->InitializeLocalsFromSig();
1957 uint32_t params_count = static_cast<uint32_t>(this->num_locals());
1958 uint32_t locals_length;
1959 this->DecodeLocals(this->pc(), &locals_length, params_count);
1960 for (uint32_t index = params_count; index < this->num_locals(); index++) {
2
←
Assuming the condition is false
→
3
←
Loop condition is false. Execution continues on line 1968
→
1961 if (!VALIDATE(this->local_type(index).is_defaultable())) {
1962 this->errorf(
1963 this->pc(),
1964 "Cannot define function-level local of non-defaultable type %s",
1965 this->local_type(index).name().c_str());
1966 }
1967 }
1968 this->consume_bytes(locals_length);
1969
1970 CALL_INTERFACE(StartFunction);
1971 DecodeFunctionBody();
1972 if (!this->failed()) CALL_INTERFACE(FinishFunction);
4
←
Taking true branch
→
5
←
Calling 'LiftoffCompiler::FinishFunction'
→
1973
1974 // Generate a better error message whether the unterminated control
1975 // structure is the function body block or an innner structure.
1976 if (!VALIDATE(control_.empty())) {
1977 if (control_.size() > 1) {
1978 this->error(control_.back().pc, "unterminated control structure");
1979 } else if (control_.size() == 1) {
1980 this->error("function body must end with \"end\" opcode");
1981 }
1982 }
1983
1984 if (!VALIDATE(this->ok())) return this->TraceFailed();
1985
1986 TRACE("wasm-decode %s\n\n", VALIDATE(this->ok()) ? "ok" : "failed");
1987
1988 return true;
1989 }
1990
1991 bool TraceFailed() {
1992 TRACE("wasm-error module+%-6d func+%d: %s\n\n", this->error_.offset(),
1993 this->GetBufferRelativeOffset(this->error_.offset()),
1994 this->error_.message().c_str());
1995 return false;
1996 }
1997
1998 const char* SafeOpcodeNameAt(const byte* pc) {
1999 if (pc >= this->end_) return "<end>";
2000 WasmOpcode opcode = static_cast<WasmOpcode>(*pc);
2001 if (!WasmOpcodes::IsPrefixOpcode(opcode)) {
2002 return WasmOpcodes::OpcodeName(static_cast<WasmOpcode>(opcode));
2003 }
2004 opcode = this->template read_prefixed_opcode<Decoder::kValidate>(pc);
2005 return WasmOpcodes::OpcodeName(opcode);
2006 }
2007
2008 inline WasmCodePosition position() {
2009 int offset = static_cast<int>(this->pc_ - this->start_);
2010 DCHECK_EQ(this->pc_ - this->start_, offset)((void) 0); // overflows cannot happen
2011 return offset;
2012 }
2013
2014 inline uint32_t control_depth() const {
2015 return static_cast<uint32_t>(control_.size());
2016 }
2017
2018 inline Control* control_at(uint32_t depth) {
2019 DCHECK_GT(control_.size(), depth)((void) 0);
2020 return &control_.back() - depth;
2021 }
2022
2023 inline uint32_t stack_size() const {
2024 DCHECK_GE(kMaxUInt32, stack_.size())((void) 0);
2025 return static_cast<uint32_t>(stack_.size());
2026 }
2027
2028 inline Value* stack_value(uint32_t depth) {
2029 DCHECK_LT(0, depth)((void) 0);
2030 DCHECK_GE(stack_.size(), depth)((void) 0);
2031 return &*(stack_.end() - depth);
2032 }
2033
2034 void SetSucceedingCodeDynamicallyUnreachable() {
2035 Control* current = &control_.back();
2036 if (current->reachable()) {
2037 current->reachability = kSpecOnlyReachable;
2038 current_code_reachable_ = false;
2039 }
2040 }
2041
2042 private:
2043 Interface interface_;
2044
2045 ZoneVector<Value> stack_; // stack of values.
2046 ZoneVector<Control> control_; // stack of blocks, loops, and ifs.
2047 // Controls whether code should be generated for the current block (basically
2048 // a cache for {ok() && control_.back().reachable()}).
2049 bool current_code_reachable_ = true;
2050
2051 static Value UnreachableValue(const uint8_t* pc) {
2052 return Value{pc, kWasmBottom};
2053 }
2054
2055 bool CheckHasMemory() {
2056 if (!VALIDATE(this->module_->has_memory)) {
2057 this->error(this->pc_ - 1, "memory instruction with no memory");
2058 return false;
2059 }
2060 return true;
2061 }
2062
2063 bool CheckHasMemoryForAtomics() {
2064 if (FLAG_wasm_atomics_on_non_shared_memory && CheckHasMemory()) return true;
2065 if (!VALIDATE(this->module_->has_shared_memory)) {
2066 this->error(this->pc_ - 1, "Atomic opcodes used without shared memory");
2067 return false;
2068 }
2069 return true;
2070 }
2071
2072 bool CheckSimdPostMvp(WasmOpcode opcode) {
2073 if (!FLAG_wasm_simd_post_mvp && WasmOpcodes::IsSimdPostMvpOpcode(opcode)) {
2074 this->error(
2075 "simd opcode not available, enable with --wasm-simd-post-mvp");
2076 return false;
2077 }
2078 return true;
2079 }
2080
2081#ifdef DEBUG
2082 class TraceLine {
2083 public:
2084 explicit TraceLine(WasmFullDecoder* decoder) : decoder_(decoder) {
2085 WasmOpcode opcode = static_cast<WasmOpcode>(*decoder->pc());
2086 if (!WasmOpcodes::IsPrefixOpcode(opcode)) AppendOpcode(opcode);
2087 }
2088
2089 void AppendOpcode(WasmOpcode opcode) {
2090 DCHECK(!WasmOpcodes::IsPrefixOpcode(opcode))((void) 0);
2091 Append(TRACE_INST_FORMAT, decoder_->startrel(decoder_->pc_),
2092 WasmOpcodes::OpcodeName(opcode));
2093 }
2094
2095 ~TraceLine() {
2096 if (!FLAG_trace_wasm_decoder) return;
2097 AppendStackState();
2098 PrintF("%.*s\n", len_, buffer_);
2099 }
2100
2101 // Appends a formatted string.
2102 PRINTF_FORMAT(2, 3)__attribute__((format(printf, 2, 3)))
2103 void Append(const char* format, ...) {
2104 if (!FLAG_trace_wasm_decoder) return;
2105 va_list va_args;
2106 va_start(va_args, format)__builtin_va_start(va_args, format);
2107 size_t remaining_len = kMaxLen - len_;
2108 Vector<char> remaining_msg_space(buffer_ + len_, remaining_len);
2109 int len = VSNPrintF(remaining_msg_space, format, va_args);
2110 va_end(va_args)__builtin_va_end(va_args);
2111 len_ += len < 0 ? remaining_len : len;
2112 }
2113
2114 private:
2115 void AppendStackState() {
2116 DCHECK(FLAG_trace_wasm_decoder)((void) 0);
2117 Append(" ");
2118 for (Control& c : decoder_->control_) {
2119 switch (c.kind) {
2120 case kControlIf:
2121 Append("I");
2122 break;
2123 case kControlBlock:
2124 Append("B");
2125 break;
2126 case kControlLoop:
2127 Append("L");
2128 break;
2129 case kControlTry:
2130 Append("T");
2131 break;
2132 case kControlIfElse:
2133 case kControlTryCatch:
2134 case kControlLet: // TODO(7748): Implement
2135 break;
2136 }
2137 if (c.start_merge.arity) Append("%u-", c.start_merge.arity);
2138 Append("%u", c.end_merge.arity);
2139 if (!c.reachable()) Append("%c", c.unreachable() ? '*' : '#');
2140 }
2141 Append(" | ");
2142 for (size_t i = 0; i < decoder_->stack_.size(); ++i) {
2143 Value& val = decoder_->stack_[i];
2144 WasmOpcode val_opcode = static_cast<WasmOpcode>(*val.pc);
2145 if (WasmOpcodes::IsPrefixOpcode(val_opcode)) {
2146 val_opcode =
2147 decoder_->template read_prefixed_opcode<Decoder::kNoValidate>(
2148 val.pc);
2149 }
2150 Append(" %c@%d:%s", val.type.short_name(),
2151 static_cast<int>(val.pc - decoder_->start_),
2152 WasmOpcodes::OpcodeName(val_opcode));
2153 // If the decoder failed, don't try to decode the immediates, as this
2154 // can trigger a DCHECK failure.
2155 if (decoder_->failed()) continue;
2156 switch (val_opcode) {
2157 case kExprI32Const: {
2158 ImmI32Immediate<Decoder::kNoValidate> imm(decoder_, val.pc + 1);
2159 Append("[%d]", imm.value);
2160 break;
2161 }
2162 case kExprLocalGet:
2163 case kExprLocalSet:
2164 case kExprLocalTee: {
2165 LocalIndexImmediate<Decoder::kNoValidate> imm(decoder_, val.pc + 1);
2166 Append("[%u]", imm.index);
2167 break;
2168 }
2169 case kExprGlobalGet:
2170 case kExprGlobalSet: {
2171 GlobalIndexImmediate<Decoder::kNoValidate> imm(decoder_,
2172 val.pc + 1);
2173 Append("[%u]", imm.index);
2174 break;
2175 }
2176 default:
2177 break;
2178 }
2179 }
2180 }
2181
2182 static constexpr int kMaxLen = 512;
2183
2184 char buffer_[kMaxLen];
2185 int len_ = 0;
2186 WasmFullDecoder* const decoder_;
2187 };
2188#else
2189 class TraceLine {
2190 public:
2191 explicit TraceLine(WasmFullDecoder*) {}
2192
2193 void AppendOpcode(WasmOpcode) {}
2194
2195 PRINTF_FORMAT(2, 3)__attribute__((format(printf, 2, 3)))
2196 void Append(const char* format, ...) {}
2197 };
2198#endif
2199
2200#define DECODE(name) \
2201 static int Decode##name(WasmFullDecoder* decoder, WasmOpcode opcode) { \
2202 TraceLine trace_msg(decoder); \
2203 return decoder->Decode##name##Impl(&trace_msg, opcode); \
2204 } \
2205 V8_INLINEinline __attribute__((always_inline)) int Decode##name##Impl(TraceLine* trace_msg, WasmOpcode opcode)
2206
2207 DECODE(Nop) { return 1; }
2208
2209#define BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(op, _, sig) \
2210 DECODE(op) { return BuildSimpleOperator_##sig(kExpr##op); }
2211 FOREACH_SIMPLE_OPCODE(BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE)BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(I32Eqz, 0x45, i_i) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(I32Eq

, 0xbb, d_f) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(I32ReinterpretF32, 0xbc, i_f
) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(I64ReinterpretF64, 0xbd, l_d) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE
(F32ReinterpretI32, 0xbe, f_i) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(F64ReinterpretI64
, 0xbf, d_l) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(I32SExtendI8, 0xc0, i_i) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE

, l_l) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(I64SExtendI16, 0xc3, l_l) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE
(I64SExtendI32, 0xc4, l_l)
2212#undef BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE
2213
2214 DECODE(Block) {
2215 BlockTypeImmediate<validate> imm(this->enabled_, this, this->pc_ + 1);
2216 if (!this->Validate(this->pc_ + 1, imm)) return 0;
2217 ArgVector args = PopArgs(imm.sig);
2218 Control* block = PushControl(kControlBlock);
2219 SetBlockType(block, imm, args.begin());
2220 CALL_INTERFACE_IF_REACHABLE(Block, block);
2221 PushMergeValues(block, &block->start_merge);
2222 return 1 + imm.length;
2223 }
2224
2225 DECODE(Rethrow) {
2226 CHECK_PROTOTYPE_OPCODE(eh);
2227 Value exception = Pop(0, kWasmExnRef);
2228 CALL_INTERFACE_IF_REACHABLE(Rethrow, exception);
2229 EndControl();
2230 return 1;
2231 }
2232
2233 DECODE(Throw) {
2234 CHECK_PROTOTYPE_OPCODE(eh);
2235 ExceptionIndexImmediate<validate> imm(this, this->pc_ + 1);
2236 if (!this->Validate(this->pc_ + 1, imm)) return 0;
2237 ArgVector args = PopArgs(imm.exception->ToFunctionSig());
2238 CALL_INTERFACE_IF_REACHABLE(Throw, imm, VectorOf(args));
2239 EndControl();
2240 return 1 + imm.length;
2241 }
2242
2243 DECODE(Try) {
2244 CHECK_PROTOTYPE_OPCODE(eh);
2245 BlockTypeImmediate<validate> imm(this->enabled_, this, this->pc_ + 1);
2246 if (!this->Validate(this->pc_ + 1, imm)) return 0;
2247 ArgVector args = PopArgs(imm.sig);
2248 Control* try_block = PushControl(kControlTry);
2249 SetBlockType(try_block, imm, args.begin());
2250 CALL_INTERFACE_IF_REACHABLE(Try, try_block);
2251 PushMergeValues(try_block, &try_block->start_merge);
2252 return 1 + imm.length;
2253 }
2254
2255 DECODE(Catch) {
2256 CHECK_PROTOTYPE_OPCODE(eh);
2257 if (!VALIDATE(!control_.empty())) {
2258 this->error("catch does not match any try");
2259 return 0;
2260 }
2261 Control* c = &control_.back();
2262 if (!VALIDATE(c->is_try())) {
2263 this->error("catch does not match any try");
2264 return 0;
2265 }
2266 if (!VALIDATE(c->is_incomplete_try())) {
2267 this->error("catch already present for try");
2268 return 0;
2269 }
2270 c->kind = kControlTryCatch;
2271 FallThruTo(c);
2272 stack_.erase(stack_.begin() + c->stack_depth, stack_.end());
2273 c->reachability = control_at(1)->innerReachability();
2274 current_code_reachable_ = this->ok() && c->reachable();
2275 Value* exception = Push(kWasmExnRef);
2276 CALL_INTERFACE_IF_PARENT_REACHABLE(Catch, c, exception);
2277 return 1;
2278 }
2279
2280 DECODE(BrOnExn) {
2281 CHECK_PROTOTYPE_OPCODE(eh);
2282 BranchOnExceptionImmediate<validate> imm(this, this->pc_ + 1);
2283 if (!this->Validate(this->pc() + 1, imm, control_.size())) return 0;
2284 Control* c = control_at(imm.depth.depth);
2285 Value exception = Pop(0, kWasmExnRef);
2286 const WasmExceptionSig* sig = imm.index.exception->sig;
2287 size_t value_count = sig->parameter_count();
2288 // TODO(wasm): This operand stack mutation is an ugly hack to make
2289 // both type checking here as well as environment merging in the
2290 // graph builder interface work out of the box. We should introduce
2291 // special handling for both and do minimal/no stack mutation here.
2292 for (size_t i = 0; i < value_count; ++i) Push(sig->GetParam(i));
2293 Vector<Value> values(stack_.data() + c->stack_depth, value_count);
2294 TypeCheckBranchResult check_result = TypeCheckBranch(c, true);
2295 if (this->failed()) return 0;
2296 if (V8_LIKELY(check_result == kReachableBranch)(__builtin_expect(!!(check_result == kReachableBranch), 1))) {
2297 CALL_INTERFACE(BrOnException, exception, imm.index, imm.depth.depth,
2298 values);
2299 c->br_merge()->reached = true;
2300 } else if (check_result == kInvalidStack) {
2301 return 0;
2302 }
2303 for (int i = static_cast<int>(value_count) - 1; i >= 0; i--) Pop(i);
2304 Value* pexception = Push(kWasmExnRef);
2305 *pexception = exception;
2306 return 1 + imm.length;
2307 }
2308
2309 DECODE(BrOnNull) {
2310 CHECK_PROTOTYPE_OPCODE(typed_funcref);
2311 BranchDepthImmediate<validate> imm(this, this->pc_ + 1);
2312 if (!this->Validate(this->pc_ + 1, imm, control_.size())) return 0;
2313 Value ref_object = Pop(0);
2314 if (this->failed()) return 0;
2315 Control* c = control_at(imm.depth);
2316 TypeCheckBranchResult check_result = TypeCheckBranch(c, true);
2317 if (V8_LIKELY(check_result == kReachableBranch)(__builtin_expect(!!(check_result == kReachableBranch), 1))) {
2318 switch (ref_object.type.kind()) {
2319 case ValueType::kRef: {
2320 Value* result = Push(ref_object.type);
2321 CALL_INTERFACE(PassThrough, ref_object, result);
2322 break;
2323 }
2324 case ValueType::kOptRef: {
2325 // We need to Push the result value after calling BrOnNull on
2326 // the interface. Therefore we must sync the ref_object and
2327 // result nodes afterwards (in PassThrough).
2328 CALL_INTERFACE(BrOnNull, ref_object, imm.depth);
2329 Value* result =
2330 Push(ValueType::Ref(ref_object.type.heap_type(), kNonNullable));
2331 CALL_INTERFACE(PassThrough, ref_object, result);
2332 c->br_merge()->reached = true;
2333 break;
2334 }
2335 default:
2336 this->error(this->pc_, "invalid argument type to br_on_null");
2337 return 0;
2338 }
2339 } else if (check_result == kInvalidStack) {
2340 return 0;
2341 }
2342 return 1 + imm.length;
2343 }
2344
2345 DECODE(Let) {
2346 CHECK_PROTOTYPE_OPCODE(typed_funcref);
2347 BlockTypeImmediate<validate> imm(this->enabled_, this, this->pc_ + 1);
2348 if (!this->Validate(this->pc_ + 1, imm)) return 0;
2349 uint32_t old_local_count = this->num_locals();
2350 // Temporarily add the let-defined values
2351 // to the beginning of the function locals.
2352 uint32_t locals_length;
2353 if (!this->DecodeLocals(this->pc() + 1 + imm.length, &locals_length, 0)) {
2354 return 0;
2355 }
2356 uint32_t num_added_locals = this->num_locals() - old_local_count;
2357 ArgVector let_local_values =
2358 PopArgs(static_cast<uint32_t>(imm.in_arity()),
2359 VectorOf(this->local_types_.data(), num_added_locals));
2360 ArgVector args = PopArgs(imm.sig);
2361 Control* let_block = PushControl(kControlLet, num_added_locals);
2362 SetBlockType(let_block, imm, args.begin());
2363 CALL_INTERFACE_IF_REACHABLE(Block, let_block);
2364 PushMergeValues(let_block, &let_block->start_merge);
2365 CALL_INTERFACE_IF_REACHABLE(AllocateLocals, VectorOf(let_local_values));
2366 return 1 + imm.length + locals_length;
2367 }
2368
2369 DECODE(Loop) {
2370 BlockTypeImmediate<validate> imm(this->enabled_, this, this->pc_ + 1);
2371 if (!this->Validate(this->pc_ + 1, imm)) return 0;
2372 ArgVector args = PopArgs(imm.sig);
2373 Control* block = PushControl(kControlLoop);
2374 SetBlockType(&control_.back(), imm, args.begin());
2375 CALL_INTERFACE_IF_REACHABLE(Loop, block);
2376 PushMergeValues(block, &block->start_merge);
2377 return 1 + imm.length;
2378 }
2379
2380 DECODE(If) {
2381 BlockTypeImmediate<validate> imm(this->enabled_, this, this->pc_ + 1);
2382 if (!this->Validate(this->pc_ + 1, imm)) return 0;
2383 Value cond = Pop(0, kWasmI32);
2384 ArgVector args = PopArgs(imm.sig);
2385 if (!VALIDATE(this->ok())) return 0;
2386 Control* if_block = PushControl(kControlIf);
2387 SetBlockType(if_block, imm, args.begin());
2388 CALL_INTERFACE_IF_REACHABLE(If, cond, if_block);
2389 PushMergeValues(if_block, &if_block->start_merge);
2390 return 1 + imm.length;
2391 }
2392
2393 DECODE(Else) {
2394 if (!VALIDATE(!control_.empty())) {
2395 this->error("else does not match any if");
2396 return 0;
2397 }
2398 Control* c = &control_.back();
2399 if (!VALIDATE(c->is_if())) {
2400 this->error(this->pc_, "else does not match an if");
2401 return 0;
2402 }
2403 if (!VALIDATE(c->is_onearmed_if())) {
2404 this->error(this->pc_, "else already present for if");
2405 return 0;
2406 }
2407 if (!TypeCheckFallThru()) return 0;
2408 c->kind = kControlIfElse;
2409 CALL_INTERFACE_IF_PARENT_REACHABLE(Else, c);
2410 if (c->reachable()) c->end_merge.reached = true;
2411 PushMergeValues(c, &c->start_merge);
2412 c->reachability = control_at(1)->innerReachability();
2413 current_code_reachable_ = this->ok() && c->reachable();
2414 return 1;
2415 }
2416
2417 DECODE(End) {
2418 if (!VALIDATE(!control_.empty())) {
2419 this->error("end does not match any if, try, or block");
2420 return 0;
2421 }
2422 Control* c = &control_.back();
2423 if (!VALIDATE(!c->is_incomplete_try())) {
2424 this->error(this->pc_, "missing catch or catch-all in try");
2425 return 0;
2426 }
2427 if (c->is_onearmed_if()) {
2428 if (!VALIDATE(c->end_merge.arity == c->start_merge.arity)) {
2429 this->error(c->pc,
2430 "start-arity and end-arity of one-armed if must match");
2431 return 0;
2432 }
2433 if (!TypeCheckOneArmedIf(c)) return 0;
2434 }
2435 if (c->is_let()) {
2436 this->local_types_.erase(this->local_types_.begin(),
2437 this->local_types_.begin() + c->locals_count);
2438 CALL_INTERFACE_IF_REACHABLE(DeallocateLocals, c->locals_count);
2439 }
2440 if (!TypeCheckFallThru()) return 0;
2441
2442 if (control_.size() == 1) {
2443 // If at the last (implicit) control, check we are at end.
2444 if (!VALIDATE(this->pc_ + 1 == this->end_)) {
2445 this->error(this->pc_ + 1, "trailing code after function end");
2446 return 0;
2447 }
2448 // The result of the block is the return value.
2449 trace_msg->Append("\n" TRACE_INST_FORMAT, startrel(this->pc_),
2450 "(implicit) return");
2451 DoReturn();
2452 control_.clear();
2453 return 1;
2454 }
2455 PopControl(c);
2456 return 1;
2457 }
2458
2459 DECODE(Select) {
2460 Value cond = Pop(2, kWasmI32);
2461 Value fval = Pop(1);
2462 Value tval = Pop(0, fval.type);
2463 ValueType type = tval.type == kWasmBottom ? fval.type : tval.type;
2464 if (!VALIDATE(!type.is_reference_type())) {
2465 this->error("select without type is only valid for value type inputs");
2466 return 0;
2467 }
2468 Value* result = Push(type);
2469 CALL_INTERFACE_IF_REACHABLE(Select, cond, fval, tval, result);
2470 return 1;
2471 }
2472
2473 DECODE(SelectWithType) {
2474 CHECK_PROTOTYPE_OPCODE(reftypes);
2475 SelectTypeImmediate<validate> imm(this->enabled_, this, this->pc_ + 1);
2476 if (this->failed()) return 0;
2477 Value cond = Pop(2, kWasmI32);
2478 Value fval = Pop(1, imm.type);
2479 Value tval = Pop(0, imm.type);
2480 Value* result = Push(imm.type);
2481 CALL_INTERFACE_IF_REACHABLE(Select, cond, fval, tval, result);
2482 return 1 + imm.length;
2483 }
2484
2485 DECODE(Br) {
2486 BranchDepthImmediate<validate> imm(this, this->pc_ + 1);
2487 if (!this->Validate(this->pc_ + 1, imm, control_.size())) return 0;
2488 Control* c = control_at(imm.depth);
2489 TypeCheckBranchResult check_result = TypeCheckBranch(c, false);
2490 if (V8_LIKELY(check_result == kReachableBranch)(__builtin_expect(!!(check_result == kReachableBranch), 1))) {
2491 if (imm.depth == control_.size() - 1) {
2492 DoReturn();
2493 } else {
2494 CALL_INTERFACE(Br, c);
2495 c->br_merge()->reached = true;
2496 }
2497 } else if (check_result == kInvalidStack) {
2498 return 0;
2499 }
2500 EndControl();
2501 return 1 + imm.length;
2502 }
2503
2504 DECODE(BrIf) {
2505 BranchDepthImmediate<validate> imm(this, this->pc_ + 1);
2506 if (!this->Validate(this->pc_ + 1, imm, control_.size())) return 0;
2507 Value cond = Pop(0, kWasmI32);
2508 if (this->failed()) return 0;
2509 Control* c = control_at(imm.depth);
2510 TypeCheckBranchResult check_result = TypeCheckBranch(c, true);
2511 if (V8_LIKELY(check_result == kReachableBranch)(__builtin_expect(!!(check_result == kReachableBranch), 1))) {
2512 CALL_INTERFACE(BrIf, cond, imm.depth);
2513 c->br_merge()->reached = true;
2514 } else if (check_result == kInvalidStack) {
2515 return 0;
2516 }
2517 return 1 + imm.length;
2518 }
2519
2520 DECODE(BrTable) {
2521 BranchTableImmediate<validate> imm(this, this->pc_ + 1);
2522 BranchTableIterator<validate> iterator(this, imm);
2523 Value key = Pop(0, kWasmI32);
2524 if (this->failed()) return 0;
2525 if (!this->Validate(this->pc_ + 1, imm, control_.size())) return 0;
2526
2527 // Cache the branch targets during the iteration, so that we can set
2528 // all branch targets as reachable after the {CALL_INTERFACE} call.
2529 std::vector<bool> br_targets(control_.size());
2530
2531 // The result types of the br_table instruction. We have to check the
2532 // stack against these types. Only needed during validation.
2533 std::vector<ValueType> result_types;
2534
2535 while (iterator.has_next()) {
2536 const uint32_t index = iterator.cur_index();
2537 const byte* pos = iterator.pc();
2538 uint32_t target = iterator.next();
2539 if (!VALIDATE(ValidateBrTableTarget(target, pos, index))) return 0;
2540 // Avoid redundant branch target checks.
2541 if (br_targets[target]) continue;
2542 br_targets[target] = true;
2543
2544 if (validate) {
2545 if (index == 0) {
2546 // With the first branch target, initialize the result types.
2547 result_types = InitializeBrTableResultTypes(target);
2548 } else if (!UpdateBrTableResultTypes(&result_types, target, pos,
2549 index)) {
2550 return 0;
2551 }
2552 }
2553 }
2554
2555 if (!VALIDATE(TypeCheckBrTable(result_types))) return 0;
2556
2557 DCHECK(this->ok())((void) 0);
2558
2559 if (current_code_reachable_) {
2560 CALL_INTERFACE(BrTable, imm, key);
2561
2562 for (int i = 0, e = control_depth(); i < e; ++i) {
2563 if (!br_targets[i]) continue;
2564 control_at(i)->br_merge()->reached = true;
2565 }
2566 }
2567
2568 EndControl();
2569 return 1 + iterator.length();
2570 }
2571
2572 DECODE(Return) {
2573 if (V8_LIKELY(current_code_reachable_)(__builtin_expect(!!(current_code_reachable_), 1))) {
2574 if (!VALIDATE(TypeCheckReturn())) return 0;
2575 DoReturn();
2576 } else {
2577 // We pop all return values from the stack to check their type.
2578 // Since we deal with unreachable code, we do not have to keep the
2579 // values.
2580 int num_returns = static_cast<int>(this->sig_->return_count());
2581 for (int i = num_returns - 1; i >= 0; --i) {
2582 Pop(i, this->sig_->GetReturn(i));
2583 }
2584 }
2585
2586 EndControl();
2587 return 1;
2588 }
2589
2590 DECODE(Unreachable) {
2591 CALL_INTERFACE_IF_REACHABLE(Unreachable);
2592 EndControl();
2593 return 1;
2594 }
2595
2596 DECODE(I32Const) {
2597 ImmI32Immediate<validate> imm(this, this->pc_ + 1);
2598 Value* value = Push(kWasmI32);
2599 CALL_INTERFACE_IF_REACHABLE(I32Const, value, imm.value);
2600 return 1 + imm.length;
2601 }
2602
2603 DECODE(I64Const) {
2604 ImmI64Immediate<validate> imm(this, this->pc_ + 1);
2605 Value* value = Push(kWasmI64);
2606 CALL_INTERFACE_IF_REACHABLE(I64Const, value, imm.value);
2607 return 1 + imm.length;
2608 }
2609
2610 DECODE(F32Const) {
2611 ImmF32Immediate<validate> imm(this, this->pc_ + 1);
2612 Value* value = Push(kWasmF32);
2613 CALL_INTERFACE_IF_REACHABLE(F32Const, value, imm.value);
2614 return 1 + imm.length;
2615 }
2616
2617 DECODE(F64Const) {
2618 ImmF64Immediate<validate> imm(this, this->pc_ + 1);
2619 Value* value = Push(kWasmF64);
2620 CALL_INTERFACE_IF_REACHABLE(F64Const, value, imm.value);
2621 return 1 + imm.length;
2622 }
2623
2624 DECODE(RefNull) {
2625 CHECK_PROTOTYPE_OPCODE(reftypes);
2626 HeapTypeImmediate<validate> imm(this->enabled_, this, this->pc_ + 1);
2627 if (!this->Validate(this->pc_ + 1, imm)) return 0;
2628 Value* value = Push(ValueType::Ref(imm.type, kNullable));
2629 CALL_INTERFACE_IF_REACHABLE(RefNull, value);
2630 return 1 + imm.length;
2631 }
2632
2633 DECODE(RefIsNull) {
2634 CHECK_PROTOTYPE_OPCODE(reftypes);
2635 Value value = Pop(0);
2636 Value* result = Push(kWasmI32);
2637 switch (value.type.kind()) {
2638 case ValueType::kOptRef:
2639 CALL_INTERFACE_IF_REACHABLE(UnOp, kExprRefIsNull, value, result);
2640 return 1;
2641 case ValueType::kRef:
2642 // For non-nullable references, the result is always false.
2643 CALL_INTERFACE_IF_REACHABLE(I32Const, result, 0);
2644 return 1;
2645 default:
2646 if (validate) {
2647 this->errorf(this->pc_,
2648 "invalid argument type to ref.is_null. Expected "
2649 "reference type, got %s",
2650 value.type.name().c_str());
2651 return 0;
2652 }
2653 UNREACHABLE()V8_Fatal("unreachable code");
2654 }
2655 }
2656
2657 DECODE(RefFunc) {
2658 CHECK_PROTOTYPE_OPCODE(reftypes);
2659 FunctionIndexImmediate<validate> imm(this, this->pc_ + 1);
2660 if (!this->Validate(this->pc_ + 1, imm)) return 0;
2661 HeapType heap_type(this->enabled_.has_typed_funcref()
2662 ? this->module_->functions[imm.index].sig_index
2663 : HeapType::kFunc);
2664 Value* value = Push(ValueType::Ref(heap_type, kNonNullable));
2665 CALL_INTERFACE_IF_REACHABLE(RefFunc, imm.index, value);
2666 return 1 + imm.length;
2667 }
2668
2669 DECODE(RefAsNonNull) {
2670 CHECK_PROTOTYPE_OPCODE(typed_funcref);
2671 Value value = Pop(0);
2672 switch (value.type.kind()) {
2673 case ValueType::kRef: {
2674 Value* result = Push(value.type);
2675 CALL_INTERFACE_IF_REACHABLE(PassThrough, value, result);
2676 return 1;
2677 }
2678 case ValueType::kOptRef: {
2679 Value* result =
2680 Push(ValueType::Ref(value.type.heap_type(), kNonNullable));
2681 CALL_INTERFACE_IF_REACHABLE(RefAsNonNull, value, result);
2682 return 1;
2683 }
2684 default:
2685 if (validate) {
2686 this->errorf(this->pc_,
2687 "invalid agrument type to ref.as_non_null: Expected "
2688 "reference type, got %s",
2689 value.type.name().c_str());
2690 }
2691 return 0;
2692 }
2693 }
2694
2695 DECODE(LocalGet) {
2696 LocalIndexImmediate<validate> imm(this, this->pc_ + 1);
2697 if (!this->Validate(this->pc_ + 1, imm)) return 0;
2698 Value* value = Push(this->local_type(imm.index));
2699 CALL_INTERFACE_IF_REACHABLE(LocalGet, value, imm);
2700 return 1 + imm.length;
2701 }
2702
2703 DECODE(LocalSet) {
2704 LocalIndexImmediate<validate> imm(this, this->pc_ + 1);
2705 if (!this->Validate(this->pc_ + 1, imm)) return 0;
2706 Value value = Pop(0, this->local_type(imm.index));
2707 CALL_INTERFACE_IF_REACHABLE(LocalSet, value, imm);
2708 return 1 + imm.length;
2709 }
2710
2711 DECODE(LocalTee) {
2712 LocalIndexImmediate<validate> imm(this, this->pc_ + 1);
2713 if (!this->Validate(this->pc_ + 1, imm)) return 0;
2714 Value value = Pop(0, this->local_type(imm.index));
2715 Value* result = Push(value.type);
2716 CALL_INTERFACE_IF_REACHABLE(LocalTee, value, result, imm);
2717 return 1 + imm.length;
2718 }
2719
2720 DECODE(Drop) {
2721 Value value = Pop(0);
2722 CALL_INTERFACE_IF_REACHABLE(Drop, value);
2723 return 1;
2724 }
2725
2726 DECODE(GlobalGet) {
2727 GlobalIndexImmediate<validate> imm(this, this->pc_ + 1);
2728 if (!this->Validate(this->pc_ + 1, imm)) return 0;
2729 Value* result = Push(imm.type);
2730 CALL_INTERFACE_IF_REACHABLE(GlobalGet, result, imm);
2731 return 1 + imm.length;
2732 }
2733
2734 DECODE(GlobalSet) {
2735 GlobalIndexImmediate<validate> imm(this, this->pc_ + 1);
2736 if (!this->Validate(this->pc_ + 1, imm)) return 0;
2737 if (!VALIDATE(imm.global->mutability)) {
2738 this->errorf(this->pc_, "immutable global #%u cannot be assigned",
2739 imm.index);
2740 return 0;
2741 }
2742 Value value = Pop(0, imm.type);
2743 CALL_INTERFACE_IF_REACHABLE(GlobalSet, value, imm);
2744 return 1 + imm.length;
2745 }
2746
2747 DECODE(TableGet) {
2748 CHECK_PROTOTYPE_OPCODE(reftypes);
2749 TableIndexImmediate<validate> imm(this, this->pc_ + 1);
2750 if (!this->Validate(this->pc_ + 1, imm)) return 0;
2751 Value index = Pop(0, kWasmI32);
2752 Value* result = Push(this->module_->tables[imm.index].type);
2753 CALL_INTERFACE_IF_REACHABLE(TableGet, index, result, imm);
2754 return 1 + imm.length;
2755 }
2756
2757 DECODE(TableSet) {
2758 CHECK_PROTOTYPE_OPCODE(reftypes);
2759 TableIndexImmediate<validate> imm(this, this->pc_ + 1);
2760 if (!this->Validate(this->pc_ + 1, imm)) return 0;
2761 Value value = Pop(1, this->module_->tables[imm.index].type);
2762 Value index = Pop(0, kWasmI32);
2763 CALL_INTERFACE_IF_REACHABLE(TableSet, index, value, imm);
2764 return 1 + imm.length;
2765 }
2766
2767 DECODE(LoadMem) {
2768 // Hard-code the list of load types. The opcodes are highly unlikely to
2769 // ever change, and we have some checks here to guard against that.
2770 static_assert(sizeof(LoadType) == sizeof(uint8_t), "LoadType is compact");
2771 static constexpr uint8_t kMinOpcode = kExprI32LoadMem;
2772 static constexpr uint8_t kMaxOpcode = kExprI64LoadMem32U;
2773 static constexpr LoadType kLoadTypes[] = {
2774 LoadType::kI32Load, LoadType::kI64Load, LoadType::kF32Load,
2775 LoadType::kF64Load, LoadType::kI32Load8S, LoadType::kI32Load8U,
2776 LoadType::kI32Load16S, LoadType::kI32Load16U, LoadType::kI64Load8S,
2777 LoadType::kI64Load8U, LoadType::kI64Load16S, LoadType::kI64Load16U,
2778 LoadType::kI64Load32S, LoadType::kI64Load32U};
2779 STATIC_ASSERT(arraysize(kLoadTypes) == kMaxOpcode - kMinOpcode + 1)static_assert((sizeof(ArraySizeHelper(kLoadTypes))) == kMaxOpcode
- kMinOpcode + 1, "arraysize(kLoadTypes) == kMaxOpcode - kMinOpcode + 1"
);
2780 DCHECK_LE(kMinOpcode, opcode)((void) 0);
2781 DCHECK_GE(kMaxOpcode, opcode)((void) 0);
2782 return DecodeLoadMem(kLoadTypes[opcode - kMinOpcode]);
2783 }
2784
2785 DECODE(StoreMem) {
2786 // Hard-code the list of store types. The opcodes are highly unlikely to
2787 // ever change, and we have some checks here to guard against that.
2788 static_assert(sizeof(StoreType) == sizeof(uint8_t), "StoreType is compact");
2789 static constexpr uint8_t kMinOpcode = kExprI32StoreMem;
2790 static constexpr uint8_t kMaxOpcode = kExprI64StoreMem32;
2791 static constexpr StoreType kStoreTypes[] = {
2792 StoreType::kI32Store, StoreType::kI64Store, StoreType::kF32Store,
2793 StoreType::kF64Store, StoreType::kI32Store8, StoreType::kI32Store16,
2794 StoreType::kI64Store8, StoreType::kI64Store16, StoreType::kI64Store32};
2795 STATIC_ASSERT(arraysize(kStoreTypes) == kMaxOpcode - kMinOpcode + 1)static_assert((sizeof(ArraySizeHelper(kStoreTypes))) == kMaxOpcode
- kMinOpcode + 1, "arraysize(kStoreTypes) == kMaxOpcode - kMinOpcode + 1"
);
2796 DCHECK_LE(kMinOpcode, opcode)((void) 0);
2797 DCHECK_GE(kMaxOpcode, opcode)((void) 0);
2798 return DecodeStoreMem(kStoreTypes[opcode - kMinOpcode]);
2799 }
2800
2801 DECODE(MemoryGrow) {
2802 if (!CheckHasMemory()) return 0;
2803 MemoryIndexImmediate<validate> imm(this, this->pc_ + 1);
2804 if (!VALIDATE(this->module_->origin == kWasmOrigin)) {
2805 this->error("grow_memory is not supported for asmjs modules");
2806 return 0;
2807 }
2808 Value value = Pop(0, kWasmI32);
2809 Value* result = Push(kWasmI32);
2810 CALL_INTERFACE_IF_REACHABLE(MemoryGrow, value, result);
2811 return 1 + imm.length;
2812 }
2813
2814 DECODE(MemorySize) {
2815 if (!CheckHasMemory()) return 0;
2816 MemoryIndexImmediate<validate> imm(this, this->pc_ + 1);
2817 Value* result = Push(kWasmI32);
2818 CALL_INTERFACE_IF_REACHABLE(CurrentMemoryPages, result);
2819 return 1 + imm.length;
2820 }
2821
2822 DECODE(CallFunction) {
2823 CallFunctionImmediate<validate> imm(this, this->pc_ + 1);
2824 if (!this->Validate(this->pc_ + 1, imm)) return 0;
2825 ArgVector args = PopArgs(imm.sig);
2826 Value* returns = PushReturns(imm.sig);
2827 CALL_INTERFACE_IF_REACHABLE(CallDirect, imm, args.begin(), returns);
2828 return 1 + imm.length;
2829 }
2830
2831 DECODE(CallIndirect) {
2832 CallIndirectImmediate<validate> imm(this->enabled_, this, this->pc_ + 1);
2833 if (!this->Validate(this->pc_ + 1, imm)) return 0;
2834 Value index = Pop(0, kWasmI32);
2835 ArgVector args = PopArgs(imm.sig);
2836 Value* returns = PushReturns(imm.sig);
2837 CALL_INTERFACE_IF_REACHABLE(CallIndirect, index, imm, args.begin(),
2838 returns);
2839 return 1 + imm.length;
2840 }
2841
2842 DECODE(ReturnCall) {
2843 CHECK_PROTOTYPE_OPCODE(return_call);
2844 CallFunctionImmediate<validate> imm(this, this->pc_ + 1);
2845 if (!this->Validate(this->pc_ + 1, imm)) return 0;
2846 if (!VALIDATE(this->CanReturnCall(imm.sig))) {
2847 this->errorf(this->pc_, "%s: %s",
2848 WasmOpcodes::OpcodeName(kExprReturnCall),
2849 "tail call return types mismatch");
2850 return 0;
2851 }
2852 ArgVector args = PopArgs(imm.sig);
2853 CALL_INTERFACE_IF_REACHABLE(ReturnCall, imm, args.begin());
2854 EndControl();
2855 return 1 + imm.length;
2856 }
2857
2858 DECODE(ReturnCallIndirect) {
2859 CHECK_PROTOTYPE_OPCODE(return_call);
2860 CallIndirectImmediate<validate> imm(this->enabled_, this, this->pc_ + 1);
2861 if (!this->Validate(this->pc_ + 1, imm)) return 0;
2862 if (!VALIDATE(this->CanReturnCall(imm.sig))) {
2863 this->errorf(this->pc_, "%s: %s",
2864 WasmOpcodes::OpcodeName(kExprReturnCallIndirect),
2865 "tail call return types mismatch");
2866 return 0;
2867 }
2868 Value index = Pop(0, kWasmI32);
2869 ArgVector args = PopArgs(imm.sig);
2870 CALL_INTERFACE_IF_REACHABLE(ReturnCallIndirect, index, imm, args.begin());
2871 EndControl();
2872 return 1 + imm.length;
2873 }
2874
2875 DECODE(CallRef) {
2876 CHECK_PROTOTYPE_OPCODE(typed_funcref);
2877 Value func_ref = Pop(0);
2878 ValueType func_type = func_ref.type;
2879 if (!func_type.is_object_reference_type() || !func_type.has_index() ||
2880 !this->module_->has_signature(func_type.ref_index())) {
2881 this->errorf(this->pc_,
2882 "call_ref: Expected function reference on top of stack, "
2883 "found %s of type %s instead",
2884 SafeOpcodeNameAt(func_ref.pc), func_type.name().c_str());
2885 return 0;
2886 }
2887 const FunctionSig* sig = this->module_->signature(func_type.ref_index());
2888 ArgVector args = PopArgs(sig);
2889 Value* returns = PushReturns(sig);
2890 CALL_INTERFACE_IF_REACHABLE(CallRef, func_ref, sig, func_type.ref_index(),
2891 args.begin(), returns);
2892 return 1;
2893 }
2894
2895 DECODE(ReturnCallRef) {
2896 CHECK_PROTOTYPE_OPCODE(typed_funcref);
2897 CHECK_PROTOTYPE_OPCODE(return_call);
2898 Value func_ref = Pop(0);
2899 ValueType func_type = func_ref.type;
2900 if (!func_type.is_object_reference_type() || !func_type.has_index() ||
2901 !this->module_->has_signature(func_type.ref_index())) {
2902 this->errorf(this->pc_,
2903 "return_call_ref: Expected function reference on top of "
2904 "found %s of type %s instead",
2905 SafeOpcodeNameAt(func_ref.pc), func_type.name().c_str());
2906 return 0;
2907 }
2908 const FunctionSig* sig = this->module_->signature(func_type.ref_index());
2909 ArgVector args = PopArgs(sig);
2910 CALL_INTERFACE_IF_REACHABLE(ReturnCallRef, func_ref, sig,
2911 func_type.ref_index(), args.begin());
2912 EndControl();
2913 return 1;
2914 }
2915
2916 DECODE(Numeric) {
2917 byte numeric_index =
2918 this->template read_u8<validate>(this->pc_ + 1, "numeric index");
2919 WasmOpcode full_opcode =
2920 static_cast<WasmOpcode>(kNumericPrefix << 8 | numeric_index);
2921 if (full_opcode == kExprTableGrow || full_opcode == kExprTableSize ||
2922 full_opcode == kExprTableFill) {
2923 CHECK_PROTOTYPE_OPCODE(reftypes);
2924 } else if (full_opcode >= kExprMemoryInit) {
2925 CHECK_PROTOTYPE_OPCODE(bulk_memory);
2926 }
2927 trace_msg->AppendOpcode(full_opcode);
2928 return DecodeNumericOpcode(full_opcode);
2929 }
2930
2931 DECODE(Simd) {
2932 CHECK_PROTOTYPE_OPCODE(simd);
2933 uint32_t opcode_length = 0;
2934 WasmOpcode full_opcode = this->template read_prefixed_opcode<validate>(
2935 this->pc_, &opcode_length);
2936 if (!VALIDATE(this->ok())) return 0;
2937 trace_msg->AppendOpcode(full_opcode);
2938 return DecodeSimdOpcode(full_opcode, 1 + opcode_length);
2939 }
2940
2941 DECODE(Atomic) {
2942 CHECK_PROTOTYPE_OPCODE(threads);
2943 byte atomic_index =
2944 this->template read_u8<validate>(this->pc_ + 1, "atomic index");
2945 WasmOpcode full_opcode =
2946 static_cast<WasmOpcode>(kAtomicPrefix << 8 | atomic_index);
2947 trace_msg->AppendOpcode(full_opcode);
2948 return DecodeAtomicOpcode(full_opcode);
2949 }
2950
2951 DECODE(GC) {
2952 CHECK_PROTOTYPE_OPCODE(gc);
2953 byte gc_index = this->template read_u8<validate>(this->pc_ + 1, "gc index");
2954 WasmOpcode full_opcode = static_cast<WasmOpcode>(kGCPrefix << 8 | gc_index);
2955 trace_msg->AppendOpcode(full_opcode);
2956 return DecodeGCOpcode(full_opcode);
2957 }
2958
2959#define SIMPLE_PROTOTYPE_CASE(name, opc, sig) \
2960 DECODE(name) { return BuildSimplePrototypeOperator(opcode); }
2961 FOREACH_SIMPLE_PROTOTYPE_OPCODE(SIMPLE_PROTOTYPE_CASE)SIMPLE_PROTOTYPE_CASE(RefEq, 0xd5, i_qq)
2962#undef SIMPLE_PROTOTYPE_CASE
2963
2964 DECODE(UnknownOrAsmJs) {
2965 // Deal with special asmjs opcodes.
2966 if (!VALIDATE(is_asmjs_module(this->module_))) {
2967 this->errorf(this->pc(), "Invalid opcode 0x%x", opcode);
2968 return 0;
2969 }
2970 const FunctionSig* sig = WasmOpcodes::AsmjsSignature(opcode);
2971 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(sig)((void) 0);
2972 return BuildSimpleOperator(opcode, sig);
2973 }
2974
2975#undef DECODE
2976
2977 using OpcodeHandler = int (*)(WasmFullDecoder*, WasmOpcode);
2978
2979 // Ideally we would use template specialization for the different opcodes, but
2980 // GCC does not allow to specialize templates in class scope
2981 // (https://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=85282), and specializing
2982 // outside the class is not allowed for non-specialized classes.
2983 // Hence just list all implementations explicitly here, which also gives more
2984 // freedom to use the same implementation for different opcodes.
2985#define DECODE_IMPL(opcode) DECODE_IMPL2(kExpr##opcode, opcode)
2986#define DECODE_IMPL2(opcode, name) \
2987 if (idx == opcode) return &WasmFullDecoder::Decode##name
2988
2989 static constexpr OpcodeHandler GetOpcodeHandlerTableEntry(size_t idx) {
2990 DECODE_IMPL(Nop);
2991#define BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(op, _, sig) DECODE_IMPL(op);
2992 FOREACH_SIMPLE_OPCODE(BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE)BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(I32Eqz, 0x45, i_i) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(I32Eq
, 0x46, i_ii) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(I32Ne, 0x47, i_ii) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE
(I32LtS, 0x48, i_ii) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(I32LtU, 0x49, i_ii) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE
(I32GtS, 0x4a, i_ii) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(I32GtU, 0x4b, i_ii) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE
(I32LeS, 0x4c, i_ii) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(I32LeU, 0x4d, i_ii) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE
(I32GeS, 0x4e, i_ii) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(I32GeU, 0x4f, i_ii) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE
(I64Eqz, 0x50, i_l) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(I64Eq, 0x51, i_ll) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE
(I64Ne, 0x52, i_ll) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(I64LtS, 0x53, i_ll) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE
(I64LtU, 0x54, i_ll) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(I64GtS, 0x55, i_ll) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE
(I64GtU, 0x56, i_ll) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(I64LeS, 0x57, i_ll) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE
(I64LeU, 0x58, i_ll) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(I64GeS, 0x59, i_ll) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE
(I64GeU, 0x5a, i_ll) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(F32Eq, 0x5b, i_ff) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE
(F32Ne, 0x5c, i_ff) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(F32Lt, 0x5d, i_ff) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE
(F32Gt, 0x5e, i_ff) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(F32Le, 0x5f, i_ff) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE
(F32Ge, 0x60, i_ff) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(F64Eq, 0x61, i_dd) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE
(F64Ne, 0x62, i_dd) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(F64Lt, 0x63, i_dd) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE
(F64Gt, 0x64, i_dd) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(F64Le, 0x65, i_dd) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE
(F64Ge, 0x66, i_dd) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(I32Clz, 0x67, i_i) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE
(I32Ctz, 0x68, i_i) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(I32Popcnt, 0x69, i_i)
BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(I32Add, 0x6a, i_ii) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(
I32Sub, 0x6b, i_ii) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(I32Mul, 0x6c, i_ii) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE
(I32DivS, 0x6d, i_ii) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(I32DivU, 0x6e, i_ii
) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(I32RemS, 0x6f, i_ii) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE
(I32RemU, 0x70, i_ii) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(I32And, 0x71, i_ii)
BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(I32Ior, 0x72, i_ii) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(
I32Xor, 0x73, i_ii) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(I32Shl, 0x74, i_ii) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE
(I32ShrS, 0x75, i_ii) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(I32ShrU, 0x76, i_ii
) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(I32Rol, 0x77, i_ii) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE
(I32Ror, 0x78, i_ii) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(I64Clz, 0x79, l_l) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE
(I64Ctz, 0x7a, l_l) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(I64Popcnt, 0x7b, l_l)
BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(I64Add, 0x7c, l_ll) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(
I64Sub, 0x7d, l_ll) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(I64Mul, 0x7e, l_ll) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE
(I64DivS, 0x7f, l_ll) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(I64DivU, 0x80, l_ll
) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(I64RemS, 0x81, l_ll) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE
(I64RemU, 0x82, l_ll) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(I64And, 0x83, l_ll)
BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(I64Ior, 0x84, l_ll) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(
I64Xor, 0x85, l_ll) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(I64Shl, 0x86, l_ll) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE
(I64ShrS, 0x87, l_ll) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(I64ShrU, 0x88, l_ll
) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(I64Rol, 0x89, l_ll) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE
(I64Ror, 0x8a, l_ll) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(F32Abs, 0x8b, f_f) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE
(F32Neg, 0x8c, f_f) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(F32Ceil, 0x8d, f_f) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE
(F32Floor, 0x8e, f_f) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(F32Trunc, 0x8f, f_f
) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(F32NearestInt, 0x90, f_f) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE
(F32Sqrt, 0x91, f_f) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(F32Add, 0x92, f_ff) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE
(F32Sub, 0x93, f_ff) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(F32Mul, 0x94, f_ff) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE
(F32Div, 0x95, f_ff) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(F32Min, 0x96, f_ff) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE
(F32Max, 0x97, f_ff) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(F32CopySign, 0x98, f_ff
) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(F64Abs, 0x99, d_d) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(
F64Neg, 0x9a, d_d) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(F64Ceil, 0x9b, d_d) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE
(F64Floor, 0x9c, d_d) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(F64Trunc, 0x9d, d_d
) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(F64NearestInt, 0x9e, d_d) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE
(F64Sqrt, 0x9f, d_d) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(F64Add, 0xa0, d_dd) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE
(F64Sub, 0xa1, d_dd) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(F64Mul, 0xa2, d_dd) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE
(F64Div, 0xa3, d_dd) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(F64Min, 0xa4, d_dd) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE
(F64Max, 0xa5, d_dd) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(F64CopySign, 0xa6, d_dd
) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(I32ConvertI64, 0xa7, i_l) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE
(I32SConvertF32, 0xa8, i_f) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(I32UConvertF32
, 0xa9, i_f) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(I32SConvertF64, 0xaa, i_d) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE
(I32UConvertF64, 0xab, i_d) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(I64SConvertI32
, 0xac, l_i) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(I64UConvertI32, 0xad, l_i) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE
(I64SConvertF32, 0xae, l_f) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(I64UConvertF32
, 0xaf, l_f) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(I64SConvertF64, 0xb0, l_d) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE
(I64UConvertF64, 0xb1, l_d) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(F32SConvertI32
, 0xb2, f_i) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(F32UConvertI32, 0xb3, f_i) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE
(F32SConvertI64, 0xb4, f_l) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(F32UConvertI64
, 0xb5, f_l) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(F32ConvertF64, 0xb6, f_d) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE
(F64SConvertI32, 0xb7, d_i) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(F64UConvertI32
, 0xb8, d_i) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(F64SConvertI64, 0xb9, d_l) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE
(F64UConvertI64, 0xba, d_l) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(F64ConvertF32
, 0xbb, d_f) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(I32ReinterpretF32, 0xbc, i_f
) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(I64ReinterpretF64, 0xbd, l_d) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE
(F32ReinterpretI32, 0xbe, f_i) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(F64ReinterpretI64
, 0xbf, d_l) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(I32SExtendI8, 0xc0, i_i) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE
(I32SExtendI16, 0xc1, i_i) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(I64SExtendI8, 0xc2
, l_l) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE(I64SExtendI16, 0xc3, l_l) BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE
(I64SExtendI32, 0xc4, l_l)
2993#undef BUILD_SIMPLE_OPCODE
2994 DECODE_IMPL(Block);
2995 DECODE_IMPL(Rethrow);
2996 DECODE_IMPL(Throw);
2997 DECODE_IMPL(Try);
2998 DECODE_IMPL(Catch);
2999 DECODE_IMPL(BrOnExn);
3000 DECODE_IMPL(BrOnNull);
3001 DECODE_IMPL(Let);
3002 DECODE_IMPL(Loop);
3003 DECODE_IMPL(If);
3004 DECODE_IMPL(Else);
3005 DECODE_IMPL(End);
3006 DECODE_IMPL(Select);
3007 DECODE_IMPL(SelectWithType);
3008 DECODE_IMPL(Br);
3009 DECODE_IMPL(BrIf);
3010 DECODE_IMPL(BrTable);
3011 DECODE_IMPL(Return);
3012 DECODE_IMPL(Unreachable);
3013 DECODE_IMPL(I32Const);
3014 DECODE_IMPL(I64Const);
3015 DECODE_IMPL(F32Const);
3016 DECODE_IMPL(F64Const);
3017 DECODE_IMPL(RefNull);
3018 DECODE_IMPL(RefIsNull);
3019 DECODE_IMPL(RefFunc);
3020 DECODE_IMPL(RefAsNonNull);
3021 DECODE_IMPL(LocalGet);
3022 DECODE_IMPL(LocalSet);
3023 DECODE_IMPL(LocalTee);
3024 DECODE_IMPL(Drop);
3025 DECODE_IMPL(GlobalGet);
3026 DECODE_IMPL(GlobalSet);
3027 DECODE_IMPL(TableGet);
3028 DECODE_IMPL(TableSet);
3029#define DECODE_LOAD_MEM(op, ...) DECODE_IMPL2(kExpr##op, LoadMem);
3030 FOREACH_LOAD_MEM_OPCODE(DECODE_LOAD_MEM)DECODE_LOAD_MEM(I32LoadMem, 0x28, i_i) DECODE_LOAD_MEM(I64LoadMem
, 0x29, l_i) DECODE_LOAD_MEM(F32LoadMem, 0x2a, f_i) DECODE_LOAD_MEM
(F64LoadMem, 0x2b, d_i) DECODE_LOAD_MEM(I32LoadMem8S, 0x2c, i_i
) DECODE_LOAD_MEM(I32LoadMem8U, 0x2d, i_i) DECODE_LOAD_MEM(I32LoadMem16S
, 0x2e, i_i) DECODE_LOAD_MEM(I32LoadMem16U, 0x2f, i_i) DECODE_LOAD_MEM
(I64LoadMem8S, 0x30, l_i) DECODE_LOAD_MEM(I64LoadMem8U, 0x31,
l_i) DECODE_LOAD_MEM(I64LoadMem16S, 0x32, l_i) DECODE_LOAD_MEM
(I64LoadMem16U, 0x33, l_i) DECODE_LOAD_MEM(I64LoadMem32S, 0x34
, l_i) DECODE_LOAD_MEM(I64LoadMem32U, 0x35, l_i)
3031#undef DECODE_LOAD_MEM
3032#define DECODE_STORE_MEM(op, ...)DECODE_IMPL2(kExprop, StoreMem); DECODE_IMPL2(kExpr##op, StoreMem);
3033 FOREACH_STORE_MEM_OPCODE(DECODE_STORE_MEM)DECODE_IMPL2(kExprI32StoreMem, StoreMem); DECODE_IMPL2(kExprI64StoreMem
, StoreMem); DECODE_IMPL2(kExprF32StoreMem, StoreMem); DECODE_IMPL2
(kExprF64StoreMem, StoreMem); DECODE_IMPL2(kExprI32StoreMem8,
StoreMem); DECODE_IMPL2(kExprI32StoreMem16, StoreMem); DECODE_IMPL2
(kExprI64StoreMem8, StoreMem); DECODE_IMPL2(kExprI64StoreMem16
, StoreMem); DECODE_IMPL2(kExprI64StoreMem32, StoreMem);
3034#undef DECODE_LOAD_MEM
3035 DECODE_IMPL(MemoryGrow);
3036 DECODE_IMPL(MemorySize);
3037 DECODE_IMPL(CallFunction);
3038 DECODE_IMPL(CallIndirect);
3039 DECODE_IMPL(ReturnCall);
3040 DECODE_IMPL(ReturnCallIndirect);
3041 DECODE_IMPL(CallRef);
3042 DECODE_IMPL(ReturnCallRef);
3043 DECODE_IMPL2(kNumericPrefix, Numeric);
3044 DECODE_IMPL2(kSimdPrefix, Simd);
3045 DECODE_IMPL2(kAtomicPrefix, Atomic);
3046 DECODE_IMPL2(kGCPrefix, GC);
3047#define SIMPLE_PROTOTYPE_CASE(name, opc, sig) DECODE_IMPL(name);
3048 FOREACH_SIMPLE_PROTOTYPE_OPCODE(SIMPLE_PROTOTYPE_CASE)SIMPLE_PROTOTYPE_CASE(RefEq, 0xd5, i_qq)
3049#undef SIMPLE_PROTOTYPE_CASE
3050 return &WasmFullDecoder::DecodeUnknownOrAsmJs;
3051 }
3052
3053#undef DECODE_IMPL
3054#undef DECODE_IMPL2
3055
3056 OpcodeHandler GetOpcodeHandler(uint8_t opcode) {
3057 static constexpr std::array<OpcodeHandler, 256> kOpcodeHandlers =
3058 base::make_array<256>(GetOpcodeHandlerTableEntry);
3059 return kOpcodeHandlers[opcode];
3060 }
3061
3062 void DecodeFunctionBody() {
3063 TRACE("wasm-decode %p...%p (module+%u, %d bytes)\n", this->start(),
3064 this->end(), this->pc_offset(),
3065 static_cast<int>(this->end() - this->start()));
3066
3067 // Set up initial function block.
3068 {
3069 Control* c = PushControl(kControlBlock);
3070 InitMerge(&c->start_merge, 0, [](uint32_t) -> Value { UNREACHABLE()V8_Fatal("unreachable code"); });
3071 InitMerge(&c->end_merge,
3072 static_cast<uint32_t>(this->sig_->return_count()),
3073 [&](uint32_t i) {
3074 return Value{this->pc_, this->sig_->GetReturn(i)};
3075 });
3076 CALL_INTERFACE(StartFunctionBody, c);
3077 }
3078
3079 // Decode the function body.
3080 while (this->pc_ < this->end_) {
3081 uint8_t first_byte = *this->pc_;
3082 WasmOpcode opcode = static_cast<WasmOpcode>(first_byte);
3083 CALL_INTERFACE_IF_REACHABLE(NextInstruction, opcode);
3084 OpcodeHandler handler = GetOpcodeHandler(first_byte);
3085 int len = (*handler)(this, opcode);
3086 this->pc_ += len;
3087 }
3088
3089 if (!VALIDATE(this->pc_ == this->end_)) {
3090 this->error("Beyond end of code");
3091 }
3092 }
3093
3094 void EndControl() {
3095 DCHECK(!control_.empty())((void) 0);
3096 Control* current = &control_.back();
3097 stack_.erase(stack_.begin() + current->stack_depth, stack_.end());
3098 CALL_INTERFACE_IF_REACHABLE(EndControl, current);
3099 current->reachability = kUnreachable;
3100 current_code_reachable_ = false;
3101 }
3102
3103 template <typename func>
3104 void InitMerge(Merge<Value>* merge, uint32_t arity, func get_val) {
3105 merge->arity = arity;
3106 if (arity == 1) {
3107 merge->vals.first = get_val(0);
3108 } else if (arity > 1) {
3109 merge->vals.array = this->zone()->template NewArray<Value>(arity);
3110 for (uint32_t i = 0; i < arity; i++) {
3111 merge->vals.array[i] = get_val(i);
3112 }
3113 }
3114 }
3115
3116 void SetBlockType(Control* c, BlockTypeImmediate<validate>& imm,
3117 Value* args) {
3118 const byte* pc = this->pc_;
3119 InitMerge(&c->end_merge, imm.out_arity(), [pc, &imm](uint32_t i) {
3120 return Value{pc, imm.out_type(i)};
3121 });
3122 InitMerge(&c->start_merge, imm.in_arity(),
3123 [args](uint32_t i) { return args[i]; });
3124 }
3125
3126 // Pops arguments as required by signature.
3127 V8_INLINEinline __attribute__((always_inline)) ArgVector PopArgs(const FunctionSig* sig) {
