16#define RETURN_FALSE_IF_MISSING_CPU_FEATURE(name) \
17 if (!CpuFeatures::IsSupported(name)) return false; \
18 CpuFeatureScope feature(this, name);
19
20namespace liftoff {
21
22constexpr Register kScratchRegister2 = r11;
23static_assert(kScratchRegister != kScratchRegister2, "collision");
24static_assert((kLiftoffAssemblerGpCacheRegs &
25 Register::ListOf(kScratchRegister, kScratchRegister2)) == 0,
26 "scratch registers must not be used as cache registers");
27
28constexpr DoubleRegister kScratchDoubleReg2 = xmm14;
29static_assert(kScratchDoubleReg != kScratchDoubleReg2, "collision");
30static_assert((kLiftoffAssemblerFpCacheRegs &
31 DoubleRegister::ListOf(kScratchDoubleReg, kScratchDoubleReg2)) ==
32 0,
33 "scratch registers must not be used as cache registers");
34
35// rbp-8 holds the stack marker, rbp-16 is the instance parameter.
36constexpr int kInstanceOffset = 16;
37
38inline Operand GetStackSlot(int offset) { return Operand(rbp, -offset); }
18
←
Calling constructor for 'Operand'
→
39
40// TODO(clemensb): Make this a constexpr variable once Operand is constexpr.
41inline Operand GetInstanceOperand() { return GetStackSlot(kInstanceOffset); }
42
43inline Operand GetMemOp(LiftoffAssembler* assm, Register addr, Register offset,
44 uint32_t offset_imm) {
45 if (is_uint31(offset_imm)) {
46 if (offset == no_reg) return Operand(addr, offset_imm);
47 return Operand(addr, offset, times_1, offset_imm);
48 }
49 // Offset immediate does not fit in 31 bits.
50 Register scratch = kScratchRegister;
51 assm->movl(scratch, Immediate(offset_imm));
52 if (offset != no_reg) {
53 assm->addq(scratch, offset);
54 }
55 return Operand(addr, scratch, times_1, 0);
56}
57
58inline void Load(LiftoffAssembler* assm, LiftoffRegister dst, Operand src,
59 ValueType type) {
60 switch (type.kind()) {
61 case ValueType::kI32:
62 assm->movl(dst.gp(), src);
63 break;
64 case ValueType::kI64:
65 assm->movq(dst.gp(), src);
66 break;
67 case ValueType::kF32:
68 assm->Movss(dst.fp(), src);
69 break;
70 case ValueType::kF64:
71 assm->Movsd(dst.fp(), src);
72 break;
73 case ValueType::kS128:
74 assm->Movdqu(dst.fp(), src);
75 break;
76 default:
77 UNREACHABLE()V8_Fatal("unreachable code");
78 }
79}
80
81inline void Store(LiftoffAssembler* assm, Operand dst, LiftoffRegister src,
82 ValueType type) {
83 switch (type.kind()) {
84 case ValueType::kI32:
85 assm->movl(dst, src.gp());
86 break;
87 case ValueType::kI64:
88 assm->movq(dst, src.gp());
89 break;
90 case ValueType::kF32:
91 assm->Movss(dst, src.fp());
92 break;
93 case ValueType::kF64:
94 assm->Movsd(dst, src.fp());
95 break;
96 case ValueType::kS128:
97 assm->Movdqu(dst, src.fp());
98 break;
99 default:
100 UNREACHABLE()V8_Fatal("unreachable code");
101 }
102}
103
104inline void push(LiftoffAssembler* assm, LiftoffRegister reg, ValueType type) {
105 switch (type.kind()) {
106 case ValueType::kI32:
107 case ValueType::kI64:
108 assm->pushq(reg.gp());
109 break;
110 case ValueType::kF32:
111 assm->AllocateStackSpace(kSystemPointerSize);
112 assm->Movss(Operand(rsp, 0), reg.fp());
113 break;
114 case ValueType::kF64:
115 assm->AllocateStackSpace(kSystemPointerSize);
116 assm->Movsd(Operand(rsp, 0), reg.fp());
117 break;
118 case ValueType::kS128:
119 assm->AllocateStackSpace(kSystemPointerSize * 2);
120 assm->Movdqu(Operand(rsp, 0), reg.fp());
121 break;
122 default:
123 UNREACHABLE()V8_Fatal("unreachable code");
124 }
125}
126
127constexpr int kSubSpSize = 7; // 7 bytes for "subq rsp, <imm32>"
128
129} // namespace liftoff
130
131int LiftoffAssembler::PrepareStackFrame() {
132 int offset = pc_offset();
133 sub_sp_32(0);
134 DCHECK_EQ(liftoff::kSubSpSize, pc_offset() - offset)((void) 0);
135 return offset;
136}
137
138void LiftoffAssembler::PrepareTailCall(int num_callee_stack_params,
139 int stack_param_delta) {
140 // Push the return address and frame pointer to complete the stack frame.
141 pushq(Operand(rbp, 8));
142 pushq(Operand(rbp, 0));
143
144 // Shift the whole frame upwards.
145 const int slot_count = num_callee_stack_params + 2;
146 for (int i = slot_count - 1; i >= 0; --i) {
147 movq(kScratchRegister, Operand(rsp, i * 8));
148 movq(Operand(rbp, (i - stack_param_delta) * 8), kScratchRegister);
149 }
150
151 // Set the new stack and frame pointer.
152 leaq(rsp, Operand(rbp, -stack_param_delta * 8));
153 popq(rbp);
154}
155
156void LiftoffAssembler::PatchPrepareStackFrame(int offset, int frame_size) {
157 // Need to align sp to system pointer size.
158 frame_size = RoundUp(frame_size, kSystemPointerSize);
159 // We can't run out of space, just pass anything big enough to not cause the
160 // assembler to try to grow the buffer.
161 constexpr int kAvailableSpace = 64;
162 Assembler patching_assembler(
163 AssemblerOptions{},
164 ExternalAssemblerBuffer(buffer_start_ + offset, kAvailableSpace));
165#if V8_OS_WIN
166 if (frame_size > kStackPageSize) {
167 // Generate OOL code (at the end of the function, where the current
168 // assembler is pointing) to do the explicit stack limit check (see
169 // https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/previous-versions/visualstudio/visual-studio-6.0/aa227153(v=vs.60)).
170 // At the function start, emit a jump to that OOL code (from {offset} to
171 // {pc_offset()}).
172 int ool_offset = pc_offset() - offset;
173 patching_assembler.jmp_rel(ool_offset);
174 DCHECK_GE(liftoff::kSubSpSize, patching_assembler.pc_offset())((void) 0);
175 patching_assembler.Nop(liftoff::kSubSpSize -
176 patching_assembler.pc_offset());
177
178 // Now generate the OOL code.
179 AllocateStackSpace(frame_size);
180 // Jump back to the start of the function (from {pc_offset()} to {offset +
181 // kSubSpSize}).
182 int func_start_offset = offset + liftoff::kSubSpSize - pc_offset();
183 jmp_rel(func_start_offset);
184 return;
185 }
186#endif
187 patching_assembler.sub_sp_32(frame_size);
188 DCHECK_EQ(liftoff::kSubSpSize, patching_assembler.pc_offset())((void) 0);
189}
190
191void LiftoffAssembler::FinishCode() {}
192
193void LiftoffAssembler::AbortCompilation() {}
194
195// static
196constexpr int LiftoffAssembler::StaticStackFrameSize() {
197 return liftoff::kInstanceOffset;
198}
199
200int LiftoffAssembler::SlotSizeForType(ValueType type) {
201 return type.element_size_bytes();
202}
203
204bool LiftoffAssembler::NeedsAlignment(ValueType type) { return false; }
205
206void LiftoffAssembler::LoadConstant(LiftoffRegister reg, WasmValue value,
207 RelocInfo::Mode rmode) {
208 switch (value.type().kind()) {
209 case ValueType::kI32:
210 if (value.to_i32() == 0 && RelocInfo::IsNone(rmode)) {
211 xorl(reg.gp(), reg.gp());
212 } else {
213 movl(reg.gp(), Immediate(value.to_i32(), rmode));
214 }
215 break;
216 case ValueType::kI64:
217 if (RelocInfo::IsNone(rmode)) {
218 TurboAssembler::Set(reg.gp(), value.to_i64());
219 } else {
220 movq(reg.gp(), Immediate64(value.to_i64(), rmode));
221 }
222 break;
223 case ValueType::kF32:
224 TurboAssembler::Move(reg.fp(), value.to_f32_boxed().get_bits());
225 break;
226 case ValueType::kF64:
227 TurboAssembler::Move(reg.fp(), value.to_f64_boxed().get_bits());
228 break;
229 default:
230 UNREACHABLE()V8_Fatal("unreachable code");
231 }
232}
233
234void LiftoffAssembler::LoadFromInstance(Register dst, uint32_t offset,
235 int size) {
236 DCHECK_LE(offset, kMaxInt)((void) 0);
237 movq(dst, liftoff::GetInstanceOperand());
238 DCHECK(size == 4 || size == 8)((void) 0);
239 if (size == 4) {
240 movl(dst, Operand(dst, offset));
241 } else {
242 movq(dst, Operand(dst, offset));
243 }
244}
245
246void LiftoffAssembler::LoadTaggedPointerFromInstance(Register dst,
247 uint32_t offset) {
248 DCHECK_LE(offset, kMaxInt)((void) 0);
249 movq(dst, liftoff::GetInstanceOperand());
250 LoadTaggedPointerField(dst, Operand(dst, offset));
251}
252
253void LiftoffAssembler::SpillInstance(Register instance) {
254 movq(liftoff::GetInstanceOperand(), instance);
255}
256
257void LiftoffAssembler::FillInstanceInto(Register dst) {
258 movq(dst, liftoff::GetInstanceOperand());
259}
260
261void LiftoffAssembler::LoadTaggedPointer(Register dst, Register src_addr,
262 Register offset_reg,
263 int32_t offset_imm,
264 LiftoffRegList pinned) {
265 DCHECK_GE(offset_imm, 0)((void) 0);
266 if (emit_debug_code() && offset_reg != no_reg) {
267 AssertZeroExtended(offset_reg);
268 }
269 Operand src_op = liftoff::GetMemOp(this, src_addr, offset_reg,
270 static_cast<uint32_t>(offset_imm));
271 LoadTaggedPointerField(dst, src_op);
272}
273
274void LiftoffAssembler::AtomicLoad(LiftoffRegister dst, Register src_addr,
275 Register offset_reg, uint32_t offset_imm,
276 LoadType type, LiftoffRegList pinned) {
277 Load(dst, src_addr, offset_reg, offset_imm, type, pinned, nullptr, true);
278}
279
280void LiftoffAssembler::Load(LiftoffRegister dst, Register src_addr,
281 Register offset_reg, uint32_t offset_imm,
282 LoadType type, LiftoffRegList pinned,
283 uint32_t* protected_load_pc, bool is_load_mem) {
284 if (emit_debug_code() && offset_reg != no_reg) {
285 AssertZeroExtended(offset_reg);
286 }
287 Operand src_op = liftoff::GetMemOp(this, src_addr, offset_reg, offset_imm);
288 if (protected_load_pc) *protected_load_pc = pc_offset();
289 switch (type.value()) {
290 case LoadType::kI32Load8U:
291 case LoadType::kI64Load8U:
292 movzxbl(dst.gp(), src_op);
293 break;
294 case LoadType::kI32Load8S:
295 movsxbl(dst.gp(), src_op);
296 break;
297 case LoadType::kI64Load8S:
298 movsxbq(dst.gp(), src_op);
299 break;
300 case LoadType::kI32Load16U:
301 case LoadType::kI64Load16U:
302 movzxwl(dst.gp(), src_op);
303 break;
304 case LoadType::kI32Load16S:
305 movsxwl(dst.gp(), src_op);
306 break;
307 case LoadType::kI64Load16S:
308 movsxwq(dst.gp(), src_op);
309 break;
310 case LoadType::kI32Load:
311 case LoadType::kI64Load32U:
312 movl(dst.gp(), src_op);
313 break;
314 case LoadType::kI64Load32S:
315 movsxlq(dst.gp(), src_op);
316 break;
317 case LoadType::kI64Load:
318 movq(dst.gp(), src_op);
319 break;
320 case LoadType::kF32Load:
321 Movss(dst.fp(), src_op);
322 break;
323 case LoadType::kF64Load:
324 Movsd(dst.fp(), src_op);
325 break;
326 case LoadType::kS128Load:
327 Movdqu(dst.fp(), src_op);
328 break;
329 }
330}
331
332void LiftoffAssembler::Store(Register dst_addr, Register offset_reg,
333 uint32_t offset_imm, LiftoffRegister src,
334 StoreType type, LiftoffRegList /* pinned */,
335 uint32_t* protected_store_pc, bool is_store_mem) {
336 if (emit_debug_code() && offset_reg != no_reg) {
337 AssertZeroExtended(offset_reg);
338 }
339 Operand dst_op = liftoff::GetMemOp(this, dst_addr, offset_reg, offset_imm);
340 if (protected_store_pc) *protected_store_pc = pc_offset();
341 switch (type.value()) {
342 case StoreType::kI32Store8:
343 case StoreType::kI64Store8:
344 movb(dst_op, src.gp());
345 break;
346 case StoreType::kI32Store16:
347 case StoreType::kI64Store16:
348 movw(dst_op, src.gp());
349 break;
350 case StoreType::kI32Store:
351 case StoreType::kI64Store32:
352 movl(dst_op, src.gp());
353 break;
354 case StoreType::kI64Store:
355 movq(dst_op, src.gp());
356 break;
357 case StoreType::kF32Store:
358 Movss(dst_op, src.fp());
359 break;
360 case StoreType::kF64Store:
361 Movsd(dst_op, src.fp());
362 break;
363 case StoreType::kS128Store:
364 Movdqu(dst_op, src.fp());
365 break;
366 }
367}
368
369void LiftoffAssembler::AtomicStore(Register dst_addr, Register offset_reg,
370 uint32_t offset_imm, LiftoffRegister src,
371 StoreType type, LiftoffRegList pinned) {
372 if (emit_debug_code() && offset_reg != no_reg) {
373 AssertZeroExtended(offset_reg);
374 }
375 Operand dst_op = liftoff::GetMemOp(this, dst_addr, offset_reg, offset_imm);
376 Register src_reg = src.gp();
377 if (cache_state()->is_used(src)) {
378 movq(kScratchRegister, src_reg);
379 src_reg = kScratchRegister;
380 }
381 switch (type.value()) {
382 case StoreType::kI32Store8:
383 case StoreType::kI64Store8:
384 xchgb(src_reg, dst_op);
385 break;
386 case StoreType::kI32Store16:
387 case StoreType::kI64Store16:
388 xchgw(src_reg, dst_op);
389 break;
390 case StoreType::kI32Store:
391 case StoreType::kI64Store32:
392 xchgl(src_reg, dst_op);
393 break;
394 case StoreType::kI64Store:
395 xchgq(src_reg, dst_op);
396 break;
397 default:
398 UNREACHABLE()V8_Fatal("unreachable code");
399 }
400}
401
402void LiftoffAssembler::AtomicAdd(Register dst_addr, Register offset_reg,
403 uint32_t offset_imm, LiftoffRegister value,
404 LiftoffRegister result, StoreType type) {
405 DCHECK(!cache_state()->is_used(result))((void) 0);
406 if (cache_state()->is_used(value)) {
407 // We cannot overwrite {value}, but the {value} register is changed in the
408 // code we generate. Therefore we copy {value} to {result} and use the
409 // {result} register in the code below.
410 movq(result.gp(), value.gp());
411 value = result;
412 }
413 if (emit_debug_code() && offset_reg != no_reg) {
414 AssertZeroExtended(offset_reg);
415 }
416 Operand dst_op = liftoff::GetMemOp(this, dst_addr, offset_reg, offset_imm);
417 lock();
418 switch (type.value()) {
419 case StoreType::kI32Store8:
420 case StoreType::kI64Store8:
421 xaddb(dst_op, value.gp());
422 movzxbq(result.gp(), value.gp());
423 break;
424 case StoreType::kI32Store16:
425 case StoreType::kI64Store16:
426 xaddw(dst_op, value.gp());
427 movzxwq(result.gp(), value.gp());
428 break;
429 case StoreType::kI32Store:
430 case StoreType::kI64Store32:
431 xaddl(dst_op, value.gp());
432 if (value != result) {
433 movq(result.gp(), value.gp());
434 }
435 break;
436 case StoreType::kI64Store:
437 xaddq(dst_op, value.gp());
438 if (value != result) {
439 movq(result.gp(), value.gp());
440 }
441 break;
442 default:
443 UNREACHABLE()V8_Fatal("unreachable code");
444 }
445}
446
447void LiftoffAssembler::AtomicSub(Register dst_addr, Register offset_reg,
448 uint32_t offset_imm, LiftoffRegister value,
449 LiftoffRegister result, StoreType type) {
450 DCHECK(!cache_state()->is_used(result))((void) 0);
451 if (cache_state()->is_used(value)) {
452 // We cannot overwrite {value}, but the {value} register is changed in the
453 // code we generate. Therefore we copy {value} to {result} and use the
454 // {result} register in the code below.
455 movq(result.gp(), value.gp());
456 value = result;
457 }
458 if (emit_debug_code() && offset_reg != no_reg) {
459 AssertZeroExtended(offset_reg);
460 }
461 Operand dst_op = liftoff::GetMemOp(this, dst_addr, offset_reg, offset_imm);
462 switch (type.value()) {
463 case StoreType::kI32Store8:
464 case StoreType::kI64Store8:
465 negb(value.gp());
466 lock();
467 xaddb(dst_op, value.gp());
468 movzxbq(result.gp(), value.gp());
469 break;
470 case StoreType::kI32Store16:
471 case StoreType::kI64Store16:
472 negw(value.gp());
473 lock();
474 xaddw(dst_op, value.gp());
475 movzxwq(result.gp(), value.gp());
476 break;
477 case StoreType::kI32Store:
478 case StoreType::kI64Store32:
479 negl(value.gp());
480 lock();
481 xaddl(dst_op, value.gp());
482 if (value != result) {
483 movq(result.gp(), value.gp());
484 }
485 break;
486 case StoreType::kI64Store:
487 negq(value.gp());
488 lock();
489 xaddq(dst_op, value.gp());
490 if (value != result) {
491 movq(result.gp(), value.gp());
492 }
493 break;
494 default:
495 UNREACHABLE()V8_Fatal("unreachable code");
496 }
497}
498
499namespace liftoff {
500#define __ lasm->
501
502inline void AtomicBinop(LiftoffAssembler* lasm,
503 void (Assembler::*opl)(Register, Register),
504 void (Assembler::*opq)(Register, Register),
505 Register dst_addr, Register offset_reg,
506 uint32_t offset_imm, LiftoffRegister value,
507 LiftoffRegister result, StoreType type) {
508 DCHECK(!__ cache_state()->is_used(result))((void) 0);
509 Register value_reg = value.gp();
510 // The cmpxchg instruction uses rax to store the old value of the
511 // compare-exchange primitive. Therefore we have to spill the register and
512 // move any use to another register.
513 LiftoffRegList pinned =
514 LiftoffRegList::ForRegs(dst_addr, offset_reg, value_reg);
515 __ ClearRegister(rax, {&dst_addr, &offset_reg, &value_reg}, pinned);
516 if (__ emit_debug_code() && offset_reg != no_reg) {
517 __ AssertZeroExtended(offset_reg);
518 }
519 Operand dst_op = liftoff::GetMemOp(lasm, dst_addr, offset_reg, offset_imm);
520
521 switch (type.value()) {
522 case StoreType::kI32Store8:
523 case StoreType::kI64Store8: {
524 Label binop;
525 __ xorq(rax, rax);
526 __ movb(rax, dst_op);
527 __ bind(&binop);
528 __ movl(kScratchRegister, rax);
529 (lasm->*opl)(kScratchRegister, value_reg);
530 __ lock();
531 __ cmpxchgb(dst_op, kScratchRegister);
532 __ j(not_equal, &binop);
533 break;
534 }
535 case StoreType::kI32Store16:
536 case StoreType::kI64Store16: {
537 Label binop;
538 __ xorq(rax, rax);
539 __ movw(rax, dst_op);
540 __ bind(&binop);
541 __ movl(kScratchRegister, rax);
542 (lasm->*opl)(kScratchRegister, value_reg);
543 __ lock();
544 __ cmpxchgw(dst_op, kScratchRegister);
545 __ j(not_equal, &binop);
546 break;
547 }
548 case StoreType::kI32Store:
549 case StoreType::kI64Store32: {
550 Label binop;
551 __ movl(rax, dst_op);
552 __ bind(&binop);
553 __ movl(kScratchRegister, rax);
554 (lasm->*opl)(kScratchRegister, value_reg);
555 __ lock();
556 __ cmpxchgl(dst_op, kScratchRegister);
557 __ j(not_equal, &binop);
558 break;
559 }
560 case StoreType::kI64Store: {
561 Label binop;
562 __ movq(rax, dst_op);
563 __ bind(&binop);
564 __ movq(kScratchRegister, rax);
565 (lasm->*opq)(kScratchRegister, value_reg);
566 __ lock();
567 __ cmpxchgq(dst_op, kScratchRegister);
568 __ j(not_equal, &binop);
569 break;
570 }
571 default:
572 UNREACHABLE()V8_Fatal("unreachable code");
573 }
574
575 if (result.gp() != rax) {
576 __ movq(result.gp(), rax);
577 }
578}
579#undef __
580} // namespace liftoff
581
582void LiftoffAssembler::AtomicAnd(Register dst_addr, Register offset_reg,
583 uint32_t offset_imm, LiftoffRegister value,
584 LiftoffRegister result, StoreType type) {
585 liftoff::AtomicBinop(this, &Assembler::andl, &Assembler::andq, dst_addr,
586 offset_reg, offset_imm, value, result, type);
587}
588
589void LiftoffAssembler::AtomicOr(Register dst_addr, Register offset_reg,
590 uint32_t offset_imm, LiftoffRegister value,
591 LiftoffRegister result, StoreType type) {
592 liftoff::AtomicBinop(this, &Assembler::orl, &Assembler::orq, dst_addr,
593 offset_reg, offset_imm, value, result, type);
594}
595
596void LiftoffAssembler::AtomicXor(Register dst_addr, Register offset_reg,
597 uint32_t offset_imm, LiftoffRegister value,
598 LiftoffRegister result, StoreType type) {
599 liftoff::AtomicBinop(this, &Assembler::xorl, &Assembler::xorq, dst_addr,
600 offset_reg, offset_imm, value, result, type);
601}
602
603void LiftoffAssembler::AtomicExchange(Register dst_addr, Register offset_reg,
604 uint32_t offset_imm,
605 LiftoffRegister value,
606 LiftoffRegister result, StoreType type) {
607 DCHECK(!cache_state()->is_used(result))((void) 0);
608 if (cache_state()->is_used(value)) {
609 // We cannot overwrite {value}, but the {value} register is changed in the
610 // code we generate. Therefore we copy {value} to {result} and use the
611 // {result} register in the code below.
612 movq(result.gp(), value.gp());
613 value = result;
614 }
615 if (emit_debug_code() && offset_reg != no_reg) {
616 AssertZeroExtended(offset_reg);
617 }
618 Operand dst_op = liftoff::GetMemOp(this, dst_addr, offset_reg, offset_imm);
619 switch (type.value()) {
620 case StoreType::kI32Store8:
621 case StoreType::kI64Store8:
622 xchgb(value.gp(), dst_op);
623 movzxbq(result.gp(), value.gp());
624 break;
625 case StoreType::kI32Store16:
626 case StoreType::kI64Store16:
627 xchgw(value.gp(), dst_op);
628 movzxwq(result.gp(), value.gp());
629 break;
630 case StoreType::kI32Store:
631 case StoreType::kI64Store32:
632 xchgl(value.gp(), dst_op);
633 if (value != result) {
634 movq(result.gp(), value.gp());
635 }
636 break;
637 case StoreType::kI64Store:
638 xchgq(value.gp(), dst_op);
639 if (value != result) {
640 movq(result.gp(), value.gp());
641 }
642 break;
643 default:
644 UNREACHABLE()V8_Fatal("unreachable code");
645 }
646}
647
648void LiftoffAssembler::AtomicCompareExchange(
649 Register dst_addr, Register offset_reg, uint32_t offset_imm,
650 LiftoffRegister expected, LiftoffRegister new_value, LiftoffRegister result,
651 StoreType type) {
652 Register value_reg = new_value.gp();
653 // The cmpxchg instruction uses rax to store the old value of the
654 // compare-exchange primitive. Therefore we have to spill the register and
655 // move any use to another register.
656 LiftoffRegList pinned =
657 LiftoffRegList::ForRegs(dst_addr, offset_reg, expected, value_reg);
658 ClearRegister(rax, {&dst_addr, &offset_reg, &value_reg}, pinned);
659 if (expected.gp() != rax) {
660 movq(rax, expected.gp());
661 }
662
663 if (emit_debug_code() && offset_reg != no_reg) {
664 AssertZeroExtended(offset_reg);
665 }
666 Operand dst_op = liftoff::GetMemOp(this, dst_addr, offset_reg, offset_imm);
667
668 lock();
669 switch (type.value()) {
670 case StoreType::kI32Store8:
671 case StoreType::kI64Store8: {
672 cmpxchgb(dst_op, value_reg);
673 movzxbq(result.gp(), rax);
674 break;
675 }
676 case StoreType::kI32Store16:
677 case StoreType::kI64Store16: {
678 cmpxchgw(dst_op, value_reg);
679 movzxwq(result.gp(), rax);
680 break;
681 }
682 case StoreType::kI32Store: {
683 cmpxchgl(dst_op, value_reg);
684 if (result.gp() != rax) {
685 movl(result.gp(), rax);
686 }
687 break;
688 }
689 case StoreType::kI64Store32: {
690 cmpxchgl(dst_op, value_reg);
691 // Zero extension.
692 movl(result.gp(), rax);
693 break;
694 }
695 case StoreType::kI64Store: {
696 cmpxchgq(dst_op, value_reg);
697 if (result.gp() != rax) {
698 movq(result.gp(), rax);
699 }
700 break;
701 }
702 default:
703 UNREACHABLE()V8_Fatal("unreachable code");
704 }
705}
706
707void LiftoffAssembler::AtomicFence() { mfence(); }
708
709void LiftoffAssembler::LoadCallerFrameSlot(LiftoffRegister dst,
710 uint32_t caller_slot_idx,
711 ValueType type) {
712 Operand src(rbp, kSystemPointerSize * (caller_slot_idx + 1));
713 liftoff::Load(this, dst, src, type);
714}
715
716void LiftoffAssembler::StoreCallerFrameSlot(LiftoffRegister src,
717 uint32_t caller_slot_idx,
718 ValueType type) {
719 Operand dst(rbp, kSystemPointerSize * (caller_slot_idx + 1));
720 liftoff::Store(this, dst, src, type);
721}
722
723void LiftoffAssembler::LoadReturnStackSlot(LiftoffRegister reg, int offset,
724 ValueType type) {
725 Operand src(rsp, offset);
726 liftoff::Load(this, reg, src, type);
727}
728
729void LiftoffAssembler::MoveStackValue(uint32_t dst_offset, uint32_t src_offset,
730 ValueType type) {
731 DCHECK_NE(dst_offset, src_offset)((void) 0);
732 Operand dst = liftoff::GetStackSlot(dst_offset);
733 Operand src = liftoff::GetStackSlot(src_offset);
734 if (type.element_size_log2() == 2) {
735 movl(kScratchRegister, src);
736 movl(dst, kScratchRegister);
737 } else {
738 DCHECK_EQ(3, type.element_size_log2())((void) 0);
739 movq(kScratchRegister, src);
740 movq(dst, kScratchRegister);
741 }
742}
743
744void LiftoffAssembler::Move(Register dst, Register src, ValueType type) {
745 DCHECK_NE(dst, src)((void) 0);
746 if (type == kWasmI32) {
747 movl(dst, src);
748 } else {
749 DCHECK_EQ(kWasmI64, type)((void) 0);
750 movq(dst, src);
751 }
752}
753
754void LiftoffAssembler::Move(DoubleRegister dst, DoubleRegister src,
755 ValueType type) {
756 DCHECK_NE(dst, src)((void) 0);
757 if (type == kWasmF32) {
758 Movss(dst, src);
759 } else if (type == kWasmF64) {
760 Movsd(dst, src);
761 } else {
762 DCHECK_EQ(kWasmS128, type)((void) 0);
763 Movapd(dst, src);
764 }
765}
766
767void LiftoffAssembler::Spill(int offset, LiftoffRegister reg, ValueType type) {
768 RecordUsedSpillOffset(offset);
769 Operand dst = liftoff::GetStackSlot(offset);
17
←
Calling 'GetStackSlot'
→
770 switch (type.kind()) {
771 case ValueType::kI32:
772 movl(dst, reg.gp());
773 break;
774 case ValueType::kI64:
775 movq(dst, reg.gp());
776 break;
777 case ValueType::kF32:
778 Movss(dst, reg.fp());
779 break;
780 case ValueType::kF64:
781 Movsd(dst, reg.fp());
782 break;
783 case ValueType::kS128:
784 Movdqu(dst, reg.fp());
785 break;
786 default:
787 UNREACHABLE()V8_Fatal("unreachable code");
788 }
789}
790
791void LiftoffAssembler::Spill(int offset, WasmValue value) {
792 RecordUsedSpillOffset(offset);
793 Operand dst = liftoff::GetStackSlot(offset);
794 switch (value.type().kind()) {
795 case ValueType::kI32:
796 movl(dst, Immediate(value.to_i32()));
797 break;
798 case ValueType::kI64: {
799 if (is_int32(value.to_i64())) {
800 // Sign extend low word.
801 movq(dst, Immediate(static_cast<int32_t>(value.to_i64())));
802 } else if (is_uint32(value.to_i64())) {
803 // Zero extend low word.
804 movl(kScratchRegister, Immediate(static_cast<int32_t>(value.to_i64())));
805 movq(dst, kScratchRegister);
806 } else {
807 movq(kScratchRegister, value.to_i64());
808 movq(dst, kScratchRegister);
809 }
810 break;
811 }
812 default:
813 // We do not track f32 and f64 constants, hence they are unreachable.
814 UNREACHABLE()V8_Fatal("unreachable code");
815 }
816}
817
818void LiftoffAssembler::Fill(LiftoffRegister reg, int offset, ValueType type) {
819 liftoff::Load(this, reg, liftoff::GetStackSlot(offset), type);
820}
821
822void LiftoffAssembler::FillI64Half(Register, int offset, RegPairHalf) {
823 UNREACHABLE()V8_Fatal("unreachable code");
824}
825
826void LiftoffAssembler::FillStackSlotsWithZero(int start, int size) {
827 DCHECK_LT(0, size)((void) 0);
828 RecordUsedSpillOffset(start + size);
829
830 if (size <= 3 * kStackSlotSize) {
831 // Special straight-line code for up to three slots
832 // (7-10 bytes per slot: REX C7 <1-4 bytes op> <4 bytes imm>),
833 // And a movd (6-9 byte) when size % 8 != 0;
834 uint32_t remainder = size;
835 for (; remainder >= kStackSlotSize; remainder -= kStackSlotSize) {
836 movq(liftoff::GetStackSlot(start + remainder), Immediate(0));
837 }
838 DCHECK(remainder == 4 || remainder == 0)((void) 0);
839 if (remainder) {
840 movl(liftoff::GetStackSlot(start + remainder), Immediate(0));
841 }
842 } else {
843 // General case for bigger counts.
844 // This sequence takes 19-22 bytes (3 for pushes, 4-7 for lea, 2 for xor, 5
845 // for mov, 2 for repstosl, 3 for pops).
846 pushq(rax);
847 pushq(rcx);
848 pushq(rdi);
849 leaq(rdi, liftoff::GetStackSlot(start + size));
850 xorl(rax, rax);
851 // Convert size (bytes) to doublewords (4-bytes).
852 movl(rcx, Immediate(size / 4));
853 repstosl();
854 popq(rdi);
855 popq(rcx);
856 popq(rax);
857 }
858}
859
860void LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32_add(Register dst, Register lhs, Register rhs) {
861 if (lhs != dst) {
862 leal(dst, Operand(lhs, rhs, times_1, 0));
863 } else {
864 addl(dst, rhs);
865 }
866}
867
868void LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32_addi(Register dst, Register lhs, int32_t imm) {
869 if (lhs != dst) {
870 leal(dst, Operand(lhs, imm));
871 } else {
872 addl(dst, Immediate(imm));
873 }
874}
875
876void LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32_sub(Register dst, Register lhs, Register rhs) {
877 if (dst != rhs) {
878 // Default path.
879 if (dst != lhs) movl(dst, lhs);
880 subl(dst, rhs);
881 } else if (lhs == rhs) {
882 // Degenerate case.
883 xorl(dst, dst);
884 } else {
885 // Emit {dst = lhs + -rhs} if dst == rhs.
886 negl(dst);
887 addl(dst, lhs);
888 }
889}
890
891namespace liftoff {
892template <void (Assembler::*op)(Register, Register),
893 void (Assembler::*mov)(Register, Register)>
894void EmitCommutativeBinOp(LiftoffAssembler* assm, Register dst, Register lhs,
895 Register rhs) {
896 if (dst == rhs) {
897 (assm->*op)(dst, lhs);
898 } else {
899 if (dst != lhs) (assm->*mov)(dst, lhs);
900 (assm->*op)(dst, rhs);
901 }
902}
903
904template <void (Assembler::*op)(Register, Immediate),
905 void (Assembler::*mov)(Register, Register)>
906void EmitCommutativeBinOpImm(LiftoffAssembler* assm, Register dst, Register lhs,
907 int32_t imm) {
908 if (dst != lhs) (assm->*mov)(dst, lhs);
909 (assm->*op)(dst, Immediate(imm));
910}
911} // namespace liftoff
912
913void LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32_mul(Register dst, Register lhs, Register rhs) {
914 liftoff::EmitCommutativeBinOp<&Assembler::imull, &Assembler::movl>(this, dst,
915 lhs, rhs);
916}
917
918namespace liftoff {
919enum class DivOrRem : uint8_t { kDiv, kRem };
920template <typename type, DivOrRem div_or_rem>
921void EmitIntDivOrRem(LiftoffAssembler* assm, Register dst, Register lhs,
922 Register rhs, Label* trap_div_by_zero,
923 Label* trap_div_unrepresentable) {
924 constexpr bool needs_unrepresentable_check =
925 std::is_signed<type>::value && div_or_rem == DivOrRem::kDiv;
926 constexpr bool special_case_minus_1 =
927 std::is_signed<type>::value && div_or_rem == DivOrRem::kRem;
928 DCHECK_EQ(needs_unrepresentable_check, trap_div_unrepresentable != nullptr)((void) 0);
929
930#define iop(name, ...)do { if (sizeof(type) == 4) { assm->namel(...); } else { assm
->nameq(...); } } while (false) \
931 do { \
932 if (sizeof(type) == 4) { \
933 assm->name##l(__VA_ARGS__); \
934 } else { \
935 assm->name##q(__VA_ARGS__); \
936 } \
937 } while (false)
938
939 // For division, the lhs is always taken from {edx:eax}. Thus, make sure that
940 // these registers are unused. If {rhs} is stored in one of them, move it to
941 // another temporary register.
942 // Do all this before any branch, such that the code is executed
943 // unconditionally, as the cache state will also be modified unconditionally.
944 assm->SpillRegisters(rdx, rax);
945 if (rhs == rax || rhs == rdx) {
946 iop(mov, kScratchRegister, rhs)do { if (sizeof(type) == 4) { assm->movl(kScratchRegister,
rhs); } else { assm->movq(kScratchRegister, rhs); } } while
(false);
947 rhs = kScratchRegister;
948 }
949
950 // Check for division by zero.
951 iop(test, rhs, rhs)do { if (sizeof(type) == 4) { assm->testl(rhs, rhs); } else
{ assm->testq(rhs, rhs); } } while (false);
952 assm->j(zero, trap_div_by_zero);
953
954 Label done;
955 if (needs_unrepresentable_check) {
956 // Check for {kMinInt / -1}. This is unrepresentable.
957 Label do_div;
958 iop(cmp, rhs, Immediate(-1))do { if (sizeof(type) == 4) { assm->cmpl(rhs, Immediate(-1
)); } else { assm->cmpq(rhs, Immediate(-1)); } } while (false
);
959 assm->j(not_equal, &do_div);
960 // {lhs} is min int if {lhs - 1} overflows.
961 iop(cmp, lhs, Immediate(1))do { if (sizeof(type) == 4) { assm->cmpl(lhs, Immediate(1)
); } else { assm->cmpq(lhs, Immediate(1)); } } while (false
);
962 assm->j(overflow, trap_div_unrepresentable);
963 assm->bind(&do_div);
964 } else if (special_case_minus_1) {
965 // {lhs % -1} is always 0 (needs to be special cased because {kMinInt / -1}
966 // cannot be computed).
967 Label do_rem;
968 iop(cmp, rhs, Immediate(-1))do { if (sizeof(type) == 4) { assm->cmpl(rhs, Immediate(-1
)); } else { assm->cmpq(rhs, Immediate(-1)); } } while (false
);
969 assm->j(not_equal, &do_rem);
970 // clang-format off
971 // (conflicts with presubmit checks because it is confused about "xor")
972 iop(xor, dst, dst)do { if (sizeof(type) == 4) { assm->xorl(dst, dst); } else
{ assm->xorq(dst, dst); } } while (false);
973 // clang-format on
974 assm->jmp(&done);
975 assm->bind(&do_rem);
976 }
977
978 // Now move {lhs} into {eax}, then zero-extend or sign-extend into {edx}, then
979 // do the division.
980 if (lhs != rax) iop(mov, rax, lhs)do { if (sizeof(type) == 4) { assm->movl(rax, lhs); } else
{ assm->movq(rax, lhs); } } while (false);
981 if (std::is_same<int32_t, type>::value) { // i32
982 assm->cdq();
983 assm->idivl(rhs);
984 } else if (std::is_same<uint32_t, type>::value) { // u32
985 assm->xorl(rdx, rdx);
986 assm->divl(rhs);
987 } else if (std::is_same<int64_t, type>::value) { // i64
988 assm->cqo();
989 assm->idivq(rhs);
990 } else { // u64
991 assm->xorq(rdx, rdx);
992 assm->divq(rhs);
993 }
994
995 // Move back the result (in {eax} or {edx}) into the {dst} register.
996 constexpr Register kResultReg = div_or_rem == DivOrRem::kDiv ? rax : rdx;
997 if (dst != kResultReg) {
998 iop(mov, dst, kResultReg)do { if (sizeof(type) == 4) { assm->movl(dst, kResultReg);
} else { assm->movq(dst, kResultReg); } } while (false);
999 }
1000 if (special_case_minus_1) assm->bind(&done);
1001}
1002} // namespace liftoff
1003
1004void LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32_divs(Register dst, Register lhs, Register rhs,
1005 Label* trap_div_by_zero,
1006 Label* trap_div_unrepresentable) {
1007 liftoff::EmitIntDivOrRem<int32_t, liftoff::DivOrRem::kDiv>(
1008 this, dst, lhs, rhs, trap_div_by_zero, trap_div_unrepresentable);
1009}
1010
1011void LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32_divu(Register dst, Register lhs, Register rhs,
1012 Label* trap_div_by_zero) {
1013 liftoff::EmitIntDivOrRem<uint32_t, liftoff::DivOrRem::kDiv>(
1014 this, dst, lhs, rhs, trap_div_by_zero, nullptr);
1015}
1016
1017void LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32_rems(Register dst, Register lhs, Register rhs,
1018 Label* trap_div_by_zero) {
1019 liftoff::EmitIntDivOrRem<int32_t, liftoff::DivOrRem::kRem>(
1020 this, dst, lhs, rhs, trap_div_by_zero, nullptr);
1021}
1022
1023void LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32_remu(Register dst, Register lhs, Register rhs,
1024 Label* trap_div_by_zero) {
1025 liftoff::EmitIntDivOrRem<uint32_t, liftoff::DivOrRem::kRem>(
1026 this, dst, lhs, rhs, trap_div_by_zero, nullptr);
1027}
1028
1029void LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32_and(Register dst, Register lhs, Register rhs) {
1030 liftoff::EmitCommutativeBinOp<&Assembler::andl, &Assembler::movl>(this, dst,
1031 lhs, rhs);
1032}
1033
1034void LiftoffAssembler::emit_i32_andi(Register dst, Register lhs, int32_t imm) {
1035 liftoff::EmitCommutativeBinOpImm<&Assembler::andl, &Assembler::movl>(
1036 this, dst, lhs, imm);
1037}
